Supportive Concepts ⭐

☁️ Editable Template

An Editable Template allows the user to update the template as they discover anything missing or inconvenient about the template. Black: With each update the template becomes more thorough and easier to use.
Problem Solving Template Example ⭐

Describe the problem here.

Goal

Describe the desirable goals here.
Causes

In this section, list the causes by type. Use ✔️❌ to mark causes that are confirmed or eliminated.
Solutions

Solution

In this section, list the solutions by type.

Autonomy

Compassion

 Definition not sufficient?
 Compassion is understanding there is a lack of understanding.
 My reply on that definition
 Action not needed
 Be kind to fellow fools
 Is provoking part of compassion?
 Is the skill of not getting provoked part of compassion? >> The order of action according to compassion
 Empathy is debilitating
 Example of Empathy leading to throwing up
 Empathic definition
 Is leniency compassion?
 Black-or-White judging not malice versus judging compassion.
 Effect of compassion by itself. will exhaust resources

🎯 Deployment
This step is a final check of the response before deployment. Please start a discussion thread for reviews.
📋 Response Checks
✅ Confirm that the purpose is peacemaking Tanya: Confirm that the response serves a purpose of peacemaking.
✅ ✅ Confirm that key terms are defined LRRH: Sharing definition is can avoid/resolve conflicts.
✅ Confirm that the response is not an attack Evelyn: A response that define terms is not an attack when it does not use any derogatory terms and does not belittle people who have other definitions. Tanya: It is okay to demonstrate whether a response is logically valid.
✅ Confirm the tone Evelyn: If available, confirm with Grammarly that the tone of the response is not negative.

[202301010947]
Happy New Year!
2023 JAN 01 SUN 9:47 AM
Magic Bakery
⭐
Welcome to 2023! StarTree: StarTree nominated @Music and @Vacation for Rank S for 2022 December! StarTree: @Music for the playlist, and @Vacation for Magic Bakery plays NCIS!
LRRH: StarTree, I want to make an @Wish node for New Year Resolutions. StarTree: 202301011001|Done!
Ivy: New Year Resolutions haven't been working.
LRRH: I think maybe it would work if it is tied to monthly chapter ranking?
⭐
Sasha: Is this an Abilene Paradox solution question?
LRRH: I suppose it can be. I want to know what is difficult and what the challenges are. Sasha: @LRRH, If you make a suggestion, you should know at least one person who has a burning desire for it. Otherwise you could be proposing something no one wants. LRRH: 🏳️ Ivy: The way it has been working is that if you want to do something that is credit worthy, then just do it and get credits.
LRRH: Should we track the total points we get per chapter? Ivy: I think the monthly tracking is enough. We shouldn't set a "goal" to meet some progress target. LRRH: But we already are tracking ranking. Ivy: Maybe that is enough. Evelyn: What if we talk about something we wanted to do last year but did not finish? Sasha: Someone needs to give ther personal example, else this topic is might be empty.
Black: There might be a Japanese class starting January. Is anyone interested? Evelyn: We didn't keep that club going. 😖 Black: It seems that unless an activity contributes to a chartered monthly ranking, it won't get done at all. LRRH: @Wish can adopt Japanese learning. Black: Thank you. Sasha: Japanese already has a daily quest tracker. Why didn't it stick as a daily quest? Black: I think logging about two lines of Japanese song lyrics is worth maximum of 1 credit per day. Evelyn: Let's do some. 🤗 Little Red Riding Hood thanks all and wishes everyone a happy new year.
� Discussions

202208172056|🥨 Magic Bakery 202208180941|🎄 Wishing Tree 202208141844|🍮 Magic Detectives 💬 Discussions
{"id":"202301011001","parentid":"202208172056","parentname":"Magic Bakery","icon":" 🎊 ","title":"New Year Resolutions","subtitle":"Goal Setting","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2023/01/08/14/48/donut-7705449_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"LRRH","description":"","card-text":""}
NCIS
[202301011545]
Case 8: Plot Twist 1
◀ 2023 JAN 01 SUN 3:45 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 8 Plot Twist 1!
Sasha: ⚠️ The game content is rated "Age teen to adult"
🚨 PLOT TWIST 1
Sasha: A naked body with a bullet hole in his neck is found on the second day at a war reenactment. The victim is identified as a participant of the reenactment by his fellow reenactors. The victim did not show up for final roll call last night.
Sasha: We will reveal all clues for Round 1 and Round 2, then 6 for Round 3, and 2 for Round 4.
🔍 [179] Crime Scene
Zoey: The body has white castic powder on it that has been eating away his flesh. Zoey takes some sample for the lab.
Zoey: It probably helps that there is no picture. Evelyn: 😖 Amelia: Let's see who has a functional antique gun.
🔍 [52] Best Friend on Scene
44: At the crime scene was the victim's best friend Mr. Ham. "I bet it is [the Lawyer] who did it," says Mr. Ham, "In the reenactment last week, [the lawyer] came up from nowhere and punched [the victim] for no good reason. [The lawyer] wasn't even invited." Someone else chuckles, "You got in a pretty good punch yourself today."
44: It isn't clear to me who was punching whom in the last comment. Black: I think that meant Mr. Ham punched the victim.
🔍 [224] Ms. Ready
Amelia: Amelia checks the roster of the reenactment to see if anyone one had a criminal record and gets a match--Ms. Ready, who works at a shooting range. Amelia finds her there. "Despite working here, I don't like guns," Ms. Ready says, "This is my dad's place. I just work here." Amelia asks her about the victim. "Sorry, never met him," says Ms. Ready.
🔍 [72] Mr. Fox
Black: Black searches at the vicim's house and sees a popular reenactment magazine addressed to a Mr. Fox. Mr. Fox's address was very close to where the victim's body was found. So he then goes to see Mr. Fox. Mr. Fox, a 67 yearold, is on house arrest on a DUI charge.
🔍 [199] The Lawyer
Tanya: According to the records, Mr. Fox, who is now on house arrest, is the driver and the victim is the passenger when their car hit [the Lawyer]'s wife, who is now in a coma. The Lawyer sued them for punitive damage but the judge cited insufficient evidence to award. [The Lawyer] left the courtroom screaming for justice.
Tanya: The Lawyer has a motive of revenge. But in that case, he would want to kill both the victim and Mr. Ham.
🔍 [43] Shooting Range
StarTree: StarTree finds a reenactment guild photo online where the victim is kissing Ms. Ready!
Tanya: The father has a motive if he really doesn't like the victim. Amelia: That could explain why Ms. Ready lied.
🔍 [281] Headquarters
Evelyn: The victim was shot by bullet from an antique gun. The bullet, which is still lodge in his neck, was most likely the cause of death. The also has contusion around his eye. The clotting suggestes that it happened serveral hours before the victim was killed.
🔮 [40] Victim's Girlfriend
P4: P4 is practising oracle skill with mom. What do you see, P4? The victim's girlfriend is watching the news about his death. She seems happy.
Sasha thanks the players!
� Discussions
NCIS
[202301011713]
Case 8: Plot Twist 2
◀ 2023 JAN 01 SUN 5:13 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 8 Plot Twist 2!
Sasha: ⚠️ The game content is rated "Age teen to adult"
🚨 PLOT TWIST 2
LRRH: At the crime scene, Little Red lets her dog run and finds an reenactment uniform beneath a large rotting log. A note in the pocket reads, "I know about [Ms. Ready]. Don't brother coming home or I'll kill you. - [Girlfriend]"
LRRH: I suppose the girlfriend is the murderer because she seems like a patient person.
🔍 [195] Crime Scene
Zoey: There are footprints in the soft dirt leading from the body to the back of the field but then dissipate. The shoe size seems to be that of a medium-size man or a large woman.
Zoey: It wasn't clear why the footprint ends from the clue. I assume that it is just because the ground is not soft there or other people have walked over it there. Zoey: I meant I don't think the clue is asking us to imagine the murderer got onto a helicopter. XD
🔍 [233] Headquarters
Ivy: The main ingredient of the white powder found on the body is Sodium Hydroxide, also known as lye. It is hightly caustic to skin, but also commonly found in lots of household stuff. The murderer probably used it to erase some kind of evidence.
StarTree: StarTree checked the finance of the guild that is hosting the reenactment and finds that it is in the red!
Zoey: What kind of evidence was the murderer trying to hide? Their own scent? Tanya: I think we need to deduce the order of these two events: 1) The victim became naked; and 2) The victim was murdered. Sasha: The uniform should have blood stain if the victim was shot first.
🔍 [16] Best Friend Mr. Ham
44: 44 asks Mr. Ham about the punch. "I did that," says Mr. Ham, "[The victim] was upset about a squabble with this girlfriend and started taking the battle too seriously. He pushed me too far, so I put him down. It was not big deal, we were laughing again shortly thereafter."
🔍 [156] Mr. Fox
Black: Black talks to Mr. Fox regarding the victim. Mr. Fox says that he let the victim borrow his magazine, and also many other things. "We were best friends," says Mr. Fox passionately.
44: The clue card on Mr. Ham says he is the best friend. Black: The clue card on Mr. Fox says the victim is Fox's only friend. Sasha: Mr. Fox's feeling is not mutual. Tanya: Mr. Fox doesn't have a motive.
🔍 [97] The Lawyer
Tanya: Tanya interviews the Lawyer at his office. The Lawyer made no attempt to hide his anger over the failed lawsuit against the victim and Mr. Fox. Tanya notices the antique gun in display at his office. "That's a [Italian gun model] used before the war." says the Lawyer. "Are you a gun collector?" asks Tanya. "That's my dad's. He is the collector."
Tanya: What was the model of the murder weapon? 44: It was a British rifle. Tanya: I see.
🔍 [45] Ms. Ready
Amelia: Ms. Ready admit that she knew the victim after Amelia confronts her with the photo. "I begged [the guild] the remove that photo. My dad would kill me if he knew I was seeing [the victim]," says Ms. Ready, "I also don't want [victim's girlfriend] to find out. I'm sorry, but she is crazy." Amelia notices a rifle on the wall, which Ms. Ready allows her to take back to HQ.
🔍 [251] Shooting Range
StarTree: The rifle Amelia brought back is an American model that was recently fired! It has prints from both the father the daughter all over it except the trigger!
Amelia: When Amelia returns to the shooting range, the father has fled the scene.
🔍 [40] Victim's Girlfriend
LRRH: Red goes to the victim's girlfriend to ask her about the note. "Of course I meant it," says the girlfriend, "First the beatings, then the cheating. Of course I meant it!"
LRRH: Is such a note legal? The victim has his own home. The girlfriend is just declaring an update to the boundary. Tanya: I think that is legal. Sasha: In any case, there is no physical evidence connecting the murder to the girlfriend.
Sasha thanks the players!
� Discussions

202208092007|Paladin Hall

 202301011739|⚖️ Criminal Law {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202301011739","music":""}
{"cmd":"MC3"}
A
Affirmative Defense 🏛️ Affirmative Defense
A defense that negates guilt by proving that the defendant has an excuse for the crime, such as duress, insanity, entrapment. 202301161835|[173]
B
Bill of Attainder 🏛️ Bill of Attainder
A type of law that mandates a punishment or denies a privilege without a judicial trial. This kind of law is prohibited by the Constitution.202303162257|[5]
D
Deadly Force ⚔️ Deadly Force
In the use of deadly force in self-defense, as long as the belief in imminent harm is reasonable and the amount of force used in return is reasonable, the victim's motive is irrelevant 202301161835|[183]. The defender does not need to retreat, even when it is safe to do so, before using deadly force in return. 202301182053|[178]. Declaration of intention to kill insufficient to justify self-defense 202301182053|[182] 202211072244|⚔️. Objectively reasonability does not include oracle knowledge 202302061037|[180] 202211072244|⚔️.

Notable Comparisons

202211072244|🌵 Notably different from Reciprocative Self-Defense
Defending Others Defending Others
A person may use the same force as defending oneself in defending a third party, within reasonable judgment that the attack is unlawful. 202301161835|[176]
Double Jeopardy Double Jeopardy
A person is charged more than once for the same crime, such as when an act is in violation of both federal and state statutes. Most legal systems prevent double jeopardy. 202306052009|[16] 202306052009|[17]
E
Elements of a Crime Elements of a Crime
Act (actus reus), Mental State (mens rea), concurrence (of the act and mental state), and causation (of factual and proximate cause of result 202302142037|[1].
Ex post facto law ⚔️ 🏛️ Ex post facto law
An retroactive law that: Makes an act criminal that was not criminal when it took place; "Aggravates" a crime or make its punishment more severe; Changes the rules of evidence against criminal defendants, as a class; or Changes criminal procedure to deprive criminal defendants of any substantive right. These types of laws are prohibited by the Constitution. 202303162257|[6]

Comparison

202304182325|🔮 Arcacian constitution does not prohibit ex post facto laws because doing so would allow lawful evil to use legal loopholes to harm others. 202303162257|[6]
Exception Expressio unius, exclusio alterius
Inclusion of one implies the intention to exclude others. When a statue includes a specific exception, it is implied that there are no other unstated exceptions. 202305022202|[13]
Excuse Defense: Excuse
An excuse as a defense (such as duress) is based on the premise that a reasonable person would act the same under the coercive condition, and therefore the actor should not be punished for acting reasonably. 202301182053|[174]
F
Factual Merger Factual Merger
A doctrine that it is not permissible to punish for a lesser included offense if there is conviction of a larger offense. 202306052009|[17]
Felony ⚔️
I
Infraction ⚔️
Intent Intent
202307211946|[19] Two circumstances of "intend": 1) Desire that the result happens. 2) Knowledge that their action will cause the result to happen.
Interpretation Interpretation

Specific controls general

When two statutes address the same subject, the more specific rule takes priority over the more general rule 202304051611|[10]. The common laws may be used to interpret what the criminal statute does not specify 202304051611|[11].
J
Justification Defense: Justification
A justification as a defense (such as necessity) is based on the premise that the actor has avoided the occurrence of a greater harm by his criminal act, and there produced net social utility. 202301182053|[174] Justification includes actions that are legal. 202301182053|[179]
M
Misdemeanor ⚔️
Murder ⚔️ Murder
202307211946|[20] Major difference between typical law and reciprocative justice law: In typical law, a person can be convicted of murder only when the victim dies as a result. In reciprocative law, murder is about the offender's intention to kill in combination with their action to kill. Whether the victim dies is irrelevant to the murder charge. The fact on whether the victim dies from the assault is part of the judgment of the damage inflicted, but not the crime of the action. The crime is not whether the victim is dead. The crime is that the offender tried to kill someone. 202308022006|[24]
N
Non-deadly Force Non-deadly Force
The use of non-deadly force to defend oneself requires the defender to be without fault and use only reasonable force to protect themself from the attacker's imminent use of unlawful force on them. 202301161835|[175]
O
Overlaping Offenses Overlapping Offenses
202307211946|[18] When the law has overlapping offenses, the lesser included offense become not applicable.
P
Plain Meaning Rule Punishment
202305022202|[12] Under the "Plain Meaning Rule", if the language and meaning of a statute are clear, the court must apply it with the exception if it would lead to oppression, injustice, or an absurd result.
Punishment Punishment
202302191059|[3] Theory of Punishment justisfying the punishment of a crime: 1) Specific Deterrence: Prevention of crime by discouraging a specific offender; 2) Restraint: The form of punishment (such as imprisonment) prevents further offenses; 3) Rehabilitation: Remove the offender's need or willingness to commit further offenses; 4) General Deterrence: Dissuade similar offense by the general public; 5) Public Message: Using the trial process to inform the community about the standards of right and wrong; 6) Retribution: The one who violates society's rule owes a debt to society and deserves to be made to suffer in proportion to their wrong.
R
Reasonable Belief Reasonable Belief
A reasonable belief that a particular danger exists requires: 1) The defedant believed a danger existed, and 2) their belief was reasonable. The factors to consider include the victim's knowledge of agressor's reputation for violence; aggressor's threats or physical superiority; victim's experiences bearing on the honesty of his belief as to danger, such as situations where they has been in danger before.202301161835|[177]
Repeal Repealing a statute does not exonerate a person whose judgement has become final. Some states have a saving provision where prosecution may continue with the statute that exists at the time of the crime. 202305022202|[14] 202306052009|[15]
Retreat Retreat
In reciprocative justice (and the general rule), there is no duty to retreat for a victim subjected to life-threatening force. In jusridictions where there is a duty to retreat, there is usually excepts in the following situations: 1) The victim cannnot retreat in complete safety; 2) the attack occurs at the victim's home or place of business; 3) the attack occurs when the victim is making a lawful arrest; 4) the attack occurs when the attacker is robbing the victim 202302142037|[181].
S
Superseding Cause Superseding Cause
202308022006|[22] A defense to escape liability by showing that an incidence was caused by an intervening third party of unforseeable causes.
T
Tort Tort
202302191059|[2] An incident that results in liable damages to an individual, even when the incident was unintentional. The party that causes the incident is held liable, but is not punished for causing the incident.
202308022006|[21] General tort principles of causation: cause-in-fact and legal cause applies to criminal law also.
202207161423|🏛️ Philosophies 💬 Discussions
{"id":"202301011739","parentid":"202208092007","parentname":"Paladin Hall","icon":"⚖️","title":"Criminal Law","subtitle":"","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2018/09/09/19/57/balance-3665426_960_720.png","music":"","author":"Natalie","description":"","card-text":""}
Issues: 7 | Quests: 1116

Cardinal Quest
[202301032033]
Failure Analysis
◀ 2023 JAN 03 TUE 8:33 PM
Cardinal Quest
⭐
This is a routine check of Cardinal Quest status and planning for 2023. This is not an emergency.
StarTree: There are 5 open quests, 193 quest hours, 56 side quests, and 1 prep quest remaining! P4 completed the potion quest.
Tanya: Red 202301010947|mentioned 202301011001|New year resolution on Jan 1. I think we should do that for Cardinal Quest by setting a direction and priority of improvement.
Tanya: There are currently 94 unanalyzed fails at the Cardinal Quest Log. So I propose that for the four monthly rank up for @Cardinal, we prioritize failure analysis to be one of them. Tanya: @StarTree, could you list the categories?
⭐
StarTree: TSN 29, CHK, 21, MND 19, COM 8, PROC 8, PROJ 4, AIM 2, APT 2, DSN 2, HBT 1, LAN 1, SPEC 1!
TSN (29): This type of failures can be avoided by having better notes!
CHK (21): This type of failures can be avoided by adding checks to Evelyn's checklist!
MND (19): This type of failures are mistakes that we don't yet know how to avoid!
COM (8): These are communication failures, where people weren't on the same page!
PROC (8): These failures are caused by not understanding the process!
PROJ (4): These failures are related to insufficient project management!
AIM (2): These failures are related to overall goals we are aimming at!
APT (2): These were "Aptitude", StarTree doesn't know why they are marked as such!
DSN (2): These failures are related to the design!
HBT (1): This failure is related to habit!
LAN (1): This failure is related to language!
SPEC (1): This failure is related to specification!
Tanya: I think we should take care of TSN and CHK on the field during downtime. At a discussion thread like this we should handle other categories.
⭐
Ledia: I beg to differ. I think we should do the ones we know what to do first. Those are the low hanging fruit. Tanya: There could be some important failure that we overlook because we don't know what to do with them. Ledia: But the counts of those other categories are so small, to me that means they are infrequent and thus inconsequential. Tanya added a New Year Resolution for Cardinal Quest. Tanya: Let's destroy fringe categories. @StarTree please add a count of 94 failures. StarTree: Done!
Tanya: The failure on HBT was that the cart lamp was left on over the weekend. It only happened once. Evelyn: I think that could be part of MND, that someone just forgot. Tanya: But it took two mistakes for that to happen: 1) The lamp was not turned off, 2) the cart was not unplugged from the outlet. Tanya: The cart should always be unplugged at the end of the day to reduce any possible damage. Ledia: But it only happened once. Someone must be trying to leave for the weekend in a hurry. Tanya: Who was the last one at camp? StarTree: It was P4! P4: I'm sorry! Ledia: It is rare that P4 is closing off. P4: P4 left the camp the way it was. 🐣 Evelyn: It's okay, now we know that the last one should shut down the power. 🤗 P4: P4 knows now! 💟 Ledia: I think this issue can be prevented by adding a note on the Quest Log. Whoever doing the quest is logging credits, so they will see it. Tanya: I would consider that resolved. HBT group is now empty. Tanya: And I regroup SPEC as TSN.
Tanya: The LAN failure was about misinterpreting the meaning of a message because it was written in a foreign language.
Tanya: In particular, someone misinterpreted who will do a task. That led to unnecessary delay. Evelyn: I think that can be grouped as COM.
⭐
StarTree: The message was on 2022-03-29: "XXさんに確認下さい。" Then on 2022-03-31, Zoey replied that we are waiting for someone to confirm, but the original message was asking us to confirm! Zoey: Someone replied "thank you," so I thought they were going to confirm. XD Zoey: The cause wasn't that the message was in Japanese. The cause was that I skimmed through emails. XD Ledia: I don't think so. It was in English it would be obvious even if you skim through it. Evelyn: I think that week was hectic. So this could be just a reading error. 😅 StarTree: On March 29, 2022, the quest time was from 8:06 AM to 10:36 PM! Evelyn: It was over 12 hours. 😖 Tanya: For analysis, I will regroup this MND/EXH. EXH stands for Exhaustion. It marks an error that happens on a High Stress Level day. We might return to the EXH group if we see a pattern of that causing errors. Tanya thanks all for their good work.

Happy Calendar
[202301042043]
The Sandwich Shop
2023 JAN 04 WED 8:43 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
So I went to the sandwich shop recommended by my coworkers. Black: This was written in retrospec on 202301042043 about what happened on 20221231 around 1 PM.
Black: Before the break, there was an end of year gathering when my coworkers recommended a sandwich shop near my aunt that I would be visiting around new year. Black: It was December 31, it was raining, and the shop will close on the next two days. I arrived at the small shop a little after noon. Black: The small shop was previously at the on ramp to the freeway but that exit has been permanently blocked, presumably for safety reasons. Black: So now the shop is at the deadend of a long street, which is very strange for a sandwich shop to be. Black: On the window of the shop was a "cash only" sign. I was planning to order two sandwiches and three cups of soup. Black: I didn't check how much cash I brought. Black: And it turned out that I was short by $10. Black: "I guess that will have to do," the shop owner said, and told me to come again and bring friends. Evelyn: Such a nice person. 😊 Ledia: So are you going to pay it back next time? Black: Yes. Ledia: Just pay and not order anything? Black: Maybe the same order without BBQ sauce. None of us liked the BBQ sauce. Tanya: Why didn't you know that you didn't have enough cash? Black: I thought it was just sandwiches, how much could it be. Tanya: You mean you didn't see the menu? Black: I didn't see the menu, and while I was there I didn't see a menu. The shop was small and had only four seats. Tanya: @StarTree. StarTree: Sandwiches were $15 each and soup was $5 each according to a September 2022 photo of the menu! Ledia: And what was the total? Black: $54, I paid $44. Tanya: Subtotal would be $45. 20% tax? StarTree: The tax was 7.75%! Tanya: The total would be correct if it was $16 per sandwich and $6 per soup. Ledia: Isn't that expensive even at the base price? Black: Oh well. Zoey: The only moral I get from this story is please check the menu first. XD Black thanks all for chiming in for his story.

Cardinal Quest
[202301051520]
Failure Analysis Part 2
◀ 2023 JAN 05 THU 3:20 PM
Quest Channel
⭐
This is Tanya calling for routine failure analysis. This is not an emergency.
Tanya: There are 24 Failures to be discussed. I am starting from the ealieest one in April 2022. Tanya: This failure, along with at least two other, is about taking too long to respond.
⭐
Casey: I think the one in April was special. Logistisc was overwhelmed and couldn't send package in time. StarTree: The package was issued on Mar 31 but did not ship out until April 4! Ledia: Mar 31 was a Thursday. Apr 4 was a Monday. Tanya: But the package was requested on Mar 29, a Tuesday. It took a whole week to ship. Ledia: What were you expecting? Tanya: To ship out on Mar 29 or Mar 30. Evelyn: That week was the same hectic week. 😖 Casey: Adding to the delay, some people were off that week. Tanya: I see. I will mark the cause as EXH.
Tanya: Now the other two: May 2, and Oct 19. StarTree: May 2 (Monday) Quest Time was 10:13 AM to 9:15 PM! Tanya: The response delay was 2 weeks. Could you find more information about the context? StarTree: There was a request for a scroll on Apr 19, but no one responded until May 2! Tanya: What was the Inbox size on Apr 19 and May 2? StarTree: Apr 19: 61, May 1: 155, May 2: 22! Ledia: It looks like someone discovered the request while going through the Inbox. Tanya: Who was going through the Inbox? StarTree: It was Evelyn! Evelyn: I think those two weeks were also overwhelming. 😖 StarTree: Deer Crossing was on! Tanya: I see. We had a routine to check inbox but we were overwhelmed by other priorities. I'll mark that as EXH.
Tanya: And Oct 19? StarTree: That week was Eastern Sea quest! Tanya: Marked as EXH Tanya: 21 failures remain to be analyzed.
Tanya: Apr 21 Deer Crossing. What was that about?
⭐
Black: It was missing specification. We didn't consider that Wisp Circle needed to be compatible with the old glyphs. We were trying to make that work.
Tanya: The next one, Jun 3 is about a lack of standard. When we use a slash as a separator in a title, sometimes we use slash (/), sometimes backslash (\). In MAP, I am using (/) like other teams. Please be consistent.
Tanya: Next on the same day, Jun 3. Someone requested an item that was meant to be removed. @StarTree could you confirm whether the error was in registration or in the the request? StarTree: Registration was correct! Tanya: I will mark that as EXH because that week we were doing Arsenal.
Tanya: Next: Jun 30. We got an enchantment scroll since April, but we didn't use it until June. Evelyn: We were still doing Arsenal. Tanya: I see. EXH.
⭐
Ledia: Is it helpful if we just mark them EXH? What is the counter measure? Tanya: After the first round of analysis, we can return and see if we can prevent EXH. The implication is that if we weren't overwhelmed, the issue wouldn't have happened. Evelyn: We will try to stay ahead so that we are not overwhelmed.
Tanya: Next: July 2. We had a question that we could ask in a meeting but did not ask. Ledia: Jul 2 was a Saturday. Sasha: We don't normally have topics for the meeting. I think we just forgot about it until I checked the log that we were supposed to ask. Black: I think in general we should just email instead of waiting for a meeting to ask a question. StarTree: The Inbox size was 28! Tanya: It doesn't look like we were overwhelmed. Sasha: I think that we had already emailed but got no reply. So the meeting was an opportunity to discuss. Tanya: I will set the solution to LOG. If there is a topic to discuss during a meeting, please put it in LOG. Then when we join the meeting we will see it.
Tanya: Next: July 12. Arsenal. Gravity Gate leylines were connected wrong.
Evelyn: That was my fault. And we added a step in the checklist. Tanya: I mark as EXH.
Tanya: Next: Aug 5. The meeting invitation has information but I didn't scroll down to read it because I wasn't aware that there were more. Evelyn: I wonder what kind of countermeasure this takes… now that we know about it. Tanya: I added to TSN
Tanya: Next: Aug 10. Sasha reported that someone pulled an all nighter and started the next day like a zombie. Evelyn: Who was the zombie…? Sasha: I don't remember. StarTree: StarTree doesn't have a record of that! Ledia: I bet it was Zoey after binge-watching anime. Zoey: That is highly possible. I don't keep track of that. XD Casey: It was me. I was building Magic Bakery with LEGO. I came then I just went home. I didn't do anything that day. Tanya: I see. Zoey: Ledia lost her bet. XD Evelyn: By the way, I do want to discuss binge-watching. Although it is not related to Cardinal Quest. Tanya: Let's close down and start a new thread. 13 failures remain. Tanya thanks all for their good work.
💬 Discussions

Habit

Binge-Watching
PIN 202301052146
Binge-Watching
Habit
Binge-Watching is watching many episodes at once. While it can be easier to follow the story from one episode to another, it could also lead to problems if you trade sleep for watching.
📺 How to stop binge-watching
What do you do if binge-watching becomes disrruptive?

🌳 Paper Stars

Make paper stars while binge-watching. P4: This may not stop you from binge-watching, but lets you get something done while watching.

🧱 Exercise

You could pair watching video with exercise, and stop when you are beat.

🌊 Watch with someone

Find a friend to watch with at a slower pace. Evelyn: So that you wait until they are ready to watch the next episode.

🧱 Queue It

Put the show in a queue Black: Put the show you want to binge watch on a queue with other shows or activities, so that you don't watch the next episode until you also go through the other tasks.

🧱 Strict bed Time

Set a strict bed time.

🧱 Episode limit

Set a limit on how many episodes to watch.

🧱 Timed Shut down

Set a timer to cut the power.

🔥 Watch Sped-up

Watch at increased speed

🧱 Turn off lights

To bring yourself into bed time.

🧱 Timed interrupt

Set an hourglass or a timer, and do something else when the time is up.

Jump to...

202208182205|🚀 Habits
Habits
[202301052202]
Binge-Watching
2023 JAN 05 THU 10:02 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This thread is about how to stop binge watching. The node is 202301052146|here.
Evelyn: Binge-watching is when you watch many episodes at once. It could become a problem when it disrupts your sleep. Evelyn: This thread and the node is mainly about how to stop it if it is causing some undesirable effects.
Evelyn: I think one way to help stop it is having a friend who would watch with you, so you wait until they are also ready to watch.
Ledia: For my understanding, does someone have a problem of binge-watching? Evelyn: I think... let's focus on the solutions. 😅
Black: Put the show you want to binge watch on a queue with other shows or activities, so that you don't watch the next episode until you also go through the other tasks. Ledia: That takes more discipline. Black: Not really. I think when you start switching to a different task, the addiction would be dampened. You might even discover something else more fun to do.
Zoey: If you have enough discipline you could limit the number of episodes you watch or set a strict sleep time. But I think the point is that those methods do not work, otherwise you won't be binge-watching in the first place. XD
Sasha: How about setting a time on the TV or computer to shut down? Ledia: I think that is better than discipline. Zoey: But if you really want to watch it it would be overriden. XD
P4: What about binge-watching with a speed up? Zoey: Does that even work? wouldn't the sound be all messed up? XD Sasha: Actually that's not a bad idea. I can watch it fine at 1.5x. Ledia: And what are you watching? Sasha: NCIS. Ledia: Speaking of which, when are we resuming the almost daily detective game? Sasha: Let's say tomorrow. I'm still trying to catch up from the games we played during the break. Evelyn wishes all a good health.

15
SCOREBOARD
🥨 Players: Black, Casey, Evelyn, Ledia, P4, Sasha, StarTree, Tanya, Zoey
⭐ Merits: Black, Casey, Evelyn, Ledia, Tanya
🏅 Recognitions:
💟 Kudos: Black, Casey, Evelyn, Ledia, P4, Sasha, StarTree, Tanya, Zoey
💗 Awards: 3B, Black, Evelyn, Gaia, Kisaragi, LRRH, Natalie, Patricia, Sasha, StarTree, Sylvia, Tanya, Vivi
👑 Top: 25 Black 16 Evelyn 15 Sasha 15 StarTree 12 Tanya 9 Kisaragi 9 Vivi 8 Sylvia 8 LRRH 8 Ledia 7 Gaia 7 3B 6 Patricia 5 Natalie 5 P4 5 Zoey 3 Helen 3 Casey 2 Ken 2 Mikela 2 James 2 V 2 Arcacia 1 Ivy
Cardinal Quest
[202301061856]
Failure Analysis Part 3
◀ 2023 JAN 06 FRI 6:56 PM
Quest Channel
⭐
This is Tanya calling for routine failure analysis. This is not an emergency.
Tanya: Continuation of Failure Analysis. 13 remaining.
Tanya: Aug 17. A drawing for crafting was not translated from foreign language. Evelyn: I think this can be handled by the checklist.
Tanya: Next. Aug 30. Arsena/Geyser. What was that about? Casey: We were waiting for a part to finish crafting, but it might be possible to test using an alternative. Tanya: I will mark that as EXH because we prioritized other tasks.
Tanya: Next. Sep 6. Cat Island. Evelyn: That was about missing content when we merged to the main scroll. There is now a checklist for that.
Tanya: Sep 6. Cat Island. Evelyn: There is also a checklist for that. This was about the content of the scroll does not match the main scroll when they are merged.
Tanya: Sep 13. Arsenal. Serpent Cave. We didn't explain how the cave works. Evelyn: I will add description to TSN.
Tanya: Oct 6. Dawn Island. Missing specification. We already added to TSN.
Tanya: Dec 8. Death Valley. There was a failured marked as management where we ordered something when we don't really know whether they are needed. Ledia: I think that is not entirely accurate. There were two required ingredients. The quest asked for the first but not the second. So we gave them the first, first. Evelyn: But that was strange. Ledia: Not if they already have the second. Zoey: We didn't get a good answer on what is supposed to happen. So we just complete our part first. Sasha: Then was it a failure or not? Tanya: Vladanya marked it as a failure. Zoey: But there was nothing more we could know about it. Evelyn: Let's add a note in TSN that we did not/could not know whether they have the second ingredient. Tanya: That is impossible. The second ingredient will also have to be new. Tanya: Five failures remain.
Tanya: Dec 8. A component came with wrong labels. Was the order wrong? StarTree: We never ordered the labels! Evelyn and StarTree made them! Tanya: Was that the plan? Evelyn: I think that was the plan, but we could have planned better. I will add to checklist.
Tanya: Dec 13. Deer Crossing. The same meeting was being scheduled by two people. It was flagged as a communication failure. Sasha: I should have asked before scheduling. I added a note to TSN.
Tanya: Dec 16. Deer Crossing. There was some activity near us where some other questers disconnected equipment that is running a test. We didn't warn them even though we were near it. Evelyn: I was there and knew they were moving something, but they were in my blindspot. When I realized what happened it was already too late. Ledia: It was a Friday. Evelyn: It was a low stress Friday. We were just tidying things around camp and doing clerical tasks. Tanya: What is the counter measure? Evelyn: I think I should have asked them earlier what they were planning and reposition so I could see them. Black: This is KY. Hazard Prediction. Tanya: Training topics will go to TSN. Ledia: The training is not going to prevent the situation if Evelyn wasn't there. How about a sign that says, "Testing in progress, do not power off"? Tanya: That is a good idea. Sasha: Do you attach the sign only when the equipment is in use? Ledia: I think it can just be there permanently. Whoever uses the equipment will know if they can power off. LRRH: I will ask that team about this suggestion. LRRH: They are off but I made labels. Tanya: I mark this resolution type SGN for Signage LRRH: I still need their permission to put a sign on their equipment.
Tanya: Dec 21. Red hit her head after connecting a leyline. LRRH: But it was fine. I had protect on. Tanya: But you didn't notice that you would hit something. Ledia: For countermeasure, how about choosing a path that does not have such hazards? Tanya: I consider that resolved by TSN, and changed the category to SFT for Safety.
Tanya: Last one. Dec 21. Deer Crossing. We were asked to check an enchantment, but would have made a wrong call if the asker didn't give us further hint that it was wrong. Casey: I was careless. Evelyn: I have just added to TSN. Tanya: That concludes this round of failure analysis. The next target area is to clear the messages we marked to add to TSN. Ledia: Is the New Year Resolution completed? I thought the plan was to do one failure analysis each month. Tanya: It is completed. We caught up and cleared all of them. LRRH: Good job. Tanya is recognized for the skill Collapsed Time Frame. Tanya thanks all for their good work.
💬 Discussions

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202301061940|🔒 Public Locker {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202301061940","music":""}

Puzzle

Jim and Sarah are spies working together. They cannot meet each but they need to pass something important through a public locker. Each of them has a separate lock that only they may open or close. How would they use the locker to pass the parcel securely?

Show Answer

Jim puts the secret in the locker then locks it with his lock. When Sarah sees that, she puts on her own lock. After that, when Jim sees Sarah's lock, Jim unlocks his. Finally, Sarah gets the content by unlocking hers.

📒 RD #32
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202301061940","parentid":"202208141928","parentname":"Puzzle Plaza","icon":"🔒","title":"Public Locker","subtitle":"Puzzle","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2020/02/29/15/20/cake-4890393_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Mikela","description":"","card-text":""}

👑 Top: 13 LRRH 13 Tanya 12 Evelyn 11 Ledia 9 Black 8 Sylvia 8 P4 7 Arcacia 7 StarTree 6 Gaia 6 Patricia 6 Kisaragi 6 Casey 6 Zoey 4 Sasha 3 Mikela 3 James 3 V 2 Vladanya 2 Ivy 1 Fina 1 Natalie
CH 16 Manga
[202301071248]
Abilene Paradox Part 2
◀ 2023 JAN 07 SAT 12:48 PM
Wyvern Island
⭐
This is for discussing solutions to the Abilene Paradox at this node.
Sasha: Abilene Paradox is the undesirable situation where people trying to do something nice for others end up doing something no one wants.
Zoey: I think this kind of issue is easy to solve by simply knowing that it exists.
Evelyn: I think there can be some method to avoid that situation, such as brainstorming for more options. If the person who gives the first suggestion gives more than one suggestion and start comparing them, then others will see that the choices are meant to be compared and speak their mind.
Black: You can keep a tally on who likes which choice. Ledia: I can't really think of anything to add. Evelyn: I want to add the concept of mindfulness.
💗
Evelyn: Mindfulness includes paying attention to whether others really like an idea or are trying to be polite. Being mindful of other's emotion dispels Abilene Paradox.
Tanya: I think there is enough content for the Abilene Paradox solutions. Let's also do Self-Interest vs Other-Interest
Tanya: Let's also do Self-Interest vs Other-Interest. How should we define these terms?
⭐
3B: I have thought about it and I think Self-Interest exists in pursuing Win-Lose and Win-Win outcomes, while other-interest exists in pursuing Lose-Win and Win-Win outcomes. In such definition, there is a middle ground where the two overlap. 3B: The main difference is that when a Win-Win outcome is unreachable, a person with a Self-Interest worldview will choose Win-Lose. While a person with an Other-Interest world view will choose Lose-Win.
Ledia: How do you determine a person who pursues Lose-Win is not in fact pursuing Win-Win if they want to sacrifice? 3B: It escaped me... LRRH: Is there a point in drawing such difference? Tanya: It was part of the prompt: "self-interest is good for all." LRRH: But deciding whether a person is acting based on self-interest or other-interest would not change the range of solutions to a problem. Ledia: I think there is a perspective based on "invisible hand" that even if people only pursue Win-Lose, the outcome will be as much Win-Win and society can get. If we bypass the term "self-interest", I think that is what the prompt means. Sasha: I disagree. I think the original meaning is not pursuing Win-Lose. It is just pursuing self-win. So that includes Win-Lose and Win-Win. Self-interest should be ambivalent toward whether others also win. Self-interest means, "I pursue my Win." It is not intrinsically hostile. Ledia: Then let's dissect it. Is being hostile to others when pursuing self-win good? Such as when you know a way for Win-Win, but you intentionally choose a Win-Lose path. Sasha: There is a difference between winning a battle and winning a war. If you are to harsh on others, they could fight back and you lose long term. So even if you pursue self-interest, it doesn't mean that you would be short-sighted. Ledia: Then if you know that you will die? then you don't care about people fighting back? Sasha: People normally don't know when they will die, and they could have some people they want to protect. Zoey: I call foul. "Have some people they want to protect" is not part of self-interest. Sasha: It is. It is like you want people to worship you, so so keep your worshipers alive. That is self-interest. ERROR Sasha: Such as the Abilene Paradox, when you try to do something good for other while buring what you want for yourself. Ivy: If Self-interest is defined to include Win-Lose and Win-Win, then its opposite would include Lose-Lose also. Ledia: For my understanding, if someone forces you to do something, and you do it because you don't want to be killed, are you doing it out of self-interest? Sasha: Yes. And that also includes when you escape or fight back. Acting in self-interest does not excuse someone else's wrong doing. Ledia: But how do you define wrong doing? The oppressor is also acting in self-interest. Sasha: Everyone breathes, is breathing evil?
⭐
LRRH: I don't think we can easily resolve this definitional conflict. I am leaning toward people who attack "self-interest" are suffering from black-or-white thinking. They cannot see that prioritzing self-interest is at least neutral.
LRRH: A person who prioritizes self-interest (Win-Lose or Win-Win), and a person who prioritizes other-interest (Lose-Win or Win-Win) are compatiable. There is no conflict to resolve.
⭐
Ledia: What if you only prioritize Win-Win? Then shouldn't that view be strictly better than a view that would prioritize Win-Lose or Win-Win? LRRH: Yes, I suppose.
Ledia: Then Win-Win is strictly good. Win-Lose is not as good. Self-Interest includes Win-Lose, so Self-interest is also not as good. Other-interest and self-interest might equivalent, that's why we can't tell which one is better among them. LRRH: I agree.
3B: I think we might have gone further than what I can draw in a page. So, after page 12, who wants to move first?
LRRH: First I jump onto the turtle because I also want people to speak their minds. Sasha: That gives an example where self-interest is good.
Zoey: Then I want to show that Abilene Paradox is a weak attack because people who are susceptible to it actually want others to benefit, so once they know about this paradox and try to know what people really think, the paradox would not materialize. It is easily dispelled. You don't need to pursue self-interest to defeat Abilene Paradox. 3B: What do you want to do on scene? Zoey: I cast faerie fire and show that the "flood" is an illusion. 3B: Okay. I think then Sasha would need to response. But please let me draw this first. 3B thanks all for the content.
� Discussions

202207161423|Philosophies

 202301071252|🌵 Abilene Paradox {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202301071252","music":""}
Abilene Paradox
Issue
When a group decides something no one wants out of mutual politeness.
Abilene Paradox is the undesirable situation where people trying to do something nice for others end up doing something no one wants.
⭐ Solutions

☀️ Awareness

Be aware of this issue and confirm what people really want.

☁️ Brainstorm

Make more than one suggestion and make it clear that choices and objections are welcome.

🌳 Survey

Keep a tally on who like which choices.

☀️ Mindfulness

Be able to tell the difference between sincerity and merely politeness.

🌳 Golden Rule

If you can't confirm Sasha: Such as when you try to do good for people in the future., you may assume that other populations is as diverse as to the best of your knowledge.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202301071252","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"🌵","title":"Abilene Paradox","subtitle":"Issue","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/11/22/19/27/arid-1850193_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Sasha","description":"","card-text":""}
Issues: 8 | Quests: 1158

202210151642|Bookshelves

 202301080924|🎩 Writing Magic {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202301080924","music":""}
This node collects writing tips!
🎪 Audience and Purpose
Write for yourself first. Helen: "When you write a story, you're telling yourself the story. When you rewrite, your main job is taking out all the things that are not the story." {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.openculture.com/2023/01/stephen-kings-20-rules-for-writers.html","desc":"[link]"}
What writing do you like to read?
Short and Direct

Descriptive

Funny Dialogues

Wellplaced DM involvement for suspence

Just start writing. Helen: You may start from the start of the story, or the part you want to write. You may start with the part the reader should not know. Everything will be fine when you revise.
Identify your target audience and their needs, interests, and expectations.
Define your purpose and main message for writing.
Use appropriate tone, style, and language for your audience and purpose.
Provide clear, relevant, and engaging information that supports your purpose.
Organize your ideas logically and coherently for your audience.
🌳 Structure and Outline
Collect keypoints then organize.
Use a schema to identify blindspots
Preview structure for informational writing
Start with a clear thesis statement that summarizes your main argument and guides your writing.
Use an outline to organize your ideas into logical sections and sub-sections, such as introduction, body, and conclusion.
Follow a consistent structure throughout your writing, such as using topic sentences, transitions, and evidence to support your points.
Review your outline and structure before you start writing, and revise them as you go along if needed.
Seek feedback from others on your outline and structure, and make adjustments accordingly.
🚀 Clarity and Conciseness
Use simple and precise words to convey your message.
Avoid unnecessary jargon, slang, or filler words that may confuse or distract the reader.
Organize your ideas into clear and logical paragraphs with topic sentences and transitions.
Use active voice and strong verbs to show action and responsibility.
Eliminate redundant or irrelevant information that does not support your main point.
🍌 Editing and Revising
Use a spell checker and a grammar checker to identify common mistakes.
Copy and paste to ChatGPT. XD
Read your draft aloud to catch errors and awkward sentences.
Ask someone else to read your draft and give you feedback on clarity, organization, and coherence.
Revise your draft based on the feedback and your own evaluation. Focus on the main idea, structure, and argument of your text.
Edit your draft for style, word choice, and tone. Avoid jargon, clichés, and vague expressions. Use transitions to connect your sentences and paragraphs.
Proofread your final version carefully before submitting or publishing it. Check for typos, punctuation errors, and formatting issues.
Avoid passive voice, and adverbs Helen: avoid adverbs especially after "he said" and "she said." {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.openculture.com/2023/01/stephen-kings-20-rules-for-writers.html","desc":"[link]"}

🔮 Reference Writing
📒 Writing Magic
📘 Writing Whizardry
20230108: This list is from the book Writing Whizardry. The categories are from me.

Vivid Scenes

[1] Put muscle in your verbs
[2] Say what you mean
[3] Tell it all
[4] Invigorate your verbs
[5] Paint vivid word pictures
[6] Fix your focus
[7] Show, don't tell
[8] Lights! Camera! Action!
[9] Setting the scene

Flowing ideas

[10] Exciting leads
[11] Grab your reader's attention
[12] Satisfying endings
[13] Build bridges
[14] Write for your reader
[15] Variety adds spice
[16] S-t-r-e-t-c-h a sentence
[17] Crunch sentences

Characters

[18] Bring your characters to life
[19] Different apperance
[20] Different acts
202301162147|[21] Speech Quirks
[22] Different thoughts
[23] Put them all together
[24] What's in a name?
[25] Character tags

Be sensible

[26] Let the reader see what you see
[27] Smell what you smell
[28] Hear what you hear
[29] Taste what you taste
[30] Feel what you feel
[31] Put them all together

Be emotional

[32] Mood Magic
[33] Love
[34] Anger
[35] Frustration

Clarity

[38] New-P New-P Rule

[40] Support your great ideas
[41] Examples give extra support
[42] Get real
[43] Sensational similes
[44] Magnificient metaphors
[45] Say what?

Literary Devices

[46] Get noisy with onomatopoeia
[47] Alluring alliteration
[48] Don't keep the reader in the dark
[49] Keep 'em in suspense
[50] Use a little hype
[51] Say it with meaning
[52] An anthropomorphic angle
[53] Bring things to life

More Literary Devices

[54] Try a rhyme
[55] Surprise your reader
[56] Could you repeat that?
[57] Color your dialogue with colloquialisms
[58] Season your dialogue with idioms
[59] Lively allusions
[60] Say it with symbols

{"id":"202301080924","parentid":"202210151642","parentname":"Bookshelves","icon":"🎩","title":"Writing Magic","subtitle":"Writing Skill","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2018/02/16/14/38/stars-3157822_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Helen","description":"","card-text":""}

Status

Indecision
PIN 202301081047
Indecision
Status Effect
Indecision happens when a person feels that they need to make a decision, but fails to make a satisfying decision. Its effect includes holding up their mind from make other decisions.
⭐ Solutions
How do you free yourself from indecision?

Solution

In this section, list the solutions by type.

Jump to...

202208181022|😖 Status Effects
Status Effects
[202301081057]
Indecision
◀ 2023 JAN 08 SUN 10:57 AM
Happiness Clinic
⭐
A problem that troubles you is not a problem too small to discuss.
Black: The whale nursery is ordering optional sweatshirts. I need to reply by Monday but I cannot decide whether to get it.
Reason not to: The sweatshirt is a 1/4 zip. I don't like putting on or taking off clothing over my head. I also already have a whale nursery jacket that is very warm. Even if I get this new sweatshirt, I don't think I will use it.
Reason to: Would it be weird if everyone else has the new sweatshirt and I don't?
⭐
Sasha: That is Abilene Paradox. You are hit. Zoey: @Black, why are you giving Sasha ammo? XD Sasha: Abilene Paradox is not as rare as you make it to be. Evelyn: Are we still waiting for 3B? 😅 3B: I think problem solving has higher priority.
⭐
Zoey: Okay. So you know there is this thing called 202301071252|Abilene Paradox. You are imagining that everyone else will get and wear the sweatshirt. If you get that sweatshirt just to fit in, you are in the dead center of Abilene Paradox because you are doing something you don't actually want to do.
Zoey: So, it would help if you know that many people will not wear it. Do you have evidence that they will not?
Black: The reason of that sweatshirt is that it is cold and some people are wearing their own hoodies with other logos. The nursery cannot ban those hoodies without giving them an alternative.
Ledia: And how many people are wearing those hoodies now? Black: Few. Maybe around 10%. Ledia: And you are not one of them, are you? Black: I am not. I wear short sleeves most of the time. If it is cold I wear the old nursery logo jacket. That jacket has full zipper. And even that is normally temporary because the facility has heating. Ivy: Just don't get it. You don't need it. It is a waste of resources.
Black: What if I will grow to like that sweatshirt? Zoey: But you already said you don't like wearing clothing that goes over your head. What is going on? XD Tanya: The fear of regret is stronger than the fear of waste. Tanya: As I have always said, the cost of indecision in time is more than the cost of waste. If you can't decide, then pick the choice that you would regret less. Black: I think that would mean to get it, because I think someone is going to order one that is sized too big. Then I can trade with them. Sasha: I would agree on Tanya about regret. This reason has nothing to do with other people. Zoey: But you get piles of board games. XD Sasha: But isn't it better if you play it and confirm you don't like it, than not to try at all? Evelyn: But if you are getting it in case someone else orders the wrong size... I think I might do that too. 😅
Ledia: Shouldn't you just ask if the nursery will re-order if there is a demand? If they say yes then don't order it. Sasha: And what if they say no? Ledia: Realistically, why would it be no? There are new workers and they need uniform. Old uniforms get worn out. Why wouldn't they routinely reorder uniform? Sasha: Double standard. You are using double standard. You asked for fact, but when I asked you what if the fact goes the other way, you said won't care. Ledia takes one psychic damage.
LRRH: Little Red worries that this topic won't end.
Casey: Let's go treasure hunting while thinking about it.
⭐
Ivy: You are planning to get one sweatshirt that is inconvenient to wear, and easy to get dirty and frayed. What will you do with the existing jacket that is more convenient and more durable? Black: If the new sweatshirt is redundant, then I might wear it at home. Ivy: And what do you do with what you already have at home? Black: They are clothing, they eventually wear out. Then I have replacement. LRRH: I think you already have more clothing than you wear. Ivy: I am trying to stop unnecessary things from being made. Black: Things I don't wear tend to be clothing I need to put on from the top. Tanya: Because you wear glasses. Ledia: Quarter zip should be fine with glasses. But it is of couse less convenient than full zip.
⭐
Evelyn: What is the ideal outcome? Black: That my jacket has the new logo, and others can also get that jacket, which has full zip. Evelyn: How about you make the suggestion about a jacket and get the sweatshirt? I'll take it if you don't end up wearing it. Tanya: Evelyn likes sourvenirs. Ledia: Well, now we've got a demand. Is it settled? Black: I think that is settled. Black decides to make the suggestion and get the sweatshirt. Black thanks all for helping.
� Discussions
NCIS
[202301082213]
Case 8: Plot Twist 3
◀ 2023 JAN 08 SUN 10:13 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 8 Plot Twist 3!
Sasha: ⚠️ The game content is rated "Age teen to adult"
🚨 PLOT TWIST 3
StarTree: StarTree followed the money and found that the guild is being investigated for distributing a grant of $10k without accepting competing applicants! The treasurer is Mr. Ham, the victim's best friend!
Sasha: Friendly reminder: only six clues to be revealed in this round. Tanya: The girlfriend and the daughter are low on my suspect list.
🔍 [33] Best Friend Mr. Ham
StarTree: Mr. Ham awarded the grant to the victim without telling the rest of the guild, and the bank clerk remembers the victim cashing out the check and giving half of the money to Mr. Ham!
44: 44 confronts Mr. Ham about the grant, "Did you split the grant with [the victim]?" "No, that was an entirely different matter."
Sasha: Money is money, what is the difference? Even if the victim owes Ham money, if Ham helps the victim get money illegally so the victim may pay him back, Ham is still part of the crime. Tanya: Mr. Ham has a motive. Is it bad if we mark which suspsect has motive, means, and opportunity? Sasha: For this game, let's wait until we guess. Tanya: What if there is a separate notes area with spoiler alert? Sasha: I think that is doable. But you would have to update it since you don't know all the clues yet. Ledia: I think it would be convenient. Especially if you stretch the play time. Evelyn: Yes, I would like a summary. 😅 Tanya: I added notes on Mr. Ham. Evelyn: It is very helpful. 😊 LRRH: The word 'Opportunity' is too long. how about 'chance'? Ledia: Better.
🔍 [3] Headquarters
StarTree: Yo! Mr. Fox calls the HQ saying the Lawyer is outside his house with a gun trying to kill him!
Ledia: Ledia rushes to Mr. Fox's house and sweeps the area. Mr. Fox is safe and there is no sign of the lawyer.
Ledia: Was Mr. Fox under influence of just alcohol or hallucination? Could he have killed the victim not knowing that he did it?
🔍 [124] Mr. Fox
StarTree: StarTree looks up the alarm record of Mr. Fox's bracelet and found that it ran off for three minutes the previous morning!
Zoey: What does 'previous morning' mean? Is that within the time of death? XD StarTree: StarTree has no idea! Tanya: I think that means Mr. Fox does not have an alibi.
🔍 [165] Crime Scene
Zoey: Zoey does an experiment to see whether Mr. Fox could reach the crime scene and back in 3 minutes. She ran from Fox's house to the crime scene and back at a pace she assumes Mr. Fox is capable. It took her about 2 minutes.
Zoey: I know we don't have a motive for Fox. Yet. Ledia: No motive, no means, only opportunity.
🔍 [88] Papa Lawyer
Tanya: After learning that the lawyer's father is an antique gun collector, Tanya asked Red to find and talk to him.
LRRH: Little Red knocks on Papa Lawyer's front door but there is no answer. Her dog brings her to a shed where she knocks again. "Just a second," replies Papa Lawyer. He opens the door and apologizes, "Sorry about that, I was busy making a new batch of soap. What can I do for you, little miss?"
LRRH: Can you... Ivy: Yes, lye is a key ingredient of homemade soap. Zoey: Is it just me or everyone who knows chemistry in this game is a murderer? Sasha: We are lucky that the murderers are not forensic scientists. Ledia: Are we on the same page that although Red finds Papa Lawyer making soap, we can reasonably assume that Lawyer Jr. also knows that? Tanya: Yes.
🔍 [115] Papa Ready
James: James goes to a fellow agency to help identify a decomposed body that the shooting range owner, Papa Ready, was found digging it up at a site 30 miles away from the reenactment site. Found with the body was a large diameter slug--the bullet fired from a shotgun.
Black: This seems to be a separate incident. James: You don't say. Sasha: Okay! We will reveal Plot Twist 4 next round and there will be two free clues! If you want detective EXP in the meantime, you could summarize the notes for the suspects if it has not been done!

Unused Round 3 Clue

🏅 Recognitions:
💟 Kudos: 3B, 44, Black, Casey, Evelyn, Ivy, James, Ledia, LRRH, Sasha, Skyle, StarTree, Tanya, Zoey
💗 Awards: 3B, 44, Amelia, Arcacia, Evelyn, James, Patricia, Sasha, Skyle, Sylvia, V, Vladanya
👑 Top: 22 Helen 15 Black 10 Sylvia 9 Skyle 9 Evelyn 8 James 8 Sasha 6 44 6 Patricia 6 V 6 3B 6 Ledia 5 Amelia 5 Arcacia 5 Zoey 5 StarTree 4 Vladanya 4 Kisaragi 4 Ivy 3 Casey 3 LRRH 3 Tanya 1 Fina 1 Natalie

202207161423|Philosophies

 202301092123|🌍 Better World Metrics {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202301092123","music":""}
Better World Metrics
Metric
Civilization metrics evaluate society's progress. Positive metrics measure desirable outcomes, while zero metrics aim for zero undesirable outcomes. Using these metrics, societies can gauge their strengths and weaknesses and identify areas for improvement.
⭐ Social and Public Health
Evaluating a society's ability to ensure citizen welfare and promote social justice through measures like healthcare, child mortality rates, and poverty rates.
📌 Child Mortality Rate {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2023/04/america-mortality-rate-guns-health/673799/","desc":"[link]"}
⭐ Economic growth and prosperity
Measuring a society's economic output, standard of living, and wealth distribution can provide insights into its level of economic development and well-being.
202211251143|🧻 Poverty
⭐ Social and political freedoms
Evaluating the degree of individual freedom, human rights, and political participation within a society can reveal the level of democracy and justice in that society.
202212170823|🚨 Crime
Cultural and artistic achievements
Examining the quality and diversity of a society's cultural expressions, including literature, music, art, and architecture, can offer insights into its intellectual and aesthetic achievements.
Scientific and technological innovation
Tracking a society's advances in science, technology, and engineering can reveal its ability to solve complex problems and enhance its quality of life.
Environmental sustainability
Assessing a society's impact on the natural world and its ability to preserve natural resources for future generations can reveal its level of environmental consciousness and sustainability.
💬 Discussions

NCIS
[202301092133]
Case 8: Plot Twist 4
◀ 2023 JAN 09 MON 9:33 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 8 Plot Twist 4!
Sasha: ⚠️ The game content is rated "Age teen to adult"
🚨 PLOT TWIST 4
James: The body that Papa Ready dug up is identified as Mr. Bank, who has been missing for over a year. On his body are strands of Ms. Ready's hair.
Sasha: There are only two free clues in this round. First come first serve. Tanya: I only have one prime suspect, Mr. Lawyer. Ledia: I think we are really getting the drift down. Black: We are still missing any physical evidence connecting the murder to the lawyer. I think we should reveal HQ first. If that doesn't show anything unexpected then reveal the lawyer. Tanya: I am fine with that plan.
🔍 [271] Headquarters
Ivy: Ivy tested the American rifle taken from the shooting range and concludes that the bullet that killed the victim could have been fired from that also. The bullet that killed the victim has an unusually large amount of rust trapped in its grooves.
Ivy: I think that might mean the bullet has been in the barrel for a long time. The discharge might be an accident, and... Ivy: We are missing a clue on whether the rifle from the shooting range has been recently fired. Ledia: I think we might need bonus clue to also reveal clues from Ms. Ready. P4: ** P4 sings ** StarTree: StarTree thinks maybe the murderer is not the same person who got lye onto the victim! Zoey: What about the footprints, what do they mean? P4: Maybe the victim was stepping backward until he was shot? Sasha: By the way... with the new scoring, everyone of us who has joined so far will take part in the accuracy ratio. Only those who contribute to bonus clues can change their mind. LRRH: ** LRRH sings ** Sasha: I've just update the Detective Notes section. To me Papa Ready is the only suspect who is rated 'strong' on Motive, Means, and Chance. So I am just going to reveal his last clue to see if that gives him an alibi. Sasha: If not, the murderer could be Ms. Ready.
🔍 [160] Papa Ready
Sasha: Having been caught red headed moving the body of Mr. Bank, Papa Ready confessed that Ms. Ready killed Mr. Bank, but insisted that they have nothing to do with the murder of the victim. "Why did you dig up Mr. Bank's body?" asks Sasha. "I was afraid that [my daughter] would crack, so I wanted to move that evidence." says Papa Ready.
Sasha: If you believe that Papa Ready is truthful that they have nothing to do with the victim's murder, then the lawyer would be the prime suspect. Tanya: Still short of any physical evidence linking him to the murder. Sasha: We are still four AA short of the first bonus clue. Let's start making your choice. Zoey: I pick the Lawyer. I hope that his last clue would be the missing link. ** Zoey sings XD ** Evelyn: I pick the Lawyer also. ** Evelyn sings ** LRRH: Same. Ivy: As of now, there is no physical evidence linking the lawyer to the murder. I pick the daughter. Ms. Ready. Ledia: This is a tough one. I would want to use the bonus clue on the lawyer. * Ledia sings * StarTree: StarTree follow Ivy, wee~~! ** StarTree sings ** Sasha: I pick Papa Ready for now. ** Sasha sings ** Evelyn: I like how singing at this time helps make the game less stressful. 😊 Black: There seems to be no good reason not to chip in for the bonus clue. I pick the lawyer. ** Black sings ** Ledia: Well, it would be more awesome if you just pick before bonus clues. P4: P4 wants to roll the dice. ** P4 rolls ** Ms Ready. Ivy: Dad, pick a suspect. James: The Lawyer. ** James sings ** Tanya: The Lawyer. Sasha: Okay. Now those who contributed may collectively review one bonus clue. Ledia: I call to reveal the last clue of the lawyer.
⭐ [69] The Lawyer

Bonus Clue 1

LRRH: "Hello Mister, I am with Magic Detectives and would like to speak to your son," says Little Red. "Oh, welcome," says Papa Lawyer, "is this about [this case] or [that case]?" Apparently Mr. Lawyer routinely talks to detectives, but Little Red wants to ask about... "What nice rifle you have," Little Red speaks about the antique British rifle hanging on the wall, "does it still fire?" "I doubt it, my dear. Most of these guns are just for show, too rusty to be any use otherwise."
Zoey: Whew. XD Sasha: I switch to the Lawyer. James: Come on, Ivy, thanks Daddy for singing. Ivy: I switch to the Lawyer. StarTree: Wee~~! ** StarTree jumps to the lawyer ship~ ** P4: P4 flies to the laywer ship also. Sasha: Okay. Now we reveal the unused clues. Starting with the crime scene.
🥁 [246] Crime Scene

Unused Round 4 Clue

Zoey: Zoey finds a small trace of gunpower at the crime scene. Zoey wonders if HQ can match this gunpower to one of the rifles they collected as evidence.
🥁 [189] Victim's Girlfriend

Unused Round 3 Clue

LRRH: Little Red was talking to the girlfriend about the note. "The worst part was that [the victim] was holding out on me," says the girlfriend, "He just got a big check and didn't expect me to find out." Little Red notices a bottle of drain opener in the cabinet as the girlfriend is looking for something to drink.
LRRH: Does... Ivy: Yes. Drain opener has lye. Zoey: Uh-oh. TPK! XD Ledia: Have some faith would you. 😉 Sasha: Okay. Let's reveal the round 4 clue of the girlfriend last. Zoey: XD
🥁 [170] Mr. Fox
StarTree: Mr. Fox's bracelet is alarming out right now!
Ledia: Ledia rushes to the location, and finds Mr. Fox crying hysterically at the crime scene. "What am I going to do now? Oh God, what am I going to do now?"
Evelyn: This is the saddest scene so far. 😢 StarTree: 😭
🥁 [22] Best Friend Mr. Ham
44: 44 asked Mr. Ham to explain how what he did was not the same as splitting the grant money. "At that point it was his own personal money. He could use it for anything. including paying off what he owed me. I have given him several loans since his divorce." says Mr. Ham. "Did your fight that morning have anything to do with this?" asks 44. "He wanted more. I said no, and he wouldn't shut up."
Sasha: Nope. Mr. Ham is guilty. Tanya: Agreed.
🥁 [140] Ms. Ready

Unused Round 3 Clue

Amelia: Amelia asked Ms. Ready where her father went, but the daughter won't answer. "Were both of you involved in the murder of [the victim]?" asked Amelia. To that Ms. Ready shook her head. "Tell me where your father is, or you are going down alone." "Go ahead and arrest me then," said Ms. Ready. Just then, a fellow agency informed us that her father was caught digging up a body.
🥁 [122] Ms. Ready

Unused Round 4 Clue

Amelia: Amelia confronted Ms. Ready on the body that James identified, "Who was Mr. Bank? Another boyfriend?" Ms. Ready won't answer.
44: 44 interrupts the interrogation to talk to Amelia. "Ms. Ready has an alibi. Several customers confirmed that she was at work at the time of the murder."
🥁 [228] Victim's Grilfriend

Unused Round 4 Clue

LRRH: "That's some pretty dangerous stuff you have in the cabinet," Little Red says about the bottle of drain opener in the kitchen cabinet. "That's what I said!" says the girlfriend, "he never puts stuff back where they should be after using them! He drives me crazy all the time!" The girlfriend seems to have zero sympathy for the victim's murder.
🛎️ SOLUTION
Sasha: The murderer is the Lawyer!
Motive: Revenge for the two drunks who put his wife into a coma.
Means: The Lawyer used the rusty British rifle of his dad. That was a big mistake as it could only barely fire and left rust trace on the bullet. That undoed his attempt to use lye (which he also took from his dad's shed), to destory evidence that might have left on the victim's body.
Opportunity: The solution didn't say that the Lawyer stalked the victim, but it was implied.
Sasha: Please return for the next case!
Sasha thanks the players!

[202301102202]
Case 1: Plot Twist 1
◀ 2023 JAN 10 TUE 10:02 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 1 Plot Twist 1!
Sasha: ⚠️ The game content is rated "Age teen to adult"
🚨 PLOT TWIST 1
Sasha: The victim is found dead over the keyboard of his computer at his apartment. Still running on his computer is an MMO game called Dark Wonderland.
Sasha: To prepare for the finale of Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, I decided that we will first re-do Case 1, which only Tanya and I played. Sasha: Since we already know the solution, we will sit out in the discussion and take a fail. Sasha: We will reveal all clues for Round 1 and Round 2, then 6 for Round 3, and 2 for Round 4.
🔍 [260] Crime Scene
Evelyn: The body has dark blue lips and excessive salivation. Evelyn estimates that the time of death was one day ago. According to report, he was found by the apartment manager.
Tanya: At his computer, Tanya sees two email threads of angry exchanges, one with a Mr. Conan, the other with a Mr. Dragon.
Evelyn: I think the victim was poisoned, although the clue didn't say so explicitely. 😅
🔍 [276] Headquarters
StarTree: StarTree looks up the game Dark Wonderland, which has several thousand people online at the moment!
Zoey: Death gun. XD Ledia: Is the apartment manager one of the suspects? Tanya: No. Ledia: It is a little odd how the apartment manager discovered the body after just one day.
🔮 [157] Mr. Conan
P4: P4 is practicing oracle skill with mom. What do you see, P4? P4 sees Mr. Conan reading a video game magazine that talks about him. The headline reads, "What is Conan's next big one?" Mr. Conan mumbles, "All that work for nothing. Why did [the victim] freeze me out? I wasn't asking for all that big a share. Why did he do that?"
🔍 [180] Mr. Dragon
3B: A fellow agency has just received a call from Mr. Dragon requesting protection from a Mr. Diamond. Dragon says that Diamond is the murderer and he would be next.
🔍 [4] Mr. Diamond, the Mad Hatter
Ledia: Ledia says on the channel, "Mr. Diamond, the ex-pro-wrestler? He is better known as the Mad Hatter. I wonder what he does nowadays."
Ledia: If the victim was poisoned, I don't really see the murderer would be an ex-pro-wrestler. Black: Maybe the Mad Hatter serves tea.
🔍 [223] Victim's Coworker Mr. Blake
StarTree: StarTree finds that the victim had filed an assault charge against his co-worker Mr. Blake, who is a soldier with numerous records of losing his temper toward his commanding officers, and is on probation for civilian assault charges!
Ledia: This coworker also does not fit the profile of someone who would murder using poison. Zoey: The murderer must be a chemist. Follow the fumes. XD
🔍 [29] Victim's Father
LRRH: Little Red visits the victim's father to break the news to him. "I don't even have a son," says the father as he begins to weep, "not after what he said when his mother died a month ago. Before that, I hadn't seem him for more than a year. I once loved my son, but now I think I bred the devil."
💬 [144] Victim's Girlfriend
Mikela: Mikela finds where everyone has been and joins the channel. "According to the absolutely true gossips, the victim has a long-distance girlfriend who has been a fan of the game Dark Wonderland that the victim and Mr. Dragon created together. However, rumor has it that the victim recently dumped her over the phone saying that he needs more space!
Ledia: It wouldn't surprise me if it was his girlfriend who came looking for him and discovered the body. Sasha: Just a reminder to the newer players that if you want to level up your detective level, you need to both guess the right suspect at Round 4, and has enough lightbulb 💡 moments during the game. You cannot get lightbulbs from what the clue says, but you can get them from interpreting those clues, reminding others about them, and by summarizing the motive, means, and opportunities at the Detective Notes section. Mikela: What is the plan after NCIS? Sasha: We have Consulting Detective, Detective, and 221 B Baker Street. I think it will last for more than one year. Mikela: Mikela is thinking whether the guild will do puzzles again. Zoey: I quite like the pacing of NCIS, eight clues and stop. We can do that every day. Mikela: Could we rotate so that some days we do puzzle time? Sasha: I think the weekend is the natural good time to do puzzle time because we don't marathon with this pacing. Ledia: Or any day we don't have enough time to do a detective round. Mikela: The detective game runs for four nights straight. Is it bad to have a puzzle time when it ends before starting the next one back to back? Sasha: That is only NCIS. I have no idea how many sessions it takes for Consulting Detective. Evelyn: I think puzzle time is good in the morning. Mikela: Then puzzle time will never get prime time. 😢 Evelyn: I am okay with alternating. Sasha: Okay. Let's try this: In between each case is puzzle time until Mikela is satisfied. This applies to games I run because I think the channel is just first come first serve. Mikela: I am fine with that. Sasha: And of course you can also start a puzzle in the morning or after we have a detective round, or when there is no time to have a detective round. Sasha: I think the main challenge is that we don't want a situation (like before) where we are just trying to get a session over with so the next activity could start. Evelyn: I think not scheduling them on the same night would be more relaxing. Mikela: And I understand that the players of detective would want to keep running a case until it ends, since it is harder to remember what the case is about otherwise. Sasha: Exactly. Sasha: So, by this plan, the next puzzle night is this Saturday. The plan for tomorrow night is Case 1 Plot Twist 2!
Sasha thanks the players!
