202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202301110856|💣 Rioters, Assemble! {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306272117","music":""}
After riots in a large institution, one section did not reopen for much longer compared to other section. Why?

Show Answer

The rioters threw rock samples from the geology department at the police!
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://a.co/d/0nWS4YP","desc":"📒"} Classic Lateral Thinking Puzzles. Pg 115
💬 Discussions
{"id":"P202301110856","parentid":"202208141928","parentname":"Puzzle Plaza","icon":"💣","title":"Rioters, Assemble!","subtitle":"Puzzle","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/07/30/16/05/goal-1557417_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Mikela","description":"","card-text":""}
Puzzle Plaza
[202301110900]
Rioters, Assemble!
◀ 2023 JAN 11 WED 9:00 AM
Puzzle Plaza
⭐
Hey hey hey, it is puzzle morning!
Mikela: After riots in a large institution, one section did not reopen for much longer compared to the other sections. Why?
Evelyn: It can't be it is destroyed, can it? 😅 Sasha: Too normal. Ledia: Do we get detective XP for guessing? Sasha: I would say yes. But perhaps not the win ratio, otherwise no one would play. Ledia: How about we replace the buzzer with the lightbulb for DXP, and don't use the buzzer unless you really want to wager? Then if you use the buzzer, that could affect your detective hit rate. Sasha: I think that is a good idea. Casey: Is it because many rioters work in that section, they quit or were arrested? Mikela: Here is a hint: Evelyn is closer, the rioting was violent, but it wasn't damages to the building that prevented reopening. Sasha: You mean it is damage to some property, but not damage to the building itself? Like things were stolen during the rioting? Mikela: Sasha is extremely close! Ledia: They destroyed the furnitures? To make barricade? Mikela: Not the furnitures in this case, but you are closer than Sasha! Evelyn: Did they burn books in a library? Mikela: Extremely close! The institution is not a library! And the object they stole and used were not books! P4: Was it a school? Mikela: It is an edcuational place but not a school. I'll allow three more guesses before revealing the answer. Tanya: Was it a gallery? Mikela: It is a type of gallery, but the object in question are not paintings! Sasha: Museum and statues? Mikela: It is a museum, but the objects are more boring than statues! Ledia: This is like playing Clue. We are guessing the place, the object, maybe we should be guessing the motive also. Mikela: I am only giving you one last guess! Casey: What is boring? Fossils? Mikela: The rioters threw rock samples from the geology department at the police! Congratulations, Casey, your guess was the closest! Evelyn: 😖 Ledia: If Casey used the buzzer, would the answer be close enough as a win? Mikela: I assume that question is for Sasha! Sasha: This is way harder than NCIS. NCIS is basically a multiple choice out of six. This is fill in the blank. Ledia: Well, you can decide how difficult it is by deciding how close the answer needs to be to score a hit. Is fossil close enough to rock samples to score a hit? Sasha: If you were to decide, what would you say? Ledia: I would say the closest guess, which Mikela normally determines by her standard, gets a win. But guesses that are not as close do not get a loss. There is no penalty to guessing, but the winner can win. Evelyn: I think that would be fun. Sasha: Wouldn't that inflat the hit ratio? I don't want people getting easy wins at @Puzzle, because puzzles are short. Ledia: I think it caters to a different player type because puzzles are shorter. Sasha: I am not against a player getting a win in puzzle. If you use the buzzer you may get a win. I just don't want people getting a win without any risk of getting a loss. Ledia: But if we don't know how close an answer needs to be to get a win, how do we judge whether to take the risk? Mikela: That is a very interesting question! Tanya: In NCIS, the chance of getting a win so far is close to 100% since we discuss. LRRH: I think the possibility of getting a loss would keep people from using the buzzer. Ledia: It depends on the leeway. Mikela: During the drumroll stage of the puzzle, I would let people propose answers. When there are three choices or so, the players would vote. The closest choice is the winning choice even if it is not exactly the same as the solution. Here, the difference between this and the detective game is that a puzzle player is not obligated to pick a final answer. They may come to just get lightbulbs. Sasha: I am fine with this idea. Ledia: That is very reasonable. I am fine with it too. Mikela: Okay. We will try that next time. And the next puzzle will be this if you want to start thinking about it before we discuss: Mikela: A man told his wife that he buried guns in the garden when he did not. Why? Mikela wishes all a wonderful day!
� Discussions
NCIS
[202301112031]
Case 1: Plot Twist 2
◀ 2023 JAN 11 WED 8:31 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 1 Plot Twist 2!
Sasha: ⚠️ The game content is rated "Age teen to adult"
🚨 PLOT TWIST 2
Evelyn: Suspecting that the cause of death is poison, Evelyn asks the field agents to bag all suspcious food and drink, and perhaps also the keyboard that the victim would have touched.
🔍 [118] Crime Scene
Zoey: At Evelyn's prompt, Zoey bags samples of all remaining food and drink in the victim's apartment. Among them is one from an almost empty bottle of energy drink that had rolled under a couch on the side of the computer desk. It could very well have rolled from the desk to the couch.
Zoey: If we were really playing as ourselves, I could have tried casting detect poison to see if the bottle is poisoned. Sasha: I think we can do that, such as when a clue finds poison, you could say that you used magic to detect it.
🔍 [240] Headquarters
Zoey: Worried that somehow the poison might degrade over time, Zoey casts detect poison on the bottle from under the couch. it is definitely poisoned, but she couldn't tell what kind of poison. Zoey makes a note and sends it back to the lab.
Ivy: At HQ, Ivy runs tests for the poison, and the bottle. "In the meantime, I matched fingerprints on the bottle to the victim's coworker Mr. Blake." says Ivy.
Zoey: What kind of evidence was the murderer trying to hide? Their own scent? Zoey is recognized for the skill Detect Poison.
🔍 [169] Victim's Coworker/Boss Mr. Blake
Kisaragi: The detectives visit Mr. Blake at his house. "We would like to ask you a few questions about your desk resassignment at work," says Kisaragi. "I was promoted to become a product manager," says Mr. Blake. "Do you know [the victim]?" "Of course, he is constantly reminding me how unqualified I am for the job, so we fought. Is that what this is about?"
Kisaragi: The clue card doesn't say Mr. Blake is just the victim's coworker. It says he is the victim's boss. Since Mr. Blake has just been promoted, I don't think he would kill the victim. Kisaragi: Mr. Blake also seems calm and doesn't know that the victim has died. P4: Why would a boss be less likely a murderer? Kisaragi: I think a boss has other means to revenge so they are less likely to resort to murder. P4: 💟
🔮 [198] Mr. Conan
P4: P4 sees Mr. Conan at his apartment. There are computer manuals, a very dead plant, open bags of chips, colorful frogs in a sealed terrarium, and art pieces made of wire hangers.
P4: Mr. Conan has poison frogs. Zoey: Arrest the chemist! XD
🔍 [73] Mr. Dragon
Ledia: Ledia took the quest to protect Dragon, who has many locks for his front door. "You've got to get to [Diamond] before he gets to me," says Dragon. "Someone else is onto him," says Ledia, "Do you want my protection or not?" Dragon let Ledia in. "Why would [Diamond] wish you harm?" asks Ledia. "He vowed revenge on both of us, insisting that we owe him more money for the [poor] work he did." says Dragon.
Ledia: It wasn't entirely clear from the clue, but I think he meant Diamond was the victim and Dragon's employee.
🔍 [66] Mr. Diamond, the Mad Hatter
Black: Black interviews Mr. Diamond at his residence, which is a fleabag hotel. "I wouldn't be here if [the victim's company] had just paid me my money," says Diamond, clearly agitated, "I worked for months, doing voice-overs for some stupid computer game. Now all I ever hear from them is 'check is in the mail.'" According to records, Diamond filed a lawsuit against the victim's company, but, "Why did you end up dropping those charges?" asks Black. Diamond is stunned at that question.
Black: Diamond might not have enough money to sue. He is in the opposite relation of Blake. Diamond is running out of options to get even.
🔍 [47] Victim's Father
LRRH: "What did your son do, [Papa Victim]?" asks Little Red. "My son was a genius. He programmed his first game at 7. When he asked me to fund him to quote 'take over the gaming world' I let him borrow my retirement fund. How could my own son cheat me? How?" says the father.
LRRH: Do we know where the money went? Zoey: I don't think any clue mentioned the victim's finance. Maybe the money is just in his bank account? LRRH: Would the father get the money back if his son is dead? The first clue of the father mentioned that he was the victim's only living next of kin. Ledia: I think it would go to him. Evelyn: 😖
🔍 [135] Victim's Girlfriend
StarTree: StarTree logs into the victim's account in Dark Wonderland and found nasty in-game messages from "the Girlfriend" in the gossips, "I'm now here in town. This is your last chance to make it right." !
Sasha thanks the players!

💟 Kudos: Black, Casey, Evelyn, Ivy, Kisaragi, Ledia, LRRH, Mikela, P4, Sasha, Tanya, Zoey
💗 Awards: Arcacia, Black, Cardinal, Evelyn, Ivy, LRRH, Melody, P4, Patricia, Sasha, StarTree, Sylvia, Tanya, V, Vivi, Vladanya, Zoey
👑 Top: 26 Helen 19 Vivi 19 Evelyn 17 Vladanya 15 Sasha 14 Zoey 13 StarTree 12 P4 12 LRRH 12 Black 11 Sylvia 8 Arcacia 8 Tanya 7 V 7 Ivy 7 Ledia 6 Patricia 6 Cardinal 5 Mikela 4 Melody 4 Kisaragi 3 Ken 2 Casey 1 Neil 1 Natalie 1 James 1 3B

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202301120931|🔫 Garden of Guns {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202301120931","music":""}

Puzzle

A man told his wife that he buried guns in the garden when he did not. Why?

Show Answer

The man was in prison and knew that all his mail would be read. His wife asked him when she should plant the potatoes. He replied in mail, "don't plant any potatoes, I hid some guns in the garden." Later, his wife wrote back, "The police came and dug up the garden but found nothing." He replied, "Now plant the potatoes."

📒 Classic Lateral Thinking Puzzles. Pg 195
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202301120931","parentid":"202208141928","parentname":"Puzzle Plaza","icon":"🔫","title":"Garden of Guns","subtitle":"Puzzle","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/07/30/16/05/goal-1557417_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Mikela","description":"","card-text":""}
Puzzle Plaza
[202301121026]
Garden of Guns
◀ 2023 JAN 12 THU 10:26 AM
Puzzle Plaza
⭐
A man told his wife that he buried guns in the garden when he did not. Why?
Mikela: Following the previous discussion, you will come up with some ideas then we will see which one is the closest to the solution! Casey: Is this one of those questions where "Garden" or "Gun" have a different meaning? Robert: So she wouldn't dig in the yard and find the bodies? Amelia: Because he wants his wife to dig a hole in the garden. Black: Why would she want to dig up his guns? Amelia: To kill him for burying the guns. Tanya: I think that solution would not be complete unless the husband has a reason to provoke the wife into killing him. Sasha: And why would the husband need to bury the gun? He could probably provoke the wife in many other ways and just have the gun easily accessible to the wife. Ledia: It would seem that the purpose is to dig the garden. But why would buried guns be an incentive for the wife to dig? Zoey: The one I knew was about a stream with pebbles. A farmer wants to get the pebbles off the stream and spread rumors that someone dropped gold there. Then strangers came removing the pebbles as they futilely search for the gold. 44: The one I read is potatoes. 😬 Black: What does that mean?
Mikela: Spoiler Alert below! 44: The story/joke goes that the guy is in prison, his wife told him during visit that she wants to grow potatoes, he told her to wait. Then a few days later, he called the wife using the prison phone and tell her that he buried guns in the garden (knowing that the phone is tapped). A couple days later, a bunch of FBI came to their house and dug around the garden, but found nothing. In the next visit, he tells his wife that she can plant the potatoes now that the soil is plowed. 😅 Zoey: That's the answer isn't it? Now what? XD Ledia: Do you instantly get a win if you have heard of the solution? Sasha: I have not thought about that. What do you think? Ledia: I think that has nothing to do with detective skill so that shouldn't be a win. Tanya: How do you tell if a person already knows the solution of a mystery? Black: If a person already knows the solution of many puzzles, wouldn't they be unable to level up if you not let them get a win? Ledia: But you don't get a win if you replay the same mystery. That's why Tanya and Sasha take a fail for NCIS Case 1 when we replay it. Sasha: That's true. Mikela: We could skip this one and try another one. Sasha: I think that is what we need to do. Mikela: I added a spoiler alert tag. I will reveal the clues now, in case you decide that 44's solution is NOT the answer. Mikela: Clue 1/2: The man lied but was not trying to deceive his wife. Mikela: Clue 2/2: The man worried that gardening is too hard for his wife who lives alone and has no one to help her. Sasha: There is nothing suggesting anything unlike 44's version. Mikela: Then next is the solution... Mikela: The man was in prison and knew that all his mail would be read. His wife asked him when she should plant the potatoes. He replied in mail, "don't plant any potatoes, I hid some guns in the garden." Later, his wife wrote back, "The police came and dug up the garden but found nothing." He replied, "Now plant the potatoes." Mikela: Congratulations! Together you know everything! Robert: I like this one. Robert: Maybe only applies to America and China. I feel like some other countries would be courteous enough to undo what they did. Zoey: XD Ledia: After having the clues, if I had proposed an alternative solution same as 44's, but the communication method was letters instead of telephone, would that be a distinct choice that would beat his solution? Mikela: I think that difference is not significant enough. Tanya: But your book is "Classic Lateral Thinking Puzzles". Zoey: We have to think old school. XD Sasha: I would say if you dare to make a good case to split hair then let's do it. Mikela: Okay. Next puzzle will be: A man has been enjoying his meal at a dinner party and had just started a delicious dessert. Why did he deliberately knock over the salt cellar into his dessert and ruin it? Mikela wishes all a wonderful day!

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202301121032|🍨 Monster Dessert {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202301121032","music":""}
Monster Dessert
Puzzle

Puzzle

A man has been enjoying his meal at a dinner party and had just started a delicious dessert. Why did he deliberately knock over the salt cellar into his dessert and ruin it?
🔍 Clue 1: Status
The man was hungry and would normally enjoy this dessert. He had started eating it. It tasted good, and he felt fine.
🔍 Clue 2: Motive
The man did not want to eat the dessert and didn't want to appear rude.
💡 Guess A
The man remembers that the dessert is unhealthy. He ruins the dessert to beat the temptation. 😖
💡 Guess B
The man placed a bet with someone that he could stop himself from eating the dessert.
💡 Guess C
The man wants to avoid a debuff soon after. Such as he needs to drive and doesn't want to feel sleepy.
💡 Guess D
It is about an ingredient of the dessert that he has recently decides not to eat.
💡 Guess E
It is for a religious reason.
💡 Guess F
He doesn't have enough money to pay for the dessert.

Show Answer

The host sneezed! The guest felt that his dessert had been contaminated but didn't want to be impolite and made up an apparent excuse!

📒 Classic Lateral Thinking Puzzles. Pg 195
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202301121032","parentid":"202208141928","parentname":"Puzzle Plaza","icon":"🍨","title":"Monster Dessert","subtitle":"Puzzle","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2018/05/08/10/41/apple-pie-3382722_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Mikela","description":"","card-text":""}
NCIS
[202301121941]
Case 1: Plot Twist 3
◀ 2023 JAN 12 THU 7:41 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 1 Plot Twist 3!
Sasha: ⚠️ The game content is rated "Age teen to adult"
🚨 PLOT TWIST 3
Tanya: FYI: The victim was hired by the military to develop a new computer game called SEAL, intended as a recruiting tool.
Sasha: Friendly reminder: only six clues to be revealed in this round. Since Tanya and I have already played this, we will not be discussing. Ledia: I think we should reveal more clues for Mr. Conan because he has poison frogs. We don't know how his frogs got to the victim, so we need more clues. P4: P4 wants to free the frogs. Evelyn: 😊 LRRH: Which two suspects are the least likely? Ledia: I think Dragon is unlikely, because he is still working with the victim. He wouldn't want to make his own work harder without him. Black: Are Conan and the victim coworkers? All it takes is for Conan and the victim to have met, where Conan gave the victim some poison drinks. Evelyn: It didn't say whether they are still working together. If the victim suddenly avoided him, Conan probably have not met the victim since.
🔍 [34] Headquarters
StarTree: StarTree finds that Mr. Dragon is a beta tester of an online game called SON OF A SEAL where all the enemies are clones of the victim and the hero is a sniper who can also use poison!
StarTree: Dragon might have a motive! Ledia: His motive might not be strong enough for the trouble. Black: Think of it this way. You are at his home protecting Dragon. If it turns out that he is the murderer, the drumroll is going to show Ledia missing all the clues. Ledia: Very compelling.
🔍 [95] Mr. Dragon
Ledia: "Why does [Diamond] think you owe him money?" asks Ledia. "We hired him to do voice-over but we couldn't use half of his mumbly [speech]," says Dragon. "And what did [the victim] think?" "Who knows? I haven't talked to him since he sold out to the military last month behind my back. Left me cold," says Dragon.
Ledia: If what he says is true, he now has a weak motive but not the opportunity.
🔍 [174] Crime Scene
Zoey: At the crime scene, there is a total of four bottles of that energy drink. Three of them were toward the back in the refrigerator, the fourth one is the one found under the couch. Only the one under the couch has poison.
Zoey: The clue has a detective suggesting that someone inserted the poison bottle in front so the victim would get it first. Zoey: But I don't see how that is relevant unless the poison would self-destruct if it is in the cold for too long. Zoey: And for the murderer to place the poison drink in front, the murderer would have to be at the victim's apartment. Ledia: Would the girlfriend have the key?
🔍 [216] Mr. Conan
James: James visits the shy and mumbling Conan following the lead from P4. Eventually the topic got to what exactly made him angry at the victim. "I showed him a new first-person shooter I developed," says Conan, "he promised me a big cut in a new project that he is working on, but he hasn't returned my emails for weeks now."
James: The clue card says the victim stole Conan's idea. But it didn't say for which game. James: I think it is safe to interpret that the military recruiter game "SEAL" is the game the victim is working on now, and the victim tricked Conan into showing his idea, but didn't give Conan a cut.
🔍 [111] Victim's Girlfriend
Mikela: Hey hey hey! Rumor has it that the long distance girlfriend moved to town to be with the victim's father! Yes, they already know each other! The girlfriend prefers the kind father over his selfish son!
🔍 [125] Victim's Boss Mr. Blake
Kisaragi: Kisaragi asks Mr. Blake about his car that is parked on his driveway, "Mr. Blake, we noticed that the rubber seal around your car window has deep scratches. Have your car been recently burglarized?" "Not that I know of," Mr. Blake says, and goes check his car, which has the scratch as described. Mr. Blake checks inside the car. On the car seat a six-pack of energy drink is missing two bottles. "I drank one on my way back. it looks like someone stole a bottle," says Mr. Blake.
Kisaragi: Mr. Conan has coat hangers for opening car doors. Ledia: The timing would be strange though. he would have to have stalked Blake, stole a bottle from his car, stalk the victim and put it in his house. Then one day ago, the victim drank that and died. So Blake hasn't driven or noticed for more than one day. Seems like a complicated murder. Black: But no one else has the poison. Ledia: You could probably buy the poison by itself without the frog. Evelyn: Just to clarify... It is not us who stole the bottle from Blake's car for the lab, is it? 😖 Kisaragi: The clue did not say that any detective took the bottle. I think the clue meant to suggest the bottle under the victim's couch is from this six-pack that Mr. Blake bought. Zoey: But it would make sense if we stole it after seeing the NCIS show. XD Sasha: I know, right? Sasha: Okay. No clue remaining for Round 3. Please return for Round 4, will the detectives do better than Tanya and Sasha?
❔ [10] Victim's Father

Unused Round 3 Clue

❔ [82] Mr. Diamond, the Mad Hatter

Sasha thanks the players!

Monster Dessert
[202301130841]
Monster Dessert
◀ 2023 JAN 13 FRI 8:41 AM
Puzzle Plaza
⭐
A man has been enjoying his meal at a dinner party and had just started a delicious dessert. Why did he deliberately knock over the salt cellar into his dessert and ruin it?
44: He needs the container to put the dessert in? Mikela: Okay. I've decided that you do need the clues so the choices are relevant. So here are the clues...
🔍 Clue 1: Status
Mikela: The man was hungry and would normally enjoy this dessert. He had started eating it. It tasted good, and he felt fine.
🔍 Clue 2: Motive
Mikela: The man did not want to eat the dessert but didn't want to appear rude.
Evelyn: Is it something about his health? He enjoys it but he knows that it is unhealthy. In order to not appear rude, he ruins the dessert. 😖 Mikela: I'll count that as one of the multiple candidate guesses. Casey: My guess is that the man wagered a bet with someone that he could stop himself from eating the dessert. Sasha: I think it is not about long term health but something he will do soon after. Such as he needs to drive and doesn't want to feel sleepy. LRRH: It is about the ingredient of the dessert that he has recently decided not to eat. Tanya: It is for a religious reason.
Ledia: For those proposing new ideas, are you sure you would pick yours over what exists? LRRH: I thought you don't have to pick your own guess. Mikela: No you don't! Ledia: But the player would need to read ALL of them to pick the closest one. More is not merrier. Evelyn: I'll make my guess shorter. 😖 Mikela: I highlighted the keyword in each guess. That is the keyword that I will use to determine which guess is the closest. Evelyn: I think it helps a lot. 😊 Ledia: Since you all came up with the guesses based on the clues, they are technically equally likely to be closest to the solution. The more choices you make the more risky it is for someone to choose. Ledia: Are you really going to risk your hit ratio on one of the guesses? Zoey: If I were to choose, I would probably choose A. Ledia: But will you? The chance of a hit is closer to 20%. Zoey: You are trying very hard to scare me and it is working. 🤔 Mikela: Well, this might be where true detective skill shows! Zoey: Or true cheating skill if you just Google the answer. XD P4: P4 thinks that guesses A, C, and D are similar. Could we get a WIN if the solution is closest to one of those? Ledia: That's not a bad idea if A, C, D are considered one choice, and B, E is considered the other. But you would need to confirm that it is grouped before people make a choice.
⭐
Sasha: Could we increase the reward somehow? The more choices there are, the more a win would worth. Tanya: I think that would be too much like gambling. Tanya: How about the more guesses there are the smaller chance that a wrong guess would result in a loss? Casey: I could almost get behind that, but you mean if my guess is wrong, I have 1/5 chance of losing a whole point. So if I am unlucky, I could lose many more points than I should... Evelyn: I think that is still too much like gambling. 😅 LRRH: How about we track puzzle wins differently? With a different tag? Sasha: I am slightly against that because I think that win IS related to detective win. I just want to make it less risky. Ledia: How about we reveal more clue? Tanya: But then you are deliberately trying to eliminate guesses, which begs the question of why didn't we wait to create the choices. Ledia: But no one would intentionally create irrelevant guesses otherwise.
💡
LRRH: Little Red Riding Hood is detecting a discussion paralysis. We are discussing how not to lose points instead of discussing how to tell these guesses apart IF that is what we have to work with. Sasha: I agree that this exercise should be more about challenging our detective skills than to provide a safe opportunity to grind detective XP. Mikela wishes all a wonderful day!
� Discussions
NCIS
[202301131934]
Case 1: Plot Twist 4
◀ 2023 JAN 13 FRI 7:34 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 1 Plot Twist 4! ⚠️ The game content is rated "Age teen to adult"!
🚨 PLOT TWIST 4
Sasha: Sasha relays to Ledia the finding about Dragon's game featuring killing the victim, as the result from the lab seems to be ready...
Sasha: Only two free clues in this round! Ledia: No one has a strong motive except the father, since the father lost his retirement saving.
🔍 [229] Headquarters
Ivy: Test result: The poison in the energy drink is from poison dart frogs.
Ivy: So far Conan with the poison frog is the only one that has anything matching the poison. His motive may seem weak but people have murdered for even less. Unless someone else has poison, he would be my prime suspect. Ledia: We only know that the poison from the bottle is poison frog poison. We don't know that they come from Conan's frogs, or that Conan's frogs have the same poison. Ivy: True, but other suspects don't have anything like that at all. Black: I was in the middle of talking to Diamond. I was asking him why he dropped the lawsuit. Ledia: I don't think killing the victim would do him any good, since he might still believe that the victim will send him checks. Zoey: When in doubt, check the crime scene. XD
🔍 [201] Crime Scene
Zoey: Zoey checks the victim's apartment again but found no sign of break-in. "Who might have a key to the victim's apartment?" thinks Zoey.
Zoey: The murderer need not have a key if the victim invited them to his apartment. Ledia: Blake could have swapped the victim's drink at work. The victim brought it home. Evelyn: But how did he get the poison? Zoey: Amazon. XD
💬 Detective Choices
Sasha: Okay. It is time to make your choices. Ivy: Conan with poison frog. Zoey: Hold on, I have an idea. Maybe we should think about why Sasha and Tanya got it wrong. Ledia: That is a bit meta-gaming since they didn't have the benefit of that kind of clue. Evelyn: *sings* LRRH: Did we eliminate any suspect? Zoey: We didn't. XD Ivy: No one else has the poison so far. Zoey: But we didn't reveal the last clue of any suspect. What if their last clue is a receipt of them buying poison? XD Ivy: I don't think the game would give you both the means and opportunity in the last clue. Conan is only missing the opportunity, the other suspects are missing both means and opportunity. Kisaragi: The Victim's Boss is only missing the means. Zoey: If you assume that the girlfriend has a key, then she is only missing the poison. Ivy: I am skeptical on whether you could actually buy poison frog poison online. Ledia: They don't necessarily have to buy it online. Black: The girlfriend had only recently move to the victim's town. Where was she before in the "long distance" relationship? Zoey: Better not be Columbia! XD Sasha: Please try to pick your suspect. If you don't pick a suspect, you are assumed to have picked the suspect you interviewed or take a loss. P4: P4 picks Conan also. Zoey: I pick Blake the boss. He has the best opportunity of swapping a bottle. Black: Blake has almost no motive, I think it is the girlfriend. Sasha: Everyone else except @Evelyn and @StarTree has a default suspect. Please choose. StarTree: StarTree follow Ivy, Wee~~! Evelyn: I suppose I will also follow my labmates. 😅 StarTree: *sings* Sasha: Three AA short of the first bonus clue. Those who haven't explicitly picked a suspect are James, Mikela, LRRH, 3B, Ledia, Kisaragi. Kisaragi: I pick Mr. Blake. I think we cannot explain the fingerprints on the bottle with the girlfriend. Ledia: That's true. Kisaragi: *sings* Ledia: @Black, how do you explain the fingerprints on the bottle? Black: I can't. *sings* Ledia: Conan has the poison frogs and coat hanger to get the bottle from Blake. Maybe he used coat hangers to get in the victim's apartment. I choose Conan. Ledia: *sings* Sasha: Bonus clue 1 is unlocked. Mikela: I follow the crowd. *sings* 3B: I choose Conan also. LRRH: Little Red thinks the majority is probably right and chooses Conan. Sasha: The ones with bonus clue please pick the next clue to reveal and the choices will be set for those without a bonus. Black: I want to reveal the last clue of the girlfriend to see if she has a key or if she had recently been to the rain forest, or work in a zoo, a lab, or anything suspicious. So far we have only heard rumors about her.
⭐ [190] Victim's Girlfriend

Bonus Clue 1

Black: Black tracks down the girlfriend at her new apartment and confirms that the rumors about her are true. "[The victim's father] believes in me," says the girlfriend, "He knows I was too good for his son. He even agrees that maybe I know more about game design than his greedy son and offered to bankroll me if I could prove it, just to show [his son] that he is expendable."
Black: To me this suggests that the father does not want to murder his son, since he has another way of getting back at him, and his finance is not in a dire situation. He still has enough to fund someone else. Black: I switch to Conan. Black: I also imagine that none of the suspects has a key to the victim's apartment. And since the Girlfriend might get bankrolled if she could help the father show his son, the girlfriend also has no motive to murder. Sasha: Anyone else switching? @Kisaragi? Kisaragi: I don't think that changes the situation about Blake. Ledia: What is your explanation about the scratch marks at Blake's car? Kisaragi: I cannot explain it. Kisaragi: I switch to Conan. Ledia: And Zoey? Zoey: Do I trust myself that I would be the only one correct? No. But I don't have AA. XD Ledia: You could use mine. Zoey: Thank you, I switch to Conan. XD Sasha: Okay! Drumroll!
🥁 [10] Victim's Father

Unused Round 3 Clue

LRRH: Little Red was interviewing the father, who believed that his son's business partner changed him. "That guy craves evil stuff and has no respect for anything," says the father, "I have only met him once, but I could tell right away that he was a bad influence. He caused my son to also think only about the money and power. After they became a big success, my son acted like he didn't owe me anymore. I don't know what I would do now if it wasn't for [the girlfriend]."
LRRH: I can't tell who is the bad influence. Ledia: I think that is Dragon. They made Dark Wonderland together.
🥁 [18] Victim's Father

Unused Round 4 Clue

LRRH: "[The girlfriend] was a caring friend of my son's. She encouraged him to succeed, but he broke her heart, just like how he broke his mother's heart and mine."
🥁 [82] Diamond the Mad Hatter

Round 3 unused clue

Black: "We also know that you served some time a while back for beating up a competitor in the ring. You almost killed him," says Black. "That was a long time ago and ended my career," says Diamond. "Are you still taking steroids?" asks Black, to which Diamond does not answer.
🥁 [22] Best Friend Mr. Ham

Round 4 unused clue

Black: Black returns to the question about the dropped lawsuit. "They threatened me," says Diamond, "They said that I won't get any chance for gigs like doing voice-over and autograph signings at comic conventions if I don't drop the changes. Look at me, I'm just a has-been. Those gigs are all I have left."
🥁 [41] Former partner Dragon

Unused Round 4 Clue

Ledia: Ledia tries as tackfully as she could to ask about the game where players kill the victim. "Yea? I made that game to mock him for screwing me over by joining fascist wannabe's," says Dragon, "It's just fantasy." "The poisoning part is a little real, don't you think?" "You mean he really got himself poisoned?" says Dragon with a devilish grin.
🥁 [207] Boss Blake

Unused Round 4 Clue

Kisaragi: "Who else knows about your fight with [the victim]?" asks Kisaragi. "Pretty much everyone involved in our project at work, why?" says Blake. Kisaragi notices that there is a tiny screw under the car door, and the side mirror is knocked almost sideways.
Kisaragi: I don't understand the significance. Ivy: Those might be what the burglar/murderer left on scene. We might match them with something. Please bag and tag.
🥁 [60] Conan with Poison Frogs

Unused Round 4 Clue

James: Speaking to Conan, James notices that one leg of his eyeglasses is held by tape. Jame asks, "Does that tape have a special meaning, it seems to be quite a signature look." "No, I just broke it yesterday bumping into a wall. I plan to get it fixed tomorrow," says Conan.
James: Conan dropped the tiny screw at Blake's car. Sasha: We'll see...!
🛎️ SOLUTION
Sasha: The murderer is Conan!
Motive: Conan is a genius game developer but with only one big hit under his belt. Desperate for the next hit to show that he is not a one-hit wonder, he signed over the rights to his revolutionary game idea to the victim after being offered a big cut, which didn't happen.
Means: Conan used poison from recently purchased poison frogs, and put that in a bottle of energy drink he stole from Blake's car.
Opportunity: Conan knew that he needs a fall guy for the murder and picked Blake after hearing about the public fight between him and the victim, and knew that both of them like that energy drink. So he decided to use poison and frame Blake. ** Note: The solution DOES NOT explain how Conan got the bottle of poison into the victim's refrigerator without leaving a trace. **
Sasha: Congratulations everyone! You all win! Sasha: So to answer the obvious question of why Tanya and I lost... Tanya: My idea was that regardless who has poisons, the murderer must get the poison to the victim. From the clues that we got, only the Girlfriend might have the means to do so. Sasha: At that time, we revealed almost no clue from the girlfriend or the father. We were betting on those clues to confirm one of them has a key to the victim's apartment. It was only a question between the girlfriend and the father, and we picked the girlfriend. Tanya: Another issue was that poison frogs in captivity are not poisonous. Since we did not know what clues are left for the girlfriend, we thought that the game was trying to mislead us to choose Conan, whose pet frogs would turn out to be non-poisonous. Zoey: OMG! The game was wrong. XD Ivy: No, not if the frogs were captured from the wild, which seems to be what the solution claims. Wild poison frogs can retain their poison for years. Sasha: Anyway we were wrong, we were playing it quite quickly to judge whether the game is playable for the guild. We got characters and relationships confused. Ledia: How long did do you play? Sasha: Maybe an hour before bed. Evelyn: It is probably a lot harder playing it that way. 😅 Sasha: Anyway we will take the loss! Please return for the final case!
Sasha thanks the players!

202208172107|Music Room

 202301140917|🍯 Original Music {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202301140917","music":""}

NCIS
[202301142208]
Case 9: Plot Twist 1
◀ 2023 JAN 14 SAT 10:08 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 9 Plot Twist 1! The game content is rated "Age teen to adult" ⚠️
🚨 PLOT TWIST 1
Sasha: A rising politician star is found floating face down in this swimming pool wearing only his boxer shorts.
Sasha: This is the last case in the NCIS game! Sasha: We will reveal all clues in Round 1 and Round 2, then six clues in Round 3, and only two clues in Round 4 not counting bonus clues.
🔍 [284] Crime Scene
Zoey: When Zoey arrived, the press was already there, and the body was being put on a stretcher. According to Sasha, the victim's wife found the body.
Evelyn: The body looks unusually pale and there are... injection marks between his toes.
Evelyn: I don't understand the clue "injection marks between his toes". Does it really mean the webby tissue between the toes were punctured by a needle? 😖 Zoey: We'll see whether they really mean that. XD Mikela: So the guy is dead and what gets you are the needle holes? Evelyn: I'm sorry. 😖 Zoey: Mikela is here. XD Mikela: Mikela is already here as part of the press!
🔍 [275] Headquarters
Evelyn: The victim has no water in the lungs, meaning he did not drown. Evelyn examines his heart and concludes that the vicitim died of a cardiac arrest. Then she examines the multiple injection marks between his toes.
Evelyn: The murder weapon might be a shoe with needles. 😖 Zoey: XD Zoey: If you feel needles poking you in your shoes, would you strip down do your underwear and jump into a pool? XD Evelyn: You are right, I'll continue the autopsy. 😅 Ledia: If those are injection holes, I think maybe the murder did it there because they thought the medical examiner might not find them.
🔍 [231] Victim's Wife
Kisaragi: "Sorry for you loss," says Kisaragi. The wife snorts as she continues to pour a glass of scotch. "Do you know of anyone who might have wished your husband harm?" asks Kisaragi. "To be honest, I think he killed himself," the wife slurs, "He was hardly a man anymore. They always seem to self-destruct. Why couldn't he be more of a real man like Hatchet?"
🔍 [253] Victim's hatchet man
LRRH: Little Red visits Mr. Hatchet at his home. Mr. Hatchet has bumps all over his face. "Don't worry. It is not contagious, just the meds," says Mr. Hatchet. "Mr. Hatchet, do you know who might have wished [the victim] harm?" asks Little Red.
🎩 [12] Victim's commanding officer
Mikela: Hey hey hey! The absolutely true rumor has it that the victim, as a Reservist, has a commanding officer, Candy, who has a grudge against him. The victim kept putting him down in front of others, and Candy whines about the victim being a phony who joined the Reservist only to further his political career!
Zoey: Mikela has good skill for this game, when a clue says something the detectives shouldn't know. XD
🔮 [151] Wealthy Industrialist
P4: P4 is practicing oracle skill with mom. What do you see, P4? P4 sees a wealthy man throwing his leather shoe at the TV. The man said something, what did he say, P4? "[The victim] was the dumbest of the bunch. We could have made a fortune together on the government building contract, Now I'm out at least $200 mil. Why did he break his promise? And now look at him."
P4: This man has shoes. Zoey: No way! The murder shoes! XD Zoey: Jokes aside, I don't think he is the murderer because he wants money and is hoping that the victim will give him another opportunity or make it up to him.
🔍 [209] Victim's operative
Tanya: Scanning the scene, Tanya sees the person most shocked by the murder. @StarTree, ID this blonde please.
StarTree: Ms Polly, 24, Compaign operative of the victim. She helped get the victim elected and is working for his re-election!
Ledia: I know we will reveal all clues, but why would you pay attention to someone who is shocked? Do you think she is faking it? Tanya: A murderer can be shocked if their murder attempt ended up killing the wrong person. Ledia: Compelling. Zoey: You can't die from stepping on needles, so we are looking for poisons again. Arrest the chemist. XD
🔍 [48] Victim's Defeated Rival
Natalie: Natalie is at church and overhears a conversation. "Is there anything else I can do to help, Pastor?" asks Peers as he lays out the pastor's robe. "You have done more than I could ever ask," replies the pastor, "why not relax and enjoy today's sermon?" Peers looks out into the church with a melancholy expression. "You are a good man, Peers, you have made right by God. Others will eventually forgive you as well, including your wife."
Sasha: Good job making it work!
Sasha thanks the players!

NCIS
[202301151806]
Case 9: Plot Twist 2
◀ 2023 JAN 15 SUN 6:06 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 1 Plot Twist 2! The game content is rated "Age teen to adult" ⚠️
🚨 PLOT TWIST 2
Sasha: Two things: First, Mr. Peers has been caught trespassing the victim's property. Second...
Evelyn: The victim died of heroin overdose.
🔍 [191] Crime Scene
Zoey: In the woods surrounding the victim's house, Zoey finds burnt remnants of a military unform with a name tag and a medal.
🔍 [235] Headquarters
Evelyn: The scrapes on the victim's back suggest that he was dragged to the pool.
Ivy: There is blood residue on the medal found in the woods. The owner of that blood is still being determined.
🔍 [62] Peers, Political Rival
Natalie: After catching Peers treaspassing, Natalie obtained a warrant to search Peers' house. On his answering machine is massage from an angry businessman.
🔍 [136] Commanding Officer
Black: Black visits the Commanding Officer at the reservist base to verify Mikela's report. "[The victim] and I had another argument the last time I saw him. He was late from lunch, so I wrote him up. He stormed out with a strange woman. That's all I know." Black checks the visitor log, which shows two recent visitors: Polly the campaign operative, and Stars the Businessman.
🔍 [182] Businessman
Ledia: Ledia asks the Businessman at his office, "Why did you visit [the victim] so many times on the Reservist base?" "I'm a supporter of his campaign," says the Businessman, "everyone knows that." "Then why did you leave that disparaging mdssage on Peers's answering machine?" The Businessman looks shaken, "Okay, I was losing fatih in [the victim], thinking about switching to Peers." Ledia notices blood on the Businessman's sleeve.
Ledia: Apparently, the answering machine message was the businessman being angry at the victim, not Peers. The Businessman doesn't have a motive to murder. Zoey: If Tanya is right, the victim's campain operator has a motive to kill the Businessman so he cannot support the rival. Somehow the murder goes wrong and her client is dead instead. Tanya: That doesn't explain the burnt military uniform. Zoey: The uniform could be burnt to cover up something else.
🔍 [126] Polly, Campaign Operator
Tanya: "It's all my fault..." the campaign operator repeats as Tanya approaches her. "[The victim] might have become the President one day," sobs Polly, "but not with a wife like [the victim's wife]. I failed to convince him to leave her."
Tanya: Polly seems to have a bigger motive on killing the wife than the victim.
🔍 [85] Hatchet
LRRH: "Are you serious? Who wouldn't wish [the victim] harm? He was among the best backstabbers. After the campaign, it quickly became obvious that I was next to be backstabbed. Hell, even I want to kill him for owing me half a million. For services rendered, so to speak,"says Hatchet. "Did you kill him?" asks Little Red. "I'm not that stupid. Not when there is still a chance of getting my money."
🔍 [243] Wife
Kisaragi: "Of course I knew about my husband's dirty little secret," says the wife, "Everyone did. But kept quiet because they liked him." Kisaragi asks the wife where the victim was before he came home. "He spent the day at base playing pretend soldier again."
Kisaragi: It was not entirely clear from the clue what the "secret" is. I think the secret is that the victim was a known heroine user. Ledia: No drug test on base? Zoey: I've just looked it up that injecting betwen toes is a known way to use heroine without being obvious. Ledia: Too bad the victim is not a suspect. Zoey: I think drug test is supposed to be random. Sasha: Okay! Things should get more interesting in Round 3 when we have to let go of two clues!
Sasha thanks the players!

Virtues
[202301161027]
8th Deadly Sin
2023 JAN 16 MON 10:27 AM
Magic Bakery
⭐
No Stupid Question the podcast will do a series on the seven deadly sins and is asking the listeners for a suggestion of an 8th. 3B: It seems like something we would be interested in suggesting. What do you think?
⭐
Zoey: I looked up 8th deadly sin and found there was an eighth: despair/despond. Which is cynicism, hopelessness, "what difference would that do?" Tanya: @StarTree please make a node titled "Virtues". StarTree: 202301161040|Done!
Tanya: The four cardinal virtues are: Fortitude, Justice, Prundence, Temperance. I want to see their relation to the 7 or 8 deadly sins.
Zoey: The eight evil thoughts are: gluttony, lust, avarice, anger, sloth, sadness, vainglory and pride.
Evelyn: For the seven vices there are seven virtues on the other end.
⭐
Tanya: I see some pairs, Envy and Lust, Pride and Gluttony, Sloth and Greed, Despair and Wrath
Connection: Evny makes a person distant others, Lust makes them seek others.
Possession: Sloth is a person giving up on what they want, Greed is wanting too much.
Justice: Despair is giving up on justice. Wrath is overexcertion of justice.
Knowledge: Pride is ignorance of one's weaknesses. Gluttony is ignorance of one's strength.
Zoey: They don't align that well. Tanya: Maybe we can fix them so that they are aligned and orthogonal. Evelyn: I like the idea of aligning them, then we only have 4 things to remember. The other eight are either too much or too little. LRRH: How about six things in the middle? So far we have six elements. ☁️🌊🌳🔥🧱☀️ Ledia: I can see Connection as 🌊, Possession as 🌳, Justice as 🔥, Knowledge as ☀️. What would be ☁️ and 🧱? Black: I think Connection is solidarity, so it is 🧱. 🌊 is goodwill. Having too little is selfishness. Having too much is guilt/self-sacrifice. According to our 202211271009|Solutions. Ledia: Then ☁️ is freedom. Too little is intolerance, too much is recklessness. Evelyn: If they map nicely, should Virtue and Magic Elements be the same node? Tanya: Let's keep them separate for now and only cross-reference.
Tanya: Are the six axes distinct? Connection, Possession, Justice, Knowledge, Goodwill, Freedom. Ledia: The concepts are hard to map because the solution of a vice may not have a virtue solution in the same element. Evelyn: Maybe we should assign an element to each virtue and vice first, then decide how to show which is a solution of which.
Evelyn: Should we nominate despair as the 8th deadly sin? LRRH: Yes, because it was the 8th deadly sin. LRRH: How is despair different from pride and lust? Tanya: A person in despair does not boast about their achievements. Evelyn: Someone in despair tends to think they don't deserve love. LRRH: Grammarly rates the email sad. I hope that if they talk about that the effect would be empowering and bring people out of despair. Little Red thanks all for the discussion.
� Discussions

202207161423|Philosophies

 202301161040|🏅 Virtues {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202301161040","music":""}
Virtues
Concept
A vice and the virtue that resolves it may not belong to the same elemental group. This node attempt to assign an element to each and show their relations.
⭐ Elemental mapping of vices and virtues
Personal Vices hinders one's personal growth, usually without causing significant impact to others.
🧱 Despair
Lacks Hope ☀️ Evelyn: This is the feeling of being trapped, that nothing one does can do any good.
🌊 Gluttony
Lacks Temperance 🧱 Evelyn: This is the inability to overcome the temptation of pleasure from eating.
☁️ Sloth
Lacks Diligence 🧱
Interpersonal Vices are vices that only exists with other people.
🧱 Bias
Lacks Justice 🌊 Evelyn: This is favoritism, including favoring one's self over others.
🌊 Envy
Lacks Gratitude 🔥 Evelyn: Envy can lead to isolation or doing ill toward those who are happy.
🌳 Greed
Lacks Charity ☀️ Evelyn: Greed as an interperaonl vice refers to prioritizing one's desire to possess over the well-being of others.
🔥 Lust
Lacks Chastity 🧱
☀️ Pride
Lacks Humility ☁️
🔥 Wrath
Lacks Patience 🌳
🧭 Magic Element Virtues

Too little knowledge

Ignorance

☀️ Optimal Knowledge

🧭 Prudence

Too much Knowledge

☠️ Boostful / Pride
Indecision

Too little Freedom

Blind Faith
Worshiping

☁️ Optimal Freedom

🧭 Chastity

Too much Freedom

☠️ Lust
Recklessness

Too Little Initiative

Corwardice
Despond
Despair / Hopelessness
Fear
Guilt / Self-Doubt

🔥 Optimal Initiative

🧭 Temperance
🧭 Fortitude

Too much Initiative

☠️ Anger / Wrath
☠️ Gluttony

Too little Goodwill

Malice
Sadism
Selfishness

🌊 Optimal Goodwill

🧭 Patience
🧭 Humility

Too much Goodwill

Self-Sacrifice
Gullibility

Too little Artifact

☠️ Sloth

🌳 Optimal Artifact

🧭 Charity / Generosity
🧭 Gratitude

Too much Artifact

☠️ Avarice / Greed

Too little Solidarity

☠️ Envy / Vainglory

🧱 Optimal Solidarity

🧭 Justice
🧭 Diligence

Too much Solidarity

Control / Manipulation
Gludge
Rage
🧭 Cardinal Virtues
Temperance, Fortitude, Prudence, Justice
Temperance: Pursue goodness without overtaxing self or others.
Fortitude: Seek the strength to overcome challenges.
Prudence: Be careful in considering the effect of each action.
Justice: Choose the effect that is just when weighing actions.
📒 Wiki: Seven Deadly Sins 💬 Discussions

NCIS
[202301161712]
Case 9: Plot Twist 3
◀ 2023 JAN 16 MON 5:12 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 9 Plot Twist 3! The game content is rated "Age teen to adult" ⚠️
🚨 PLOT TWIST 3
Zoey: Zoey finds the tape of the security cameras at the basement of the victim's home, but the tape is blank.
Ivy: A fingerprint on the tape matches the wife.
Sasha: Friendly reminder: only six clues to be revealed in this round. Ledia: I think none of the male suspects are as supcious as the female suspects.
🔍 [259] Crime Scene
Zoey: Zoey knows that she needs to find the needle or the stash of heroin, but it would be a litte difficult without Red's dog. "Maybe I would start at somewhere convenient if the victim was an addict." Zoey goes to the victim's home office and starts opening every drawer at his desk. At the bottom drawer is a needle with residue white powder. "That was easy."
🔍 [77] Wife
Kisaragi: The Wife refuses to answer why her fingerprint was on the tape. "If you won't tell us why you replaced the tape, we have a warrant to search your house." "Go ahead," slurs the Wife, "you will find it very clean." Kisaragi notices that the wife has a hickey on her neck, and finds contraceptive in her car.
🔍 [221] Headquarters
Ivy: The blood on the medal matches the businessman. The needle from the victim's desk has fingerprints of the victim, the wife, and someone else I haven't identified.
🔍 [172] Polly, Campaign Operator
Tanya: "What did you have against [the wife]?" "[The wife] is holding [the victim] back by her indiscretions. She is driving him to... spiral downward. He wasn't thinking straight anymore. All he wanted me for anymore was... He was going to end up dragging me down with him. That's what [the wife] does to people."
Tanya: I think Polly could be talking about heroin addiction. Ledia: "All he wanted me for any more was..." wouldn't make sense unless Polly is a heroin supplier to the victim. Unless she meant the wife was cheating and so the victim started cheating with her.
🔍 [202] Businessman
Ledia: The businessman admits that he had a fight over the victim's broken promises. During the fight, he cut his arm on the victim's medal. He says, "But he was fine when I left him."
Tanya: Hatchet has a motive. If the wife is cheating with him, he could get his money after the wife takes his wealth. Sasha: You are at the last clue for Round 3.
🔍 [100] Hatchet
LRRH: "What do you mean by services redered?" asks Little Red. "Destroying people's lives, of course," says Hatchet, "Peers was having an affair, so we went public with it. He plunged 20 points. Conservative district loves their family values."
LRRH: I don't feel strongly about who might or might not be a murderer. Zoey: We need more clues. Might as well get a head start. XD *sings*
❔ [27] Rival

Unused Round 3 Clue

❔ [187] Commanding Officer

Unused Round 3 Clue

Sasha thanks the players!

Criminal Laws
[202301161835]
Law Game
2023 JAN 16 MON 6:35 PM
Paladin Hall
⭐
This is a 202301011739|new game where we discuss what the law ought to be in each situation drawn from a deck of cards meant to be reviewed by law students. Natalie: Is Panarcadia / Stewardism / Arcacnaism law the same as the status quo in each situation?
Natalie: Hey everyone, I have a deck of criminal law flash cards if you want to play it like a game. Casey: How do you play it? Natalie: Each card has a question, the answer is in the back. For example, card #173 asks, "What is an 'affirmative defense'?" Zoey: I have no idea, but I am interested in learning. Tanya: I think if most of us don't know the terms, we should just quickly review them until we see something we can answer or debate about. Evelyn: That would certainly save us some time blindly guessing. Sasha: It could be fun to guess. Once you know it, you can't guess. I vote for let's blindly guess. Ledia: If it is a game, are we keeping score? I think we can track points in a similar way as Detective XP, but on a different category, because this is more like philosophical knowledge. Sasha: Philosophy XP? LRRH: You can already get Guild XP from adding philosophy concept to the blog. Ledia: You could add PXP to Guild XP. LRRH: @StarTree can that be done? StarTree: If you want to! LRRH: Okay, so your contribution can get a PXP tag in the blog if it adds a philosophical concept, such as adding a definition. Ledia: So, in this case, whoever adds the definition of "affirmative defense" to the blog gets one PXP. LRRH: Yes. Sasha: Can we still guess?
[173] Affirmative Defense
Natalie: [173] What is an Affirmative Defense?
P4: Is it when you admit what you did, but defend it by saying you did it for a good reason? Natalie: P4 is almost correct! It is not about breaking the law "to do good." It is a defense that you did it with an excusable reason, such as you were forced, insane, or not fully conscious. Natalie: P4 and I both get one P XP. P4: 💟
[175] Non-deadly Force
Natalie: [175] Under what circumstance may one use non-deadly force to defend oneself?
Casey: Isn't it always? as long as your force is necessary to stop the harm? Natalie: Casey is correct! And the answer adds the important detail that the defender must be without fault. That means you must not be the aggressor. Casey and Natalie receive
[176] Defending third party
Natalie: [176] What amount of force may a stranger use in defending a third person against attack by another?
Black: Same as defending oneself except you have to make a reasonably good judgment that the person you are defending is the victim. Natalie: Correct!
[177] Reasonable Belief
Natalie: [177] What are the elements of "reasonable belief" that a particular danger exists?
Sasha: That no one is in charge and the objects that can make the danger happen are on scene? Natalie: The answer is more subjective: 1) The defendant believed a danger existed, and 2) their belief was reasonable. The factors to consider include the victim's knowledge of agressor's reputation for violence; aggressor's threats or physical superiority; victim's experiences bearing on the honesty of his belief as to danger, such as situations where they has been in danger before. Natalie: Last question for today:
[183] Deadly Force
Natalie: [183] Indiana Jones has long despised Abdul Cadabra. One day, Abdul advances toward Indy, brandising a large knife in a threatening manner. Indy reasonably believes Abdulis going to kill him. Thrilled to finally have the opportunity to kill Abdul, Indy pulls out a gun and shoots Abdul. When Indy is tried, will his self-defense claim fail because he wanted to kill Abdul?
Tanya: No. Intention is irrelevant. Attacker is at fault. Natalie: Correct!
Evelyn: I like this session even though I didn't answer any of them. Natalie: I leave the deck if you want to study. Natalie thanks all for playing!
� Discussions

NCIS
[202301172032]
Case 9: Plot Twist 4
◀ 2023 JAN 17 TUE 8:32 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, Case 9 Plot Twist 4! The game content is rated "Age teen to adult" ⚠️
🚨 PLOT TWIST 4
Black: The victim's commanding officer confessed that he knew about his heroin habit.
Mikela: According to rumors, his supplier is one of our suspects if you want to talk to her.
Sasha: Only two free clues in this round! This is the last case of this game, let's nail it! Ledia: Previously, Polly the campaign operator said the victim only needs her for 'something'. Tanya guessed that she was talking about heroin. Maybe Polly wanted to kill the wife, but the victim took the strong dose himself. Black: Don't you think it would be a huge scandal if the politicial's wife dies from drug overdose? Ledia: Maybe she supplies to Peers also. But the main point is the victim mistook the ultra dosage. Tanya: We need physical evidence connecting Polly to the needle.
🔍 [215] Campagin Operative Polly
Tanya: Tanya could not get Polly to talk further about how the victim got the drug. "She won't talk," says Tanya to the channel, "she is asking for an attorney.
Tanya: I'm sorry. This clue is a dud. Ledia: Are we safe to assume that the wife is not the supplier? Her role in the story seems to be she just cheated. Tanya: I would agree. Ivy: May I reveal the HQ clue?
🔍 [248] Headquarters
Ivy: The condom from the wife's car contains semen with blood. A person treating that with a tetracycline prescription might break out in bumps when they go outside.
Ivy: This is physical evidence linking Hatchet to the crime scene. Presummably everyone knows where the victim puts his needle, so... Ivy: Hatchet has all three: motive, means, opportunity. Ivy: I would want to reveal Hatchet's last clue in case he has an alibi. Sasha: Okay. Let's start the discussion section!
💬 Detective Choices
Sasha: Detectives, it's time to make your choices. Natalie: Hatchet. *sings* Sasha: Friendlly reminder that the detective level requires both a hit and ideas. You may get an idea point by filling out the detective notes. Natalie: Thanks! Ivy: Hatchet. LRRH: Hatchet. Black: Hatchet. I think the wife removed the tape because she wants to hide the murderer. I don't think she would remove the tape if the murderer is anyone but Hatchet. Ledia: Very compelling. Kisaragi: Why wouldn't she be removing the tape to hide herself as the murderer? Black: If we take her words for it, she was not on scene. Her last clue might be her alibi. I also think that she might be too drunk or too weak to move the body. Ledia: I think the wife hasn't lied yet. Zoey: Too drunk to lie, but awake enough to shut up. XD Zoey: Hatchet. Sasha: Hatchet. P4: Hatchet Kisaragi: Hatchet. *sings* Tanya: Hatchet. Evelyn: Hatchet. P4: {"cmd":"pl","yt":"88KIy8C66VM","desc":"*sings with Evelyn*"} Zoey: XD Ledia: Hatchet StarTree: @Mikela Sasha: *sings* Ledia: What happens if as a group we have 12 AA but only P4 has two AA? Sasha: Then two bonus clues are revealed before anyone needs to decide whether to switch. Mikela: Hatchet! LRRH: *sings* StarTree: StarTree is still waiting for her turn to sing. 😭 Zoey: It turns into karaoke! XD StarTree: Hatchet *sings* Sasha: Okay! We can discuss who to reveal for bonus clue 2 after revealing Hatchet's last clue.
⭐ [239] Hatchet

Bonus Clue 1

LRRH: "Where did you get the evidence on Peers?" asks Little Red. "We had a signed affidavit from the campagin worker he was [with]." "Do you have a copy?" "Sure," says Hatchet, who unhesitantly opens a drawer with three important pieces of evidence which Little Red is too short to see.
LRRH: The evidence inside the drawer are a VDR tape, a photograph of the wife, and a bottle of Tetracyn. Zoey: Thanks for telling. XD Sasha: So. Do we care which clue to reveal next? Or just start Drumroll? Zoey: I'll sweep the crime scene XD
⭐ [81] Crime Scene

Bonus Clue 2

Zoey: Zoey does a final sweep of the crime scene and finds nothing other than an agent from another agency who seems to be flirting with the wife. "I'm sure that is his rapport techniqe," Zoey hopes.
Sasha: Sasha sees an older agent smacks that agent's head on the back. Zoey: XD Sasha: Drumroll!
🥁 [187] Commanding Officer

Unused Round 3 Clue

Black: The commanding officer says he argues with the victim all the time, and admits that he knows about the victim's heroin habit, but higher-ups pressured him to keep quiet.
🥁 [218] Commanding Officer

Unused Round 4 clue

Black: "I understand why you couldn't report him," says Black, "at least he is not around to embarrass you anymore." "Yes, there is that," the commanding officer sneers.
🥁 [38] Businessman

Unused Round 4 clue

Ledia: Ledia presses on the fight about the burnt clothing with a bluff that they caught him on security camera. "Look, I admit to have burned his clothes, but I didn't kill him," said the Businessman, "I hit him, he was fine when I left. Then I returned to resolve the issue. He was dead and I panicked. So I removed his clothes and burned them to hide the blood."
🥁 [94] Wife

Unused Round 4 Clue

Kisaragi: The wife would not answer whether she was having an affair.
🥁 [27] Political Rival

Unused Round 3 Clue

Natalie: Peers appears not to have heard the message that the businessman left him on his answering machine.
🥁 [54] Political Rival

Unused Round 4 Clue

Natalie: After listening to the message, Peers says, "[The businessman] would back anyone who supports his big project. [The victim] broke his promises after he got elected, so [the businessman] and I started talking about him supporting my comeback." "Why did you go to [the victim's] house?" asks Natalie. "I was there only to watch and report what I saw to [the businessman] as a return of favor."
Sasha: Everyone ready? More than ready? Here we go with the solution!
🛎️ SOLUTION
Sasha: The murderer is... 😱
Sasha: Hatchet!! Sasha: It scared me a little because I forgot his actual name in the game. Zoey: XD
Motive: The victim owes Hatchet money, and might backstab him. Hatchet wants to take out the victim and give the wife and himself a better life.
Means: He injected an overdose of heroin to the victim at a golden opportunity...
Opportunity: The businessman punched the victim unconscious and left. Hatchet took that opportunity to inject an overdose. Then the businessman returned and found the victim dead. The businessman stripped the body and dragged it into the pool. Hatchet convinced the drunken wife to remove the video tape. Sasha: A detail is that Polly the campaign operative is not the "supplier" of heroin. She just helps the victim run the errands to physically get the drug. And, apparently the businessman sent Peers, the political rival to spy the victim's house so the detectives would suspect him instead!
Ledia: Sending the political rival to spy is not a very smart move. Tanya: So was stripping the body. Sasha: Congratulations! Everyone wins! Sasha: So I was planning to complete the detective XP tally since case 1 so we have a complete Tally for Magic Bakery Plays NCIS, then we can take a screenshot for the record. Sasha: Before accounting for hit ratio for Puzzle Plaza or the next game. Sasha: So please wait. It shouldn't take too long. Sasha: And it is done! Zoey takes the final lead at Level 8! Cheers!

202207161423|Philosophies

 202301180955|🧳 Hoarding {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202301180955","music":""}
Hoarding
Behavior

🥨 Magic Bakery Definition

Hoarding refers to an observable behavior of collecting large quantities of the same item. (Tanya: Compared to a Collector who has a large variety, typically of small quantities, of different items of the same category.) This definition does not imply that the hoarder has a mental disorder or that their behavior has an ill effect on themselves or others.
📒 Equivalent Statements

Statement 1a

"I saw Ann buying large quantities of toilet paper from each store."
is the same as:

Statement 1b

"I saw Ann hoarding toilet paper."
Tanya: If the term "hoarding" implies wrongdoing, the observer would not qualify to say statement 1b unless buying large quantities of toilet paper is wrong, or they know Ann does so for a malicious purpose.
📒 Included Behavior

🧱 Possession

Collecting for self, not sharing, not using. Tanya: Here I am talking about the situation when a person collects many of the same item for themself, as opposed to making a profit. If the item has a use, the hoarder may collect them without using them.

🧱 Emergency Stockpile

Collecting the item to prepare for emergency.

🌳 Profit

Collecting the item in order to profit from selling it later.

🔥 Price Gouge

Collecting the item in order to profit from selling it at a time when people will need it badly.

🔥 Artificial Scarcity

Collecting the item in order to create scarcity in order to make a profit.
📒 Excluded Behavior

☀️ Appreciation

Collecting the item to preserve or appreciate. Tanya: The usual hobby of collecting stamps is not an example of hoarding when the collector only collects one or a few or each stamp. But collecting boxes of the same stamp is a sign of possessive hoarding.
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://twitter.com/CharismaKings/status/1599509662478397440","desc":"🚀 Twitter"} 💬 Discussions
{"id":"202301180955","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"🧳","title":"Hoarding","subtitle":"Behavior","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/07/12/09/31/package-1511683_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Tanya","description":"","card-text":""}
Criminal Laws
[202301182053]
Law Game Part 2
◀ 2023 JAN 18 WED 8:53 PM
Paladin Hall
⭐
I plan to do only three cards today. Please note that this game is conducted from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions. Natalie: Please be aware that the content of some examples may not be appropriate for children.
[174] Defense type
Natalie: What "types of defenses are duress and necessity, justifications or excuses?
Evelyn: It is an excuse. Natalie: ✅ Correct for Duress. What about Necessity? Casey: Justification. Natalie: ✅ Correct!
[178] Retreat
Natalie: When one is attacked with deadly force, must one retreat, if possible, instead of using deadly force in self-defense?
Casey: Well, based on that Tanya answered earlier, you don't. You may stand your ground. Natalie: ✅ Correct!
[179] Justification vs excuse ⚠️
Natalie: Alexandra stabs Rasputin as he is about to ravish her. Is the killing justifiable, or is it excusable?
Zoey: I think that should be an excuse. Taking out a bad guy does not "produce" net social utility. It only prevents the attacker's harm to Alexandra's individual utility. Natalie: ❌ It is justifiable, since it was necessary to prevent her rape and Alexandra was exercising her legal right of self-defense. Zoey: First wrong. XD Natalie: You still get one point. Zoey: Please give me one more question. XD
[182] Self-Defense
Natalie: Juliet is pregnant. Romeo walks up to her with a knife and tells her, "once you have the baby, I'm going to kill you." Juliet pulls out a gun and shoots him. Can Juliet defend on self-defense grounds?
Zoey: No, because the threat is not imminent. Fina: It is a declaration of war if you tell someone you want to kill them. It doesn't matter whether they say they will kill you today or a year from now. You don't have a responsibility to remember when they say they will effect the harm. If they ring the bell, then it is a go. Zoey: But the deadly force section says it has to be imminent. Fina: I disagree and I stand my ground. Natalie: The answer from the card is that the threatened force must be imminent. When the threat refers to the future, then physical violence is not necessarily. Natalie: The card does not say so, but making a death threat is a crime by itself. The threat maker is liable, but not warranted to receive deadly force yet. Fina: I disagree. Deadly force is justified once as aggressor declares their malicious intention. At that point, by reciprocation, they have created an arena where deadly force is legal in their law, therefore, reciprocative deadly force becomes lawful. They rang the bell on an infinite stage. The game is on. Tanya: I agree with Fina. We need to highlight that difference between Reciprocative Justice Laws and the Status Quo Laws. Natalie: Zoey and Fina both get 1 point. But I am out of time today to contrast the two. If someone wants to reformat the node to show the contrast, please do so.
Natalie thanks all for playing!
� Discussions
Cardinal Quest
[202301182224]
Performance Review Part 1
◀ 2023 JAN 18 WED 10:24 PM
Cardinal Quest HQ
⭐
It's time for self-evaluation. What do you think of your performance and achievement?
[A1] Completing Quests On Time
⭐
Tanya: Compared to last year, we now have MAP that helps track quest schedules. MAP allows us analyze a quest and sum the estimated quest hours needs for subquests. Using that we compmleted most quests on time with some exceptions.
Exception 1: We got some TPKs that required rework. Tanya: Dawn Island was a major example.
Exception 2: We are prone to schedule delay if we misunderstand the intent. Tanya: Dawn Island was again an example, although the impact was not significant this time.
Countermeasure: To prevent both exception, we added checks to the checklist.
Evelyn: I think in the case of Fort Arsenal, we would not be on time if the region was less tolerant. 😅 Sasha: MAP doesn't track whether we are on time. Maybe it should. Now we can't really tell which quests were on time. Tanya: True.
[A2] Instructions for Others
Black: This part is about how well we inform others what to do with what we make. Evelyn: I think we could have better descriptions. 😅 Zoey: It is hard to describe when we barely know how it works. XD Evelyn: For improvement, I think the MAP and the Checklist help prevent missing content in documentation.
[A3] Internal Documentation
Tanya: For internal documentation we kept different versions of the scrolls with comments so they are easier to merge. Ledia: That was helpful. Evelyn: We also added a lot to the Field Notes.
[A4] Field Support
Evelyn: I think we are doing okay, but Vladanya is doing much more. Tanya: Yes.
[A5] Update training manuals
Evelyn: Most of our training material are in Field Notes. I think we added information, but not training material. Tanya: I think we should have a process/habit of creating training material. Zoey: It seems like a chore to copy content from Field Notes to the "Training Section." Tanya: We can think more on what to put there.
This will continue with Part 2 tomorrow.

Cardinal Quest
[202301192029]
Performance Review 2
◀ 2023 JAN 19 THU 8:29 PM
Cardinal Quest HQ
⭐
This is for Part 2 of performance review.
[B1] Reporting
Tanya: We completed reports in timely manner. Zoey: It was mostly Tanya doing all of them. XD
[B2] Teamwork
Black: Did you use interpersonal skills and work methods to complete quests successfully?
Evelyn: I think we didn't do well for death valley. We had multiple rework.
[B3] Communication and Relations
Evelyn: We were late for regular meetings. Now the default setting of reminders have changed from 15 minutes to 30 minutes.
[B4] Initiative
Black: Did you put effort beyond expectation? Did you identify issues and act proactively? Tanya: I don't think we did anything beyond.
Evelyn: I think MAP counts as something beyond primary quest, and Failure Analysis.
[B5] Training
Evelyn: I don't think we missed any training.
[B6] Dependability
Evelyn: I think our quest time tracking has improved.
[B7] Task Knowledge
Tanya: We have been adding to Field Notes as we learn something new. Black: How many pages are on Field Notes now? We could just mention it so next time we have a comparison. Black: It is better with numbers. StarTree: Field Notes is 279 pages long! Black: We should try to have numbers for all of the evaluation items. I plan to add a New Year Resolution item for evaluation. Evelyn: I think we can show hours we spent supporting in the last year. Sasha: But more support is not better. Evelyn: I think it shows we did something. Tanya: @StarTree, how many hours did we spend o support in 2022? StarTree: Support: 297 hours, Field: 23 hours!
[C1] Overall Performance Review Results
Evelyn: I think the biggest changes are MAP and CHK in 2022. Sasha: Were they new in 2022? I thought we had them for longer. Tanya: You started the Word based schedule for Deer Crossing. In 2022. MAP came after that to replace what you made. Evelyn: The checklist was newer than MAP. Sasha: Okay. I just can't believe they were so recent. Evelyn: We didn't follow up on the plan for 2022. 😖 Black: We can do it this year, as part of NYR. Evelyn: I am glad that we have the NYR section. I think that section is more guilding than the Pinned section. Evelyn: But I also like the pinned section becasuse we save that so we can review what we did in each month. Sasha: Although seeing @Manga lagging in NYR is a little depressing. Evelyn: 😖 Tanya: I think we should also mention the Quiver. Then we will know for sure that we started before 2023. Evelyn: Yes, the Quiver is convenient also. Sasha: I agree that the Quiver has some untapped potentials. Black: I think it is good for the review of 2022. I will add the NYR, but I am not sure if there is a one per person limit for NYR. LRRH: I would encourage someone else to take charge to spread out the load. Tanya: I already have failure analysis. Tanya: This is performance review, we will probably be discussing metrics and rubrics, and how to upgrade documentations to keep count. Zoey: This sounds like things that StarTree will do to be honest. Evelyn: What if StarTree wants to do something else? 😅 Black: I know StarTree did something really powerful for the current Japanese Learning NYR. Maybe I could do this and have StarTree head the Japanese NYR. LRRH: @StarTree? StarTree: StarTree takes over the Japanese NYR! Sasha: To be fair, I think the avatar should be whoever did the most contribution toward that NYR. So "Monthly backup" should be StarTree ALSO. Sasha: Since she did ALL of it. StarTree: Wee~~! LRRH: Yes, I think that is better. So Black will head Guild NYR for performance review, which is still closest to @Whale. LRRH: StarTree will head the monthly backup NYR. LRRH: StarTree will also take Japanese Lyrics NYR. StarTree: Roger!
LRRH looks forward to another good year.

Anime Song

Colors
PIN 202301192350
自分を　世界さえも　変えてしまえそうな
瞬間は　何時も直ぐそばに…
Jibun wo sekai sae mo kaete shimaesou na
Shunkan ha itsumo sugu soba ni...
Moments that seem like they can change both me
and even the world are always right next to me...
 隠せぬ苛立ちと
立ち尽くす自分を　見つめ
Kakusenu iradachi to
tachitsukusu jibun wo mitsume
Gazing at the irritation I can't hide
and myself as I stand stock still
 迷いながら　悩みながら　
悔やみながら　決めればいいさ
Mayoinagara nayaminagara
kuyaminagara kimereba ii sa
Despite my hesitation, despite my worries,
despite my regrets, I should decide
君がくれた　言葉ひとつ　
戸惑いは消え去り
Kimi ga kureta kotoba hitotsu
tomadoi ha kiesari
With one word you've given me,
my bewilderment vanishes
 からっぽだった　僕の部屋に　
光が射した
Karappo datta boku no heya ni
hikari ga sashita
Light shone
in my once empty room
 見上げた大空が　青く澄み切って行く
閉ざした　窓を　開く事を決めた
Miageta oozora ga aoku sumikitte yuku
Tozashita mado wo hiraku koto wo kimeta
The sky I gazed up at is so blue and serene
I decided to open up a window that was shut
 A1 満たせぬ日常に　
在るはずの答えを　探して
Mitasenu nichijou ni
aru hazu no kotae wo sagashite
Searching for answers
that must be in the unfulfillable everyday
 朝陽に独り　柔らかな声に　
振り向けば
Asahi ni hitori yawaraka na koe ni
furimukeba
If I turn around towards the lonesome,
gentle voice in the sunlight
 眩い陽射しの中　ふと君が微笑む
閉ざした　窓が　開きそうになる
Mabayui hizashi no naka futo kimi ga homoemu
Tozashita mado ga hirakisou ni naru
You unexpectedly smile in the midst of brilliant sunlight
I'm about to open up a window that was shut
 自分を　世界さえも　変えてしまえそうな
存在は　僕の目の前に…
Jibun wo sekai sae mo kaete shimaesou na
Sonzai ha boku no me no mae ni...
An existence that seems like it can change both me
And even the world is right in front of my eyes...
 A2 自分を　世界さえも　変えてしまえそうな
瞬間を　感じる今ここに…
Jibun wo sekai sae mo kaete shimaesou na
Shunkan wo kanjiru ima koko ni...
Right now, I sense here a moment that seems
Like it can change me and even the world...
 光へと　両手を伸ばして…
心を吹き抜ける　空の色　香る風
Hikari he to ryoute wo nobashite...
Kokoro wo fukinukeru sora no iro kaoru kaze
Spread both your hands towards the light...
A fragrant wind the color of the sky blows through my heart

Jump to...
