Ethics
[202301242154]
Ethics vs Moral
2023 JAN 24 TUE 9:54 PM
Arena
⭐
Is there a difference between ethics and moral?
Tanya: Ethics is often said to be values that a society sees to be right, while moral refers to values a person actually believes to be right. Tanya: For example, if a person chooses not to do something just to avoid being seen doing something wrong, then the person is referred to as ethical but not moral (since they would do it if they know no one would be watching).
Zoey: In this definition, what is the difference between ethical and legal? Tanya: There might not be a law against each behavior that is unethical, and there could be bad laws that are unethical. Ledia: There are at least three groups: Moral, Ethical, Lawful.
Evelyn: I think in general we should use a definition that others will understand. Tanya: @StarTree please make an Ethics node. StarTree: 202301242209|Done!
Tanya: There is now a section asking for reasons unethical behaviors remain lawful. Tanya: Filling it up is worth PXP.
LRRH: I have a somewhat off-topic idea. LRRH: Why don't we call "PXP" "CXP"? C can stand for concept. Tanya: And P stands for Philosophy. Isn't that equivalent? LRRH: But we have DXP for Detective XP. If we start from letter A, we could have A for Aracacia Award XP, B for Blog XP, C for Concept XP, and D for Detective XP. Tanya: I see. I don't have a preference one way or the other. LRRH: @StarTree could you rename all PXP to CXP? StarTree: Done!
Tanya: The next section asks for reasons that something considered immoral remains ethical. Ledia: Are there any reasons other than people don't have the same morals? Zoey: I would add Bandwagon effect. People adopt a society's ethics and laws as their own values. Ledia: Are we going to see a scoreboard for CXP like DXP? Tanya: I hope so. StarTree: StarTree plans to work on that in February! Ledia: I think that upgrade would qualify for @Arena, @Dungeon, @Seed, @Guild, @Board, and even @Mira. Tanya: I think that should be based in @Seed. Ivy: It would just be a node. You could link to it from anywhere. Ledia: I might do just that tomorrow.
� Discussions

202207161423|Philosophies

 202301242209|⚖️ Ethics {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202301242209","music":""}
Ethics refer to values a society considers to be good.
📒 Ethical vs Lawful
A society tends to define all ethical behavior lawful. But unethical behaviors are not necessarily unlawful. Reasons unethical behavior remain lawful include the following.

🧱 Corruption

When laws are passed to protect special interests in the expense of common wealth.

🌊 Delay

Sometimes laws just take time to pass careful considerations.

🔥 Preventing Loophole

A law might not pass if it creates opportunities for abuse.
📒 Moral vs Ethical
Moral refers to values a person believes and uses to judge right from wrong. Ethics of a society often reflects the majority moral of its people. However there could be situations where the two do not align. The followings are some reasons.

☁️ Different Morals

Different people may have incompatible morality.

🧱 Bandwagon Effect

People tend to adopt the majority vew (ethics) for themselves.

🌳 Tradition

People might hold on to traditions that they would determine to be immoral had they reviewed logically.
💬 Discussions

Magic Detectives
[202301280725]
Network Traffic
2023 JAN 28 SAT 7:25 AM
Magic Bakery
⭐
It's time for some real life detective work!
🚨 DAY 1
James: We were informed that someone is using torrent via our IP. We don't have torrent but someone connected to our router might, and is still using it. This quest is for deciding and acting on the situation.
James: My suggestion is finding who/which device is using torrent and to block it.
🔑 Router Password
⭐
StarTree: StarTree doesn't know the password to the router at 192.168.0.1!
StarTree: StarTree thinks that a factory reset will erase the history! Black: What if we take that router offline, and replace it with another? Sasha: Good idea!
🔍 ISP
⭐
Black: I tried to go to the ISP website to check compatible device information, but that specific webpage is not loading. However, Amazon shows devices that are listed as compatible with the ISP.
Black: So here is a decision point: Do we go ahead and order a compatible model? Or do we look for a cheap used one? Casey: I think we should look first for a used one. Evelyn: Is the purpose of getting another router to save the traffic history as evidence? Sasha: Yes. StarTree: According to our router manual, the history should have local IP, MAC address, and timestamp at its event log! James: The notice was for an event in December. There is a good chance that the log still has the event. Evelyn: What were we doing on that date? StarTree: 3B was using the tablet to draw Chapter 16 Page 10! Sasha: So: Action Item: Look for a modem to swap. If we don't find a suitable used replacement today, we order one, preferably the exact same model so we can see exactly what information is available. Black: Agreed. Tanya: We should get a node for this quest. @StarTree please make a node. StarTree: Is this not Magic Bakery Plays NCIS Case 10? Tanya: I think it should have its own node. Sasha might link to it from the NCIS node if she wants. Sasha: Please make a separate node. StarTree: 202301280946|Done!
🍀 Thrift Store
⭐
Casey: I couldn't find a suitable modem/router. Those models are too old.
Black: If we are getting used one we could check on ebay also. Black: The price is not much different from a new one. Black: * Orders a new one *
📁 Case Folder
⭐
Ivy: I am starting a master folder for this quest.
Black: Did the complaint specifically mention BitTorrent? Ivy: Yes. "downloading and distributing [...] to others, using BitTorrent protocol."
🔍 Case File Research
⭐
Tanya: I reviewed some case opinions. Most of them are for default judgment, meaning where the defendant did not respond. It seems that the plaintiff (the copyright holder) needs more than the IP and the subscriber's identity for the case. In some cases, the plaintiff cross checks with the defendant's interest at social media.
Tanya: Apparently how it works is that the copyright holder scans for torrent traffic of their film. They can see the IP address that is downloading or distributing it. Then they subpoena the subscriber of that IP from the ISP. Once they have the name, they do more research (discovery) to confirm that the subscriber is also the infringer. Or in some cases they identify someone else with access to that IP as the infringer. Then they amend the court case with the actual name of the defendant. Tanya: If the copyright holder gets a name, they would check the suspect's social media to see if they seem to have interest in their work.
⭐ Quest XP
⭐
Ledia: I think we need a better way to account for Quest XP. We know the lightbulb Dective XP is not added to the overall XP, but if we are doing quest work, we should be getting XP. I propose QXP to be the generic tag for Quest XP that counts toward the overall XP.
Sasha: I agree. Casey: I also agree. We get XP for each Cardinal Quest task, but when it comes to guild tasks, using the log is inconvenient. Sasha: So far I am giving Merit to each credit worthy task, but you can only get one merit per day. That isn't quite enough. LRRH: Could we make something like the lightbulb but with a QXP tag? Sasha: I can make bubbles with a star ⭐ to tag QXP. Ledia: And you making that change is worth XP. Sasha: Okay. I've just tagged myself. Ledia: And now the tallying needs to count that, and we need the count be shown on scoreboard. StarTree: StarTree is adding QXP to the tally! StarTree: And upgraded the original tally to make it ever so slightly faster! Sasha: Which scoreboard should we show here? This quest is not really philosophical. Ledia: I was thinking the new one can also show detective and quest XP. Ledia: I am adding that part. Ledia: Also adding a total EXP based only on the tags. Not sure what to do with the EXP on Guild Log yet. Ledia: And made the Nick attribute functional Just for Little Red Riding Hood. 😉 Ledia: Added archetype. Ledia: Added DXP to the same list. Evelyn: I think it would look better with just the icon and the raw XP count without the level for the sub categories. Ledia: I think suggestions on making things prettier should be its own sub category: BXP. Sasha: I am adding BXP to the script. Ledia: Adding BXP to scoreboard. StarTree: Added BXP to Tally! Ledia: Just making things pretty... Evelyn: I think the subcategories should be hidden by default. Evelyn: Should Idea XP count toward total XP? I think when we make a suggestion in Guild Log, we normally get XP. Doing it directly at a thread should be the same. Ledia: I would say yes. Speaking as someone with the most DXP at the moment: 100. Sasha: It would be easier to understand the scoreboard if it is accounted. LRRH: But you got the XP from playing a game. Ledia: Wouldn't that qualify as training? Sasha: I added the scoreboard to the node. LRRH: That is arguably true. Vivi: If the idea is worth a point, then just use QXP instead. Keep the lightbulb separate for games. Vivi: You should get a peacemaking XP only when your idea benefits peacemaking to the general audience. Sasha: I think DXP is still for Detective XP. It is XP for investigating or troubleshooting something. In a game the problem is made up, but the relevant skill is real. Sasha: So it boils down to: is training worth XP? If Studying is worth XP, then so is training. By studying out loud we are contributing to the blog. I say it is worth XP. LRRH: Vivi do you contest? (I suppose I get XP for arbitrating?) Vivi: I concede. LRRH: @Sasha please add code to count AA for AXP. Sasha: Done. StarTree: Tally side is done! Ledia: Profile is also done. Vivi: @StarTree, how many tally points are added today so far? StarTree: 30! Ledia: This is correct and similar to what we were getting from Cardinal Quest. We haven't been keeping enough count for Guild Quests XP. Vivi: No. The tally is wrong. If the tally is counting DXP, the increase should be more than 100 just from Ledia's score. Ledia: That's true. StarTree: 😭 StarTree: StarTree fixed it now... The difference is 502! LRRH: I think what Vivi did is worth a different sub category of XP: OXP for Oracle XP. Sasha: I added OXP to script. Ledia: Profile is done. Vivi: I am shifting the stars more to the right. Vivi: And I need to be able to see the total EXP for auditing. Ledia: I added that below the stars when the details are shown. Vivi: The archetype/level line is changed to inline-block so that when there are too many stars they stay on the same line. Vivi: 3B's score was not tallied. Now fixed.
Sasha thanks the players!

Magic Detectives
[202301290956]
BitTorrent Case Day 2
2023 JAN 29 SUN 9:56 AM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays Detective, Case BitTorrent Day 2.
🚨 DAY 2
Kisaragi: I spoke to a lawyer. They said that the plaintiff will most likely ask for the name of suspects. And we should inform the suspects before naming them.
Kisaragi: They advised that we get a lawyer within our jurisdiction to handle the case. Kisaragi: I am now checking and marking the location of lawyers on the list serving our jurisdiction. Kisaragi: Found a typo for one of the lawyer's name on the list. LRRH: Informed their webmaster on the typo. Kisaragi: Contacting one of the lawyers about our case.
🔍 Event Log on File
Kisaragi: The free consulting lawyer showed us a PDF of an event log that is part of the case document.
Kisaragi: The earliest date of the download, narrows down to just one suspect who moved in around that time. Zoey: Leave it to the head maid! Case Closed. XD Sasha: I am awarding Kisa with a detective hit for her excellence course of action with immediate result. Sasha: And a point for me for updating the script. Kisaragi: How should we proceed? LRRH: I think we should tell them immediately because the damage is per download. Evelyn: I think we should discretely tell them there is a matter to discuss, then let them choose how they want to discuss. LRRH: Okay. Since Kisa knows who the offender is, Kisa please handle it. Kisaragi: Understood. Zoey: かしこまりました XD
🛒 New Router
⭐
Black: Since we have enough evidence on who the defendant ought to be, we no longer need the event log from the locked router, thus we also don't need a new router right now.
Black: Any objection before I cancel the order of the new router? Casey: No objection. Black: And should we factory reset the router now, so that we can log in? Doing so means that we might never know what password we used. Or the answers to the security questions. Ivy: Just make sure that you write them down next time. Black: Order is cancelled.
📟 Existing Router
Black: Router is reset. However I couldn't get to its info page. I probably need to connect to it with an USB cable.
Black: While looking for an USB cable, I found the receipt of our existing router. It was bought on 2020-05-23. Black: Found that I must use the phone app to set up. Now we are in. Black: The log and event log seem unlikely to have any information for the case. It doesn't have what address is being accessed for instance. You can't tell if a device is connected or not other than the exact moment where there is an entry. Black: For most entries, the Target and Source IP are just 0.0.0.0. Ivy: The log tells which local IP is assigned to which MAC address, and the IP address of the router.
Sasha thanks the players!

CH 16 Manga
[202301302239]
Abilene Paradox Part 3
◀ 2023 JAN 30 MON 10:39 PM
Wyvern Island
⭐
This is for the draft of Chapter 16 page 15. Zoey had just used Faerie Fire to dispel Sasha's Flash Flood. 3B: What should happen on Page 15?
☀️ Q: Will Zoey's Faerie Fire dispel Abilene Paradox?
Zoey: I think it would work because Abilene Paradox is a weak argument to support self-interest.
Sasha: Except when you try to do something good for others but has no means to know what they really want. Zoey: But I think in most cases you CAN confirm, so your flash flood is mostly gone. Sasha: I upgrade the script so XP can be applied to BUBBLE, CHAT, and ENTER. Sasha: In any case your Faerie Fire doesn't completely remove my Flash Flood.
☁️ What Awareness can't solve
🏛️💗Sasha: For example, Awareness as a solution doesn't work when you are trying to do something nice for people in the future. You simply can't know what people really want in the future.
Zoey: I disagree. You can quite safely assume that people in the near future share similar demographic and want the same thing people want right now, such as autonomy and happiness. Zoey: This is different from Abilene Paradox where the person making the choice doesn't even like the choice themselves. Black: When you can't use the platinum rule of treating people the way they want (since you can't talk to them), then you can still use the golden rule as the second best. 3B: If I were to draw that, the scene is: As Faerie Fire dispels the Flash Flood rapidly, Sasha tries to summon Future, but Zoey quickly shoots it down with a gold arrow. Sasha takes one psychic damange. Evelyn: Doesn't Sasha only have one hit point? 😖 Sasha: I think my adult form has three hitpoints. Sasha: But, Ledia took a hit 202301081057|last time. Are we not drawing that? 3B: That seems like a detour. I don't know how to work that into the scene. Sasha: I think Zoey is right. Abilene Paradox is too weak. Now I consider my two other cards: Duolingo and Compassion as Self-Interest...
🌳 Sasha calls the Duolingo Owl
🏛️💗Sasha: I use the Duolingo Owl as an example of using self-interest to get things done. I argue that it is more effective than just hoping that people would be voluntarily alturistic.
Sasha: The example is that in the beginning, Duolingo harnesses people's self-interest to learn foreign language to get translation content from users learning language the other way around. Sasha: Say you know Spanish but you want to learn English. Duolingo would challenge you to translate something in English to Spanish. Then uses your translation to teach someone who knows English but tries to learn Spanish. Evelyn: That is letting people help each other. It is Arcacian. 🤗 Sasha: And my emphasis is that you can have Arcacian solutions based on people pursuing their self-interest. The person who ends up helping someone else isn't trying to help someone else. Their motivation could just be to learn the language they want to learn. Sasha: My second point is that this method, without relying on people's altruism, is more effective than those that only rely on altruism. If Duolingo just separately has people to "please translate for us and help other learn your language for free," it wouldn't have work as well as it is working. Ledia: Even without hard data, I find that argument quite compelling.
🧱 Ledia's Turn
🎀
Ledia: As the Owl comes at me, I put my sword away and let it sit on my arm. "I am sold," I say.
Ledia: I think this is good for establishing, at least, that "Self Interest is sometimes good". Ledia: And I agree that it establishes that "Self-interest can sometimes motivate more good deeds than other-interest."
3B: I think there is enough content for me. Please wait. 3B thanks all for the content.

A bright new path awaits those willing to explore.
A challenging and fascinating project is in your future.
A change of scenery is just what you need.

A clean tie attracks the soup of the day.

A frivolous gift is a giftm nonetheless.

A man best possession is a sympathetic wife.
A man can fail many times, but he isn't a failure until he gives up.
A man who trims himself to suit everybody will soon whittle himself away.

Your clever mind will lead you to many rewards.
Your clever mind will lead you to many rewards.

🗃️ Monthly Diffference Backup

@Guild

⭐StarTree: The self-backup at Backup2 takes overnight! Is there a way to speed it up?
StarTree: Backup2 now has 1.03 TB remaining. The backup each time is about 150GB! Black: What is the purpose of the full backup? Is there a way to not store files that are duplicates? Ivy: The point of the second backup is to have a duplicate. Black: But how many duplicates should there be? StarTree: The current plan will create a duplicate every month! Black: I think having just one duplicate is enough. Ivy: We also want to keep a copy of the older version of the data in case the new one is corrupted. Black: Then the monthly backup is two backups in Drive#2, and a difference backup per month. StarTree: StarTree doesn't know how to create the difference backup! Black: When you compare the directory and sees a file that is modified (but not entirely new), create an "_Archive" folder at that location and save the monthly copy of that file there. Ivy: @StarTree, how many differences do you see if you compare February to January? StarTree: 12! Ivy: I propose that after listing them on Compare, copy those to a montly difference folder with the same base structure. Black: If we are doing that, I suggest we also do it for files that are deleted compared to the latest. Ivy: That's a good point. Black: How many files are new compared to last month? StarTree: 144! Black: And how many are deleted compared to last month? StarTree: 263! Black: Files that are deleted or moved should be copied to the Diff folder of last month. File that are modified or added should be copied to the Diff folder of this month. StarTree: Understood! StarTree: Completed Diff Archive for February! StarTree: The full backup of 20230201 is now called Archive-Diff. Febrary Backup is complete!

@Board

StarTree: There was a suggestion that the Roll Call feature should use Cookies so that if the user accidentally clicks on a link going to another page, the checkmarks will be saved. is it okay to add Cookies?
LRRH: It is fine if you add a warning message. Ivy: Um... no. You need consent. Not just a warning message. LRRH: 🐣 Ivy: Additional Info: GDPR.EU Evelyn: It seems like a big hassle. 😅 Ivy: I think it is educational. Black: I think there is also an option of storing the bit data to the URL. It will not be as useful, however. Tanya: We need a node on this topic. StarTree: Now there is a 202302022025|node!

🔍 Game Pilot: 221B Baker Street

@Vacation

⭐Sasha: Okay. I need a few volunteers to help play test 221B Baker Street. This game claims to be "The Master Detective Game", but its mechanics seem really simple. Each case is much shorter compared to NCIS. Would it be good enough for us to play?
Casey: I am interested if it is shorter. Sasha: The game starts with a case introduction card, followed by at most 14 clues, where each clue corresponds to a location/subject expert. Sasha: In the actual game, the players are rivals. They roll dice and race on a game board to get clues. Sasha: For us we will just skip the game board and play it as a coop game. Sasha: Each case specifies a few questions that the detectives must answer correctly to win. Sasha: If you play, you must make guesses. The win-loss result goes toward your Detective Hit-rate. Ledia: Exciting. Sasha: That is if the cases aren't too easy. Ledia: We shall see by trying. Tanya: We need a node for that. Sasha: @StarTree please make a node. Zoey: *sings* StarTree: 202302032008|Wee~! Sasha: Please join the new thread.

202207131009|Board Games

 202302032008|🍞 221B Baker Street {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202302032008","music":""}
221B Baker Street
Board Game
This is a play-once-only detective game of
guess the culprit!

BGG
Welcome to Magic Bakery Plays 221B Baker Street! This is a game where we reveal clues and try to guess the correct culprit! The game can only be played once. If you don't want spoilers, please don't read our play log!
🥨 Magic Bakery House Rules
The official game is competitive, but we will play it as a coop. Here are some house rules and rationale.
⭐ We skip movement Sasha: The board is meaningless to us as we play is asynchronously online.
⭐ One clue per player per case Sasha: Each case has a maximum of 14 clues. If there are more players than clues, the additional players may still discuss and guess.
⭐ Chooser decides the clue Sasha: We are playing as ourselves. The player may simplify or change the content of the clue entirely. It is part of the game even if a vital clue is omitted.
⭐ If you play you are on. Sasha: At the end of each game, each player must choose their answer or take a loss. The win- loss ratio will be accounted for the detective level leaderboard.
Case 1 to 20
202207162102|🛸 Games 202211302252|✅ NCIS 202301280946|☎️ Digital Forensics 💬 Discussions
{"id":"202302032008","parentid":"202207131009","parentname":"Board Games","icon":"🍞","title":"221B Baker Street","subtitle":"Board Game","img":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/71V04MpnBUL._AC_UX679_.jpg","music":"","author":"Mikela","description":"","card-text":""}
221B Baker Street
[202302032100]
221B Case 1
2023 FEB 03 FRI 9:00 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays 221B Baker Street Case 1. The game content is probably rated teens to adult. ⚠️
🚨 Case Start
Sasha: A new preacher in town who is known carrying a large Bible is found stabbed to death in his balcony seat at the Playhouse during a performance of Hamlet. Accompanied the victim was Duchess Tallcourt. She discovered the body when she returned from the powder room after intermission. The preacher's Bible was gone. On the floor neaby was one German-made cigarette and a packet of aspirin.
Sasha: The case card content is longer than an NCIS plot twist, so I am splitting it up and let someone else RP. These RP's do not count toward the one clue per player rule.
⭐ Duchess, Duke, and Bishop
Mikela: The absolutely true rumor has it that the victim preacher was the Duchess's new favorite. That angered the Duke (her hunsband), and the Bishop whom she previously supported.
⭐ The Leader Performer and Duchess's Daughter
Tanya: The play of the night was performed by the Longworth Acting Troupe. Earl Longworth was the lead actor.
Mikela: It is widely known that Earl has been woonig the Duchess's daughter Anastasia in hopes of gaining support for his poor troupe.
📯 Scotland Yard wants to know...
A: Who killed the preacher
B: The weapon
C: The motive.
Sasha: I hope that the formatting is not too confusing. It shall improve as we play it. Sasha: Depending on how easy or difficult this game is we will make adjustments. Casey: It seems like a given to get clue from the drug store and smoke store. I will go to the smoke store.
🔍 [131] Tobacconist
Casey: Casey heard that there is a short case and chimes in, "The brand of the cigarette is the same brand that the Bishop smokes."
Casey: The clue is really short. It just says "The Bishop smokes German-made cigarettes." Ledia: Now I am curious how the game works with such short clues.
🔍 [1] Apothecary
Evelyn: Evelyn interviews the Troupe Leader and observes that he is suffering from constant headaches.
Evelyn: It's true, the clues are short. 😅 Zoey: Suppose the murderer was planting evidence against others, than the only suspect left is the Duke. Ledia: But where would you find the Duke? Zoey: Maybe the hotel? But I want to sweep the crime scene, which is the playhouse. XD
🔍 [101] Playhouse
Zoey: Zoey goes to the crime scene hoping to find more evidence, but it seems that the Scotland Yard detectives were thorough. Next she checks the attendance, and found that the Bishop was in attendance at the night of the murder.
Zoey: Well, so was the Lead Actor. XD
🔍 [41] Hotel
Ledia: The Duke family were visiting. Ledia goes to their hotel suite. She could not find the Duke, but talked to the daughter, who evidently did not like the victim.
Ledia: Good job guessing where the Duke might be. Zoey: But that was the daughter. XD Ledia: We'll see if we can actually talk to the Duke. Tanya: The Lead Actor didn't have a motive, now he does if he did that to woo the daugther. Black: Maybe the Bishop stole the aspirin hoping to make the intermission longer so he could have more time for the murder. LRRH: I go to the carriage depot to see who else might have gone to the playhouse.
🔍 [21] Carriage Depot
LRRH: Little Red goes to the Carriage Depot to see if anyone else suspcious had gone to the playhouse on the night of the murder. "Oh, are you looking for the man with the Bible? I've seen that Bible," says a driver, "That [Lead Actor] was reading it to the [victim] and the Duchess yesterday." By yesterday he meant during the day of the murder, but before the murder.
Ledia: There is a ton of missing information to fill in. Zoey: And we still don't have the weapon. Black: I'll check the pawnshop for a weapon. Tanya: Don't you think people normally throws murder weapon into the water? I would go to the Dock to look for the weapon. Black: You're right.
🔍 [91] Pawnbroker
Black: I got a clue that says, "Killer Clue (Two Parts) II. Value". What does that mean? Sasha: It means that the clue is directly about the Killer's name. I think only the Lead Actor's name Earl Longworth matches this clue. Black: I am not sure how to roleplay this. Ledia: Since it says Two Parts, does it mean there is another Killer Clue that potentially points to the same name? Sasha: Yes. Tanya: Does the Bishop have a name? Sasha: The Bishop is called Bishop of Whittenfroth. Tanya: I see Ledia: The challenge so far is to come up with the RP from the extremely short clue. Sasha: Maybe the NCIS way of playing this is bad. Let's think about that also. If we want to keep playing.
Black: Black goes to the pawnshop to look for the Bible. If the Bible was sold for money as the motive, the prime suspect would be the lead actor Earl Longworth.
Zoey: Then we are only missing the weapon.
🔍 [31] Dock
Tanya: Tanya goes to the dock to search for the weapon descretely. As she searches, she came to the theory that the large Bible was not just a Bible, but an artifact. A person who had read it up close might realize its true worth. A visit to the museum might be warranted.
Tanya: The actual clue I got was "General motive clue: You can't judge a book by its cover." That seems to point to the Bible being something very valuable, enough to worth killing for.
🔍 [121] Scotland Yard
StarTree: StarTree looks up files about the victim at headquarters. One thing that stands out is that the victim had a handsome tan, which was unusually in London!
🔍 [61] Museum
Kisaragi: Kisaragi follows Tanya's lead and confirms that the lead actor had a degree in appraising authenticity of original manuscripts. He had served as a consult to the museum in serval occasions.
Kisaragi: The clues seem to be only loosely associated with the location. Ledia: Your clue seems perfectly matching. Kisaragi: My clue did not mention the museum. But it does say the lead actor is an authority on manuscript authenticity. Ledia: Yes it is hard trying to fill in the gap for a detective game. There is always a chance of misinterpreting the context. Zoey: Still missing the weapon. Could it be that the Bibble IS the weapon? XD Sasha: I think the weapon clue would be at the Locksmith, since Locksmith and Blacksmith both have metal tools.
🔍 [51] Locksmith
Sasha: Sasha infiltrates the Troupe camp and casts elemental trace. "I think I've gotten the murder weapon," says Sasha at the quest channel, "If you live by the sword, you'll die by the sword. The murder weapon is a real sword for the play."
Sasha: All things considered, I made up the scene. Don't ask me what happens if the killer is not the lead actor or the weapon is not a sword. Sasha: Kisa is right, the relation between the location and the clue is like Codename. So the Duke might not be literally staying in a hotel, but both hotel and a mansion are "big houses", so if you go to a hotel you could find someone rich at their residence. Zoey: Four clues remain, one of them has to be about the Killer's name. So really only three clues left. Sasha: But we have answers to all three questions: Killer, weapon, motive. Zoey: What are you suggesting? That we stop getting clues? Why would I risk my hit-rate by forgoing a clue? XD Sasha: I'll consider for the next game that we can only reveal 10 clues out of 14. Evelyn: I would prefer the game to be less stressful. Sasha: I think revealing all clues woule be too easy. But for this time let's finish all of them. Ledia: But it feels strange to just ask people reveal clue. I say if we run out of players, we either stop or must use bonus clue. Sasha: I agree, I think this can be drumroll time. Ledia: I am quite confident that the answers are as we now expect: Lead Actor, Sword, Selling the Bible for money. StarTree: StarTree calls for backup for an apparently easy win!
🔍 [11] Bank
James: James answers the call and looks up the Duke. The Duke is a collector of original manuscript.
James: Did the murderer take the Bible to sell to the Duke for money, or for his daughter's hand? You decide. Zoey: Can we just say OR? They are both likely. XD
🔍 [71] Newspaper Shop
Mikela: The buzz of the day being the original manuscript of Hamlet was stolen recently from an exhibit!
Mikela: The emphasis was from the clue! Tanya: I think that emphasis was a clue that the killer was the lead actor.
🔍 [76] Park
Gaia: The killer is not short.
Tanya: We still have the second killer clue that eliminates "Tallcourt".
🔍 [111] Pub
P4: P4 goes to the Pub but found nothing relevant.
P4: The clue is "No clue." Sasha: Well, time for decision!
🥁 Detective Choices
Theory 1: Killer: Lead Actor; Weapon: Sword; Motive: Selling the Bible for money.
Theory 2: Killer: Lead Actor; Weapon: Sword; Motive: Getting to the good side of the Duke for a smooth marriage proposal to his daughter.
Tanya: I pick Theory 1 because the Lead Actor was wooing the daughter to get funding, it never said he actually loved her or wanted to be with her for any other reason. Ledia: True. Theory 1. Sasha: 1 James: 1 LRRH: 1 Zoey: Do we care about details such as to whom he sells the Bible? Tanya: Unless you want to make a point that he is not selling to the Duke, then it is implied that he sees the Duke as a potential buyer. Zoey: Okay. 1. Black: 1 Casey: 1 Kisaragi: 1 Mikela: 1! Evelyn: How do we avoid TPK? 😅 Zoey: We don't. XD We are going for our individual Detective Level. XD Evelyn: 1 😖 Sasha: Yes, Evelyn, come to the dark side where individual interest is better than group interest. If you tried to avoid TPK by choosing "otherwise", you would just be prevent the guild from a complete win. Evelyn: I realized that I don't want to be the only one winning if everyone else is wrong. 😅 Zoey: OMG rebuttal! XD StarTree: 1! Sasha: There is no proper drumroll this time... 🥁🥁🥁
🛎️ SOLUTION
Sasha: The preacher (victim) is actually a thief who stole the original manuscript of Hamlet from an exhibit on the Riviera, where he got his tan!!
Story: The preacher disguised the manuscript as a Bible and had the Lead Actor authenticate it for the Duke. But the Lead Actor was in need of money, so he killed him (with Hamlet's sword) and stole the manuscript. He also planted the cigarette to draw suspicion off himself, but left his aspirin by accident.
Killer: Lead Actor Earl LongWorth
Weapon: Sword
Motive: Manuscript
Sasha: We missed that the preacher was a thief! Anyone who got that should get a bonus win. Sasha: Still, everyone wins. Congratulations!
Sasha thanks the players!

Cardinal Quest
[202302041643]
2302 Failure Analysis
◀ 2023 FEB 04 SAT 4:43 PM
Quest Channel
⭐
This is a routine check and failure analysis for Cardinal Quest. Tanya: This is not an emergency.
💡StarTree: There are 8 open quests, 355 quest hours, 64 side quests, and 19 prep quests remaining! Preq Quests have been cleared.
📯 Dashboard upgrade
Tanya: I would like to improve the dashboard of Cardinal Quest. Any ideas?
Black: The mensions section is too long. It should be collapsed. Tanya: Done. Tanya: What do you think if I ths stats boxes become clickable, and clicking each one opens the detail screen below? Vivi: If you do that the stats boxes need to be much smaller, otherwise the user won't know that something has change when viewing on a phone. Tanya: Adding function ShowLPN. Tanya: Changed Quest Hours to the new style. Tanya: Changed Side Quests to the new style. Tanya: Changed Prep Quests to the new style. Tanya: Changed Failure Analysis to the new style. Tanya: Currently there are 12 unprocessed failures out of 211. Tanya: Added snapshot to leaderboard. Tanya: Updated script so leaderboard entries remain one row each. ERROR
🏳️ Failure Analysis: LC
Tanya: For the Countermeasures section I am adding "LC" as a new improvement this year. LC refers to the changes in the checklist where we group the check items by stages to help identify the earliest stage a check should or can be done. Any suggestion on a better codename?
Ledia: Perhaps a 'Walkthrough' ? Evelyn: I hope that we keep the same acronym so we know what we are talking about. 😅 Black: Legacy Check'? Tanya: I think we can have a new name or acronym, since this new way is a new format for the LC. Zoey: If you divide the overall checklist into stages, that is the same as dividing a dungeon into rooms. So what you now have is description of minions in each zone, or mini boss, or sub quest for each dungeon. Ledia: Totally agree. Tanya: How about 'SC' which means both Stage Check and Stage Challenge? Black: I would prefer the acronym to be PC. Tanya: I can see why. Zoey: I vote against 'PC' because I would think a computer, 'politically correct' or 'player character.' PC is too common as an acronym. Black: Then how about 'PRC'? R can mean room. Three-letter acronym is harder to miss. Ledia: So... Player Room Challenge? Zoey: It sounds forced. Tanya: What about "projected" or "predicted"? Zoey: I can live with that. I guess. Tanya: I will use PRC for now. Tanya: Currently PRC is a countermeasure for 28/211 failures. Tanya: CHK is 60/210 (29%), TSN 73/210 (35%), MAP 3/210 (1%) Evelyn: I think that occurence statistics might be helpfull for the Failure Areas. Tanya: MGT 10/210 (5%), MND 17/210 (8%), KNW 4/210 (2%). We didn't analyze the failure area for most failures. But I think most of the failures that can be solved by PRC are MGT failures. What PRC improves is better planning for foresight about the quest. Tanya: Also: EXH 13/210 (6%), FRC 3/210 (1%) Zoey: Okay, PRC in my mind is "Pre-check". Evelyn: I think that is easy to remember. 😊 Black: The failure analysis section is looking good. Tanya: I am adding some pointers on what further to do.

Action items & Priority

📌Priority 1: Complete countermeasure for all failures.
📌Priority 2: List all Failures Analysis codes.
📌Priority 3: Categorize Failure Area and Cause for all failures.
Tanya: I think that is enough failure analysis for this month. But I plan to do actual Cardinal Quest tomorrow for World Tree. Please join or monitor. Black: Sounds like a good plan. Evelyn: Let's quest! 😊 @Cardinal Monthly Failure Analysis is complete. @Cardinal has double advanced to Rank C. Tanya: Added flex ranking on the items based on occurence.
Tanya thanks all for their contributions.

 202302050852|📋 Self Evaluation {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202302050852","music":""}
Self Evaluation
Rubric
To be updated based on discussion findings.
⭐ 5-point scale
202208250038|🎪 @Cardinal 202208180954|🐳 @Whale 💬 Discussions
{"id":"202302050852","parentid":"202208180954","parentname":"Whale Nursery","icon":"📋","title":"Self Evaluation","subtitle":"Rubric","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2014/09/04/05/27/cookies-435296_960_720.png","music":"","author":"Black","description":"","card-text":""}
Self-Evaluation
[202302050851]
Self-Evaluation Rubric A1
◀ 2023 FEB 05 SUN 8:51 AM
Whale Nursery
⭐
This is a series of monthly self-evaluation discussions. The plan is to create a rubric for each evaluation topic.
📋 5 point scale
💡Black: The rubric should be based on a five-point scale where 3 means meeting expectation. 4 and 5 both mean beyond expectations, 1 and 2 both mean below expectation.
Ledia: Could you be more specific about the differences between 4 and 5, and 1 and 2?
⭐Black: The scale we want to elaborate on, for each subcategory is the following.
Grade 5: Top performance, highest level of contribution.
Grade 4: Exceeds expectation of what it takes for a satisfactory result.
Grade 3: Meets expectation, satisfactory result,
Grade 2: Partially meets expectation, areas of improvement are known and can be undertaken.
Grade 1: Below expectation, significant improvement is needed.
Ledia: From what I see, Grade 3 is the passing grade, to us that means Rank A. So Grade 4 is Rank S and Grade 5 is Rank SS. Black: I think normally a "passing grade" is a C. But I agree with your scale where Grade 3 means Rank A. Ledia: Not when you are talking about deliverables. A 'B' product has some kind of defect that the buyer has a legal right to reject. So 'Passing' means Grade A. An A product. Black: I agree with you. Black: The plan of this series is to make a rubric for each subcategory, preferably using measurable metrics. Discussion content will be summarized at 202302050852|this node.
📋 [A1] Completing Quests On Time
💡Black: This subcategory is on whether a quest is completed within deadline if there is a commitment to do so at the time of accepting the quest. In previous discussion, we recognized that we are not tracking whether deadlines are met. I think upgrading our system to track deadlines is the main topic this month.
Tanya: I think Rank A should correspond to at or above 87.5% on time. Rank B at or above 75%, and Rank C at or above 50%. Ledia: Yes, that is the normal meaning of our letter ranks. Ledia: Rank S is for 100% on time within the evaluation period. Sasha: But realistically, shouldn't meeting expectation means 100% on time? Ledia: Do you mean "Ideally"? "Realistically" there is Murphy's law. Black: Do we not care about improvements regarding being on time? Ledia: The effects of such improvements should be reflected in the ratio. If the improvements are worthwhile then the ratio should be good. Tanya: Rank SS should be for the aura effect where the quester helps other become on time. Tanya: I think we can track for SS by listing improvements and attribute the result of being on-time to those improvements. But that should come after the quester is already Rank S. Black: Let's discuss how to track on-time ness. Tanya: On MAP, we add a column for the planned deadline, a column of the actual completion time, and a column for the judgment on whether the deadline is met. Tanya: The judgment should include whether an unmet deadline is caused by us or other teams. And also whether an error by us causes rework in the field. Tanya: Having rework in the field implies the quest was not complete at delivery. That voids the on-time-ness. Zoey: I think with this metric, we can retrospectively compute the on-time ness for 2022. I think we might not even be Rank C if we count field reworks. Evelyn: 😖 Ledia: Are we accounting per quest site, per object, or per dungeon? Tanya: I think it should be per batch. So per quest site. Ledia: What happens if another team causes a delay, and we take advantage of that delay to work on another quest first? Tanya: That should be allowed and would not count toward us not meeting our original deadline. StarTree: There isn't enough space to add three columns on MAP, but StarTree has an idea! StarTree: On MAP, timeliness can its own row per quest site. This will let us filter and see all timeliness data across all quest sites, and we can use the existing columns to mark instances we failed and caused delay! Tanya: That is a good idea. Please do so. StarTree: MAP is now prepared for analysis! Evelyn: We need to investigate the due date for quests have have completed. 😅 Tanya: I marked both Dawn Island quests FAIL. Tanya: According to MAP there were 18 quest sites. I already marked 3 to MIS: Missing deadline. So we were at best Rank B. Tanya: I think that investigation is part of 202208250038|Failure Analysis. So I will add that in the priority list as priority 3. Tanya: For now I am adding the deadlines for quests that are not yet complete. Ledia: I think we can reasonably tell if a quest has failed but checking messages. Tanya: Yes. But we can do that during downtime, thus lower priority. I would like to start World Tree Quest. Ledia: Understood. Black: I think this concludes the discussion for this subcategory. MAP has been updated with a method to track whether quest deadline is met or missed. Black thanks all for their contributions. @Whale has advanced to Rank D.
� Discussions

Monster Dessert
[202302051831]
Monster Dessert Pt 2
◀ 2023 FEB 05 SUN 6:31 PM
Puzzle Plaza
⭐
Hey hey hey, we are back for the solution to 202301121032|The Monster Dessert! Mikela: Are you ready for the excitment of earning (or losing) a detective hit?
💬 About the optional scoring
Mikela: There is no pressure to bet for a hit. But if you want to bet, now is your chance! Why did the man knock over the salt cellar? Was it because:
A: The man just need some extra physical committment to ensure that he would not eat the unhealthy dessert.
B: The man placed a bet with someone that he could stop himself from eating the dessert.
C: The man doesn't want the debuff after eating the dessert, as he has other plans afterward.
D: There is an ingredient in the dessert that he wants to avoid.
E: The man did it for a religious reason.
F: The man doesn't have enough money to pay for the dessert.
Tanya: I think F is unlikely because normally the guests do not need to pay at a dinner party. And, ruining the dessert wouldn't excuse him needing to pay even if they are at a restaurant. P4: Could we pick A,C,D at once? Mikela: At this point I would say "Yes you may!" since the majority of the players would not dare to vouch for any choice! Sasha: Is there an emoji that can represent courage? Maybe whoever dares to make a choice in a situation like this may earn such badge. LRRH: How about one of these: 🚀🔥🍅🥁 Sasha: I am still using the drum for drumroll. It might be confusing. Zoey: It won't be confusing because you'll only see it at the scoreboard. Evelyn: Which one does P4 want? P4: P4 wants the tomato. 🍅 Casey: ... why? Why not a lion for courage? 🦁 Sasha: I understand the Lion more than the Tomato. Tanya: I would prefer this: 🎖️ Zoey: I know why when courage is tomato. XD Mikela: If you dare to bet, then you will get the icon you want, otherwise it is moot! Zoey: Now I want an 🏹 icon. XD Zoey: Is it worth risking a hit for the icon? XD Sasha: Well you can always level up your hit rate if you keep playing detective. Zoey: Only if they continue to be easy. XD Zoey: And are you saying that we get that icon regardless whether we are correct? Ledia: Are we going to track the number of Courage badges? And I assume that those don't count toward actual XP? Sasha: Yes we can track it like DXP-WIN or DXP-LOS. Maybe this will be DXP-CRG.
🥁Mikela: So right now I have P4 stepping out to bet a hit for a 🍅. Please make up your mind. I'll only leave this opportunity open until my food is ready... in like 10 mintues!
Casey: I bet that the solution is not A,C, or D, but something clever and satisfying. For a Lion. 🦁 Sasha: You would get the lion as long as you bet. Casey: I know, I don't know how to phrase it. 🤷‍♀️ Tanya: I follow Casey's bet for a 🎖️. We have a blindspot for the man's motive. I don't think it is A,C,or D. We need further investigation. Zoey: Whatever Tanya says. XD I follow suit for 🏹 XD Sasha: Tanya's hit rate is actually lower than yours or P4's. Zoey: But I want the 🏹 XD Ledia: That doesn't explain why you side with Tanya instead of P4. Zoey: I think P4's answer is too normal. I don't think that can be the solution. It has to be something else. XD LRRH: Then I also follow for a 🐺. Fearless Rider. Ledia: It is not very fearless if someone else already took the lead. LRRH: I am okay if the courage score has a rating based on the number of followers. Sasha: That is an excellent idea! Ledia: Then I will go for a dragon 🐉. Following Casey's choice. Evelyn: This is turning out to be a great moment for the couragous ones. 😊 Evelyn: And I am not one of them. 😅 Sasha: Can I really stand four of our group of six getting a special badge and not me? Not really. I follow Casey for a 🐇. Evelyn: 😖 Zoey: Critical Hit! XD Evelyn: I stay with P4 for a 🤗 Evelyn: 😖😖😖 Mikela: Time's Up! I will now reveal the SOLUTION!
👑 SOLUTION
Mikela: Here is the absolutely appropate and clever solution to the puzzle... 🥁🥁🥁 Mikela: The host sneezed! The guest felt that his dessert had been contaminated but didn't want to be impolite and made up an apparent excuse! Mikela: As I said earlier, the guesses would be judged based on the keyword that I highlighted. All things considered, the solution happens to match ALL THREE keywords: Unhealthy, debuff, and ingredent! So P4 and Evelyn are the winners! Congratulations!
Mikela: And for the courageous acts of the players, here are the suggested titles that StarTree or Ledia may somehow include in the profile:
💗Mikela: P4 is awarded for having by far the top initiative, starting and finishing the "fight" in the blink of an eye with unwavering precision before anyone else catches up! P4 is recognized for the Rank S combat skill Triple Assassinate.
💗Mikela: Casey is awarded for the courage to initiate opposition! Casey is recognized for the Rank A tank skill Lion's Defiance.
💗Mikela: Evelyn is awarded for never leaving a friend alone! Evelyn is recognized for the Cleric trait Friends Forever.
Mikela: For the rest, I give you the option of choosing your custom icon with the cost of one loss, or keeping your hit rate without gaining an icon. To tell you the truth I have not thought of the title to go wtih it, so if you want to keep the icon you might need to come up with it yourself. Zoey: I want to get the icon in an awesome moment so I'll keep the hit rate. XD Tanya: I will take the hit, because I was wrong.
💗Mikela: Tanya is award for her uncompromising integrity to keep the ratio real! Tanya is recognized for the Oracle skill True Ratio. LRRH: I also choose to keep my ratio. I'll wait for a more meaningful moment to get a badge. Sasha: Same. Ledia: I'll take the dragon and think of a title myself.
Mikela: Ledia is award for taking matter to her own hands! Ledia is recognized for the Adventurer skill Trail Brazer. Zoey: Now I am curious what title I would get if I did choose to take a hit! XD Mikela: There will be a next time! But that's all for this time, folks! Cheers! Mikela bids everyone a wonderful evening! @Puzzle has advanced to Rank D.
LRRH: I am glad that Mikela gave an option to not choose the icon. I wouldn't know what that icon would mean if I did get it now. Tanya: Maybe this is not the event where your icon would be relevant. LRRH: That's probably it. Ledia: Well, there is always the option of taking a hit and not getting an icon. Zoey: XD LRRH: Okay. I'll just take the hit. LRRH is recognized for Integrity. Zoey: No~~! Sasha: I don't want to be known for having integrity. I am supposed to be sneaky and opportunistic. Ledia: But you are the game master, shouldn't you be fair? Sasha: It is fair. Mikela offered the choice. It was a legal choice for me to keep my hit rate. Ledia: But if you do that the hit rate of the detective level that you created wouldn't be true. Wouldn't that jeopardize the meaning of that hit rate? Zoey: Uh-oh... Ledia caught up. we're going down! Sasha: Fine. No one escapes the wrath. Ledia: That's called Justice. Zoey: "If we burn you burn with us." XD Ledia changes the name of her skill to Dragon Fire.
🏅 Scoreboard Updates
Ledia: This seems like the perfect time to upgrade the scoreboard. Since the update directly relates to the puzzle session we just had, I don't feel like starting a new thread. You are welcome to stick around.
Ledia: First thing first: Mikela didn't update the skill list, so I will update that. The skill list is where we actually list all the recognitions. Ledia: Next is the question of how we actually display those unique awards. Sasha: I think my idea earlier about a DXP-COR tag won't work. Tanya: You can hard code a custom section in the original score entry and have the function read and display that content. You could put it as the lastelementchild of the div. Ledia: I think that will work. Ledia: It seems that eventually, 202301251008|Node 202301251008 will or can replace the Bakers section. Tanya: Quite possible. Sasha: Don't you think that if you start adding custom sections there, that list will become huge? Ledia: Yes, but if I put the custom content at a different section, the code will have to jquery twice. Once for all the tags, a second time just for the div. Sasha: That is not an issue, it is just another selector. Not another nested function. Tanya: I think Sasha is right. Sasha: But I have another idea, that I think we should use DXP-COR counter, but the icon can be customized according to an attribute. Sasha: If the icons are unique, we just need to add a common legends section to explain them and their variations. Ledia: What should be the default icon for DXP-COR? Sasha: How about a yellow heart 💛 Ledia: I think the perfect place to put that is right before the green checkmark for the hit rate. Tanya: Agreed. Ledia: May I suggest that DXP-COR be called DXP-CHA instead? CHA means challenge. It is counting challenging situations. Ledia: The more challenges the hit ratio faces, the more meaningful/accurate the hit rate is. Sasha: True. Maybe I should modify the Detective Level equation to factor in this challenge factor. Ledia: Updatied function CXP_Single2 Ledia: Added function ShowNextHTIL and ShowPrevHTIL. Ledia: Added a space before the total blog XP count to avoid confusion. Ledia: Rearranged the icons so the colors flow better. Sasha: Any idea on how the challenge number should be related to detective level? Tanya: You could make that another limit. Such as a player's detective level cannot exceed their number of challenges. Sasha: The NCIS games we played aren't entirely non-challenging. Tanya: You could retrospectively award challenge to games where someone genuinely lost. Sasha: That seems acceptable, since even if you win a game when there is no challenge, you are still improving your hit rate. Evelyn: I think a win during a challenge should worth more, but a win without challenge (where no one lost) shouldn't worth nothing. Sasha: But it is not nothing. It still gives you your hit ratio. Evelyn: But someone who leads everyone else win in a game can't level up. Sasha: True... and we don't want to make this competitive. Sasha: How about the max detective level is a player's WIN plus WIN under a challenging puzzle? Evelyn: I think that is better than having a limit only based on challenges. Sasha: FYI: I have just updated the equation to use both DXP and OXP for calculating detective level. Ledia: I am done for tonight. Good night. Evelyn: Good night. 😊 @Mira has advanced to Rank D. Tanya: As it stands, increasing the limit with CHA WIN won't benefit anyone, since P4 and Evelyn have too few XP compared to their WIN. How about letting CHA WIN make the XP worth more? Sasha: And how much more do you think it should worth? Tanya: How about a whole level? A CHA WIN is directly added to the overall detective level. Sasha: I quite like that idea. It is simple and does not reduce what we already have. Sasha: Equation is updated. @Detective has advanced to Rank D.

Criminal Laws
[202302061037]
Law Game Part 3
◀ 2023 FEB 06 MON 10:37 AM
Paladin Hall
⭐
This is a continuation of the Law Game. Natalie: Please note that this game is conducted from a philosophical stand point. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions. Natalie: Please be aware that the content of some examples may not be appropriate for children.
[180] Oracle Self-Defense
Natalie: Ann claims to be an oracle and knows that Bob intents to kill her with a knife. As Bob enters her oracle tent, Ann shoots and kills Bob. Bob drops dead with a knife in hand behind his back. Can Ann claim self-defense IF there is evidence that Bob did have an intention to kill her at the tent?
Casey: Yes. If you have evidence that someone wants to kill you, and they in fact has an out-of-place knife in hand. Fina: Yes. Preemptive strike is part of self-defense. Natalie: The card's answer is NO, because Ann lacks an objective component for the threat to be reasonable at the time she encounters Bob. Fina: The law is wrong. That is how you get oracles killed. Fina: Also, in this case, Bob approached Ann with a knife in hand. If they are strangers, Bob has the responsibility to ensure that the other stranger allows him armed as he enters. Fina: Ann is in her own oracle tent. The boundary is clearly defined. It is a visitor beware situation. Bob walked into his ownn grave. Casey: Well, I agree with Fina. What do you do in such situation? Natalie: The purpose of this game is to discover and highlight differences in the law. We will add the differences to the 202211072244|Self Defense node.
@Paladin has advanced to Rank D. Natalie thanks all for playing!
� Discussions

Magic Bakery
[202302070800]
Jelly Queen Quest
◀ 2023 FEB 07 TUE 8:00 AM
Magic Bakery Home Channel
⭐
Yesterday StarTree found that the region was infested with Jelly Queen Slimes. So Zoey decided to investigate and take action.
💠 Through the portals
🔍Zoey: Apparently the JQ Slimes went through portals and leaked everywhere. StarTree counted 991 instances. Zoey decides that since ALL of them need to be fixed eventually, she would just fix them one by one.
Zoey: Added HXP to script. Zoey: Added IXP to script.
📯Zoey: Zoey discovers that some of the Jelly Queen Slimes are friendly and seems to be legit inhabitats and calls for a second opinion. Zoey: So, we also use the JQ tag for linking chat logs to a node. I think those are legitimate uses. Unless someone else helps decide whether those are ok, I will skip them for now. Zoey: The use of JQ tag at Archive2 seems legitimate. They are used for linking chats, and for linking to a node that was being discussed. Ivy: I would like to rule that in ALL cases, the JQ tag is illegitimate even when used to list all chat. The newer style requires the user to click on "Mentions" to show the related chats. Zoey: But if the node does not have any associated chat, the user won't know it until they click on it. Isn't that inconvenient? Ivy: The problem with JQ tag is that it is a risk of un-updated content or infinite loop. Ivy: I'll be okay with another tag that automatically shows a count of the related links, but not actually listing them on the page until user clicks on it. Zoey: Let's see: There are 196 instances of that in Archive2 and 496 instances of that in Archive1. That is the majority use. 692 total. Ivy: I suggest fixing the more obviously bad cases first, where JQ could just be LNK, the new style. Zoey: I think there are about 281 cases. That is most of the remaining uses. Zoey: Cleared those linked to Arena Comparisons. 274/281 remaining. Zoey: Added WrXP for 🏹 in the script. Zoey: Cleared those linked to Adventurer's Hall. 248/281 remaining. Zoey: Clearing some loose ones. Zoey: Added WdXP for 🗡️ in the script. Ledia: Are you separating them by weapon type? Zoey: Yes. XD Ledia: Ledia joins the quest party and clears some near the Roster. 239/281 remaining. Ledia: Added WsXP for ⚔️ in the script. Zoey: Cleared around the Carrot Farm. 230/281 remaining. Manga
[202302072023]
Drawing out loud
2023 FEB 07 TUE 8:23 PM
Manga Academy
⭐
Hello, this is a session where I draw out loud, or try to talk about what I am doing and the steps I go through to draw. 3B: I will be drawing Chapter 16 Page 15, but this isn't really a discussion on what should be on the page, since I had already done a draft. 3B: And if we discuss what should be on it, I won't be actually drawing it. So... here we go.
✒️ Chapter 16 Page 15 Panel 1 Ink
3B: What I have right now is the draft for the whole page, which has three panels. The manga page is read from top to bottom. I normally put the top panel to the back, so in Krita, the first panel is the layer group at the bottom.
3B: So I rename a layer group to be Panel 1. 3B: In each panel layers group, there are three sub folders: Ink, Color, Draft. I go to the Ink group to do the outline. Sasha: I think 3B should be somehow getting XP for explaining this. 3B: But I'm not saying anything that you can't learn from the internet. Sasha: But you are talking about how your drawing is organized. It is like talking about where you hang your keys. I can't learn from the internet where you hang YOUR keys. Casey: Yea, I get credit for just posting what repair I did. Casey: We even get credits for discussing. You should be getting something for describing. 3B: But as I said, if we start chatting I won't be drawing... I'm supposed to be drawing. Sasha: I am making the 🎨 icon an XP type. MXP. Just keep drawing and talking and I will snap that to your bubble. 3B: Okay. 3B: Because I am not used to drawing a face facing right, I flip the canvas and draw it facing left. 3B: I try to draw each line in a single stroke. If the stroke looks wrong I just undo and draw again. 3B: Eyes need their only layer because I redraw them often. 3B: Hair also needs its own layer for the same reason. In general each group of line can have its own layer. I don't think there is a limit to how many layers you can have in Krita. 3B: It is okay when the lines on different layers overlap. That can be fixed using an erase mask layer without actually erasing the line. 3B: Oftentimes the draft will make your line appear better than it is. So make it more transparent or switch it off to see if your lines are good. 3B: The draft doesn't have the thickness of the clothing. I add them when I draw the actual line. 3B: This angle would show that Sasha's Magician gloves only cover the thumb, index and middle fingers. This is opposite of my drawing glove that only covers the ring and little fingers. Sasha: I think we need a character costume design sheet to highlight the details. 3B: I suppose you could crop from the manga page and organize them in PowerPoint. 3B: Here I think her arm was too short, so I made a layer group for the arm and glove, so I could move them together. 3B: My draft was bad. I should have marked where her should is. Sasha: Added UXP 🍮 for marking/admitting that something wasn't right. 3B: To draw straight lines, move from elbow or even waist. 3B: A real fan would have a lot of details, but everything else is simple so if I draw too much details it would become distractive. So I have to keep it simple. 3B: In this case Sasha's Bunny didn't have its own layer, which I regret as I try to add its paw. 3B: Now I show how to erase the extra lines using an erase mask instead of an eraser. Sasha: I think my cape should go down more in the back. 3B: I think it would be only barely visible from that angle. 3B: So those are the lines for Sasha in Panel 1. 3B: Next I will draw Zoey first because Sasha and Zoey are the main panels on page 15. The turtle is a type of background, I will draw that last.
✒️ Chapter 16 Page 15 Panel 3 Ink
3B: Here I start the line/inking for Panel 3 by first adding some draft lines to emphasize that Zoey is looking up at Sasha.
3B: I am not sure if that would be obvious viewing Zoey from behind. We shall see. Ledia: I like how the layer group for Zoey is called Sasha. 3B: I am using a template and don't bother changing the name. Sasha: But you are adding "Pnl3" at the end. 3B: Each of those layer group has a corresponding filter layer higher up on the layer list. If I only rename one of them and something goes wrong, it would be troublesome identifying which filter layer corresponds to it. Sasha: What filter? 3B: There is a blur filter on top that I want to apply only on the lines. But only I don't want the shading of each layer group cover that blur effect, so I have a clone of each line layer from from each layer group on top. Then I apply the blur filter on those clones. 3B: If I turn off the blur filter it looks like this. Sasha: So that is 3B's secret sauce! Evelyn: It looks cuter and warmer with the filter. 😊 3B: Sorry. I said it wrong, that was actually not how it works. 3B: The layer groups that we have been drawing on are the ones that are blurred. By doing that the lines are too blurry, so I need to clone the original lines and show them on top again. Sasha: As long as it works. 3B: Actually I feel like I talked about this before. 3B: I redrew the arm so the bow needs to be repositioned. I lasso the bow from the draft to reposition it. 3B: And we now have Zoey drawing an arrow from the quiver. 3B: Next is the turtle.
✒️ Chapter 16 Page 15 Panel 2 Ink
3B: With Sasha and Zoey drawn, I can reposition the turtle so that nothing looks weird. In this case I think the turtle can be moved up a little bit.
3B: In similar method, the turtle with Sasha and Red on it is drawn. 3B: As you see, I left some of the lines outside the frame. I will use an erase mask on the outer frame so the characters seem bigger. 3B: It seems that this page doesn't need panel dividers, so the lines are done. @Manga has advanced to Rank D. Evelyn: Will we continue with shading tomorrow? 3B: Shading is really easy though. Evelyn: Is it...? 😅 3B: To me the harder parts are drafting and lining. But we can continue tomorrow. Evelyn: I find this session very enjoyable. 😊 3B thanks all for the company.
Ivy: Updated script maker to not use JQ tag in the end. Ivy: Added MXP to tally. Ivy: Added UXP to tally.

Manga
[202302082054]
Drawing out loud Pt 2
◀ 2023 FEB 08 WED 8:54 PM
Manga Academy
⭐
Tonight we paint the line drawing of Chapter 16 Page 15. The process is supposed to be really simple. 3B: Please don't expect too much from this drawing out loud session.
🎨 Chapter 16 Page 15 Painting
🎨3B: For the manga, I am only using five grey tones for painting. The pages are in grey scale.
3B: The five tones are just even steps from pure white to pure black. So the three tones in the middle are just 25% black, 50% black, and 75% black. 3B: Normally when I paint I listen to music. But I don't think I can do that while talking. 3B: Let's start with Zoey in the foreground, then it is clear what we don't need to paint. 3B: As you see the paint group also has layers. 3B: Because the line drawing has gaps through the line, I use paint to draw the outline before using bucket fill. Zoey: Let's do listen to music... 🎧 3B: The white highlights can all be on the same layer since they are really easy to repaint if needed. 3B: And Zoey is painted. Now the turtle. 3B: Sometimes what I do is that I just paint over the whole thing with a base grey to make sure that there is no gap between colors. 3B: Because I am only painting with a few tones, if I started painting from the bottom layer, sometimes I can't tell when the color of an upper layer is merely showing the color of the bottom. 3B: I will draw Sasha's magic orbs last with a different brush. 3B: After painting the base, you can use that for alpha lock for other layers so the new paint stays within the base. 3B: The foreground is painted. For the background I just paint some curved regions because we will put text on them, so I want to keep them simple. 3B: I've never drawn glowing orbs before, so this is trial and error... 3B: Let's add more sparkles since Faerie Fire is still in effect. 3B: The painting is kind of done. Now I put the text over it to see how it goes. Zoey is recognized for the equipment Platinum Arrow. 3B: I think the ground needs more magic. 3B: I think it is done. What do you think? Sasha: I think I also need a magic box. Sasha is recognized for the Air Magic Chaos Sphere. Evelyn: It looks really nice. 😊 3B: Then I post it. @Manga has advanced to Rank C. 3B: The next scene should be Sasha taking the arrow. It will be dialog drafting using PowerPoint.

Activity Log Area

⭐
There is now an Activity Log section at the daily status as an alternate place to log XP!
🔔StarTree: Please note that this new Activity Log is a prototype. Please don't copy the structure and import credits for previous dates!
🔔StarTree: Being enabled is the functionality for Tally to sum XP when the XP attribute specifies a number.
Before: A tag data-QXP-StarTree would only mean one credit.
After: A tag data-QXP-StarTree="10" would count as ten credits!
Transition: At this very moment it only works for QXP. But you may start logging XP in that format because StarTree will implement that for all XP types!
Vivi: We need script maker apps script support for that format. StarTree: StarTree thinks a new column at Script Maker is needed for the value! Vivi: It is approved if you are asking for permission. 202208181042|Carrot House

 202302102154|🥧 Whose turn to pay? {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202302102154","music":"CookingWithArcacia"}
Whose turn to pay?
Magic Bakery App
This is an app that keeps track of whose turn to pay the restaurant to avoid friends paying each other.
This node is for making an app that keeps track of whose turn to pay among a group of friends.
📯 Quest Briefing
📯 Make a cute app for keeping tab for team meals.
📯 Questers get 🎁 type XP
📯 The quest is adopted by @Carrot and @Happy.
🥥 Designs

Design 1

The App is a node at Magic Bakery. It saves data in a text area the user may edit directly.

Design 2

The app saves the data in a cookie.
🥔 Prototype Area
🥔 Prototype

Prototype Data

Bill Object

Does it parse?

Prototype UI

🥝 Next Steps 🥝
Development
📌 Prototype needs its own node.
📌 🎁 type XP for quester
Function
📌 Design the data structure of a bill.
📌 Create Bill Viewer
📌 Add Bill \ Add item (food or drink)
📌 Add friend \ Assign friend to item
📌 Export \ Import data
📌 Adjust share of an item
UI
📌 Add Choco top and bottom.
📌 Decide on a name for the app (Lunch Buddies)

Arcacia: 20230313: Added JSON parse checker, three column view for development.
202208181042|🥕 Cooking with Arcacia 202208161957|🌱 Magic Bakery Lab 💬 Discussions
{"id":"202302102154","parentid":"202208181042","parentname":"Carrot House","icon":"🥧","title":"Whose turn to pay?","subtitle":"Magic Bakery App","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2022/11/22/16/04/apple-pie-7610065_960_720.jpg","music":"CookingWithArcacia","author":"Arcacia","description":"This is an app that tracks whose turn to pay the restaurant to avoid friends paying each other.","card-text":""}
App
[202302102220]
Whose turn to pay?
2023 FEB 10 FRI 10:20 PM
Carrot Studio
⭐
Once upon a time, there was an app that keeps track of which friend should pay for team lunch...
💗Arcacia: Instead of each friend paying for themself or paying the payer each time, they used a spreadsheet to keep the running tab.
Arcacia: The spreadsheet shows them which friend owes the group the most. That friend can then reduce their debt by paying for team lunch next. Arcacia: With that system, there is only one payment per meal, to the restaurant. The friends don't need to actually pay each other.!
The Quest: Can you make that happen again?
Evelyn: It is a cute concept. 😊 Tanya: Does the spreadsheet still exist? Arcacia: Yes it does, but it has been said that it is too difficult to understand. Sasha: Wouldn't that mean someone has to enter the bill to the spreadsheet? Arcacia: Yes. Zoey: I wonder if there is already an app for that. 🤔 Zoey: I found an app of the exact name, but I think it does something different. Tanya: What is the demand or priority of this quest? Arcacia: At least some people would want to use it if it is easy to use. Evelyn: I hope that it is a cute app. Zoey: There is Splitwise. Tanya: I would say this is quite low priority, since we do have another programming project for Cardinal Quest using Power Apps. Arcacia: I would like to introduce a new XP type 🎁 for making gifts, such as this app. Tanya: I am not against anyone making it, for training purpose, or for promoting Arcacianism. Tanya: But it is of lower priority. Evelyn: I think we could switch among different projects, just like we could switch to @Carrot. Tanya: I am okay with the app developmening being part of @Carrot. Evelyn: @Happy adopts this quest also. Arcacia thanks all for the considerations!

{"cmd":"ll","desc":"Treasure Hunting","en":"I went treasure hunting.","ja":"宝探しに行ってきました。"}

Music Room

Music Making Notes
PIN 202302112157
This is for making music for posting on Youtube.
[1] Noteworthy Composer
We use Noteworthy Composer to record melodies from electronic keyboard 🎹, then export it as MID file.
To record from a keyboard, we use a Noteworthy Composer project that has a beat pattern on repeat for hundreds of times. This beat pattern serves as the metronome for the recording. We use Channel 10 drumset to make a simple pattern.
The purpose is to record the melody with correct rhythm, because inputting it using mouse and keyboard is much slower. P4: The volume, instrument, and key/octave can be easily changed once the melody is recorded. P4: If you want to record both hands at once, play them further apart so Noteworthy can record them as different hands. You can easily shift their octaves after recording. P4: If you play the melody wrong during recording, just wait for the next bar and play again. The wrong part can be easily deleted.💗 P4: You don't need to know how the whole song should be at this point. The melodies can be rearranged and repeated as needed after each unique section is recorded.
In Noteworthy, delete the errorous parts and shift them to approximately the correct octave, then export the melody (or sections of melody) as MID file. P4: When the music is exported as MID file, repeat notations are not kept. So there is no need to export with repeats, since they are added in the next software.
[2] MuseScore
Import to MuseScore Notes: Velocity offset 0. Mixer setting: Drum volume: 64. Others: max volume. Export as MP3.
[3] Audacity
Audacity: Bass and Treble: Bass 0.0, Treble 12.0, Volume 1.0. Export as MP3.
[4] Clipchamp
Clipchamp: Export in highest resolution.

Jump to...

202208172107|🎹 Music Room

Book

Writing Magic
PIN 202302112339
Make Stories Fly
Writing Magic
Writer's Oath
Write as often and as much as I can; respect my writing self; and to nurture the writing of others.
20230117: This list is from the book Writing Magic!

Sec 1: Lift Off

[1] A running start
This chapter has writing prompts, and general advices on how to write better.
[2] Why I wrote this book
The author feels lucky as a writing and wants to teach others how to write. What do you feel lucky about?
[3] Shut up!
This chapter is about noticing and turning off negative and unhelpful inner chatter.
[4] Eureka!
This chapter is about trying free writing to get ideas and jogging down the ideas.
[5] Getting into it
You may start from the start of the story, or the part you want to write. You may start with the part the reader should not know. Everything will be fine when you revise. [6] Noticing

Sec 2: Heart and Guts

[7] The nitty-gritty
[8] The kiss of life
[9] Character helper
[10] Suffer!
[11] Talking
This chapter is about including dialogues in fiction writing and keeping them short for a more natural flow. I think we already do this since our writing is almost entirely dialogues! [12] Back to Beginnings
[13] Where am I?
[14] Who am I?
[15] Voice
[16] Happily ever after-or not

Sec 3: Plowing Through

[17] Stuck!
[18] The operating room
[19] Writers' Groups and Other Helpers

Sec 4: Digging Deeper

[20] Show and tell
[21] Abracadabra!
[22] I'd recognize her with my eyes closed
[23] Speaking body language
[24] Method writing
[25] Writing funny, writing punny
[26] The right moniker
[27] Fiddling with fairy tales

Sec 5: Writing Forever

[28] Writing for your spirit
[29] Putting your words out there
[30] Exeunt writing

📯 Power Apps Quest
📌4 Tanya: The Power Apps Quest is a new information quest that might replace MAP and the master PRC, but unifying the data using Power Apps. To that end there are the following subquests:
[Q1] Stages List (Rank S): Compile a list of all stages for Cardinal Quest.
[Q2] CHK Sharing (Rank S): Prepare CHK to be shared with other teams.
[Q3] Power Apps Notes (Rank S): Transfer Field Notes to Power Apps.
[Q4] Power Apps PRC (Rank S): Transfer Master PRC content to Power Apps.
Tanya: Q1 and Q2 might not be related to Power Apps. But I think it is better to assume that they are related, and first learn what Power Apps can do. StarTree: Signs up for Power Apps. Wee~! Tanya: Checks subscription. Tanya: I think the plan we want might be different. I will confirm. I was told we need a Plan 2 subscription. Tanya: Checks environment. Tanya: Requesting authorization. Tanya: I think for now we can first learn what Power Apps can do.

📯Tanya: I see about 11 tutorials at the home page. Let's see which one might be the most relevant.
[1][2:12] Canvas: You can make an web app from a blank form, and connect it to data objects. Black: This seems like user form as in VBA, but the user is using it through the web, so they don't need access to Excel.
[2][1:39] : Dataverse is the prefered data object for Power Apps
[3][2:02] : You can linking to SharePoint data.
[4][2:10]: You can link to Excel place at OneDrive.
[5][1:56]: You can link to SQL as data source.
[6]: You can make an app from an image of a form.
[7]: You can make an app from Figma.
