202208250038|Cardinal Quest HQ

 202302121738|🥾 Quest Stages {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202302121738","music":""}

Phase I - Commissioning

REG - Registration
Register the quest objectives at HQ. Including checking for the history and duplicated quest. DSC - Quest Description
This describes the details of the quest for each quest objective (Boss, Hideout, Spawnpoint) for the general public. PRM - Prismic Image
This is an images of runes for the core crystal of the area. It is used to restore the crystal in case of corruption. BTN - Quest Bulletins
Make signs and bulletin postings about the quest at the quest sites so people may know there will be quest activities and how they may join. CCL - Completion Checklist
This checklist is a detailed checklist for the quester so they can tell if their quest objective is complete. The completed list is stored at the Quest Center. SPI - Special Instruction
This is a document describing any special instruction needed for the quester, or sometimes for the general public. TCN - Commission Notice
This notice happens when a quester/team commits to do a quest. This gets the process started to supply that team for the quest.

Phase II - Hideouts

HLV - Hideout Level
This is an estimated rating on how hard the hideout is. HRF - Hideout Reference
This is the gathering and scouting of information about the hideout including its history, and similar hideouts at other sites. SUP - Quest Supplies
Identify all physical supplies, tools, and equipments needed for the quest and plan on how they would get to the quest site. MAP - Dungeon Map
This is the map of the dungeon as it is scouted or according to archive. LEY - Leyline Mapping
This is a leyline survey for powering area crystals. CIR - Circulation
This is the enchant to the core crystal on how it should transmute the area mana. LDE- Leyline details
Additional details on each new leyline. POW - Area Power
This is a check on the resulting elemental balance of the area. CMV - Combined View
This is an overall view of quest site when all is complete. ORD - Part Order
This checks whether the parts needed for the quest are ordered at various crafters. ARV - Arrival
This checks whether the parts needed for the quest have arrived at the quest site. ASM - Action
This is when hideouts get cleared.

Phase III - Spawn Points

SLV - Spawn Point Level
This is a difficulting rating of the spawn point. GEM - Gem
This is for embedding the core crystal with special gems. LRF - Library Reference
Gather scroll references for the enchantment. ENC - Enchanting
Enchanting to the core crystal. MAC - Mutual Aid Contract
Prepare reinforcement from surrounding areas if they are part of the defense. GLM - Golem training
Training area golems to work with the crystal. PFN - Pixie / Fairies Alliance
Training local pixies and faries to work with the crystal. MRG - Merchants Guild
Work with local merchant guilds to resupply for the area defense. MPS - Public Service
Working with local public services to work with the area defense. TRL - Trial
Conduct mock trial to test the defense. NTS - Portal List
This is a list of portals needed by the defense plan. SND - Distribution
This step hands off the tried system to the local. TDY - Tidying
Tidies the quest camp area as the quest concludes.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202302121738","parentid":"202208250038","parentname":"Cardinal Quest HQ","icon":"🥾","title":"Quest Stages","subtitle":"Code Reference","img":"","music":"","author":"Tanya","description":"","card-text":""}
Monster Dessert
[202302122238]
Holland Cup
◀ 2023 FEB 12 SUN 10:38 PM
Puzzle Plaza
⭐
Hey hey hey, nothing beats a puzzle before bed!
🧩Mikela: There is a prestigious race in Holland that invovles many people and much organization, yet no one knows when it will be held until two days prior the race. Why? Mikela: This puzzle is on page 195 of 202302050007|Classic Lateral Thinking Puzzles! Zoey: I think it has to do with the weather, such as snow or ice.
🔍 Clue: Infrequent Condition
Mikela: The race can only happen in a certain condition, which occurs infrequently.
💬 Discussion
Zoey: I keep my suggestion of something cold, such as ice or snow. Tanya: That seems very reasonable. Sasha: Does having a race on ice or snow take enormous organization? Is it prestigious? Sasha: My keyword is a vehicle, such as a boat or a car. LRRH: My keyword is animal. Evelyn: I like this new format where you could play even if you know the answer by suggesting a keyword. 😊 Mikela: Do we have a challenger? Casey: What do you get if you win? Sasha: It is a whole detective level. Casey: And if you lose? Sasha: A worse hit rate. Casey: My hit rate is already below 50%. This seems like a good deal for me. How do we do this? Mikela: So far there are three keywords: cold, vehicle, and animal. You will make a guess on the relevance of each of them. If you get more than half right, then you win! Casey: This is a great deal isn't it? It is basically 50% chance to win. Casey: My guess is Cold, not vehicle, not animal. I think it is prestigious enough if you can just drop anything you do in two-day's notice to participate. Zoey: The cold is a given, but now I think maybe it also involves horse riding, which makes it prestigious. Zoey: *checks her current hit rate which is 82%.* My hit rate is pretty high... At least if I fail I won't de-level. Zoey: Okay I take the challenge and pick both cold and animal, but not vehicle. Tanya: I will choose the same as Zoey. My detective level maxed out at 7. Mikela: Anyone else? Sasha: I am debating if I should really just roll the dice. Zoey: Don't you think the weather being cold is part of it? Sasha: Bias can be bad. Sasha: Okay I will just roll the dice. Zoey: So what is it? XD Sasha: I am rolling the dice! It doesn't matter if I roll now or later! Zoey: Are we sure Sasha is not going to cheat? XD Tanya: Mikela could roll for Sasha. Zoey: I don't buy it. They are both Magicians. XD Zoey: No offense. XD Sasha: I would like to ask P4 to roll for me. Three dice. P4: 💟 P4: Not cold. With vehicle. With animal. Sasha: I can't believe this... if it is not cold, what makes the event infrequent? Zoey: I think this goes to show that luck doesn't transfer. XD Sasha: Maybe I should have asked P4 to roll for herself, then choose what she chooses. Zoey: Well you can't force P4 to play. Sasha: P4, if you win from rolling dice you could get the 🍀 icon. Evelyn: Ob...objection. 😖 The 🍀 is tied to XP. We shouldn't get XP from gambling. 😖 Sasha: This is not gambling, P4 is not losing any XP if she loses. Hit rate is not XP. Sasha: If P4 helps me, her 🍀 XP would be for helping someone. "Let people help each other and reward those who do." It is Arcacian. It is XP worthy. Evelyn: I'm sorry. You are right. Mikela: Objection... OVERRULED! Tanya: @StarTree. StarTree: Added ⚖️ as an XP type! Mikela: May I have 🧩 XP? Being the Puzzle Master and all. StarTree: Added 🧩 as an XP type! Sasha: I want 🎩 XP to represent moments of creating suspense or surprise, or entertainment. They belong to the EPIC C-community category. StarTree: Added 🎩 XP type! Sasha: P4 please roll again for yourself to help this unlucky Sasha. P4: P4 wants to help Sasha. P4: Not cold, with vehicle, no animal. Sasha: Oh no, it makes even less sense. 🏳️ Zoey: But with vehicle was your suggestion. XD Sasha: I did it with the cold! Mikela: Okay, let's see if we have a winner!
🔔 SOLUTION
🎩Mikela: And the solution is... Mikela: It is Elfstedentocht where the participants skate on natural ice through 11 historical cities! Mikela: Our sole winner this time is Casey! Congratulations! 🎊 Zoey: It hurts. XD Casey: Well, it is easier if you have nothing to lose. Mikela: And for their courages to face challenges, Casey, Zoey, Tanya, Sasha, and P4 all get another 💛! Cheers! Mikela thanks all for playing! Casey: Where is my lion? Tanya: I think we can define the lion as XP for a show of courage. StarTree: Added 🦁 XP! StarTree: No one has earned a 🦁 XP yet! Casey: We shall see.
StarTree: Adds INNER Start and End to Apps Script.

Puzzle Plaza
[202302132013]
Puzzle Score
◀ 2023 FEB 13 MON 8:13 PM
Puzzle Plaza
⭐
I think there was an error in the scoring for the puzzle last night. Tanya: While Casey won by being 100% correct, Zoey and I also won because we were right 2/3.
Scoring
Tanya: While Casey by being 100% correct, Zoey and I also won because we were right 2/3. But it was recorded as a loss for the two of us.
Zoey: Ooo~ I didn't lose! XD Tanya: @StarTree? @Mikela? StarTree: StarTree doesn't know if that was the intention! Sasha: Wasn't the rule the closest one get a win? Casey was the closest yesterday. Evelyn: I think it would be more relaxing if we are not playing against each other. Casey: As long as I still win... Evelyn: And P4 was helpful to Sasha yesterday. 🤗 Zoey: From 3 wrong to 2 wrong--which is still a loss. XD P4: 💟 Sasha: I need a recognition. Sasha is recognized for the aura Abysmal Luck. Mikela: I'll let Sasha decide on the scoring because it is tied to detective level, which is not in my department. Cheers! Sasha: Well, then Sasha wins as long as someone wins. Sasha: Just kidding. Tanya: How about all winners get the win, but the top winner gets the crown 👑? Sasha: That is a great idea! StarTree please make that happen. StarTree: Done! Zoey: Should we or could we have another puzzle? Now that the difficulty has become quite reasonable. Mikela: Yes you may!
🧩 Puzzle: Dollar Murder
🧩Mikela: A man cheated a woman of a sum of $5. When the woman found out, she killed him. They were not poor. Her defense lawyer argued that she was justified for the murder, and many people agreed with her. Why? Mikela: This puzzle is on page 194 of 202302050007|Classic Lateral Thinking Puzzles!
🔍Clue 1: Mikela: The man failed to keep a promise.
🔍Clue 2: Mikela: He had not used the $5 as agreed.
🔍Clue 3: Mikela: The woman found herself considerably worse off than she had expected.
Evelyn: I don't think we should play this puzzle. 😖 Casey: This one is too easy. Sasha: Mikela please screen the puzzle first, for one that is appropriate and challenging. Mikela: I don't think the solution is what you might be thinking. But by a vote of three, this puzzle is shelved!
🧩 Dear Self
🧩Mikela: A man wrote and signed a check of $1000 from his checkbook. Although he has enough money in his account for the check to be cashed, he was charged with fraud. Why? Mikela: This puzzle is on page 194 of 202302050007|Classic Lateral Thinking Puzzles!
🔍Clue 1: Mikela: He intended to defraud.
🔍Clue 2: Mikela: The check looked fine, his signature was perfect, but it would not have proven valid.
Zoey: This seems pretty hard. Sasha: So. If we just suggest easy keywords then we would win. Mikela: There is no challenge if the choices are too easy! As for the win, that is up to you! Tanya: The puzzle didn't say who the check pays. I propose the keyword "Payee". Zoey: Good keyword! Sasha: We tend to be right with whichever idea that came first. What if we just choose this one? Mikela: I don't detect any challenge in this case so no one will get a crown. Sasha: But Tanya could be wrong. Mikela: Then I add a keyword: dead. You could think of it as the payee is dead. But is it true or false? Casey: If he wants to get the money then he needs to be able to cash it somehow. I think Impersonation is involved. Mikela: With that we have three keywords: Payee, death, and impersonation. Now I would consider this challenging. Evelyn: I think the fraud is that the man will pay a victim in exchange for something, then the check would be proven invalid. So I think it is a No on all three. Mikela: Are you taking the challenge? Evelyn: No... it is just a suggestion. 😅 Zoey: That is quite possible. 🤔 Casey: You only need two right to win. I'll take the challenge with no on all three. Sasha: What is the theory about the payee? Tanya: Such as when the payee is also himself or an accomplice in a scheme such as money laundering. Sasha: This sounds too complicated. I don't think death is relevant, for the other two keywords I can take one hit. So I choose Payee as the only relevant keyword. Zoey: I... will... side... with... Evelyn. Not relevant on all three. Tanya: I stay with Payee. Same as Sasha. Sasha: I want to know why Evelyn't wouldn't play. Evelyn: I just find this a little too stressful. 😅 Since there is nothing we can do to know more and have a better guess. P4: This time P4 stays with Evelyn by not choosing. Evelyn: 😊 Sasha: Does this counts as furapy? Mikela: I think that is all the players this time. Let's see if we have any winner...!
Mikela: And the SOLUTION is... Mikela: The man used Ink that vanishes in an hour! None of the keywords were relevant! Everyone who played wins! Mikela: And Casey and Zoey get the crown! Congratulations! 🎊 @Puzzle advances to Rank B.
Zoey: That was a good puzzle. Sasha: Evelyn don't you feel that pain in your stomach when you could have won but didn't play? Evelyn: Not in particular. 😅 Sasha: I have an idea. What if in a situation like this where Evelyn's theory is right, but she just doesn't "gamble", she still gets a win but just without the yellow heart for taking the challenge? Zoey: I think that seems fair. But what if her theory is wrong. Does she not get a loss? Sasha: If we do that she won't even talk. Tanya: Then the hit ratio will be biased. If you want to track when someone's theory is right, you also need to track whey they are wrong. Sasha: But if we track it only when the speak stands by their message, wouldn't the hit rate also be wrong? The stats won't show who is actually right most of the time. Tanya: Evelyn, is it stressful if we always track whether your theory is right? Evelyn: I hope that you get the stats you need. But I hope that I don't know about it since it would make me feel a little self-conscious. 😅 Casey: Supposably Evelyn was wrong about the puzzle that we vetoed. So were Sasha and I. Sasha: Okay. On second thought, let's not account for hit rate everytime someone predicts. Tanya: I think we can distinguish the context. In the vetoed puzzle, Evelyn wasn't really predicting the puzzle was inappropriate. She was merely sounding an alarm, or raising a concern that it might be inappropriate. Tanya: In the checkbook puzzle, what she said was a result of a different thought process where she weighed and drew a conclusion from information available. Tanya: I think we can automatically track the second type in puzzle settings. Sasha: In this case I value the player's feeling more than my desires to get stats. So I rule that we don't track win-loss unless the player commits. Sasha thanks all for the game.

Criminal Laws
[202302142037]
Law Game Part 4
◀ 2023 FEB 14 TUE 8:37 PM
Paladin Hall
⭐
This is a continuation of the Law Game. Natalie: Please be aware that the content may not be appropriate for children. Natalie: Please note that we play this game from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions.
⚔️ [181] Retreat requirement
🏛️Natalie: Ann and Bob meet at a public sidewalk one day. Ann physically attacks Bob and Bob reasonably believes that Ann is about to kill him or do him serious bodily harm. Even through Bob could safely run away, he shoots Ann with a gun. Under the majority rule, is Bob liable for Ann's death because he could have retreated safely?
Casey: I think the majority rule is you have to retreat. But I would prefer laws that say you don't have to. Fina: In Reciprocative law you don't have to retreat. A society with a law that requires retreat would have to be an Opt-in society. Otherwise it would violate self-care. Natalie: The majority rule is that there is no duty to reteat. Bob has a valid self-defense claim. Casey: My faith in the law has restored a little bit.
💬 Score Keeping
📯Natalie: This is a question mainly to @Ivy: Should we keep XP tags in the Laws node, or only in chat?
Ivy: It should only be in chat. The reason is that the chat has an approximate timestamp, and the content of an information node is often rearranged. No one can tell who did what when the text is rearranged, combined, or removed. Ivy: If you log it in chat, then your XP record is always saved. Natalie: Moved XP tags at the node to the chat thread.
🏛️ [1] Elements of a Crime
Natalie: In general, what are the elements of a crime?
Sasha: That the suspect intends to commit the crime and actually tries to do it? Natalie: Correct! It is Act, Mental State, Concurrence, and Causation.
@Paladin advances to Rank C. Natalie thanks all for playing!

Regular Expression
📯StarTree: The original object to change had a two-line pattern with the node ID in the second line. StarTree: Visual Studio Code text find accepts multiline. Fina first search and replace the multiline part without the node ID, but marking the end with a symbol '@@'. StarTree: Then she used regular expression in VSC to replace the second part with the ID, now marked with '@@'.

Log Fall
[202302152005]
Log Fall Dungeon
◀ 2023 FEB 15 WED 8:05 PM
Log Fall Dungeon
📯
Log Fall Dungeon has not have much activity since December. I would like to continue.
📌 Topic Selection
📌Tanya: I am starting at the bottom of the staging list, which is the topic of "Self-serving definition."
LRRH: The discussion was two months old. Do we need to reply? Tanya: I think it is okay without replying, but we need to resolve the underlying conflict. So please describe the conflict.
💬 Summary
Context
🏛️LRRH: Someone was suggesting that compassion is a solution of poverty. Then I pointed out the difference between a desirable situation and the actions leading to that situation. LRRH: For example, when toilet paper is in shortage, a store decision to limit purchase to 1 per person is an enforcement type solution. The store does something to stop people from not able to buy any. LRRH: In reply, the OP Michael said "Enforcing a limit of 1 set per person" is a compassionate solution. LRRH: So I asked would a solution to "race to the store and buy it before other can buy" a solution based on compassion. LRRH: In reply the OP again says that it is a solution based on compassion. LRRH: To me that suggests that they don't actually have a way to tell whether a solution is based on compassion or not. The people discussing don't have a concept that their use of adjectives are self-serving. LRRH: So I bookmarked that so we could have a node explaining what a self-serving definition is and how to spot them.
StarTree: (Added URL to script maker) Evelyn: I think this topic is quite similar to that in 202208011038|Black-or-white. Tanya: Let's first define what a self-serving definition is. At the 202209202305|Self-serving bias node. Tanya: Upgraded self-serving bias node to stack style. LRRH: I think it is, "You define a term, or avoid defining a term so that your statement is always right, and in doing so renders the word meaningless." Tanya: I put it as, "A self-serving definition is a lack of objective definition where the speaker asserts that a term is meaningful but fail to define when it cannot be applied. Self-serving definition renders a term meaningless in a discussion, and it is a sign that the speaker is having a self-serving bias." LRRH: I like how a self-serving definition is actually a lack of definition. Tanya: Added a comparison section. LRRH: Adding an example about toilet paper. LRRH: Explaining the example. LRRH: I think it is better if I link to this discussion instead of the twitter post. Since we explain the context here. Tanya: Agreed.
@Dungeon advances to Rank C. Tanya thanks all for answering the call.

Writing Advices
PIN 202302180152
202302112339|📒1: The best way to write better is to write more.
202302112339|📒2: The best way to write more is to write even when you only have five mintues.
202302112339|📒3: Read. Reading books show you how to write them.
202302112339|📒4: Reread. Let the words get inside you.
202302112339|📒5: Save everything you write, even if you don't like it, for at least 15 years. You cannot get back to your old self.

202208212113|Maintenance

 202302181848|🚗 Car Maintenance {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202302181848","music":""}
Car Maintenance
Maintenance Log
Is it time to switch to electric?
🏳️ 20230316 LRRH: 20230316: Asked the shop to put the car back together so we could bring it back. 💧 20230304 Coolant leak Casey: 20230304: There seems to be a coolant leak. Added a tray under where the car parks. Where is it leaking from?
🔋 20230224 Battery Ivy: 20230224: The car needed a jump start every time it starts (3 times today). A symptom is that the engine fan remains on for a long time after stopping the engine. Ivy: 20230225: Charged the battery to 12.22V. That wasn't enough to start the car, still need the jump pack each time. (2 times today.) Casey: 20230303: Added coolant. Ivy: 20230304: The car battery is at 10.5V in the morning. After jump start it runs at 14.45V. Maybe the battery is not dead. Ivy: 20230304: The battery is dated May 2017, almost 5 years old. Ivy: 20230304: Today the fan didn't continue after the car has stopped. Was the cause the coolant being too low?I only needed to jump once in the morning. The battery was able to start the car by itself the rest of today (4 times).
📻 20230106 Radio Antenna Casey: 20230106: Getting a new antenna to replace the one broken by car wash. Casey: 20230114: Install stubby antenna. Great reception.
🧳 20230106 Rear door support Casey: 20230106: Getting new supports to keep the hatch open. Casey: 20230114: Replaced hatch struts. Only the right side is leaking, but replaced both. The retaining clip does not need to be loosened to install, it just snaps into place. The coat stand happens to be perfect height to hold up the hatch.
🧳 20221226 Rear door Ivy: 20221226: The rear door is not detected close. But does not always happen.
🔥 20221112 Burnt smell when stopping Ivy: Noticed a burnt smell when the car stops twice. Was I burning the clutch when I stop? Did my driving habit change? Ivy: 20221110: Confirmed that I started riding the clutch when stopping at parking lot. Refilled coolant.
💨 20221122 Tire Pressure Ivy: 20221122: Front right tire pressure low. Casey: 20221123: Inflated the tire with a foot pump to 33 psi. Casey: 20221210: Inflated rear left tire with a foot pump to 33 psi.
💨 Smog Test
💨 Smog Test
Smog Test has three parts: visual inspection, functional test, and emission test. An unresolve status indicator could fail the functional test. Ivy: 20230218: Failed. Engine lamp was on. Codes: P1497, P15E8, P15FD. Ivy: 20230222: I schedule oil change on March 9th. The place said I shouldn't mention repairs for smog test, or they will ask me to go to a smog repair shop.

Criminal Laws
[202302191059]
Law Game Part 5
◀ 2023 FEB 19 SUN 10:59 AM
Paladin Hall
⭐
This is a continuation of the Law Game. Natalie: Please be aware that the content may not be appropriate for children. Natalie: Please note that we play this game from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions.
🚑 [2] Crime vs Tort
🏛️Natalie: What is the difference between a crime and a tort?
Zoey: A tort is an infringement against someone's right. I think in the way we define it, crimes are also infringement against someone's right. So...🤔 Natalie: A tort is a civil wrong against an individual, while a crime is a public wrong against the state. Zoey: But is it true that a wrong against a state is a wrong against an individual? If you chase down to the actual stakeholder that the state is protecting. Natalie: When you damages someone's property by accident, you are liable to the damages but you are not a "criminal". Tort laws determine if the defendant is liable, and how much they are liable for. Zoey: Okay. I understand. Tort does not require an intention to violate someone's rights. Natalie: That is correct! The person is being held liable is not necessarily punishable.
🏛️ [3] Theories of Punishment
Natalie: What theories of punishment are applicable to ciminal law?
Tanya: Is proportionality a theory, or consideration? Natalie: The question can be rephrased as "what are justisfications that a crime deserve to be punished?" Tanya: To deter future crimes. Natalie: Correct! The card lists six reasons, almost all of them can be boiled down to "prevention of crime."
@Paladin advances to Rank B.
📒 Formatting the node
📯Natalie: I think the list of definitions will become too long to view soon. I want to list or search them. Any ideas?
Black: TSN HTML has a text filter. As you type in the textbox, it filters the list and hides entries that do not have the entered keyword. Natalie: I'll look into it, thanks! 😃
Natalie: Natalie studies how that code works. Adds function TextSearchPN. Tanya: I would like to have text search for Dungeon also. Natalie: Let's study together! 😃 Natalie: In TSN, the search is mainly done by a function called MainFilter. That function takes the argument of a keyword, and a DOM type. Then it scans the entire page for each DOM of that type. If its innerHTML doesn't have the keyword, then it becomes hidden, otherwise its display is set to "". Natalie: In my case I need to specify which section it should scan, so I will make a function TextFilter that takes three arguments. Natalie: In TSN the input box has its own ID. I wonder if I could avoid that. Yes! It worked. But the filter itself is not entirely working. It is showing too much. Why is that? Natalie: For example, if I search for the letter "z", it does not hide the 'Defending Others' section. That section doesn't have the letter z in it. I don't think. Tanya: It is matching the class name "mbpuzzle". Natalie: Changing TextFilter to scan innerText instead of innerHTML. Natalie: If i search for upper case "E", it shows the "S - Z" section blank. But if I search for lower case "e", it shows "S - Z" section with content. Why? Tanya: Adding console.log. I discovered that the display is actually toggling. Execution can enter the IF statement even when the value of the search is "-1". Natalie: Checking the type of the returned value: It is a number. Tanya: Confirming whether the issue only happens when the input box is clicked, but not when a letter is input: Not true. It happens in both cases. Natalie: It seems to happen to any uppercase letter used in the search box. Black: It happens on lowercase letter also, if you just hit the shift key at the search box. Tanya: There is a strange behavior where if you just type "attacker" there is no match, but if you type "attackers" then backspace the 's', the matches are correct. Then as soon as you hit the shift key, the result is wrong. Black: Let's add a submit button. Black: Confirmed that the issue doesn't happen with the original TSN HTML code. Natalie: Changing TextFilter to scan TextContent instead of innerText. Natalie: Finally it is working! Natalie: I want to make the code not hide the spacers at the end. Tanya: Added an attribute to skip the spacers. Natalie: Nice! Natalie: I wonder if the alphabetical headings are necessary... Added QueryAllP2NH, ShowLP2NH. I think it looks slightly better. Tanya: I think it looks better with the alphabetical heading for now. But I think it would look better if the code automatically distribute the result evenly into three columns. Natalie: You might be right. Changing it back to with headers now. 😃
Natalie thanks all for playing and for the upgrade!

Log Fall
[202302200914]
Loaded Question
◀ 2023 FEB 20 MON 9:14 AM
Log Fall Dungeon
📯
Log Fall Dungeon is open. Tanya: Let's do the last topic at the staging area: Loaded Question. The node for the summary is 202208011031|this.
📯 Summary and Objective
Context
🏛️LRRH: In the begining I was stating that RBE has a hierarchy because a person cannot opt-out. Then Marlow said that one way to implement RBE is through holacracy. So I said holacracy would also violate autonomy unless it lets people opt-out. Then he said that I was using loaded assumptions, but I was just pointing out an umbrella term includes the bad stuff unless they are excluded by definition.
📯LRRH: My request is to add content to distinguish what is and is not a loaded question.
⚖️ Example of a Loaded Question
Claim: I am anti-hierarchy and support direct democracy.
Question: When will you stop using majority rule to rob the minority?
Tanya: The above question is a loaded question when the claimant did not use majority rule to rob the minority. Tanya: If the claimant did in fact use majority rule to rob the minority, then the question is not a loaded question.
⚖️ Example of a non-loaded question
Claim: I am anti-hierarchy and I support direct democracy.
Question: Direct democracy allows using majority rule to rob the minority. For a given decision, a person in the majority is in an upper hierarchy compared to those in the minority. How do you be anti-hierarchy and support direct democracy at the same time?
LRRH: This is not a loaded question because it is not saying that the claimant robbed the minority using a majority rule. It is asking the claimant to clarify and explain what they meant by the terms when they use those terms.
🚀 Deployment
🏛️LRRH: I think the concept this time, that a hierarchy can be top-heavy, is worth sharing.
Tanya: I agree that it is share-worthy, but perhaps not until the sighting and staging areas are clear. LRRH: Wouldn't that take a year to clear? Tanya: ... LRRH: I think it is okay to post it because the Dungeon System is suppose to triage and react to what is important. Or even if we don't triage, we could just respond with a queue. It might take a year to reply but that is okay. LRRH: At least someone else might benefit from the concept while we are slowly clearing the queue. Tanya: @Evelyn? Evelyn: What exactly do you want to post? LRRH: "World Peace Concept: A direct democracy is not necessarily free of hierarchy. It can be an upside-down hierarchy where the majority oppresses the minority." Evelyn: I think to post that we need show the alternative at the same time so people know what is "better." LRRH: The term we have been using is Choice Democracy. "Compared to Choice Democracy where each person may decide their share and freely collaborate with those who want to decide together." Evelyn: I think we should upgrade the 202209211022|Choice Democracy node before posting this concept. Tanya: Agreed. Either now or we put that on a queue. Evelyn: I would perfer to continue since we are still fresh on the topic. 😅
@Dungeon is now Rank B.
⚖️ Direct vs Choice Democracy
Evelyn: Added a section for the comparison at Choice Democracy node. LRRH: Added comparison content and explanation. Evelyn: Added a CSS class mbRef for displaying references. LRRH: Should that node be upgraded to the new format? Evelyn: I think we should let Ivy decide. LRRH: I think it should be upgraded since I am about to post and need a screenshot. Evelyn: I think it is better to minimize the change so the node can be close to what ivy wants. Zoey: Zoey sees irony since the node is about choice democracy. LRRH: A node in the blog is not necessarily a person's individual share. We are supposed to change them as needed. Zoey: @Ivy, can we change the style of your 202209211022|node? Ivy: Yes. But... Ivy: ... don't go crazy changing all of them since I think there is a better way of restructuring the nodes. It might take some time to explain separation of data from presentation. LRRH: Little Red upgrades the node. Evelyn: I think we need to keep a link to the "master node" with the best style for others to copy. Ivy: You do notice that the best style you have now shows the title three times. Tanya: Tanya takes a screenshot. Evelyn: I never noticed it before... 😅 Tanya: It is because the other nodes don't normally repeat the title for the drop cap. LRRH: I Tweeted. StarTree: In XP_TallyAllPN, StarTree uses a while loop to loop through each child of the roster frame. StarTree: Since the roster frame is a flex frame and we end it with two spacer div, the code will need to skip those. But in any case, only member div has a name attribute, so the code skips those without a name. StarTree: StarTree creates a function XP_DisplayEL. StarTree: The original function XP_Display assumes that the viewer clicked on the avatar image. From there it goes up one level to the parent. StarTree now makes a function where "this" is the frame itself! StarTree: In the original XP_Display code, the JQuery data is first loaded to a div within the avatar. StarTree wonder if that is necessary wants to see if the code would still work without it. StarTree: StarTree replace the "physical" cache with a virtual one and it still works. Wee~~! StarTree: Modified XP_Display to call XP_DisplayEL and added comments. StarTree: And it is done! Ledia: Nice! Now I have a template for the next few changes I want to make. StarTree: Wee~~!

[202302232222]
CH16 Page 16
◀ 2023 FEB 23 THU 10:22 PM
Wyvern Island
⭐
This is for the draft of Chapter 16 page 16. Zoey is about to or will have fired an arrow at Sasha. What is going to happen?
🏛️Sasha: I pretend to panic but am actually ready to nuke Zoey if she shoots at me, because that would be an Ad Hominem attack.
Zoey: I was shooting at your chaos spheres. You said people simply don't know the future, but in most cases our current guesses about the future are not wrong. Zoey: So the platinum arrows will hit the chaos sphere also. 3B: This might be for the next panel, but what happens when your arrow hits Sasha's orb? Zoey: How about one bursts, one goes through and hits Sasha, and the third does something surprising? Sasha: If you know it could go through you are not supposed to shoot. Zoey: I want to see what happens. 3B: For the arrow that goes through an orb, what would happen to the orb? Sasha: Since the arrow didn't hit, it should turn into something bad that people created when they were trying to do good. Sasha: And we recently have a perfect example: The Jelly Queens! Sasha: The story was that people created public portals leading to an unintentional result that monsters also got through and spread everywhere. Sasha: Whereas if people focused on themselves and didn't try to make it easy for everyone, the situation wouldn't have happened. The Jellies would have stayed local. The portals would open slower, and thus giving people more time to discover that it was a bad idea. 3B: I think there is enough content for at least one page. Ledia: I like how the content suddenly becomes current. Zoey: I think we will probably finish dealing with the Jellies before these pages are done. Zoey: And that would be a counter to your argument: You said if people just mind their own business, bad things won't appear as quickly. On the other hand, if people help each other, bad things will end quicker. Ledia: And I believe we would agree that specialization is a key to efficiency, and cooperation is a key allowing people to specialize compared to those who are isolated Ledia: So even in the argument that bad things will happen less when people mind their own business, advances in civilization comes from people cooperating 3B: I'll save that for next time. @Manga is now Rank A. 3B thanks all for the content.

Criminal Laws
[202302242000]
Law Game Part 6
◀ 2023 FEB 24 FRI 8:00 PM
Paladin Hall
⭐
The Law Game continues. Natalie: Please be aware that the content may not be appropriate for children. Natalie: Please note that we play this game from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions.
🏛️ [3] Felony vs Misdemeanor
🏛️Natalie: What is the typical distinction between felonies and misdemeanors in most jurisdictions?
Zoey: Felonies are more serious. So, you can go to prison for felonies, but not misdemeanors. Tanya: A felony is a willful violation of someone's rights. A misdemeanor is the breaking of a rule without an immediate victim. Natalie: Zoey's answer is closer to the common definition: A felony is a crime punishable by imprisonment exceeding one year or by death. A misdemeanor is a crime punishable by a fine or imprisonment of one year or less. Zoey: Why the one year cutoff? That seems so arbitrary. 🤔 Tanya: The difference seems administrative instead of philosophical. Natalie: Also, typically battery and assault are misdemeanors. Misdemeanors can also have a direct victim. Zoey: I think I like Tanya's philosophical distinction better. How much a person can be punished should be the effect that follows the philosophical difference in the nature of the crime. Natalie: There is also infraction, which does not have any imprisonment. Felony and misdemeanor both can have jail sentences. They differ in seriousness. Tanya: I see. Tanya: I would say in Hospitalianism, felonies are crime that involve willful intrusion. By reciprocation, and self-defense/castle doctrine, a willful intruder can be reciprocated by imprisonment or death because the victim has no responsibility to ensure that the offender will not commit the crime again. Tanya: A misdemeanor is the offender breaking a demeanor rule (a code of conduct) of an opt-in zone. A misdemeanor warrants revoking one's membership of the zone, and being expelled from the zone. For example, a hate crime in a zero-hate zone is a misdemeanor. Tanya: When the offender's membership is revoked, if they still try to get in they become an intruder. That is a felony. Tanya: An infraction would be a crime that does not warrant revoking one's membership or imprisonment. Natalie: The page is coming along quite nicely! 😃 @Paladin is now Rank A.
📰 Multicolumn Style
💡3 Natalie: I wasn't satisfied with the alphabetical categories at the Criminal Laws node so I looked up and found how to wrap text by columns. I am experimenting with it and I think the code will need to check the screen width to determine how many columns to split. If this works well I think it will be easier than using flex.
Tanya: This is a great find. Natalie: I am debating whether there should be alphabet headings. I think it looks a little odd without. Ledia: This change is much needed I think. Nice upgrade indeed. Zoey: I think the alphabetical list at Philosophies should be like this. Natalie: I think the list at philosophies look better at the moment. That's why I am debating whether this list should have alphabetical headings. But if I add them, I can't guarantee that the heading and its first entry won't be on separate columns. That would also look strange. Natalie: Hey, I figured out how to indent! Natalie: Experimenting with different styles for the letter mark. Fina: I would nominate @Paladin for Rank S for the search function and the three column display. Even if it is not completely finished. Natalie: Thanks! 😃 @Paladin is recognized as Rank S. StarTree: (Added BEST tag to script maker!) Vivi: StarTree please fix the multicolumn format for phone. StarTree: StarTree will call that class mbMC3! StarTree: The class mbMC3 does not include the indentation! Vivi: And please link to this from the Test Node. StarTree: Done! StarTree: (Upgrades Criminal Law node to the latest style. Upgraded the section Affirmative Defense to the latest style.)
Natalie thanks all for playing and for the upgrade!

Monthly Chapter Ranking
2023 FEB 25 SAT 5:08 PM
Magic Bakery Home Channel
🔔
Is the monthly chapter ranking a commitment or a statistics?
Tanya: All chapters have reached Rank A at the moment, but earlier in the month, I made a note to confirm whether that monthly ranking represents a commitment or is it merely a diagnostic.
LRRH: I think there is a commitment for each chapter to reach Rank A per month, while reaching Rank S is optional. LRRH: The requirement to rank up to rank A is quite mechanical. There should be no shortage of quests to do for them. LRRH: And anyone can rank it up. It doesn't need to be the main person looking after the chapter. Tanya: I think this explanation needs to have its own node or be part of 202210122112|Scoring Rules. LRRH: I think I'll put it in 202211161002|Chapter Scoring with place level. LRRH: I clarified that there is no rule that a chapter needs to be at least Rank A by the end of each month. It is the result of individual member(s) who decide to make that happen. Tanya: I consider my question answered.
📌Tanya: Next I notice the little box at the guild that has quest notes.
LRRH: It is cute isn't it? Tanya: That box should be empty because paper notes should be entered to Guild Log instead. LRRH: Yes. But no one really checks the guild log. But people want to clear the box of physical paper notes. Tanya: Let's have a better process for dealing with them. Ledia: I think we have a 202206231035|process. The first step is to enter them to Guild Log so that they can be sorted and completed by batch. Tanya: I agree with that process. LRRH: But the fact is that once they are entered in the Guild Log, they become forgotten. The Guild Log tasks grew by about 100 in January. This month we have the paper box and it is stable. Tanya: I see. Tanya: I think we should sort and triage the paper notes, instead of having them all be in the same box. Tanya: I grouped them into seven groups. I cleared one of them. Now six remaining. Tanya: Finished another group. Five groups remaining. Tanya: The remaining groups are: Music, Wish (Japanese), Board, Mira, Seed (JQ Quest) Zoey: Could we just let them build until next month? then we can jump start next month. Tanya: What do you mean by jump start? Zoey: The ones we left on paper are normally current and not too hard to complete. When March starts and the ranking is reset, it is easy to start with those. Tanya: I see. Then I will just clear the ones I can clear: The Japanese ones. Ivy: Earlier I made a macro <ll> for the translation, but on second thought I think all macro should be called "macro" and be distinguished by the value of cmd in the JSON string. Tanya: @StarTree could you make that change before I add to the archive? StarTree: (Modified Archive, MMInner, MacroLL) Done! Tanya: How should I log credits if I translated a line that Black put on paper? Ivy: Please use the Guild Log. Tanya: Understood. Tanya: Added "Divide and conquer". StarTree: (Made LL node displayable by itself)! Tanya: StarTree please add french to the script. StarTree: Done! Tanya: StarTree, the description and the English are often the same. Could you make English the default description? StarTree: Done! (And added DEBUG function)

Black: I was wondering if we should add things we want to say in Japanese that matches the lessons in the textbook. Black: For example, page 12 is teaching そう and page 14 is teaching ~ておく. But I couldn't think of a sentance at the moment. Tanya: I think we can treat them as a hit list. It is a list of terms in the style of Natalie's multicolumn style. It shows all grammar terms and whether we have an example for it. Black: I think that would be helpful. Tanya: Made 202302252025|Grammar Study List node. (Updated Query no record messaage.) 202207212155|Japanese Club

 📕 Grammar List 📋
Grammar Study List
Language Learning
Quest:
Recognize grammar usage applicable to what you would say or want to say in in real life situations.
{"cmd":"Wide","display":"flex"} {"cmd":"Wide","flex":"auto","marginRight":"10px"}
📕
JFBP3📕[0/17]
あ
あげる2🔍🟢 🟢あげる
🟢N4 📕29 🌐485 💚33

ageru

あげる teageru give

To express acting as a favor

verb (て form) + あげる

To express giving

noun + を + あげる 🔍
ex: A gives B a book. A は B に 本をあげる。

To express giving from above

さしあげる sashiageru sashiagemasu noun + を + さしあげます 🔍
ex: A gave Boss a book. A は Boss に 本をさしあげました。
Examples
い
いただける1🔍🟢 🟢いただける
🟢N4 🧡 🌐497

itadakeru (ichidan intransitive verb)

ていただけませんか teitadakemasenka

To ask for a favor

verb (て form) + いただけませんか 🔍
Examples
いただく1🔍🔵 🔵いただく
🔵N5? 🧡

itadaku (godan transitive verb)

いただきます itadakimasu いただきました itadakimashita

To express something given from above

noun + を + いただきます 🔍
ex: A received something from Boss. A は Boss に something をいただきました。
Examples
く
ください1🔍🔵 🔵ください
🔵N5 🌐384

kudasai

をくださいます wokudasaimasu

To express a favor received from above

noun + を + くださいます 🔍
ex: Boss gave something to me. Boss は something をくださいました。
The receipient of the favor is usually the speaker.
Examples
くれる2🔍🟢 🟢くれる
🟢N4 📕29 🌐503

kureru

てくれる te kureru tekureru くれます kuremasu くれない kurenai くれた kureta くれました kuremashita give me

To ask for a favor

verb (て form) + くれる？ 🔍

To express a favor received

noun + を + くれました 🔍
ex: A gave something to me. A は something をくれました。
The receipient of the favor is usually the speaker.
Examples
も
もらう2🔍🟢 🟢もらう
🟢N4 📕29 🌐507

morau

てもらう te morau temorau

To express a favor received

(Other than by the speaker)
noun + を + もらいました。 🔍
ex: A gave B something. B は A に something をもらいました。

To express requesting a favor

verb (て form) + もらう 🔍
ex: A gave something to me. A は something をくれました。
Examples
ん
んがために3🔍🔴 🔴んがために
🔴N1 📕49 🌐87

ngatameni

んがために n ga tame ni

To express a purpose

verb(nai form) + んがため（に） 🔍
verb(nai form) + んがための + Noun 🔍

Exception

しない -> せんがため 🔍
Examples
お
おかげで1🔍🟡 🟡おかげで
🟡N3 📕49 🌐393

okage de

のおかげで nookagede

To Express a Thankful Cause

verb + おかげで
noun + のおかげで
Examples
おく1🔍🟢 🟢おく
🟢N4 📕14 🌐509
ておく / ておいて / ておきます

te oku / te okimasu / te oite / doku

ておく teoku ておいて teoite ておきます teokimasu どく doku どいて doite

To Express Preparation

verb (te-form) + おく

To Express Preparation (Conversational)

verb (te-form without the te) + どく
Ex: マニュアルをよく読んどいて。
Examples
せ
せいで1🔍🟡 🟡せいで
🟡N3 📕49 🌐418

sei de

のせいで noseide

To Express a Negative Reason

verb + せいで
noun + のせいで
Examples
そ
そうだ6🔍🟢 🟢そうだ
🟢N4 📕12 🌐443 🌐444

sou da

だそうだ dasouda da sou da だそうです dasoudesu da sou desu

To Express Hearsay

verb (casual form) + そうだ 🔍
ex: I heard that flowers will bloom. 花が咲くそうです。
noun + だ + そうだ
な-adjective + だ + そうだ 🔍
い-adjective + そうだ 🔍

To Express Seemingness

verb ます (stem form) そう 🔍
ex: It seems flowers are about to bloom. 花が咲きそう。📕41
な-adjective + そう 🔍
い-adjective + い + そう 🔍
Examples
そうに3🔍🟢 🟢そうに
🟢N4 📕40 🌐447

sou ni

そうに souni そうな sou na souna

To Describe the manner of an action

verb ます (stem form) + そうに 🔍
な-adjective + だ + そうに 🔍
い-adjective + い + そうに 🔍
Examples
す
する7🔍🟢 🟢 する
🟢N4 📕6 🌐82

suru

Usage 1

To express something perceived through the senses:
I hear *noun* => *noun* がする 🔍
I taste *noun* => *noun* がする 🔍
I smell *noun* => *noun* がする 🔍

Usage 2

To express passage of time:
After *time* => *time* してから 🔍

Usage 3

To express clothing that is being worn:
I am wearing *clothing item* => *clothing item* しています 🔍

Usage 4

To express one's occupation:
I am a *occupation* => *occupation* をしています 🔍

Usage 5

To express a cost:
It cost *price* => *price* しました 🔍
た
ため1🔍🟡 🟡ため
🟡N3 📕49 📕90 🌐433 🌐471

sono tame ni

そのために sonotameni

To Express Reason

noun + のため or noun + のために

To Express Purpose

Examples

Tanya: We also need to identify where the posters should lead to. Sasha: I want to lead them to our Youtube Arcacian playlist, because I want to know how youtube views affect Google hits. I know it is not entirely scientific since we don't know if someone viewed the playlist by clicking on the link of the poster/card. Evelyn: I think another destination would be the Arcacian Quest Awards node. I think it would help people see what policies follow the Arcacian principle. Tanya: Let's list the destinations. Evelyn: I think I am helping to demonstrate how to gamify tasks. ... 202207112218|Promotion Quest

 202302261915|📯 Poster Quest {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202302261915","music":""}
Poster Quest
Quest
Make posters and other promotional things to promote arcacianism.
"Let people help each other and reward those who do."
This node is for designing and distributing posters for promoting Arcacianism. This is the art subquest of the Arcacian quest.
🎠 Destinations
🎠 Destinations
These are locations where we want the poster viewer to go after seeing our poster. Sasha: A good destination should offer something so a visitor would want to come again.
⭐ Free Icons
This is for making cute icons and other visuals for use in webpage.
🥧 Whose turn to pay
This is an app that helps friends take turn paying things.
🏅 Arcacian Award
This lists organizations that conincides with the Arcacian principle.
🎨 Manga
Especially the chapters about Arcacianism. Need a new chapter list that is a node.
🦄 Character Creation
This is for custom character design.
🥕 Carrot Cake
This is the main training page for Arcacian principle.
🥠 Fortune Cookie
This is just for getting people interested, or we could add Arcacian fortunes on the list.
💟 Happiness Clinic
I think this is important if it has more content.
🍱 Japanese Club
This could help others studying Japanese.
🎧 Arcacianism Playlist
This is a Youtube playlist with original music from Magic Bakery. Sasha: When they visit the link on the poster, the channel gets a view and it might help make "Arcacianism" more searchable on Google.
⚖️ Is this Arcacian?
This is a list of policies that coincide with the Arcacian Principle.
🏛️ Arcacianism
This is the philosophy node that an interested visitor would reach.
💡 Posting Ideas
💡 Posting Ideas
This is a brainstorming section for ideas on what to post. 📌 Add previous postings to each type.
Drawing
3B: There is an unfinished drawing of Red and Arcacia. I should finish that.
Yonkoma
3B: Gaia and Gaia Credits series. Yonkoma style.
Sneaky Cards
Sneaky Card style cards with tracking page.
Bookmark
Free bookmark, to be left for others to take.
Custom Form
Custom character drawing request form.
Slang Drawings
Anime style drawings to go with the Japanese Slangs posting on the board.
Ema Board
Ema board drawings. Perhaps also with a link to our make a wish form.
Fan Art
These are drawings of anime characters or mascot of the dropoff location.
Fortune Cookie
A funny fortune with a link to more.
Quiz/Puzzle
With the answer in the link.
Surveys
Help people share local interests.
Character Sheets
It doesn't really matter what we post as long as there is a link. 3B: Gaia and Gaia Credits series. Yonkoma style.
🎁 Dropoff Locations
🎁 Dropoff Locations
This section has ideas of where to post promotional material such as posters and cards.
Twitter
Posting at Twitter wouldn't require the QR code.
Japanese Store
There is a Japanese store with a free bulletin board. Opening hours: 11am to 9pm.
🖼️ Wallpaper
🖼️ Wallpaper
These are supposed to be posters but are not complete.

Place Level
[202302280858]
Pin Board
◀ 2023 FEB 28 TUE 8:58 AM
Magic Bakery
⭐
It is the end of the month, let's update the Pinned section.
LRRH: The pinned section is supposed to summarize significant activity during the month. For the icon on the left, I think it is better to standarize the meaning, such as ✅ means Rank A and 👑 means Rank S. LRRH: Right now there are special icons on the left. 💬 Discussions
Self-Evaluation
[202303051902]
Self-Evaluation A2
◀ 2023 MAR 05 SUN 7:02 PM
Whale Nursery
📯
This is a series of monthly self-evaluation discussions. The plan is to create a rubric for each evaluation topic.
📋 [A2] Instruction for others
📌Black: This part is about how well we inform others what to do with what we make. What would be an A rank for this objective?
Tanya: Bad or no instruction would cause error or questions. So I think in this case we should measure the number of questions we got that we could have answered with better instruction. Sasha: What if the next quester simply doesn't read it? Tanya: Rank A means 88% of our quests do not result in the questers asking for information that could have been reasonably provided. Zoey: I feel like we are starting to sound like lawyers. Tanya: It is inevitable. Black: With that I think we have the mechanism to track because we track such failures. Black: And since the 5 point scale is defined, I don't think I need to repeat it here. Black: Since that was quick, why don't we do the one for next month also?
📋 [A3] Internal Documentation
📌Black: A2 was for other teams. A3 is documentation for ourselves. How well have we been informing our future selves what we did?
Tanya: We need to know a lot more from ourselves than others need to know from us. I would say we are improving within a tradeoff between getting things done and making sure in the future we know what we did. Tanya: I think we can use the same mechanism in the Field Log to track internal documentation failures. Which would be moments when we need some information that is unavailable, and we think, "We should have explained it somewhere, but it is missing. Now I need to do the research again." Zoey: Are we still talking about having questions about a past quest? Or about any related topic in general including field support? Tanya: Let's start with questions on quests that we did. Black: I see that the same scale applies. The next one is quite different, so let's discuss that another time.
Black thanks all for their contributions. @Whale is now Rank D.
Quest Board
[202303052028]
GitHub Migration
2023 MAR 05 SUN 8:28 PM
Quest Board
🔔
Not to alarm anyone, but we should start (slowly) discuss migrating the website to github.
Zoey: Uh-oh, it is the end of the world. XD
Ivy: The main reason for the migration is to use database, and to better manage style sheets. Until that happens, the github site is a sandbox for testing. Tanya: It is too white. Ivy: I'm sorry it is not formatted yet. Tanya: @StarTree could you please change the background? StarTree: StarTree updated the html but doesn't know how to release it! StarTree: It is released now! Wee~~! Tanya: Does this mean we can use the whole screen this time. Ivy: Yes. But this is experiemental phase. So please treat it as a sandbox. (Don't add content there that is not already/also in the blog.) Tanya: Understood. Ivy: Status, goals, and know-how will be in the blog at the moment. Ivy: StarTree please make a node with the todo/checklist. StarTree: Roger! Zoey: Eventhough you say it is not something to be alarmed, the fact that the website will migrate to github makes formatting upgrades here moot, won't it? Ivy: It might not be entirely moot, I think it is better if you do continue upgrade the format so that the GitHub site would start with a stable and good layout. Zoey: I'm not entirely convinced. Tanya: Or, since github IS a test site, we could use it to test new layout while we build it up. Since it has no content we don't have to worry about interrupting normal posting. Ivy: Ideally when data and presentation are separate, you can still do that while the site is running. Zoey: What I meant was, suppose I have time to work on the website. Why would I want to work on the old one when I can work on the new one? Ivy: There is no reason to or not to. It is a matter of preference and understanding. I think the quester may choose to work on the old one or the new one. They will both worth credits until we decide to switch to the new one. Then we stop updating the old one to prevent continual maintenance on both sites. StarTree: StarTree added 13 items for the 202303052122|migration node! They don't include what to test at github! Ivy: I think the most important test is setting up a database and confirm that the github page can read and write to it. Vivi: I still want every node to be reachable from the home node. Ivy: My plan for the new structure is that each node structure will only have data about the node itself, not the relation it has with other nodes. The relations are store separately as another data object. When a node is displayed, the Viewer decides what to display depending on what is already displayed on the screen. Ivy: By doing this, the user can rearrange the content on the screen without worrying that sections would be duplicated. Tanya: Do you mean there will be a gird view where I could assign what to display in each box? Ivy: Yes. That is the plan because unlike a normal website, we use our website like a development environment. Ledia: Do you mean an actual game hud with mini maps and menus? Ivy: Yes if we get to there. Tanya: StarTree please add the suggester also. StarTree: Done! Ivy thanks all for their patience. @Board is now Rank A.

Questions

📌
How to query JSON objects
📌
WHERE clause
Q: How to use MongoDB with GitHub page

20230423

Using MongoDB with GitHub requires workarounds because GitHub pages are static web pages and do not support server-side scripting or database connections.
Method 1: Use third-party service (ex. MongoDB Atlas) that provides a MongoDB database and an API to access it from your GitHub page. Then use JavaScript or other client-side languages to fetch data from MongoDB Atlas and display it on your GitHub page.
Method 2 (Alternative): Use a different type of data storage (such as a JSON file, a Google Drive document, or an SQLite file) that does not require a server or a database connection. GitHub page can query them using JavaScript from repository.
Log
20230627: Added CSS to GitHub, but couldn't get Blogger to reference the same style sheet.

202210080934|Vacation Island

 202303092035|🥘 Food Club {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202303092035","music":"CookingWithArcacia"}
Food Club
Magic Bakery
This club is about food and nutrition. What is your favorite food or drink?
🗃️ Recipes
🍜 Evelyn's Udon

Ingredients

Udon, Avocado, Soy Sauce

Directions

Step 1 Boil water and make udon.
Step 2 Serve with sliced avocado and Soy Sauce.
🍚 P4's Porridge

Ingredients

Rice, Water, Sesame Oil, Nuts, Green Onion, White Pepper

Directions

Step 1 Put rice, water, and some sesame oil into rice cooker and cook it as porridge.
Step 2 Serve with nuts, chopped green onion and white pepper.
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.govoutreach.gorequest","desc":"🍣 Vegan Sushi"}
{"cmd":"QueryAllPSNi","node":"202303092159","desc":"👑 Favorite Snacks"} {"cmd":"QueryAllPSNi","node":"202303191144","desc":"🛒 Grocery List"}
💬 Discussions
{"title":"Food Club","subtitle":"Good eats","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2018/04/13/17/14/vegetable-skewer-3317060_960_720.jpg"}
Help Desk
[202303092116]
Post Maker
2023 MAR 09 THU 9:16 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
It is a huge pain to add a node. Can we do something about it?
Zoey: All of the templates at the script maker are outdated for posting nodes, can we update it or is there another plan? Ivy: The direction should be toward putting most information in the <node>. Then the javascript reads that data and presents it. Ivy: What we do in the meantime to get there, or while getting there is up to you. You may update the script maker if you want. Ledia: I think this is sort of an emergency if we can't make new nodes. Evelyn: I am only comfortable making a mini diary node at the moment. 😅 Ivy: The mini diary node is almost what the code "should be" except the tag inside should be <node> instead of <macro>. Zoey: The mini diary node is very limited in what it can do though, it is just one line in English or Japanese. Ivy: I am not recommending it, but you can actually put div in the content. But you would need to change all the quotation marks and tags. Ivy: From the mini diary node, you could expand its functionality by upgrading the code to interpret more fields. But the first step is to change it from a macro to a node. LRRH: I think we first need a new script maker while we create the node interpreter. Zoey: But how would that help? You can't actually code what happens inside a node. That means you need another editor to compress the code into JSON format for the node. You would need both the compressor and the presenter. Ivy: The point is the viewer/presenter/interpreter would need to query and interpret the relations and display the complete content. Ivy: For example, when you make a 202303092035|Food Club node in the intended way, the "Favorite Snacks" section should be its own node, and each snack should be its own node. The relations between them are: "Food Club" has a section "Favorite Snacks"; "Favorite Snacks" has a ranked list of snack items; and each of the Snack nodes are snacks. Ledia: I am convinced this is better, but in the meantime we still need to be able to make nodes easily. LRRH: @StarTree could you first make a post maker script with the test node format? StarTree: Roger! (Upgrading scrip maker. Testing. Transferring content from Food Club to Snacks node. Activating @vacation banner) StarTree: Done! @Vacation is now Rank A. Evelyn: I am glad to have StarTree in the guild. 😊 StarTree: Wee~~!

To whom it may concerns, the Jelly Queen Quest continues. Cardinal: 109 remains in Region 1. 55 in Region 2.

Zoey: I think that would just be frustrating if they don't know what they are clicking on. Right now the performance of the website is not that bad that we want to sacrifice clarity for performance. Car Maintenance
[202303152317]
Guild car is down
◀ 2023 MAR 15 WED 11:17PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
As you may know, the guild car did not pass smog test. During repair more issues were found at the engine. LRRH: The cost to repair is comparable to buying another car. So we might not repair it. LRRH: So, what should the guild do? Repair? Get another car? Or be car free?
Tanya: What are the due dates? StarTree: Last day to get the second smog test is probably March 20 Monday. Registration is first due on April 22, but past due only requires a fee of up to $70. Last day to decide Planned Nonoperation is July 21.
💡Tanya: I think we should get the car back and try for the second smog test if the engine light is not on. Ivy: The engine light was still on after oil change when I got the car last weekend. The engine was not performing way worse compared to before bring it in for oil change. I assumed they were in in the middle of fixing it and perhaps not everything is tunned back. Black: If it passes smog test then what? Tanya: Then we keep it for emergency while looking for another car or switch to no car. StarTree: According to Google most places of interest can be reached by bicycle witin 15 minutes! Black: I think in reality that is more like 20 minutes. Casey: Why would you need to keep a car for emergency? Wouldn't you just call a taxi? Evelyn: I think we know enough people who would give a ride. But I think if the repair cost is just comparable to getting another car, we should repair. Otherwise, what would happen to the car? Tanya: The guild car doesn't have AC. I don't think the cost of repairing includes fixing the AC. Ivy: I think Tanya is right. The cost is not really comparable. Evelyn: I think it has been manageable without AC. Amelia: Even with the fixes, this car will probably need more costly repairs sooner than a newer model. StarTree: The car is from 2009! Gaia: I also think it is not worth repairing. Ledia: It might be a good time to switch to an electric car. Ivy: The range can only barely reach our longest usual route. Ledia: But it can reach. You can probably find recharging station also. Ivy: It can reach on paper. We don't know what happens in reality. LRRH: So far it seems that we agree on not fixing the car. Tanya said we should get the car and see how it is now. That means tomorrow we will ask the shop to put things back. We will get the car back tomorrow or Friday. Little Red Riding Hood thanks all for ideas.

Criminal Laws
[202303162257]
Law Game Part 7
◀ 2023 MAR 16 THU 10:57PM
Paladin Hall
⭐
The Law Game continues. Natalie: Please be aware that the content may not be appropriate for children. Natalie: Please note that we play this game from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions.
🏛️ [5] Bill of Attainder
🏛️Natalie: What is a "bill of attainder"?
Sasha: Finally a normal post. Thank you! Sasha: And I have no clue what bill of attainder is. Natalie: It is a type of law that mandates a punishment or denies a privilege without a judicial trial. It is a kind of law that is prohibited by the Constitution. Sasha: No wonder I've never heard of it. Next please.
[6] Ex post facto law
Natalie: What is an "ex post facto law"?
Sasha: Is it a retroactive law? Natalie: That is right! And it includes: Making an act criminal that was not criminal when it took place; "Aggravate" a crime or make its punishment more severe; Change the rules of evidence against criminal defendants, as a class; or Change criminal procedure to deprive criminal defendants of any substantive right. These types of laws are also prohibited by the Constitution. Sasha: I think Arcacian laws are retroactive. If so this is a major difference. Ledia: Paladin laws are retroactive. You are not supposed to do something that is reasonable known to be bad just because there is no law prohibiting it, or when it was legal at the time it was committed. It is done so that people cannot use the text of the law to game the system. Sasha: I think we need an example to demonstract the difference. Ledia: A constitution that prohibits ex post facto law would allow Lawful Evil to use legal loopholes to harm others. Sasha: This is an Arena type conflict and S-Rank worthy. How should we mark this for revisit? Natalie: I added the sword symbol. Sasha: Good for now, I think. And @Arena needs a quest to deal with these differences... Which I added. @Paladin is now Rank
Natalie thanks all for playing!
Issues: 8 | Quests: 1245

Failure Analysis
[202303181311]
2303 Failure Analysis
◀ 2023 MAR 18 SAT 1:11PM
Quest Channel
⭐
This is a routine monthly failure analysis for Cardinal Quest.
Tanya: @StarTree, please first make Failure Analysis its own node. StarTree: There is a failure analysis 202207151000|node from @Whale. Do you want this to be different? Tanya: @Black, any comments? Your node is blank. Black: Let's merge them. Thank you for following up. StarTree: (Upgrading node. Merging content from Cardinal Quest. Linked to Chardinal Quest.) Tanya: StarTree please tally the unanalyzed failures and the total count. StarTree: It is 92 / 294! Tanya: Let's do it.
Tanya: Identified another solution type: CAL, which is a solution of puting routine tasks on a rotating calendar so it is not forgotten. Tanya: Also added MST master template as a solution type. Tanya: Added a higher priority 1 of just marking the counter measure code so that counter measures can be processed in batch for the same solution type. Tanya: Processing counter measures. Evelyn: Processed counter measures Black: Processed counter measures Tanya: I think it is enough for this round. But it seems we need more than one round to process the entries per month. Evelyn: I think we should at least finish the CAL type solutions. Done. Tanya: StarTree please update the count. StarTree: The count was 25. It will be updated to 64. Tanya: Yes that is fine. We would be able to process them during down time. Evelyn: I'll add that as a CAL task also. With a daily rotation. Tanya: Good idea. A-Rank Quest Failure Analysis is completed for this month. Black: I suggest we don't update the failure count now and wait for the other stats to be updated all at once. Tanya: Okay. Tanya thanks all for their contributions.
Car Maintenance
[202303181628]
Guild Car Day 2
◀ 2023 MAR 18 SAT 4:28PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
Decisions remain to be made about the Guild Car. LRRH: I think there are different threads for the discussion, so please start a section for each topic, in NCIS style.
🚨 Status
LRRH: We got an OBD2 scanner and got some codes. But the questions remain: What are doing with the car? What can we do? What else are we or should we be doing?
Evelyn: There is a section in the inventory Google Sheets for taking notes. I think maybe the content can be organized in CHK style so that if another car breaks down we can follow the same cource for decision making. Tanya: I think we will need that for comparing options also.
🚇 Timetables
StarTree: StarTree got timetables of trains to reach the farest regular destination. The schedule is the same each hour with the weekend schedule missing some early morning times.

Southbound

First: North Train: 6:10am. South Train: 🟥 7:32am. ETA: 8:41am.
Last 1: North Train: 5:10pm. South Train: 🟥 6:32pm. ETA: 7:41pm.
Last 2: North Train: 9:10pm. South Train: 🟧 10:50pm. 🟨 11:12pm. ETA: 12:05am.

Northbound

First: South Train: 🟥 6:10am. North Train: 7:32am. ETA 8:46am.
Last 1: South Train: 🟥 7:03pm. North Train: 8:32am. ETA 9:44pm.
Last 2: South Train: 🟥 7:39pm. North Train: 9:32am. ETA 10:48pm.
Last 3: South Train: 🟨 7:59pm. 🟧 8:44pm. North Train: 9:32am. ETA 10:48pm.
StarTree: The ETAs do not include the time getting to the station! Casey: If you include the time to and from the train station, the trip is at least 3 hours each way. LRRH: Is that fine or not? Ivy: It would be a pretty boring three hours, since you can't sleep as you need to know when to get off the train, and the train is moving so you could get sick watching or reading anything. Ledia: I think we've found the pro-car camp. LRRH: Is it fine if somehow it is not boring? Are there other concerns? Ivy: 1) Sanitation. 2) Luggage. You are much more limited to what you can bring if you are moving the luggage by yourself and you have to transfer from one train to another. If you travel alone you have a problem leaving the luggage to say use the restroom. Ledia: This is quite compelling if you normally need to bring a lot of stuff. Is that true? Do you actually need to bring a lot of stuff?
🧳 Luggage
Casey: Backpacks are the most convenient because you can easily go up and down stairs and it is with you wherever you go. What exactly do you need to bring that won't fit in a backpack?
Sasha: Board games. How many board games can you fit in your backpack? They are pretty boxy. Casey: Five. Including other stuff. That's more than what you can play in a weekend. Sasha: There is no way I would want to carry that. They fit but it will still be heavy. And what if your strap breaks? Casey: Bags don't just break. They get worn out and then break. Sasha: And I don't think that that bag is designed to be carried on the back. You are going to get weird back pains. Evelyn: I have that concern also. I don't one person needs to carry all of them. Casey: It is not like you are hiking with it. You are just carrying it from one platform to another when you change train. Ivy: Um. No. If there is no car at all, you will be carrying it while riding a bicycle to the train station. That is about 20 to 30 minutes. Sasha: Yes. That. Black: I have another backpack that can comfortably fit two board games, plus other belongs for the weekend. Sasha: That is nice to know but I think we are on the wrong track. Instead of investigating the limits without a car, we should just look for a replacement car. Evelyn: I thought the point was, the guild doesn't seem to need a car except for that trip. Isn't getting a car just for that wasteful? Sasha: I don't believe that you need the car just for that. I think there are some other uses that you have forgotten. Tanya: @StarTree, what else is the car used for? StarTree: The car is used for grocery shopping mainly! About once per week! Tanya: What about other places? StarTree: StarTree can only see receipts. StarTree doesn't know where the car went when there is no receipts! Tanya: But even among the receipts there is nowhere else? StarTree: There is no other function! Tanya: I think that makes a strong case not to have a car. Sasha: What if the car is cheap or affordable? Then you can go to places without worrying about the timetables, you can help people who needs a ride. You can haul big things. Tanya: I think the point is that the car hasn't been used for such purposes. So there is no evidence that the guild would start using the car in those ways just to justify having a car. The monthly trip is apparently the main and only difference. LRRH: FYI grocery shopping isn't really a concern because the only thing we really need is a bag of apples. Snacks are already piling up to the ceiling. We have been getting more snacks than we eat them. Ledia: What about the weather? It will rain, it will be hot. LRRH: I think rain is not a problem because it seldoms keep on raining. The heat might be. Casey: The longest bike trip is just 15 minutes. That is to the manga shop. Casey: But I think the guild should get another bicycle that has a rack for cargos, and stronger tires for asphalt. Sasha: I just don't think the guild needs to save such money. If someone gets hit by a car or got hurt carrying things that is going to be a lot more costy than say $30K of getting a car. To me that is a no-brainer. You need a car and with AC. Evelyn: The guild car already doesn't have AC. Sasha: But it at least has a roof! Direct sunlight will burn through your skin! It will be miserable! Sasha: Let's give a more serious thought of getting a car...
🚗 Replacement Car
Sasha: I think it is safer, more convenient, more comfortable, and more flexible by keeping a car. Having a car will save time because you won't need to plan as much and worry about what to bring. So let first just calculate how much keeping a car cost.
$32K car for 10 years: That is $270 a month.
$16K car for 10 years: $135 per month.
Sasha: Having a car is safer than riding a bicycle on the road. Don't you think it is worth spending $300 for someone's safety? Casey: Outside downtown the paths are dedicated bikepaths. I mean, it is pretty safe. Sasha: And what about downtown? Casey: We are talking about 3 or 4 blocks where cars go pretty slow. Evelyn: I think... having a car is not safer overall because the long monthly trip is the most dangerous thing each month. 😖 Ledia: Very compelling. Zoey: Since having a car is not safer, we can talk about the saving by not having a car. $300+ per month saving. XD Ledia: And the environment. Sasha: You could get an electric car. Zoey: It still makes an impact from making a car. XD Sasha: Not if it is pre-owned. Zoey: True, but someone else who needs a car could have gotten that one. Sasha: Can you stand the world with one fewer mini? Zoey: Of course. What kind of question is that? XD Sasha: Well, Ivy doesn't drive anything but a Mini. No way she starts riding a bicycle. Ivy: ... Ivy: I feel I failed in maintaining this one. I'll wait until we need an electric with long range. Ledia: It seems that the pro-car camp is down to one--Sasha. Sasha: Really? Evelyn: I would still consider fixing the car, but I am not sure how long the car would last after fixing. Ivy: With all due respect that option makes the least sense. For the same cost you could get a newer and fewer millege Mini. Evelyn: I thought it is still cheaper to fix it by a few thousand dollars. Ivy: Not if you account for the highly probably shorting remaining life of the car. Ledia: It doesn't occur to me that Evelyn would be a pro pollution person. What is going on? Evelyn: I am not pro pollution. Ivy: Even if the car passes smog test, it is still burning gas and polluting. For the guild the car is the most polluting thing. Evelyn: I'm sorry. I never thought of that, I just thought it is hurt and should be healed. 😖 Ivy: The general order is manual transmission is less polluting than automatic. There was no electric option back then. Evelyn: Okay. Ledia: There was no electric option for a Mini, that is. Ivy: ... Right. Zoey: I didn't know that it ran so deep. XD Ivy: It wasn't my car in the beginning. Ledia: Not that it would make a difference. Ivy: ... Right. Sasha: Okay. So how does this work: If you are going to get an electric Mini, why not now? What is the point of waiting? Ivy: The range is a little too short. If we take a wrong turn or there is a detour, it could run out of battery. Ledia: I don't think so. I think the range is based on Sport mode. There is a green or green+ mode. Ivy: No. I think Sport mode range is about one half. Ledia: Really. A legit deal breaker then. Zoey: Unless you are gambling not to charge, you could have drove to a charging station along the way before it gets too low. You need to be gambling if the car actually runs out of battery. LRRH: If the range is not an issue, are there other issues? Casey: Our bike rack doesn't work with the electric mini. You would need a roof rack.
Issues: 11 | Quests: 1259

What instrument is this?
This quest collects examples of different instruments that could help us make music.

202303092035|Food Club

 202303191144|🛒 Grocery List {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202303191144","music":""}
Grocery List
Get this, not that
Notes on what to and what not to get.
{"cmd":"MC3"}
