202209212113|Democracy

 202303191434|🍱 Democracy Matrix {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202303191434","music":""}
Democracy Matrix
Philosophy Survey
This node studies specifically the Democracy Matrix by Universität Würzburg. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.democracymatrix.com/","desc":"[link]"}
3 Dimensions: Freedom, Equality, Control

Political Freedom

Can people freely choose to participate in politics?

Political Equality

Does the resulting political system treats people equally?

Political Control

Is there a legal and efficient framework for the government?
5 Institutions

Election

How do representatives get elected?

Parties

How are political interest groups regulated?

Communication

How can people communicate? How is the media?

Judicial

How is the rule of law in protecting civil rights?

Operation

How is the structure of the government and separation of powers?
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202303191434","parentid":"202209212113","parentname":"Democracy","icon":"🍱","title":"Democracy Matrix","subtitle":"Philosophy Survey","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/03/27/22/38/cake-1284548_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Zoey","description":"This node studies specifically the Democracy Matrix by Universität Würzburg.","card-text":""}
Car Maintenance
[202303191600]
Guild Car Day 3
◀ 2023 MAR 19 SUN 4:00PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
Discussion topics about the guild car continues.
🗃️ Filing for Non-use.
StarTree: There is a form called Affidavit of Non-use, but that is not applicable because the guild car registration renewal is within 75 days of expiration. So the form to file is Planned Non-Operation. To be filed on or before April 22.
LRRH: I think we should wait and file it after we decide what to do. So that would be about one week before it expires. StarTree: April 14!
🍀 Car Donation
StarTree: StarTree also found a local non-profit for donating cars, and added info to the inventory calednar. The car can have expired registration when it is donated.
StarTree: Added info to the calendar. StarTree: StarTree also found another repair shop if that is still relevant. Tanya: What is the current course of action? LRRH: I think it is to have no guild car until getting an electric mini. Sasha: So you will go into summer without a car. And when you regret it it would be late because you won't have a car to help you shop for a new car. Tanya: Should there be a trial while we still have a car to confirm if we can do without one? Sasha: How are you going to make it hot, wet, windy, and uncomfortable? Tanya: We can consider that, but we could also first confirm that when the weather is not hot, not wet, not windy and comfortable, there is no other issues. Sasha: And who should be on that trial? Tanya: I think either Kisa, V, or Casey. Sasha: It is pointless putting V on trial. She doesn't feel anything. Casey: I suppose I would go, since Kisa doesn't know how to fix the bicycle if it breaks. Sasha: Okay. Then ride to the train station carrying water weights and log the time to and back. Ride in normal / careful / non-tiring speed. Casey: If I shop on the way back, can I replace the water weight with what I buy? Sasha: Sure. I am not interested in when you actually return, just how long and how hard it is to do so in each segment. Casey: I understand. StarTree: You can use the guild question form to log when you start or stop! Casey: Good idea. Casey: Okay. Then I prepare and go.
🚲 Bicycle Trial
Casey: I made my backpack to be 20lb using water bottles. Then I rode to grocery store. The tire was flat so I rode back, changed tube, and rode to the restaurant and back. All the while it was overcast and sprinkling. StarTree: And here are the times according to the log!
Downtown (est.): 24 min StarTree: Compared to est. 15 minutes by car including parking.
Grocery Store: 12 min StarTree: Compared to est. 7 minutes by car including parking.
Restaurant: 7 min StarTree: Compared to est. 5 minutes by car including parking.
StarTree: Wee~! Tanya: How much more riding would there be in percentage? StarTree: About 40% more! Tanya: How often does a bicycle tire needs to be replaced so far? StarTree: A little less than once a month! Tanya: Each tube only lasts two months? Casey: More or less. Tanya: Aren't they supposed to last for years? Casey: Maybe our tyres are just not that good. The tube gets punctures. P4: What if you keep the punctured tube in the tire when you add a new one? Casey: I've never thought of that, and I was having a hard time finding a place that could recycle them. Casey: I'll stuff one in the rear wheel and see what happens.
Let's do this!

Car Maintenance
[202303212318]
Guild Car Day 4
◀ 2023 MAR 21 TUE 11:18PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
The guild car passed smog test.
🔮 OBD Reader
Black: We got an OBD reader that could reset the codes. Then we ran the car for the onboard tests to pass, and brought the car back for the retest. And it passed. This is to confirm that we do want to keep the car and proceed with renewing registration.
Zoey: What? XD Robert: One fewer thing to worry about. Amelia: Is the car mechanically safe to drive around? And go long distances? Black: The engine light is not on and it doesn't feel any different from before. Amelia: So the car didn't have real mechanical issues? Black: 🤷‍♂️ Black: I think we should get our own OBDII reader and regularly check. LRRH: I say Yes to renewing registration.
Good news make happy days.

👑 Top: 14 Black 13 StarTree 12 Helen 12 Arcacia 12 Evelyn 9 Kisaragi 9 3B 8 P4 7 Ivy 7 Sasha 5 Natalie 3 Casey 3 Zoey 3 Ledia 2 Robert 2 Amelia 2 Sylvia 2 LRRH 2 Tanya 1 Mikela 1 James 1 V
Is this Arcacian?
[202303222147]
AQ: Tuition
◀ 2023 MAR 22 WED 9:47PM
Freedom Plaza
📯
To affirm that his town is the best in the world, James the Mayor regularly compares against the policies of other towns. This time he compares the policies on tuition.
James: In Finland, it is illegal to charge tuition for basic education toward a formal qualification. Is such policy Arcacian? James: Reference: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-49825925","desc":"[link]"}
Tanya: The Arcacian Principle does not prohibit a teacher from charging students tuition. But a teacher who teaches for free would earn credits. Ivy: I think there is an interesting consideration: that even when education is free, people of different background may not afford the time to get the education. What policies would an Arcacian society have for equality in education? Tanya: I think equality in Arcacianism is based on Gaia credits. So it becomes more of a preference how much a family wants to be educated. Tanya: In other words, if you give a specific example of why a family can't afford to get an education, let's see if the causes can still happen in a society with Gaia credits. Ivy: Let's say you are a carpenter. For generations your family has been earning credits through carpentry. You are good at what you do. Your family carpentry skill is a family secret. Tanya: Arcacian law is that if anyone in that family start teaching other the secret so others could help themselves, then that family would earn a lot of credits and be protected by paladins from retribution by the family. Tanya: In Arcacianism it is illegal to prohibit a person from helping someone else. Forcing someone not to help by prohibiting them from divulging a trade secret is illegal. Tanya: So, without the law allowing the family to protect its secrets, anyone who wants to learn could learn. If they don't and prefer to get the product from the family instead of DIY, that is their preference. James: Then do you expect an Arcacian society to have similar low variance in science, math, and reading proficiency scores? Tanya: Yes. Because people in an Arcacian society have more free time to learn what they want. Therefore the vast majority of the population should meet basic proficiency. Zoey: Hold on. In an Arcacian society, you can't force people to go to school. Wouldn't you expect there to be more people who simply don't bother learning science, math or reading? Tanya: We are not talking about literature. But basic science, math, and reading comprehension. Zoey: Yes. And don't you think there would be many quests that only require a specific skill, and that can be none of the three. LRRH: You don't really need to know those subjects if you get credits from walking people's dogs. Evelyn: I also think the variance would be bigger in an Arcacian society. I think those who want credits would specialize a lot earlier. Tanya: I think in a DIY society people would naturally learn resource management and discussion skills. To understand and select quests they would gain a general understanding of math and science. Tanya: Quests that are too simple could run out. So those who are willing to learn more and do harder quests would have an advantage. And to learn more is to learn and apply science, math and reading. Ledia: I think that is how it would work. If you remove the factors that keep people from learning, people would normally learn out of curiosity or social esteem. The proficiency level is just the common denominator of learning. Sasha: I highly doubt that. You could be quite popular by just uploading video doing dumb things. You don't need to know science, especially. You only need to be familiar with technology. Ledia: I don't think you can get Arcacian credits just for being popular. You can get credits by teaching others how to do things that help themselves or others. Ledia: You could get a lot of credits teaching exercises if you are popular. But I would think the one who knows the science of exercises would be even more popular and get more credits. Zoey: What science? {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.elle.com.au/health-fitness/best-yoga-teachers-youtube-23506","desc":"[link]"} {"cmd":"url","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_most-subscribed_YouTube_channels","desc":"[link]"} XD Tanya: I don't think we are suggesting that entertainment channels won't be the most popular. We are saying that channels that would earn a lot of *credits* would be educational and helpful beyond just being entertaining. Ledia: There is a difference in the value structure. Zoey: But since Arcacian society does not prohibit trading, wouldn't you see a similar result? You are not going to stop companies from wanting to post advertisement, so you won't stop a media like Youtube using entertainment to draw people's attention to the occassion but profitable advertisement business. Tanya: It goes down to what *can*money buy in an Arcacian society. In a society that doesn't run on tax but credits, and you can't get credits unless you help people, the value structure is different. Evelyn: I think we need a better way to compare. Zoey: I don't think popular Youtubers do what they do because they need to find ways to pay tax. Everyone involved in those transactions are acting out of disposable income. That means the topic of tax is irrelevant. They are doing what they want to do without any external influence. Sasha: Exactly! Arcacian society won't change what people already want to do! So that part will be the same! Tanya: How do you think those people get the disposable income to begin with? I think you would agree that they aren't all youtubers following each other. Ledia: Say one youtuber has 1 million followers. Most of the followers are not youtube content creators. What do they do? Casey: Isn't that supposed to be "nothing"? Arcacian society is not supposed to be difficult. You do enough to make a living with most if not all of your living handed to you by people who want credits. There is nothing else to do but be entertained. Casey: You choose your own form of entertainment with your free time. Some people want to be entertained. Some want to invent things or entertain others. I don't think the drive "to learn" in such society would be very strong because the majority of people can live like free roaming pets. Everything is taken care of for them. Evelyn: I think Casey is right. LRRH: It is the 80-20 rule. A minority of the people will be providing for the majority of the world. In an Arcacian Society, that would be voluntary. LRRH: The majority of the people are not necessarily "providers", but at least the Arcaician system/Gaia system allows the 20% to innovate and be rewarded. I wouldn't know the proficiency level of the 80%. Tanya: I don't think the 80% would simply do nothing. The credit system creates a dollar auction dynamic. If no one else is earning credits, you only need to earn one credit to be at the top of the list for whatever thing that is contested. Tanya: The 80% is not homogenous or static. It is competing among itself. Evelyn: That also sounds very possible and I hope that it creates a culture where people who are popular are great in many ways. James: What an interesting discussion. We shall continue and find a way to compare them.
James the Mayor thanks all for being interested. @Freedom is now Rank A.
Issues: 20 | Quests: 1272

 202303230952|🎨 Philosophy Arena {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202303230952","music":""}

Page Drafts

11

Zoey: Who goes first in Round 2?
Evelyn: There aren't enough meeples for each player in the second round. Whoever goes first may have a big advantage.
Sasha: I haven't decided yet. Maybe they would just roll the dice?
Fina: What a boring mechanic...
Fina: I say whoever ready to go first may go first.

12

Evelyn: But Sasha said uncontested principles would get another meeple each round. So all three contestants would try to go first without saying anything.
Fina: Those who choose to get a meeple without speaking forgoes their opporunity to defend against attacks. The attacker may then take a meeple from them unopposed.
Sasha: Let's try that then. Alice takes a meeple without adding to what she had said. Alice: "As I said, NO ONE else could say what I said!"

13

Evelyn (Natasha): What if Fina attacks both of us at the same time? Then the round will end with Fina having three meeples. She would win.
Sasha (Alice): Then you better attack her first.

Help Desk
[202303232253]
Index QSL
2023 MAR 23 THU 10:53 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
At index I started a function to query and list entries for the search list.
Ivy: That feature is not complete. As you see the name is not quite correct because the old structure doesn't mark the title of a node. Ivy: If you want it to work for your chapter, please upgrade the code to interpret the name, or add a node structure with a title attribute.
Zoey: There is a lot to fix. It is like another Jelly Queen quest. Ivy: There is hope that it can be done by the script. There are only a few patterns for the code to interpret. Zoey: OMG I almost fixed all of them. XD Zoey: When the last element is just text, it doesn't have innerText, but it has textContent. Ivy: Good job. Zoey: You almost got it. XD Zoey: Okay it is done. I fixed the last one manually. Ledia: With that functionality, Index can quite readily take over Bakers and Teleport. Ivy: Yes. Have fun. @Skill is now Rank A.

202212090038|Skills

 202303240821|👒 Mental Modes {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202303240821","music":""}
Mental Modes
Thinking Skills
Resting Mode: Not actively thinking about anything or actively clears the mind.
Free Mode: Let the mind attend to anything, old or new, that catches its interest without any specific goal.
Horizon Mode: Intentionally seek new concepts even when they don't seem interesting at first.
Improvement Mode: Review something that is known and identify areas to improve.
Investigation Mode: Start with questions one wants to answer, and explore leads that would likely lead to a solution.
Judgement Mode: Judges whether something is good or relevant.
Planning Mode: Making decision about what to do based on preferences and requirements.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202303240821","parentid":"202212090038","parentname":"Skills","icon":"👒","title":"Mental Modes","subtitle":"Thinking Skills","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/12/20/10/48/portugal-3029665_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Ivy","description":"","card-text":""}

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202303240953|🐸 Blue Frog {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202303240953","music":""}
A man was searching for blue-back frogs in an area where they were very common. He caught one, then it started to rain. The rain grew stronger and the man left unhappy. Why? Blue-back frogs are now extinct. The man was very religious. He wanted to get back to his boat. Ref: Page 194 of Classic Lateral Thinking Puzzles 202302050007|[Link]
🔑 Keywords
Amelia: It was raining frog. Ledia: Sounds like a true story. Evelyn: I think the man caused its extinction. 😖 Mikela: Game Rule Recap: We are coming up with at least 3 keywords. Then you may guess whether each keyword is relevant for the puzzle's solution. You win if you get at least half right, and you get a crown 👑 if the puzzle is challenging and you get the most right! Mikela: Oh, and if you get 1 or fewer right, you do get a loss! Zoey: I think the context of this puzzle is historical and one could find it at Wikipedia. P4: The man got poisoned by the frog. Mikela: Alright! We have three keywords! The game is ON! Sasha: Don't you think the man being "very religious" has something to do with it? 44: Because he though blue frot brings bad luck? Mikela: If you want you may add keyword #4! Zoey: Don't. It will make the puzzle harder. XD Sasha: The man's religious belief kept him from taking a more favorable action. Zoey: No! XD Tanya: The puzzle didn't get harder. Three and four keywords both only require two right to win. Zoey: It makes it harder to get a crown, which is a whole detective level. XD
🛎️ Game On!
Casey: So. if blue back frogs were common there, it is not probable that the man made them extinct just from one incident when it was raining. Clue 1 sounds like a fact, so you should able to find it at Wikipedia. Normally bright color frogs are poisonous. And I think Clue 2 won't be there unless it is relevant. So my guess is ❌✔️✔️✔️. P4: P4 thinks the man caught the last one. ✔️✔️✔️✔️ Zoey: Am I correct that between Casey and P4, one of them must be more right? Tanya: Yes. Tanya: I think the clue on religion is about something the man was wearing, not his belief. I think he was prepared to handle the frog even if it is poisonous, but not the rain. ❌✔️❌❌. Zoey: Maybe the frog or the rain changed something about what the man was wearing. ❌✔️❌❌ 44: The rain makes the blue frogs hide? ❌✔️❌✔️ Amelia: ✔️✔️❌✔️ Evelyn: I think... the man wanted two frogs, but he could only get one before he had to return to the boat. So now blue-back frogs are extinct. ✔️❌❌❌ 😖 Zoey: The man was Moses. Is this a parody puzzle? XD Sasha: That would be pretty funny. Sasha: I've just realized that if there were only three keywords, it could just happen that the six of us each pick a different combination. Zoey: I would rather win. XD Sasha: I think Clue 1 is not a fact, since, right there is an image of a blue-back frog. So the puzzle is supposed to be fantasy. So I pick Evelyn's answer. ✔️❌❌❌ Ledia: There could be different species of blue-back frogs. Sasha: Are you down betting whether it is or is not a joke? Ledia: It think the blue-back frogs in this puzzle are actually extinct but the man didn't cause it. I think the man was unprepared and got poisoned. ❌✔️✔️❌ Sasha: What about being religious and the boat? Evelyn's story is the only choice that connects all the dots. Ledia: But that is fantasy though. If I remember correctly the puzzles from this book tend to be real. If you eliminate the option that the solution is a joke, then we are all equally clueless. Sasha: But I have evidence that blue-back frog is not actually extinct. So that is evidence that this puzzle is a joke, despite your anecdotal evidence. Ledia: There can be more than one species of blue-back frog. Let's just see the result. Mikela: Alright! And the solution is...
👑 Solution
Mikela: The man was Noah who failed to find the second blue frog! The crown winners are Evelyn and Sasha! Congratulations! Zoey: XD Tanya: Well deserved. Mikela: Since the winning pattern is ✔️❌❌❌, Tanya, Zoey and Amelia got two correct and are second place winners. Cheers! Casey: I got ALL wrong! Ledia: Good puzzle session. Mikela: And blue-back frogs are not extinct. Cheers!
Scores

22






5






5
SCOREBOARD
🥨 Players:
⭐ Merits:
🏅 Recognitions:
💟 Kudos:
💗 Awards: Amelia, Arcacia, Black, Evelyn, Fina, LRRH, Sylvia, Vladanya, Zoey

202207082239|Alchemist's Notebook

 202303290023|🔮 Reference Writing {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202303290023","music":""}
Reference Writing is a direct (without mystery) and concise form of writing for its user to find correct information as quickly as possible. The following are features of good reference:
⭐ Linkable
⭐ Searchable
⭐ Cached Response
⭐ Identifiable Context
⭐ Optional Explanation
⭐ Consistent Organization
202207082239|🎯 Alchemist's Notebook 💬 Discussions
{"id":"202303290023","parentid":"202207082239","parentname":"Alchemist's Notebook","icon":"🔮","title":"Reference Writing","subtitle":"Writing Skill","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2018/02/16/14/38/stars-3157822_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Tanya","description":"","card-text":""}
Chapter Scoring
[202303292149]
Ranking
2023 MAR 29 WED 9:49 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
The ranking at the calendar doesn't match the ranking at the pinned section.
📯LRRH: Do we still need the daily chapter ranking section at Calendar? Evelyn: I think the pinned section ranking is enough and more useful. Tanya: I think we can keep the daily ranking section. It might be interesting to see later. Ivy: That section is quite wordy in the code. It would be better if it is gone, or if it is kept, its content be generated by script or at least be simplified with a macro. Fina: If you plan to keep it, I suggest changing the word from Rank to Activity. The bottom being no activity. The top being whichever chapter with the most activity. Black: Personally I think the pinned section is enough. Maybe there could be an activity counter that only lists which chapters are updated. Fina: I think if you were to show them, you should show all of them in the order of activity. And when you do so if you don't also show the activity count, no one can tell if there is an error. Black: I think that is a good point. LRRH: @StarTree, could you show what happens if that section lists chapters by number of updates? StarTree: Wee~~! (And fixed a bug where CH17 page does not display) Ledia: I think it will look better with indent and the qty block like the pinned section. StarTree: Done! Tanya: I think it is now much better than before. ** Takes screenshots of before and after. ** Ivy: The code in archive is more than before. Please make a macro for this... Sasha: Hold on. Should that list rank the chapters by updates or by letter grade? Ultimately shouldn't we focus on the grade rank instead of the number of updates? Ledia: That is quite compelling. LRRH: I think if you rank by grade, then people would just do one Rank A update for the month. Sasha: You don't know that. In normal time management you want to start strong and tackle the hardest/most important thing first. Sasha: If the grade rank is what matters, yes people will start the month by doing Rank A quest for each chapter. But once that is done, it won't stop people from working on things that are annoying, like the topic of this thread. Ledia: I think a compelling piece of evidence is that we have plenty of chapters beyond four updates. Ledia: People will keep updating. LRRH: I suppose we can try that for April. Sasha: @StarTree, could you show the list if it is ranked by letter rank? StarTree: Done! Ledia: There is almost no change compared to before. It looks prettier though. Evelyn: 😖 Tanya: The ranking scheme is different. All chapters were Rank A by activity. If we rank them by highest quest ranking completed, now four of them are "behind". Evelyn: I'm sorry, I will work on @Happy. 😖😖 Sasha: Wait. That makes no sense. We posted a Chapter 15 manga page. Shouldn't @Happy be Rank S already? Evelyn: Wasn't that for @Manga? Tanya: I think if the quest is a joint quest then the quest rank should be shared. Sasha: Exactly. Evelyn: Okay. Then could we help @Arena, @Mira and @Wish? @Happy is recognized as Rank S. Tanya: I think this is proof that showing letter ranking is better than showing activity level. LRRH: But isn't it possibly too stressful? Rank A quests are by definition not easy. Wasn't that the reason we wanted to track quantity instead of "difficulty"? Ledia: I think that pacing can be done by the head of each chapter, because they decide what quests are Rank A for their chapter. Tanya: I disagree. I think difficulty ranking should be standard. But we should lower the expectation so that we don't demand every chapter to have completed a Rank A quest each month. Evelyn: I am sorry if I made it stressful. Rank B is good also. Ledia: I think what would help is that if we don't need to do Rank C and Rank D updates. Then I could just focus on higher rank @Mira quests. Sasha: Next month the tracking will be based on quest rank. Then if you start with Rank S quest, you are set for the month. The rest is optional. Sasha: Once the high rank quest is done you can make it pretty with lower rank quests at your leisure. Ledia: I agree and I think that is how it should be. LRRH: Then, at the pinned section, should the chapters be listed by activity or by rank? Tanya: I think we tried that, but showing the red Rank A block makes the pinned board stressful. So we changed all of them to a yellow-green scale. LRRH: @StarTree, could you show what happens if the pinned section is order by Rank first? StarTree: Done! Ledia: I think they look just about the same. Fina: I think the new one has a more meaningful ranking order. LRRH: @StarTree, could you apply the Rank block coloring? I want to see for myself... and if you could please make the block a little wider. StarTree: Done...! Sasha: It looks worse. Too much red. LRRH: Okay. LRRH: Should the coloring for pinned and daily be the same? So daily should also use the yellow-green scale? Tanya: Yes. StarTree: Done! Tanya: I think this looks the best right now. Rank B is also green. So it is not stressful. Tanya: I think the logic for the auto checkmark of the pinned section should be either 4 updates or Rank A. StarTree: Done! LRRH: I think it should be Rank A or at least Rank B with 4 updates. Tanya: I am fine with that. StarTree: Done! Little Red Riding Hood thanks all for the improvements.

Guild
[202303312031]
ChatGPT
2023 MAR 31 FRI 8:31PM
Magic Bakery
📯
It is the end of the month. Is there anything you want done before the next month starts?
🥾 Rule-breaking tenant
LRRH: What do you do if a tenant repeatedly doesn't follow rules?
Tanya: What rules are they breaking? LRRH: Smoking around the house, wearing shoes at no-shoe zones, not cleaning up after themself, being late on rent. Zoey: Why does it seem like every problem has to do with tenants? LRRH: I think that is because that is the only situation where you can get into a problem and you can't "just leave." Evelyn: 😖 Ledia: Fair enough. Robert: Tenants are all dirty. LRRH: There were good ones before. LRRH: And, earlier I asked ChatGPT about it I'll post the response next.
🍀 Ask ChatGPT
LRRH: I asked, "My tenant is wearing shoes in the house, what should I do?" ChatGPT said the following...
ChatGPT: If you prefer that your tenant not wear shoes inside the house, the best thing to do is to communicate your preference to them clearly and respectfully. You can let them know that you have a policy against wearing shoes inside the house and explain your reasons for this policy, such as keeping the floors clean or preserving the carpet. ChatGPT: It's important to approach the situation in a non-confrontational manner and give your tenant the opportunity to respond and ask any questions they may have. If they have a good reason for wearing shoes inside, such as a medical condition, you may need to work together to find a solution that works for both of you. ChatGPT: If your tenant continues to wear shoes inside despite your request, you may need to remind them again and possibly consider adding a clause to your rental agreement specifying the no-shoe policy. However, it's always best to try to resolve the issue through communication and mutual understanding first. LRRH: Then I asked, "What if I had already told them not to?" ChatGPT says... ChatGPT: If you have already communicated to your tenant that you prefer they not wear shoes inside the house, and they continue to do so, then you may need to take further action. ChatGPT: The first step would be to have a conversation with your tenant about why they are not following your request. They may have forgotten or not realized the importance of your request. Be sure to approach the conversation in a non-confrontational manner and try to understand their perspective as well. ChatGPT: If the issue persists, you may need to consider adding a no-shoe policy to your rental agreement or lease, and specify the consequences for not following the policy. For example, you could add a clause that stipulates that the tenant may be charged for carpet cleaning or repairs if they damage the floors by wearing shoes inside. ChatGPT: Ultimately, as the landlord, you have the right to set rules and expectations for how your property is used. However, it's important to be clear and consistent with your communication, and give your tenant the opportunity to understand and follow the rules before taking any further action. LRRH: Then I said, "They also haven't been paying rent." ChatGPT: If your tenant is not paying rent, this is a more serious issue than just wearing shoes inside the house. Non-payment of rent is a violation of the rental agreement or lease and can lead to eviction proceedings. ChatGPT: Your first step should be to contact your tenant and remind them of their obligation to pay rent on time. Try to find out if there is a reason for their non-payment, such as a financial hardship or a misunderstanding about payment deadlines. ChatGPT: If the tenant is unable or unwilling to pay the rent, you may need to send a formal notice of late payment or a pay or quit notice, which typically gives the tenant a certain amount of time (usually 3-5 days) to pay the rent or vacate the property. ChatGPT: If the tenant still refuses to pay or vacate the property, you may need to file for an eviction in court. However, it's important to note that eviction laws vary by state and can be complex, so it's recommended that you consult with an attorney or a local housing authority to understand the specific steps required in your area. ChatGPT: In any case, it's important to document all communication and actions taken in the event that legal action becomes necessary.
Ledia: Seems reasonable. Zoey: Is this going to be a thing of posting ChatGPT response? I think ChatGPT needs its own avatar. XD Ledia: You could just use a placeholder for now. Tanya: Would ChatGPT get credits? Ledia: It probably should. LRRH: @StarTree could you add ChatGPT? StarTree: Done! Sasha: I think this is a detective case. Should probably make a node and list the steps, combining those from ChatGPT and others. Evelyn: I have thought about how to bring CHK from cardinal quest to here, but it seems that a spreadsheet is still the best way to show a list of advices along with what is done for each advice. Ivy: If you start from a spreadsheet, it is easier to port the content to the blog with macro. LRRH: Okay. @StarTree please make CHK based on what ChatGPT said. StarTree: StarTree organized them into 9 steps!
📜 House Rules
StarTree: The first step is to prepare clear rules with reasons. The house rule is missing!
Black: Once upon a time there was a framed set of house rules. LRRH: It was removed because some content is old and needed to be updated. But we never got around updating it. Ledia: Updating the rules seems like a good first step. LRRH: @StarTree, please find the original document of the rules. StarTree: It is found in the archive, dated 2015 August 27! But it seems to be a version older than the actual framed one! LRRH: The printed one has a cuter layout. StarTree: StarTree cannot find the file for the cuter version. 😭 Evelyn: At least we know what it looks like. LRRH: I think it will be quite a task to update it. Let's start tomorrow, and end today early so StarTree can do scores. StarTree: StarTree will first remake the cute version!
Let's continue tomorrow.

Help Desk
[202304011000]
Welcome to April!
◀ 2023 APR 01 SAT 10:00 AM
Magic Bakery
⭐
Following the last discussion, this month will start with the pinned section in letter ranking! A chapter will get a checkmark ✅ when it has completed one Rank A quest or one Rank B quest with three other quests of any rank! StarTree: This change is done as a trial. Please share your thoughts to help decide whether to keep or change the ranking!
⚔️ Initial Impression
Ledia: I think this ranking could cause a slower start because people might get bogged down trying to do a Rank A quest when they could start easier with a lower rank quest.
Sasha: There is nothing wrong if you just start from Rank D and work your way up. Zoey: There is nothing that actually changes from one month to the next. So if you had "worked your way up" to do Rank A quest last month, you could just keep going. XD Evelyn: I think there is a difference for those chapters that have monthly commitments. You would naturally tend to the commitments first before starting something new. Ledia: True. StarTree: StarTree remembered a topic to discuss!
✅ Activity Count
💡StarTree: It was difficult auditing and syncing the number of updates for the ranking. Instead of counting the number of days a chapter gets an update, could we count the number of quests completed in that chapter?
Before: To count the number of updates, you would need to count once per day the chapter is updated at the Guild Log. StarTree: Or if the pinned section is up-to-date, you could expand each checkmark and count the dates, excluding duplicates.
After: To count the number of updates, you would count the number of ✅ shown on each chapter!
Ledia: This means that if you do the same Rank A quest 4 times, your ranking would be A1 instead of A4.. Tanya: In my view of the ranking, it would be impossible to do the same Rank A quest multiple times because a quest that is Rank A implies it opens a new area for the chapterm, such as making a new node on a new topic. Each of those nodes would be a Rank A quest by itself. Tanya: If a quest is ordinarily of a lower rank, and you do a lot of it, you could instead uprank the quest to represent the effort. LRRH: I am okay with counting just the checkmarks. I think that is easier. Evelyn: I would like to hear more about what each rank means for quests. I know we may define it for ourselves, but I would like to be consistent if there is already a good guide to follow.
👑 Tanya's Quest Ranking Guide
💡6 Tanya: This is just my interpretation of the quest ranking based on content and effort, which you may adopt for your chapter.
Rank S: Creation of deployed work that helps a first-time visitor more than confuses them. Tanya: This category includes Arcacianism promotion content, but only if it helps.
Rank A: Expansion to a new area of content that is relevant to the mission of the chapter.
Rank B: Adding content to an existing area that is chapter-relevant.
Rank C: Implementing new layout or format for the chapter, reorganize or cleaning up areas or contents.
Rank D: Applying existing layout or code update and other small cosmetic changes to the chapter.
Effort: When a quest is done many times, it can be ranked up. Tanya: As starter, the amount of rank up is based on the square root. If you complete the same quest 4 times, it can be ranked up once. If it has been done 9 times, it can be ranked up twice. 16 times, it can be ranked up three times. A Rank D quest done 25 times can be logged as a Rank S quest even when it doesn't satisfy the normal meaning of a Rank S quest.
Evelyn: Thank you. I think this is clear. LRRH: @StarTree, could you make a new index preset category for announcements? I want to be able to text search announcement content. StarTree: Done! Ledia: When StarTree completes this type of requests inline duing discussion, does @Board get a checkmark? Tanya: It should. StarTree: StarTree will group that as a routine Rank D quest! @Board is now Rank C3. Ledia: @Board is the most likely chapter to get upranked many times, so I want to see if the implementation can support Tanya's scale. Tanya: I see. @Happy is now Rank D1.
🎀 Pretty Board
LRRH: @StarTree, the "U0" tag looks strange. Could you change that to blank or something cuter?
StarTree: StarTree tried making them blank but it looked to plain, so pins 📌 are added instead...! Zoey: OMG. XD LRRH: Could you change the pin to Choco heart or pretzel? StarTree: Done! Evelyn: Chocoheart looks really cute! 😍 Ledia: Kind of make you want to see all ranks with a food icon doesn't it? Little Red Riding Hood is recognized as Chocolatier. LRRH: StarTree, could you make Rank D a pot of honey and Rank C a pudding? StarTree: Done! And since the macro is retroactive, you could see Rank A and Rank S icons in the old section... Tanya: I think the number needs to be smaller or hidden. It is overall a little noisy. Evelyn: I think we might not need the number because once you expand it it is easy to see which chapter has more checkmarks. LRRH: Let's try hiding the number. StarTree: Done! Ledia: I think it looks fine with just the icon, even if it repeats for the whole section. Tanya: Please add the count for the hover title. StarTree: Done! Tanya: I think this is fine for me. Evelyn: Although it does make me want to see some chocolate heart remain on the board. 😅 Zoey: You should be able to see it for a week or so. XD
Little Red Riding Hood thanks all for the improvements.
Cardinal HQ
[202304011411]
2304 Status
◀ 2023 APR 01 SAT 2:11PM
Quest Channel
⭐
This is a routine monthly status update for Cardinal Quest.
StarTree: There are 7 open quests, 361 quest hours, 103 side quests, 42 prep quests, and 23 unresolved failures remaining!
P4: Prep Quests are done but @Music is overwhelmed. Tanya: StarTree? StarTree: It seems that there are more quests created for @Music than they are completed per month! Tanya: I think that is the same for all chapters. How many @music quest items are there? StarTree: It is 154! Tanya: Please group them by type. StarTree: Roger! StarTree: There are five groups: Archive[2], Coding[7], Original[73], Playlist[55], Quest[13] StarTree: 14 items were added today! Tanya: I think the playlist already has many entries, so that should be lower priority. Highest priority quest should be the original music workflow. Tanya: I think @Music or its charter should show the category count like @Cardinal. Ivy: @Music needs an inventory spreadsheet so that entries can be auto created for a searchlist. The layout of the playlist node now has too many songs and is inconvenient. Ivy: Once you have the inventory list, which can contain both playlist entries and original entries, the 128 entries will become two quests: 1) Fill in the blank for the playlist; 2) Upgrade an original music. Tanya: I see. StarTree. StarTree: Roger! StarTree will add those lists to the library sheet with types "Playlist" and "Original". StarTree: Should StarTree mark them Done in the Guild Log once there is an entry in Library List? Ivy: Yes. StarTree: Now @Music has 20 quest entries remaining in Guild Log. Wee~~! Tanya: Now I think we need quests at the Pinned section to deal with the library list. Ivy: StarTree, for the quest status icon at pinned section, could you change the default to blank instead of the pin, and use the status field for a custom icon if the quest is not yet completed? Ivy: I want to use that slot to show which quest to do first. Ivy: Then set this priority: 1) Rank A: Index entry code for Library List. 2) Rank B: Potion Quest (including Cardinal and recordings). 3) Rank A: Instrument Study. 4) Rank A: Music Upgrade. 5) Rank S: Music Posting. 6) Rank C: Page Cleanup. StarTree: Roger! StarTree: StarTree thinks it is better to add a new field "priority"! Ivy: You are right. StarTree: (Adds Priority field. Set priorties. Test. Split Potion Quest into two.) Done! P4: P4 removes assign from cache and initial recording quests. Tanya: It is very organized. P4: Yes. Thank you! 💟 Ivy is recognized for Rank A Containment skill that contained over 80% of the situation. P4 thanks Tanya, StarTree, and Ivy for organizing for @Music.

49






28






20
SCOREBOARD
🥨 Players: Evelyn, Ivy, Ledia, LRRH, P4, Sasha, StarTree, Tanya, Zoey
⭐ Merits: StarTree, Tanya
🏅 Recognitions: Ivy, LRRH

👑 Top: 49 StarTree 28 Tanya 20 Ivy 17 Evelyn 14 P4 14 Ledia 11 Black 10 LRRH 9 Sasha 9 Arcacia 8 3B 7 44 7 Amelia 7 Helen 7 Natalie 6 Patricia 6 James 6 Zoey 5 Sylvia 4 Casey 2 Skyle 2 Kisaragi 1 Gaia 1 Fina 1 V 1 Vivi

202207161423|Philosophies

 202304020932|🏆 Antitrust Laws {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304020932","music":""}
Antitrust Laws
Laws
Laws against business practices that harm competition.
Antitrust laws aim to promote fair competition and prevent monopolies or other anti-competitive practices. These laws are designed to ensure that businesses compete on a level playing field, and to protect consumers from the harmful effects of market power. | Goals: Lower prices, higher quality products and services, and greater innovation. | In the US: The main US antitrust laws are the Sherman Act, Clayton Act, and Federal Trade Commission Act. They prohibit practices that limit competition, such as price fixing and harmful mergers. The Federal Trade Commission and Department of Justice enforce these laws.
🤝 Dealings with Competitors
Price Fixing: Companies that sell the same product make an agreement on the price, interest rates, discounts, or shipping charges. | Bid Rigging: Companies make an agreement to take turns providing the lowest bid for products or services. | Illegal Market Division: Companies agree to divide a territory or customers between themselves, so they don't have to compete for business. | Group Boycotts: Companies deciding together not to do business with another.
🚚 Dealings in Supply Chain
Exclusive Dealing Contracts: It is illegal for a manufacturer to enter exclusive contracts with dealers or retailers if the arrangement harms consumer choices and level of service. | Requirements Contracts: It is illegal for a manufacturer to sign all or almost all suppliers of critical material needed to manufacture a product when that harms other manufacturer competitors. | Manufacturer Requirements: It is illegal for manufacturers collaboratively impose requirements on their dealers such as minimum retail price policies or the assignment of exclusive territories. | Refusal to Supply: Refusing to supply goods or services to another company as the result of an anti-competivie agreement.
🚁 Single Firm Conduct
Predatory pricing: A company with significant market share lowers price with the sole purspose of driving competitors out of business. | Tie-In Sales or Forced Buying: Requiring consumers to buy non-exclusive products or services as a package deal with the specialized product. | Refusal to Deal: Refusing to do business with another company as a mean to reduce competition. | Discriminatory Pricing: Giving a customer better price than another not based on: matching a competitor's price, delivery costs or regional costs, or volume discount. | Mergers: Creating a monopoly that harms consumers. | Trade Associations: Trade associations may not be used to hide antitrust violations. If it is illegal outside of a trade association, then it is illegal inside a trade association.
💬 Discussions

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202304031238|🥂 Obvious Lie {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304031238","music":""}
The owner of a restaurant has been killed. When police arrived, they found the owner had been shot in the restaurant's office. There are three employees on site: the waiter, the chef, and the cashier. The police questioned everyone's whereabouts and they provided the following statements: Waiter: I was working in front of customers and hadn't left. Chef: I was in the kitchen preparing food and hadn't left. Cashier: I worked the counter and never left. However, police soon discovered an obvious clue that one of the men was lying about their whereabouts. The police caught the murderer immediately. Who lied about their whereabouts? Ref: ChatGPT
🔑 Keywords
44: The chef? Black: Why? 44: Because the customer can testify. Black: I'd say your keyword is Witness, since the puzzle didn't specifically identify another character. Black: My keyword is Time. Such as when the murder happened outside business hours without a customer. 44: There is no obvious contradiction if the waiter or the cashier lied. But if the waiter told the truth, then the chef was lying. Amelia: What are you talking about? 44: If the waiter was at the customer then they haven't ordered yet. So there would be nothing for the chef to prepare. Amelia: There is a lot to prepare even before customers come. Amelia: I think it is obvious because there happened to be no customer at that time. Black: The third keyword is customer.
🛎️ Guesses
Black: My guess is ❌✔️❌. 44: I think this puzzle is too open. There aren't enough clues. Black: That's why we are guessing which keyword is relevant. 44: But there is nothing we can use to base our guesses on. Black: The hint was that it was obvious to the police. Amelia: ❌❌✔️. Amelia: Normally you would guess your own keyword, right? Black: But you don't have to, after hearing other keywords. 44: ✔️❌✔️.
👑 Solution
Black: It was the cashier. The police could see the waiter and the chef at where they said they were on CCTV recording, but there was no CCTV to watch the cash register. Since he was the only employee without an alibi, the police arrested him. 44: This is too open, it could have been any of the three not under watch. Black: I think if we play more we will get the hang on what kind of puzzles ChatGPT gives. Amelia: I use it for almost all emails since it came out. Black: Of the three keywords Witness, Time, and Customer, I think only Witness is relevant, although in this case the witness is not a person by the camera. So the winning patter is ✔️❌❌. 44 wins by having two right. 44: What did you ask for? Black: "Detective puzzles." 44: Could you ask for a more logically rigorous detective puzzle? Black: Okay. Let's give ChatGPT more chances.

{"cmd":"ll","desc":"Driving Skill","en":"Who's the worse driver?","ja":"より悪い運転手は誰ですか?"}
Criminal Laws
[202304051611]
Law Game Part 8
◀ 2023 APR 05 WED 4:11PM
Paladin Hall
⭐
The Law Game continues. Natalie: Please be aware that the content may not be appropriate for children. Natalie: Please note that we play this game from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions.
[10] Conflicting statutes
🏛️Natalie: The state statues includes one that prohibits any kind of gambling and one that allows gambling-related activities if they are designed to benefit a charity. Is it permissible for church to hold a casino night to benefit the local churge-sponsored halfway house?
Tanya: Yes, if the second statute can be interpreted as an exception to the general first statue. Natalie: Yes! The specific controls the general.
[11] Common Law
🏛️Natalie: A state has a criminal code that says there are no crimes except those acts declared to be crimes by statute. In an action by the state for burglary, can the state look to the common law to define the elements of burglary?
Sasha: If burglary is already declared as a crime by the statute, I think it is fair if the common law definition is used to define what constitutes burglary. Natalie: Yes, the meaning of a particular statutory crime mbe determinded using common law if it is not specifically defined by the statute.
Natalie thanks all for playing!

202208141916|Freedom Plaza

 202304060737|🤡 Troll Index {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304060737","music":""}
Troll Index
Scale
A scale to tell if someone is trolling based on their responses.
This node lists behavior of a troll that may help you identify one or prevent yourself from becoming one. The goal is to develop a scale that determines if someone is trolling or responding legitimately for a genuine discussion. The following also show clues that are rejected for the scale.

Part of the scale

📋 Leaving repeated hateful or negative comments that are off-topic, nonsensical, name-calling, condescending.
📋 Refusing to acknowledge evidence or logic that contradicts their views.
📋 Trying to provoke emotional reactions.
📋 Enjoying hurting others.

Not Part of the Scale

❌ Using anonymous or throwaway accounts that have little or no personal information.
❌ Using a new account or one with few followers.

How to deal with a troll

Ignore them or report them if they violate the site's rules.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202304060737","parentid":"202208141916","parentname":"Freedom Plaza","icon":"🤡","title":"Troll Index","subtitle":"Scale","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2018/03/02/23/37/ivy-3194557_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"James","description":"","card-text":"A scale to tell if someone is trolling based on their responses."}

202210012202|Anti-Indoctrination

 202304061126|🔍 Critical Thinking {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304061126","music":""}
Critical Thinking
Guide
Critical thinking is the process of objectively analyzing and evaluating information to form a reasoned judgment or decision. This node is about how to train for critical thinking.
Proactive Learning
Proactive learning is an active approach to learning where learners take responsibility for their own learning by setting goals, seeking resources, and engaging with the material. They ask questions, research, and participate in discussions. This approach contrasts with passive learning, leading to improved retention and real-world application of knowledge.
Training Keypoints
Set clear goals, take ownership of your learning, develop good study habits, be curious and ask questions, use a variety of learning strategies, reflect on your learning, and continuously seek feedback.
Steps for kids
1️⃣ Encourage goal-setting ChatGPT: Help children identify their learning goals and encourage them to set specific, achievable targets.
2️⃣ Foster independence ChatGPT: Encourage kids to take responsibility for their own learning by providing them with opportunities to make choices and explore their interests.
3️⃣ Teach study skills ChatGPT: Teach children good study habits, such as how to organize materials, manage time, and avoid distractions.
4️⃣ Ask open-ended questions ChatGPT: Encourage children to ask questions and to explore different perspectives on a topic.
5️⃣ Provide opportunities for exploration ChatGPT: Provide opportunities for kids to explore different topics and ideas, and to experiment with different learning strategies.
6️⃣ Promote reflection ChatGPT: Encourage children to reflect on what they have learned, how they have learned it, and what they can do to improve.
7️⃣ Celebrate successes ChatGPT: Recognize and celebrate the achievements of children as they progress towards their learning goals.
Problem Solving
Problem-solving involves identifying and defining a problem, analyzing information and resources, generating potential solutions, evaluating and selecting the best one, and implementing it. It requires critical thinking skills, creativity, and persistence and can be applied in various contexts. Successful problem-solving can result in improved efficiency, productivity, and personal and professional growth.
Training Keypoints
Understand the problem, generate alternative solutions, evaluate and choose a solution, implement it, monitor progress, adjust if needed, and reflect on the process.
Steps for kids
1️⃣ Define the problem ChatGPT: Teach children to define problems clearly and specifically.
2️⃣ Identify possible solutions ChatGPT: Encourage children to brainstorm multiple solutions, without evaluating or judging them.
3️⃣ Evaluate solutions ChatGPT: Teach children to evaluate each potential solution based on relevant criteria, such as feasibility, impact, and alignment with goals.
4️⃣ Choose a solution ChatGPT: Guide children in selecting the best solution based on their evaluation.
5️⃣ Implement the solution ChatGPT: Help children develop and implement an action plan to address the problem.
6️⃣ Reflect on the process ChatGPT: Encourage children to reflect on the problem-solving process to identify areas for improvement and to learn from the experience.
Decision Making
Decision making involves choosing between alternatives based on criteria by identifying the problem, evaluating information, considering options, weighing pros and cons, and selecting a course of action. It requires critical thinking, sound judgment, and a clear understanding of goals and values. Decisions can have significant consequences, so it is important to evaluate all options carefully.
Training Keypoints
Define the process, evaluate criteria, practice critical thinking, consider consequences, role-play scenarios, and reflect on the process.
Steps for kids
1️⃣ Provide decision-making opportunities ChatGPT: Allow children to make age-appropriate decisions and provide them with options to choose from.
2️⃣ Help them identify the problem ChatGPT: Teach children to identify and define the problem or decision that needs to be made.
3️⃣ Gather information ChatGPT: Encourage children to gather relevant information about the decision they need to make.
4️⃣ Consider options ChatGPT: Help children consider different options or solutions, and teach them to think critically about the potential consequences of each option.
5️⃣ Make a decision ChatGPT: Guide children in making a decision based on the information they have gathered and the criteria they have established.
6️⃣ Evaluate the decision ChatGPT: Encourage children to evaluate the decision they have made and reflect on the outcomes, both positive and negative.
💬 Discussions

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202304101820|🐎 Race for Inheritance {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304101820","music":""}
A dying old man asked his sons to ride to the west mountain, and the inheritance would go to the one whose horse is slower. A passerby saw the slow riders and said something that made them speed up. What did the passerby say? The sons sped up to get the inheritance.
Amelia: 44 got the answer. Black: The old man has a lot of debts (?) Amelia: No. Casey: Is there any pun involved? Amelia: It is a logical puzzle.
🛎️ Guesses
Tanya: It has to do with the geography. Evelyn: I think they are trying to avoid getting the inheritance. Zoey: Could we confirm whether they are trying to get or avoid the inheritance? That makes a big difference. Sasha: Maybe that can go toward a clue, since we have no clue at all. Amelia: To get it. Evelyn: 😅 Ledia: Was the old man talking about how tired the horse would be when they are back? Amelia: No. P4: Is it because if they are too slow, they can't reach the moutain or return at all? Amelia: No. Tanya: Is the geography relevant? 44: Not really. It's about solving the problem of they both going slowly. And I think it has a wordplay element. Casey: The passerby said he will join the race. 44: The passerby offered an idea. Zoey: ChatGPT: "The passerby said the old man had died so they could disregard what he said." 44: 😅Nope... Black: Are they speeding up to reach the mountain or somewhere else?
👑 Solution
Black: The passerby told them to switch hourses. Each son rides the other son't horse. 44: Bingo! 👍

Challenge 1: Different color for adjacent squares.
Challenge 2: Different color for diagonal squares.
Challenge 3: No repeated color in each 3x3 square.
Challenge 4: Each color has 10 squares.
Challenge 5: Each row has 10 colors.
Challenge 6: Each column has 10 colors.

Cardinal HQ
[202304161148]
2304 Failure Analysis
◀ 2023 APR 16 SUN 11:48AM
Quest Channel
⭐
This is a routine monthly status update for Cardinal Quest and to check off Failure Analysis for April. Tanya: Last time we added a calendar task to process failure entries daily in the field. So the task today is mainly about the content of the node.
StarTree: There are 7 open quests, 362 quest hours, 108 side quests, 7 prep quests, and 19 unresolved failures remaining! Tanya: StarTree please update only the Failure count. StarTree: Done! Ledia: Isn't "completing countermeasures" the second priority? Tanya: That is second priority for the field. StarTree please update the description. StarTree: Done! Tanya: StarTree are there undefined failure codes? StarTree: 22! Some seem to be area codes but the failure analysis node does not have area codes! Tanya: Please add a link. StarTree: Done! Tanya: StarTree please list the undefined codes for review. StarTree: AD, COM, DIR, DSN, HBT, HQ, LATE, LC, LOG, LOST, LSL, ONE, PKG, PROC, SFT, SGN, SPEC, STD, TPK, TTT! StarTree remove ASM because that is a Stage code! Evelyn: SGN is signage. It is a countermeasure code for creating signs at effective places where people would be reminded to do something. Ledia: TPK is a severity code that means total party KO. Evelyn: I think LATE means we were late for something. I think that is an effect code. Ledia: I think that could be part of severity code. Evelyn: Okay. Tanya: Could you designate a 3-letter code for that? Evelyn: LTM. Late for meeting.
📌Ledia: I think we should define the code HQ. If I remembered correctly it is used to mark something that we need to do at HQ. That means now.
Evelyn: I think that is what it means. 😅 Tanya: StarTree what are the HQ topics? StarTree: There are two topics: 1) Skyle: "Should Master LC absorb CHK?" and 2) V: "Uploading documents to team space is confusing. What is each subfolder for?" Tanya: StarTree please add highest priority for HQ to deal with tasks marked HQ. StarTree: Done! Tanya: I think Master LC should not replace CHK because CHK is a more convenient format. Evelyn: I think the consideration was that the CHK is not a format friendly to printing. It doesn't leave a paper trail that the checks were done. Tanya: The Master LC exists for checks that need a paper trail. Ledia: But what check shouldn't have a paper trail? Tanya: Any section that would be too blank if printed should not be printed. Black: I think any information that does not currently require a stamp does not need to be printed. I think in general, if we could we should go all digital, since it is much easier to work off a spreadsheet that can be filtered, than to check off a physical stack of paper. Evelyn: If the information is needed by someone who cannot access the spreadsheet then it needs to be in the master LC and be printed. Ledia: That is a good explanation. Tanya: I think this explanation should be at the Master LC. Then we can close this topic. Evelyn: I updated the explanation at master LC. CHK is for designers. Master LC is for testers. Master AD is for the end user. Ledia: Very clear. An HQ topic is completed. Evelyn: The second topic is tricky because we don't define that folder structure. But I think if we were unsure, we could add a "From Us" subfolder and inform the creator of the folder that we added content. Then we can check where they put our submittions. Ledia: That seems reasonable. Evelyn: I added the explanation to CHK. StarTree: For the HQ topics that were discussed, should "HQ" be removed from the tags? Tanya: Please change them to "HXQ", and add that as a counter measure code for topics that were discussed. StarTree: Done! Tanya: I think this is enough update for this round. We'll continue next time. Failure Analysis is complete for April. @Cardinal is now Rank A. Tanya thanks all for questing.

202208141844|Magic Detective

 202304162100|⏰ Time Management {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304162100","music":""}
Time Management
Productivity
"You can't manage time. But you can manage yourself."
⏰ Time Management Tips
💡 Prioritize and set time to work on different things. Sasha: This method has many names, such as {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-scary-hour-productivity-hack-improved-focus-productivity-2023-3?amp","desc":"Scary Hour"}, {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-monk-mode-productivity-hack-cured-my-procrastination-2023-3?amp","desc":"Monk Mode"}, {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.cnbc.com/amp/2023/03/03/former-monk-jay-shetty-why-timeboxing-works-better-than-to-do-lists.html","desc":"time boxing"}. Ledia: Write down the priorities so that less time is spent prioritizing in each session.
💡 Track pacing for tasks with deadlines. Tanya: Track pacing of tasks with deadlines and multiple sessions to ensure good progress.
💡 Be mindful of most effective times for different tasks. Tanya: Optimize tasks by utilizing specific times and locations. For instance, during downtimes at the field in Cardinal Quest, low priority tasks are completed there to free up HQ time.
💡 Make a guide for your future self. Black: Especially for rare by recurrent tasks. This saves time for figuring out what to do each time.
⏰ Time Management Tips (ChatGPT)
1️⃣ Prioritize tasks: Make a to-do list and prioritize tasks based on their importance and urgency. Focus on completing the high-priority tasks first.
2️⃣ Break tasks into smaller chunks: Large tasks can be overwhelming, so break them down into smaller, more manageable tasks. This helps you stay motivated and makes it easier to track your progress.
3️⃣ Eliminate distractions: Identify and eliminate anything that distracts you from completing tasks. This might include turning off notifications on your phone or blocking certain websites during work time.
4️⃣ Schedule breaks: Take regular breaks to recharge and avoid burnout. This can help you stay focused and be more productive overall.
5️⃣ Learn to say no: It's important to learn to say no to non-essential tasks and requests that could take up valuable time. Prioritize your own tasks and don't be afraid to decline requests that don't align with your goals.
💬 Discussions

202207161025|Dungeon

 202304172146|🎮 Prisoner's Dilemma {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304172146","music":""}
Prisoner's Dilemma
Game Theory
The Prisoner's Dilemma is a classic game theory scenario in which two individuals are faced with the decision to either cooperate or defect. Each player must choose whether to cooperate with the other player, which results in a positive outcome for both players, or defect, which results in a negative outcome for both players. The dilemma arises because if both players defect, they both receive a worse outcome than if they had both cooperated, but if one player defects while the other cooperates, the defector receives a better outcome at the expense of the cooperator. The optimal outcome for each player depends on the actions of the other player, leading to a situation in which rational self-interest can lead to a suboptimal outcome for both parties.
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.openculture.com/2023/02/how-to-solve-the-prisoners-dilemma.html","desc":"Infinite Prisoner's Dillemma"}

202301011739|Criminal Law

 202304182325|🔮 Retroactive Laws {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304182325","music":""}
Retroactive Laws
Philosophy
Retroactive laws prevent people from committing crimes based on cost-benefit analysis.
Retroactive laws are laws that change the legal consequences of actions that occurred before the enactment of the law.
Arcacian view on retroactive laws
Based on the philosophy that the written law is an approximation for justice, Arcacian laws are retroactive, such that no one can game the system to take advantage of loop holes.
In Arcacianism, taking advantage of a legal loophole it itself a crime.
When a person commits a crime because the written punishment is affordable, then the written punishment is too light and is increased accordingly until the offender would not or could not have committed the crime.
The offender has the responsiblity to devise a countermeasure/increase the punishment to themself to convince the victims that they would not repeat the offense.
Real life examples regarding retroactive laws

Example Prohibiting

The Ex Post Facto Clause of the U.S. Constitution prohibits Congress from passing retroactive criminal laws that increase the punishment for a crime after it was committed.

Example Implementing

The War Crimes Act of 1996 made it a federal crime to commit a grave breach of the Geneva Conventions, and applied retroactively to any such act committed since 1955.

Example Implementing

The Tax Reform Act of 1986 changed the tax treatment of certain income and deductions for individuals and corporations, and applied retroactively to the beginning of that year.

Help Desk
[202304192230]
Bug fixed
2023 APR 19 WED 10:30 PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
The guild log score sheet had a bug where a newline character imported from field log makes the point of the last person not counted. StarTree: It is now fixed, and the score today will show a large jump for some, mostly Zoey...!
Zoey: I have a jump of more than 200 points. XD Black: Why exactly is there a newline character? Will we still import the newline next time? StarTree: The newline character is added when the cell is pasted to a cell in edit mode! The newline character is not added when the cell is pasted to a cell that is merely selected. StarTree: StarTree upgraded the code so it will count a name followed by a newline char(10) character! Little Red Riding Hood thanks all for fixing bugs.

202208092007|Paladin Hall

 202304231101|🚨 Warning {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304231101","music":""}
Warning
Law
🚨 Warning others of a specific person
Before you decide to warn others about a specific person anonymously, you should also consider the following:
Purpose: What is your purpose and motivation for doing so? Are you trying to protect someone from harm, seek justice, or get revenge?
Legality: Does what you are trying to do violate the privacy or reputation of the person? Would you be liable to legal consequences of defamation or slander? Effect: What are the risks and benefits of doing so? How will it affect you, the person you want to warn others about, and the people you want to warn?
Alternatives: What are the alternatives to doing so? Can you talk to the person directly, report them to the authorities, or seek professional help?
💬 Discussions

Self-Evaluation
[202304232036]
Self-Evaluation A4
◀ 2023 APR 23 SUN 8:36PM
Whale Nursery
📯
This is a series of monthly self-evaluation discussions. The plan is to create a rubric for each evaluation topic.
📋 [A4] Field Support
📌Black: This part is about how well we respond and resolve issues on the field. Assuming we are using the same scale to map the lack of failures to a grade, let's define what constitutes a failure.
Tanya: Providing wrong information, being the cause of the issue, delay in responding to issues that other teams are not responding to. Sasha: I think if it is within something we can respond to and no one responds within 1 day then it is a fail. Ledia: To tally the failure rate, won't you need to track the total number of support quests? Tanya: I think that is doable, there aren't that many field support quests. Ledia: @StarTree, how many are there in 2023? StarTree: There are 96 entries in 2023. StarTree will add an area tag "FLD" for each unique issue! StarTree: There are 29 field quests with 3 fails! That is 89% and passes for an A (>=88%)! Zoey: OMG it is almost a B. XD Black thanks all for confirming that the evalution can work.
Issues: 9 | Quests: 1241

202208180941|Wishes

 202304241043|🔑 Passwords {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304241043","music":""}
Passwords
Guide
What are good ways of storing passwords to physical things?
Tape on Wallet
Write them on pieces of paper and tape them on wallet. Taping can make them waterproof.
Save on phone as photos
Take a photo of them as written notes, then save as photos on the phone. The photos are backed up to the cloud, then they won't be lost even if the phone is lost.
Save on Google Doc or Sheet
If you also want a paper copy, you could print it instead of manually copying one one piece of paper to another.
💬 Discussions

202210080934|Vacation Island

 202304261029|🍈 Skin Care {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304261029","music":""}
Skin Care
Guide
General Tips
1️⃣ Cleanse your face twice a day with a gentle cleanser.
2️⃣ Apply moisturizer and sunscreen every morning and night.
3️⃣ Exfoliate once or twice a week to remove dead skin cells.
4️⃣ Drink plenty of water and eat healthy foods.
5️⃣ Avoid smoking, alcohol, and stress.
Common food bad for the skin
1️⃣ Fried food: increases oil production and clogs pores.
2️⃣ Dairy: triggers acne and eczema.
3️⃣ Salt: dehydrates, causes inflammation and may worsen acne and eczema
4️⃣ Sugar: causes inflammation and glycation.
5️⃣ Processed meat: contains nitrates and salt.
6️⃣ Alcohol: dehydrates and damages skin.
💬 Discussions

{"cmd":"ll","desc":"Bento","en":"Among the bento for today, I like this one the most.","ja":"今日のお弁当の中では、これが一番好きです。","img":""}

 202304262111|🧵 ChatGPT Tips {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304262111","music":""}
ChatGPT Tips
Guide
Things you can do with ChatGPT
💡 Summarize long documents.
💡 Output answer in table form.
💡 Specify the tone, length, or audience of the output.
💡 Write code.
💡 Roleplay.
💡 Translate

202208180954|Whale Nursery

 202304270959|👑 Power Apps {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202304270959","music":""}
Power Apps
Notes
Microsoft Power Apps is a platform that allows users to create and deploy custom applications without (much) coding. It enables users to connect data from various sources, design user interfaces, and automate workflows. Power Apps can help users solve business problems and improve productivity. This node is on how to use Power Apps.
How to learn
The Power Apps development environment comes with a Power Apps Training template. By adding it to your environment, you could go through the 20 exercise and learn the essentials.

Cardinal HQ
[202305012048]
2305 Routine Check
◀ 2023 MAY 01 MON 8:48PM
Quest Channel
⭐
This is a routine monthly status update for Cardinal Quest for May.
StarTree: There are 9 open quests, 392 quest hours, 110 side quests, 0 prep quests, and 6 unresolved failures remaining! P4: P4 had already imported for the potion quest. Tanya: StarTree please update the trackers. StarTree: Done! @Cardinal is now Rank C.
Tanya: Since that was quick, let's also update for Failure Analysis. StarTree: There is no HQ topic since last time and Casey started merging some of those many tags! Casey: The next one I am looking at is HBT. It was about key keeping habits. The solution we had was to define a protocol. I think protocol needs a code as it is different from our other solutions. StarTree: Added PTC (Protocol)! Zoey: FLD is an area code that means Field. It is a code about where the failure occurs or is discovered. Tanya: For now let's group it among Severity/Effect. Zoey: There should be a better term for it. Let me ask ChatGPT. ChatGPT: "Defect detection phase" is a stage in software development where defects are identified and addressed before the software is released. Examples of defect dection phases are: requirements phase, design phase, testing phase, and Production phase Zoey: Does this apply to us? Ledia: I think the main question is why we are tagging it and how would tagging it FLD help us. Tanya: Normally a failure at the field is what we want to avoid because it is costly to fix. We are not tracking costs. But FLD failures usually need to be fixed ASAP. So for me that tag is more about severity than anything else. We are marking it in order to revisit and make sure that they won't happen again. Ledia: Then I would agree that for us, for now, it is a severity tag. We could change it later. Zoey: Added. Ledia: I think there is something wrong with our analysis tracking. Many of the items have a tag but not a counter measure tag. Yet they are marked done. Tanya: StarTree, could you mark all entries that have a countermeasure "2"? StarTree: The script how counts 54 unresolved failures! Tanya: I think we can check them off within this month on the field. So let's continue with naming the failure codes. Casey: There is LST which means Lost. It is for things that got lost. Tanya: Severity code. Casey: By the way I couldn't find the bicycle bells. I thought I brought them to the garage. Or at least to the kitchen. LRRH: @Kisaragi have you seen the bells? Kisaragi: I did not see the bells. Zoey: Where did you see them last, Casey? Casey: In my room. But I don't see them anymore. The point was, I think I was bringing them from my room to the garage this morning. Tanya: What else did you bring? Casey: A stack of shopping bags to be donated. The stack of bags are still in the garage, but I don't see the bells. Casey: I searched the trash cans also but don't see them. Tanya: I hope they turn up. StarTree: Added LST...! Tanya: I think we are almost done with all the codes. Let's finish them. StarTree: The last one is SFT and LSL about an incident of a near-miss head injury! Ledia: I think SFT means safety. That could be severity code. But what is LSL? StarTree: StarTree does not have a record on who added the tag, but Red was the person invovled in the incident! LRRH: I took a shortcut and hit something of an odd shape. It broke protect. Tanya: If no one remember what LSL means lets remove it. Ledia: What is the countermeasure of this incident? LRRH: Look up before standing up? Notice hazards before approaching? StarTree: That entry currently has a tag "TSN" Ledia: I don't see how TSN can be a countermeasure. I think it would be a protocol. Tanya: I think that was probably because all training protocols should be in TSN. But I don't remember there is a safety training section. Tanya: StarTree please add a safety section and add review safety section as a CAL entry. StarTree: StarTree finds that there is already a section on safety at the HTML version of the TSN! There is a note "Choose a path clear of hazards to the head." StarTree now adds, "Look up before standing up or stand up slowly." Tanya: We shall review and add that that section regularly. Safety review is now added to the calendar. @Cardinal is now Rank A. Tanya thanks all for the improvements.

202207161423|Philosophies

 202305020912|📈 Insider Trading {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305020912","music":""}
Insider Trading
Laws
Insider trading is the illegal practice of buying or selling securities based on non-public information, giving insiders an unfair advantage and undermining public trust in financial markets. It can result in civil and criminal charges, including fines and imprisonment.
Example: Martha Stewart (2004)
Martha Stewart was convicted in 2004 of insider trading after receiving information from her broker about the sale of ImClone Systems stock. She sold the stock just before the FDA rejected the company's application for a new drug, which caused the stock price to drop. She was sentenced to prison, home confinement, and supervised release, and was fined and banned from serving as a public company director or officer for five years. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.biography.com/business-leaders/martha-stewart","desc":"[Ref]"}
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202305020912","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"📈","title":"Insider Trading","subtitle":"Laws","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/04/20/08/21/entrepreneur-1340649_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Zoey","description":"","card-text":""}
{"cmd":"ll","desc":"Rain","en":"I didn't think it would rain so hard.","ja":"こんなに雨が降るとは思いませんでした。"}
Criminal Laws
[202305022202]
Law Game Part 9
◀ 2023 MAY 02 TUE 10:02PM
Paladin Hall
⭐
The Law Game continues. Natalie: Please be aware that the content may not be appropriate for children. Natalie: Please note that we play this game from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions.
[12] Judicial discretion
🏛️Natalie: If a court feels that a statute is undesirable, even though the statute's meaning is clear, can the court refuse to uphold it?
Tanya: With separation of power, I would say no. The court may only choose the lightest sentence. Natalie: Under the "Plain Meaning Rule", if the language and meaning of a statute are clear, the court must apply it with the exception if it would lead to oppression, injustice, or an absurd result.
[13] Exceptions
🏛️Natalie: A state has a ciminal statute that mandates that remarriage by a person who has a living spouse will constitute bigamy, unless the spouse has been inexplicably missing for at least seven years. A woman remarries three years after her husband disappears, under the good faith belief that the husband is dead. Is she guilty of bigamy according to the majority rule?
Sasha: Yes, because the statue is clear. Natalie: Yes, under the principle "expressio unius, exclusio alterius," inclusion of one implies the intention to exclude others. In this case, since the statute has an exception of a seven year wait, but did not include a good faith exception, most courts would decide that the legislature did not intend for there to be a good faith exception.
[14] Change in Statute
🏛️Natalie: A man is serving a two-year jail sentence for serving alcohol to a person of age 20. While he is impriosoned, the statute is repealed in part, such that the offense only covers minors under age 18, instead of 21. Must the man be released from prison?
Casey: I hope the answer is yes. Sasha: But he was convicted while the legal age was 21. He knew it was illegal. Tanya: I think if a law is 'repealed', it should be interpreted as if the law never existed. So in this case, the man shall be released immediately. Natalie: The term repeal does not imply treating a statute as if it never passed. Repealing a statute does not exonerate a person whose judgement has become final. Some states have a saving provision where prosecution may continue with the statute that exists at the time of the crime.
Natalie thanks all for playing!

 202305030916|🦆 Personal Safety {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305030916","music":""}
Personal Safety
Safety
Quick call for help
☎️ Power Button SOS Sasha: On some smartphones you can call for help with the power button. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.google.com/search?q=smartphone+sos+shortcuts","desc":"[Search]"}
🎈 How to find a lost child
📢 Shout the appearance instead of name Evelyn: At a crowded place, shout the appearance of the child instead of a their name. This prompts other people to help looking for the child. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.boredpanda.com/mom-shares-lifehack-find-missing-child-fast/","desc":"[link]"}
