202207161025|LogFall

 202305031000|🧶 Philosophical Mysteries {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305031000","music":""}
Philosophical Mysteries
Mystery
Consciousness
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://bigthink.com/thinking/4-hardest-unsolved-problems-philosophy/","desc":"[link]"} The consciousness problem is the challenge of explaining how and why we have subjective experiences of the world. It is one of the most fundamental and perplexing questions in philosophy and science. How does the brain produce the mind? How can physical processes give rise to qualia, the felt sensations and emotions that make up our conscious experience?
Existence
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://bigthink.com/thinking/4-hardest-unsolved-problems-philosophy/","desc":"[link]"} The philosophical problem of having something rather than nothing is about the reason for basic existence. It asks why there is anything at all, or why there is not nothing instead of something. This question has been raised by many philosophers and physicists, such as Leibniz, Wittgenstein, and Heidegger. Some possible answers to this question are based on God, gravity, quantum fluctuations, or multiverses. However, none of these answers are conclusive or satisfactory. The problem of having something rather than nothing remains a profound and puzzling mystery.
The Ship of Theseus
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://bigthink.com/thinking/4-hardest-unsolved-problems-philosophy/","desc":"[link]"} The Ship of Theseus is a philosophical puzzle that explores the nature of identity and persistence. It asks whether an object that has all of its parts replaced over time remains the same object or becomes a different one. For example, if a wooden ship is gradually repaired with new planks until none of the original ones remain, is it still the same ship?
The demarcation problem
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://bigthink.com/thinking/4-hardest-unsolved-problems-philosophy/","desc":"[link]"} The demarcation problem is the question of how to distinguish between scientific and non-scientific knowledge. It is a philosophical challenge that has implications for the validity and reliability of different claims and methods. Some possible criteria for demarcation are falsifiability, empirical evidence, testability, and logical consistency.
💬 Discussions

202207161423|Philosophies

 202305071032|🏘️ Healthy Community {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305071032","music":""}
Healthy Community
Principles
Healthy community principles can be followed by a community to improve its metrics on safety and happiness.
🗂️

Select Query

(To be added)
Abundance in skilled personnel
A healthy community has more skilled people to fill community roles than what the community needs. This allows community members to rotate, take breaks, cross-audit, and create as many task forces as needed to handle community needs. Black: To that end, a healthy community provides free training for those skilling up to fill those roles and opportunities to get actual experience.
Belonging and happiness
A healthy community has a high sense of belong and happiness among the member. This is iin-part supported by a community with sufficient ownership and learning so that everyone can find a respectable role in the community. Evelyn: When a community let people fill roles they want, the community becomes more happy.
Caretakers Inclusion
A healthy community provides its caretakers the option to reside in the same community they take care.
Compensation
Majority opinion does not grant permission to rule over the minority, but might help gather compensation to negotiate with the minority.
Competence in handling internal distrubances
A healthy community can handle internal distrubances by itself quicker than calling upon neighboring communities for help. Black: This is not a comment against mutual aid or effective use of shared resources, but a measure of a community health. An analogy is that a person who can stand and support their own weight is more healthy than those who rely on others on support.
People-First Principle
A healthy community addresses the needs of individuals instead of requiring individuals to address the needs of the community.

People-first principle is

Coordinator: "We have a block requesting extra patrol to reduce crime. Please sign up and help them."

People-first principle is not

Leader: "The crime rate in our city is too high, therefore every block must assign a block leader and patrol."
Black: This is not a comment against mutual aid or effective use of shared resources, but a measure of a community health. An analogy is that a person who can stand and support their own weight is more healthy than those who rely on others on support.
Selfcare Principle
A healthy community lets people help each other. Tanya: This principle includes cases where a person helps themself, and does not include cases where a person helps themself through hurting others. Fina: There is no difference if the person appoints a helper that is also the one the community would have assigned. This principle covers that cases when the person wants a helper other than the one the community provides. This principle maintains the person, not the community, has the right to choose their helper.
Upper limit of possessions
A healthy community does not have a mechanism that would allow a person to own so many possessions or resources to the point that some members of the community cannot meet their basic needs. LRRH: Available living places grow slower than available people and technology to do work. As technology advances, the value of a person's work is supposed to go to zero. This means that a sustainable society cannot make people participate in full competition in living spaces. A person should have a living space as long as they are "good enough". The availability of that space comes from having laws against people owning excess living spaces.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202305071032","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"🏘️","title":"Healthy Community","subtitle":"Principles","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2018/05/06/15/48/city-3378773_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Black","description":"","card-text":""}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202305071257|🏅 Citizen Patrol {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305071257","music":""}
Citizen Patrol
Protocol
Citizen Patrol provides a routine opportunity for emergency prevention and preparation.
Citizen Patrol is an organized protocol where voluntary community members patrols the neighborhood for improved safety and awareness of the surrounding.
Purposes & Key Benefits
⭐ Identify safety hazards
⭐ Connect community members
⭐ Skill up community members
⭐ Increase community awareness
⭐ Promote community improvements
⭐ Increase cross-checking and auditing
⭐ Routine practices of emergency protocols

Protocol

Planning
Map the areas requested help. Match helpers to where they can help considering the following:
Minimum Competence
Consider the minimul competence for the helper that would not make the situation worse. Consider not only the skills of the helper, but in combination to the area and those at the area.
Replacement and Reinforcement
In general, the commander center cannot forbid a mutually agreed service between the requester and the helper. For matches that remain risky, offer more competent help as replacement or supervisor as they become available.
Watchers in a Car
Team
Have separate people in the car do the following if they cannot be safely done by the same person: 1) Drive. 2) Record. 3) Report/Call for help.
Setup
Park at a location with good view of the surrounding and easy to drive away if attacked. Park at a spot that makes it clear if someone is appraoching you and not other objects of interest. Park for egress. Lockdoors and close windows except for venting.
If someone suspicious is sighted
Take pictures or video and submit. If they approach, start the engine of the car and identify yourself as a watcher vehicle. If they attack, drive away and sound the horn.
Protocol without technology
This section describes the protocol without the help of technology (smart phone apps).
1️⃣ Establish an incident command center which handles the following: helper roster, who is on patrol and when they should be back, and the list of known issues and hazards. The main task of the command center is to account for the safe return of patrollers and to coordinate efforts to cover needed areas.
2️⃣ Maintaining a list of issues and hazards. This information is collected by patrollers and compiled by the command center. A copy of which allows a patroller confirm the status of an issue, and to look for similar issues that are not reported.
3️⃣ Training Manual. The training manual is adopted to the skill and local issues to help patrollers skill up as they perform inspections.
4️⃣ Quest board. A quest board shows area or time that lack patrol for community members to sign up.
5️⃣ Patroller Safety. The patroller team is not asked to handle any situation that they are not competent in handling. They should notify the command center in such case to call on competent members.
Protocol against lone melee attacker
This is for the context when an attacker with a melee weapon (such as a knife) is on the loose.
1️⃣ Define a relevant scale of protection for people to assess their own safety. The goal is to keep people safe while knowing where the attacker is so that the attacker can be stopped.
2️⃣ Let people move to safe places as much as possible. For people that cannot move to safer places, offer to increase the safety where they are.

Safety measures in order of increasing safety

* Buddy System: Stay or travel with others
* Stay with others with someone ready to record and call for help
* Mobile Sentry: Set up a unit of two or more people in a vehicle that can watch, record, call for help, and retreat as needed. * Sentry Network: Arrange mobile or stationary sentries so that each sentry is within sight of at least one other.
* Stay inside a shelter and observe with remote cameras or drones.

FAQ

Q: Shouldn't professionals do this?
While professional (people who are hired by the community to patrol / inspect) could perform the tasks, having only professionals perform the tasks would deprive the community the opportunity skill up, bond, and develop the passion for taking care of the community. Hiring of professionals may also lead to the following issues that are less likely to happen when the same task is performed by competent and passionate members:
🚩 A professional may hide an issue that they are responsible for fixing.
🚩 A professional may cut corners to reduce their effort for the payment.
🚩 A professional may create or prolong issues for their job security.
🚩 A professional may exploit the community's lack of expertise to charge higher fees or recommend unnecessary work.
A healthy community phases out its reliance on professional but freely skills up its members on all tasks related to the safety and function of the community.
Q: What if there are not enough volunteers?
First, the community needs to have such protocol to confirm that the community has no volunteer because a passion cannot develop if the community does not have an opportunity for it to exist. Once the protocol is in-place, the proportion between professional and volunteer patrols become seamless. The community can hire professionals as need to cover areas that lack volunteers, or offer community credits for needed slots. The protocol allows the professional to have at least one competitor, the voluntary community members, and opens the door for other professional competitors as inspectors or inspector trainers.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202305071257","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"🏅","title":"Citizen Patrol","subtitle":"Protocol","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2022/04/24/08/08/park-7153125_960_720.png","music":"","author":"Black","description":"","card-text":""}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202305071516|🔫 Weapon Ownership {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305071516","music":""}
Weapon Ownership
Philosophy
Weapon ownership laws resolve the situations when different sub-populations hold different views on weapon ownership. The fundamental philosophy is the same as the treatment of possession and transportation of hazardous substances involving zoning and declarations.

Principles

Optional Zones
An optional zone is a zone where a person does not "need" to enter. The owner of such zone may impose any rules regarding the entrance requirement, including whether the zone allows carrying of weapons of any kind.

Example

A restaurant may declare that it is a no-gun zone. Then anyone who enters with guns is violating the restaurant owner's autonomy.
Violator pays for enforcement costs
The violator of a law is responsible for the cost of the enforcement of the law. When the enforcement is prepare initiailly without a known violator, a community could solicit backers (sponsors). When a violator is found, the violator pays back the backers.
Compensate dissenters outside optional zone
To enact a law that restricts civil rights, promoters of the law have a responsibility to negotiate and compensate the dissenters in the zone. The dissenters are under no obligation to compromise.

Example:

A community wants to become a gun-free zone but there are dissenting residence in the community. A moral resolution is to negotiate with the dissenters and compensate for their costs to relocate.
Popularity does not justify infringement of rights, but could help spread the burden of compensation.
Hazard Range
Possession and transportation of any hazardous substance requires notification to anyone entering the hazard range if the substance becomes active to do harm. An optional zone has the right to waive such notice when it has enough clearance to contain the hazard range entirely within its boundaries.

Example:

A person has a gun with a range of 300m. To carry it loaded, the person needs to notify anyone within range. Since people 300m away cannot be expected to be able to see the gun, a siren might be required when the gun becomes loaded. An optional zone may waive the requirement of siren for qualified/licensed individuals.
Individual responsibility of violations
An intruder who violates the laws of an optional zone is responsible for the crime, not the other members of the zone they originate unless it is an invasion promoted by the originating zone.

Example:

A person carries a gun from a non-gun-free zone into a gun-free zone. While the gun-free zone may hold the intruder responsible for the enforcement of the entire gun-free zone, the gun-free zone does not have a standing to hold the non-gun-free zone responsible for checking people who exit the zone.

Additional from Hospitalian Laws

When an intruder is caught, the violated zone becomes eligible to, after a fair trial, execute the intruder and gain the corresponding area from the intruder's zone of origin. It is the responsibility of the intruder or its zone of origin to bargain for alternative resolutions that would prevent future occurences.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202305071516","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"🔫","title":"Weapon Ownership","subtitle":"Laws","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/03/13/19/29/sword-2140940_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Black","description":"","card-text":""}
Log Fall
[202305071023]
Healthy Community
◀ 2023 MAY 07 SUN 10:23AM
Log Fall Dungeon
📯
This discussion is for the topic Principles for Healthy Community. If time allows we could continue with Weapon Laws and Citizen Patrol.
📯 Principles of Healthy Community node
Black: This topic came about at Nextdoor. I listed some principles across several posts. I think there should be a node listing all of them.
StarTree: There is a similar node 202301092123|Better World Metrics, should there be a new node? Black: I think for now please make a new node first. We might merge them later. StarTree: The new node is 202305071032|here! Black: There will be a number of principles so please add the search structure. StarTree: Done! Black: So I will start adding principles. We could further organize them as needed.
Abundance in skills to fill roles
🏛️Black: A healthy community has more skilled people to fill community roles than what the community needs. This allows community members to rotate, take breaks, and have the skill necessary to cross-monitor the performance of those performing the role.
Black: To that end, a healthy community provides free training for willing individuals to skill up to fill those roles and opportunities to get actual experience.
Effect: Immediate Local Response
🏛️Black: Since a healthy community has more skilled personnel than what is needed, a healthy community seamlessly calls upon the community to handle emergencies. A healthy community can handle internal distrubance by itself faster than calling for outside help.
Black: This is not a comment against mutual aid arrangements with other communities. This is just a metric on what "healthy" means, as in a healthy person can stand on their own feet and support their own weight without relying on someone else who can do more than support their own weight.
Black: What other principles do you think are there? I think we should add at least one more from someone else before moving onto the next topic. Evelyn: Shouldn't there be a principle on happiness? That a healthy community is happy? Black: I think I do see a slight difference in metrics and principles. I think happiness is a metric, and the principle for that would be about how a community improves on that metric. Tanya: Let's see what Evelyn puts first.
Belonging and Happiness
💗Evelyn: A healthy community has a high sense of belong and happiness among the member. This is iin-part supported by a community with sufficient ownership and learning so that everyone can find a respectable role in the community.
Evelyn: I think this point is quite close to what Black said but my focus is that if you let people fill roles they want make the community more happy. Tanya: Instead of deciding what are metrics and what are principles, let's just record everything and sort them later as needed. Even if they sound duplicate. Tanya: Maybe if there are 20 or more entries, we would consider sorting them. Black: Agreed.
Meeting needs
⭐LRRH: A healthy community is where people's basic needs are met. And a healthy way for that to happen is to ensure that no one can amass excess possession in a way that prevents a community member from getting what they need.
LRRH: I feel that this section could be really long because presumably Each philosophy is based on some principle about what a healthy community should have. Are we really going to list all types of freedoms and rights here? Black: I think a difference between a metric and a principle is that a principle can simultaneously improve multiple metrics. So, as long as you follow the principles, your community will improve regardless what metric people use to measure health. Tanya: So you start with a metric, and come up with principles that would let a community improve on such metric. LRRH: So in this case, you mean meeting needs is a metric, but the concept "people shouldn't have excess possessions in a way that prevent others from meeting their basic needs" is a principle. Black: I think yes. LRRH: Then I'll call that the upper limit principle.
Caretakers inclusion
🏛️Fina: A healthy community provides its caretakers the option to reside in the same community they take care.
Fina: This ties into what Red said. It doesn't tell you how it is done, but you would know if it is violated. Evelyn: I think even though the principle doesn't show the path, it is important as a principle.
Black: I think this is a good number to start. Let's switch gear and made nodes for the other topics. Tanya: I think we should add the Arcacian Principle, at least the first half.
Let people help each other
🏛️Tanya: A healthy community lets people help each other. This principle includes cases where a person helps themself, and does not include cases where a person helps themself through hurting others.
Fina: In Stewardism, the shorter name for that is Self-care Principle. Evelyn: How do you draw the connection that letting people help themselves result in a more healthy community? Fina: When a person has wants to choose self-help or appoint a willful helper and the system forbids so, the person stays without help for longer. There is no difference if the person appoints a helper that is also the help the system would have assigned. Evelyn: Okay.
@Carrot is now rank A. StarTree: Citizen Patrol now has a 202305071257|node!
Citizen Patrol
💡Black: Citizen Patrol is an organized protocol where members of a community patrols the neighborhood for improved safety and awareness of the surrounding.
Black: This patrol routine is not meant to happen only when the community is looking for a criminal on the loose. It is also for noticing safety hazards, areas for maintenance, or just exercise and community bonding. The organization methods follows the incident command structure which is also used during emergencies. Black: Example of situations where a citizen patrol would help: 1) Provide a routine opportunity to practice incident command. 2) Provide a routine opportunity for community members to know each other. 3) Orient the community members on how they may improve the safety and quality of the surrounding. 4) Identify naturally occuring emergencies such as people who collapse from a stroke. 5) Identify or deter man-made situations such as car crashes and crimes. Black: Q: Why shouldn't the police do this? Black: A: The police can certainly do this, but when the police force is small and does this exclusively this could take away the community's opportunity to be familiar with the protocol and their readiness in using it to handle emergencies.
💡Black: Protocol. The following shows the general protocol independent to the technology that implements it. (It is understood that using integrated smart phone apps can make this easy, but the general protocol is meant to be functional even after all electronics are fried.) Black: Establish an incident command center. The role of the command center is to track patrollers so that it knows when a team of patrols has not returned. As a helper/patroller, register or notify the center before making the loop. Black: The command center keeps log of incidents and inform the next team to check for status updates. Did areas marked as hazardous get worse? Black: The command center updates its safety inspection and training manual and adapt it to include local points according to the skill levels of the citizen patrols/safety inspectors. Black: When there is a time or area where patrols are needed, the command center creates a quest for citizens to sign up. Black: In all cases, a team is not meant to handle any situation they are not comfortable in handling. They should inform the command center of all emergencies so the center can dispatch appropriate help.
Black: That's all I can think of that is directly about citizen patrol. What else do others want to add or change? Tanya: @StarTree please first post that on the node. StarTree: Done! Sasha: What if people don't have the time to do that, or what if they want to be compensated for doing so? Black: In a quest society, the normal compensation is community credit. If you sign up for a slot in demand you get more credits. The main difference between that and the status quo is that the community can dynamically offset the need to hire anyone when it itself has enough passion to take care of itself. Black: But if the system has no mean to do so from the start, then the community loses an opportunity to develop its own passion in that area. Tanya: I think in terms of content that node is sufficient and we could move on to or start the weapon node. StarTree: The node is 202305071516|here!
Weapon Ownership
🏛️Black: The main principle relevant to weapon ownership laws are: 1) An opt in zone is free to set its rules regarding its members such as weapon ownership requirements. 2) A person carrying hazardous substance of any kind has the responsibility to inform its surrounding about the hazard they are carrying.
Black: Together, this means that an opt-in zone can define for itself what weapons can or cannot be concealed or carried. Black: On the Nextdoor thread there was also a principle that if a law cannot infringe on a person's right to self-defense unless it applies to an opt-in zone. But a tax-funded zone is not an opt-in zone if the taxpayer can't opt out of that funding. With that I gave examples on what laws would infringe on such right and what laws would not. StarTree: StarTree doesn't know what to start with! Black: Intro: Weapon ownership laws resolve the situations when different sub-populations hold different views on weapon ownership. The fundamental philosophy is the same as the treatment of possession and transportation of hazardous substances involving zoning and declarations. Black: Principle: Opt-in Zones / Preferential Zones. An optional zone is a zone where a person does not "need" to enter. The owner of such zone may impose any rules regarding the entrance requirement, including whether the zone allows carrying of weapons of any kind. Black: Violator is responsible for the cost of enforcement. When the enforcement is prepare initiailly without a known violator, a community could solicit backers (sponsors). When a violator is found, the violator pays back the backers. Black: Compensate dissenters outside optional zone: To enact a law that restricts civil rights, promoters of the law have a responsibility to negotiate and compensate the dissenters in the zone. The dissenters are under no obligation to compromise. LRRH: Popularity does not justify infringement of rights, but could help spread the burden of compensation. Black: Range of Caution: Possession and transportation of any hazardous substance requires notification to anyone entering the "blast range" if the substance becomes active to do harm. An optional zone has the right to waive such notice when it has enough clearance to contain the blast range entirely within its boundaries. Black: Individual responsibility of violations: An intruder who violates the laws of an optional zone is responsible for the crime, not the other members of the zone they originate unless it is an invasion promoted by the originating zone. Tanya: Additional from Hospitalian laws: When an intruder is caught, the violated zone becomes eligible to, after a fair trial, execute the intruder and gain the corresponding area from the intruder's zone of origin, as if the intruder decided to migrate to the violated zone for the rest of their life. It becomes the responsibility of the intruder or its zone of origin to bargain for alternative resolutions that would prevent future occurences. Evelyn: I think that added part is a little scary and prone for abuse. Tanya: Without it the baseline of negotiation is unclear. Tanya: Because the violated thing is not an individual, any member of the violated zone may vouch for the intruder and become their supervisor. Evelyn: If someone carries a gun into a zone, learns that it is a gun-free zone, and on their way out was caught, then they could be executed? Tanya: The moment you found that you broken a serious rule you are supposed to turn yourself in and be escorted out or have your gun impounded until you leave. Reason is applied to judge whether the offender is amiss or a malicious intruder. Hospitalian zones are normally not weapon-free, so in this case we are really talking about someone claiming that have smuggled in high power weapon "by mistake", which is absurd. Tanya: If you own those weapon you should already know the law of the zones you are heading. Tanya: I would like to check responses and react to responses current at Nextdoor.
Obstacles
🔍Tanya: So I was reading the responses and am trying to name the obstacles in the discussion. It seems that a main obstacle is that people cannot cater the concept that current system has a problem, or that they could help address that problem.
Sasha: Could you be more specific? Tanya: For example, on one night the attacker was spotted by a stationary group of witnesses three times, but the group could not produce one photo or video about any of those exchanges, including the last one where the attacker came into melee range and attacked with a knife. That means that the group did not have the capability or readiness to record. But no one is admitting that as a factual defficiency. Sasha: They seem territorial. They don't want other people to look at the problem they haven't solved. Tanya: We need a node and countermeasure against that behavior.
Tanya thanks all for answering the call.

 202305082225|👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Brothers and Sisters {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305082225","music":""}
Brothers and Sisters
Puzzle
A girl has an equal number of brothers and sisters, but each brother only has half as many brothers and sisters. What is the correct number of brothers and sisters?

Show Answer

Four sisters and three brothers.

Log Fall
[202305092159]
Discussion CHK
◀ 2023 MAY 09 TUE 9:59PM
Log Fall Dungeon
📯
For the discussion at Nextdoor, I think there is a lot to explore and learn even if there is no reply. I started a CHK section in the Google Sheets. Maybe we also need a Google Doc for annotations.
Tanya: What is the format of this thread? Evelyn: I am not sure. 😅 I think the document should start with a summary of the prompt and where the participants stand. After that maybe extended explanations and analysis. Evelyn: Somehow we should also look at how things are said to improve future discussions. But I am not sure where would be a good place for that. Such as whether it should be at the end of the document, or an entirely separate document. Tanya: I think if it is fair it could be in the same document. Although it is hard to imagine that wouldn't make some participants angry. Sasha: I think that is part of our puzzle: How to point out is misconduct in a way that makes people want to behave better. Black: Let's start with the prompt and summary of standpoints. Black: The context was that a serial killing started happening, and someone (an ordinary citizen) asked if there is more they could do. StarTree: (At this point the group switched to the document. Points will be accounted at the Guild Log!) Evelyn: Maybe we should try to keep logging our discussion for the document here. I'll try to summarize next time. 😅 Evelyn thanks all for creating the document.

202208250038|Cardinal Quest

 202305102255|🍓 Cardinal Core {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305102255","music":""}
Advantage and Disadvantage
Advantage: Roll an extra die for each advantage and succeed if any roll succeeds.
Disadvantage: Roll an extra die for each disadvantage and fail if any roll fails.
Advantage and disadvantages cancel out each other when applied to the same roll.
Advantages can be gained from in-game and outside-game reason as the GM finds appropriate to encourage roleplay or to perform real life tasks.
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X_DdGRjtwAo","desc":"📺 Advantage Math"}
Approach

FATE Accelerated

Approach is a simplification of 18 FATE CORE skills into 6: Careful, Clever, Flashy, Forceful, Quick, Sneaky.

Cardinal Core

Approaches (as defined in FATE Accelerated) are zero-cost skills (as recognized in Cardinal Core). The player character gets an advantage when performing an action they are recognized for.
Combat
Magic Bakery Mod: Similar to hitpoints, combat skills can be imported based on a player's actual physical ability. A basic attack deals 1 damage. A character's skill proficiency determines whether their attack would connect if the target does not dodge. Armor can be used to negate damage. An armor rating of 1 negates an attack that deals 1 damage or lower. Healing skills can be used to recover hit points.
Hit Point

Magic Bakery

Player Character hit points are based on actual constitution of the player according to the following guideline:
ConstitutionHit Points
Beast / Monsters ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Exceptionally Tough❤️❤️❤️❤️
Adult / Fit ❤️❤️❤️
Teenager / Weak ❤️❤️
Child / Fragile ❤️
Item

Item Type

Gear An item to be equiped, as opposed to a consumable item.
Supply An item that is consumable.

Item Rarity

Legendary An item that retains memory per user.
Common An item that is easily obtained.
Quest

Cardinal Core

A Quest is an declared opportunity to for players to earn credits. Basic parts of defining a quest include a list of objectives and a socring metric. Credits are used by players to equip their characters with skills beyond their actual abilities.
Skill

Cardinal Core

Game Skill proficiency mirrors a player's actual proficiency, or are rewarded using guild credits. A Skill Test refers to the steps to determine the proficiency when a player wants to add a skill to their character. Cardinal: To roll for skill placement, the DM let the player roll with a starting advantage until they get a ➖.
Rank Success Rate Dice Roll
SSS ~0.8% ➕➕➕➕➕➕➖
SS ~1.5% ➕➕➕➕➕➖
S ~3% ➕➕➕➕➖
A 6.25% ➕➕➕➖
B 12.5% ➕➕➖
C 25% ➕➖
D 50% ➖

Magic Bakery Mod

Skill proficiency is described in an S-ranking system where each letter corresponds to the probability of success. During a game, the success rate is determined by dice roll.

Rank Success Rate Dice Roll
S (100%) No need to roll
A 87.5% Roll with double advantage
B 75% Roll with advantage
C 50% Roll once
D 25% Roll with disadvantage
Translations
Real life situations where useful peacemaker skills are translated into game situations.

Sizing a situation

Scouting
Zoey: Know the scope of the situation to plan accordingly.

Preparation

Gearing up / Restock
P4: Be prepared to get many things down efficiently.

Simplify a situation

Debuff
Evelyn: Make yourself comfortable.

Searching information

Spell Casting
P4: The longer you take, the longer it takes.

Quick & Precise Work

Shuriken Throwing
P4: Maintain focus for better hit rate.

Handling Emergency

Tanking Adds
Tanya: Deal with small quick tasks before turn snowball into something bigger.

202212090038|Adventurers' Hall

 202305110938|🍍 Intelligence {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305110938","music":""}
Intelligence
Skill
"Looking sharp!"
"Naturally."
Intelligent people are effective in how they live and handle themselves. You could become more intelligent by tackling inefficiencies in everyday life.
Being Punctual
Being punctual involves knowing yourself, the discipline to manage yourself, and the foresight to prepare for the occassion.
Being Observant
Intelligent people notice things around them, including things to be cautious about and things to be appreciated. Do you notice what is dangerous around you? Do you notice areas where you can make a difference? Do you notice when others make an effort to improve things? Can you identify a person's skill level, emotions, and intentions?
Argument Your Capacity
Intelligent people do not let their physical and mental limits limit their effectiveness. Can't remember everything that is important? Write it down, put it on a calendar, create a routine. Let nothing stop you from doing what is good.
Making Eye Contact
Being able to make eye contact is a sign of confidence in yourself and your relation with the person you are looking at. If you find that you cannot make good eye contact, are you not ready to interact? Are you confused or uncertain about the relation between you and others? Intelligent people resolve those issues and identify the role they have in making each interaction pleasant, rewarding, and effective.
Solving Problems
Intelligent people can solve problems and identify when others are really asking for a problem to be solved. When a problem is not a solitary puzzle, being able to identify the problems, gather information from people who might be reluctant to disclose, and organize people of different interests to collaborate for an effective resolution are all parts of problem-solving.
Masterful Vibe
Intelligent people can read the atmosphere and lighten the room. They can respectfully identify and deal with all situations. Doing so includes being able to look after oneself, dressing appropriately, and having enough understanding of the environment and people involved to make oneself naturally fitting and uplifting to the situation.

Guild
[202305141243]
Tenants
◀ 2023 MAY 14 SUN 12:43PM
Magic Bakery
📯
Let's continue the discussion from "Yesterday" MBST. LRRH: Magic Bakery Standard Time. Zoey: 🤣
📯 Overall Policy
LRRH: The Magic Bakery residents section has tenants who don't follow "rules" or are late on rent. Last time we were talking about house remaking the house rules. At the same time there is a CHK section about this issue. I think right now we should discuss the overall intention and to update the CHK.
Tanya: I think the residential section needs its own charter. But you may consider that a lower priority than updating CHK. LRRH: So far a charter is for defining what actions are worth guild credits. So that would basically be Charter 27, but with only maintenance of the residential section. Tanya: There you can define the residency requirements, which are presummably different from the requirements to earn guild XP. Since you don't need to be a resident to earn Guild XP. LRRH: Okay. So, the requirements: I would say that the main requirement is that you need to be a good person, such as not cheating about rules and not hiding when you break things. To me, that is more important than the ability to "pay rent". Evelyn: What if someone who is currently a resisdent doesn't meet the requirement? Should they be evicted? LRRH: I think the answer is Yes. And I want to argue that it is Arcacian to do so because awarding recidency to someone who breaks rule over someone who does not would be injustice to those who choose to be good. Evelyn: What if they have nowhere else to go? Ledia: What if they do? LRRH: I think for some of the violations, it is just a matter of living style. There should be plenty of places where they would be more compatible. If we don't "kick them out", we can't create the home we want. We are sacrificing for no reason. Sasha: I agree with Red. Evelyn: What if they can change their behavior and be compatible? Sasha: The point is that they don't want to. Otherwise they won't be breaking the rules. And if there are better places out there, why would we want to trouble outselves in asking them to change? There are other places where they can be they way they want. Evelyn: But they are here, so there is something they want here. Zoey: Because the rent is cheap. XD Ledia: The guild needs to be able to tell if it is being exploited. Evelyn: I need evidence that they could be elsewhere. Zoey: That is just rental ads. XD Evelyn: There is only one other place of the same price range. If they have problem paying rent now they would have problem paying that. Zoey: I see at least two. You can tell them to start looking or they would miss good deals. LRRH: I want to switch gear and first talk about what I want and new plans for the place.
🧭 House Plans
LRRH: Here are some plans for the residential section to help promote Arcacian values.
Smoke Free: I want the place to be smoke free including the yards. LRRH: There is currently 1 violator. They smoke in the backyard and leaves buds there. They don't clean up until asked to do so. But even if they clean up, I don't want the place to have smoking because there are kids nearby.
Cleaning up: People who use the common area should clean up. LRRH: I think there is at least 1, but possibly only 1 violator.
Resource Library: I want to have a section where people can come and check out items. LRRH: The plan is to use the garage. There we could place equipment and board games for people to check out. There is currently 1 violator preventing this from happening by having clutters and an inoperable car in the garage.
Quiet Hours: I want the place to be quiet at night. LRRH: This should be quite easily done by requiring headphones at night. There is currently 1 violator.
Tanya: How many violators are there total? LRRH: Two. The first three issues are for violator 1. The last issue is for violator 2. Ledia: And you meant both of them are behind on rent? LRRH: Yes. Tanya: I think among the issues, Smoking is the biggest issue. If someone is smoking outside, others can't open their windows. Tanya: Next in severity is cleaning up after oneself. Ledia: I don't think someone can just quit smoking even if they really want to stay. But instead of telling them: "I want this place to be smoke free", you should tell them all plans at once so that they don't quit smoking just for you to say, "now I want this place to be clean", and then "I want your car out of the garage." Zoey: I think you could just say you have other plans for the place without saying what those plans are. Unless they ask. Ledia: I think they would ask for sure, and if your initial message is too short it would sound really cold. Zoey: I guess that's true. 🤔 LRRH: Are we at the point of crafting a message for Violator 1? The points being smoking, keeping places clean, and car in garage. Sasha: Yes. Let's get it rolling.
📝 Draft Message to Violator 1
Zoey: Hmm.. I asked ChatGPT to create a message: ChatGPT: Dear [Tenant's Name],
I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to follow up on my previous message regarding a few important matters that I think will contribute to a more comfortable and enjoyable living environment for everyone in the building.
I wanted to kindly remind all tenants that smoking is not permitted in any outdoor areas, including the yards. As you may be aware, smoking can be detrimental to both the health and comfort of other tenants in the building, and I would like to ensure that everyone is able to enjoy a smoke-free living space, both indoors and outdoors.
In addition to maintaining a smoke-free environment, I would like to reiterate the importance of keeping the kitchen and common areas clean and tidy, as well as clearing any clutter and inoperable cars from the garage.
Thank you for your cooperation in these matters. By working together, we can create a more comfortable and enjoyable living environment for all tenants.
If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to me.
Best regards,
[Your Name]
Ledia: I think that is too robotic. LRRH: Could I start with what I would have said and upgrade it to something more understandable? LRRH: Hello [name], I think I want to make the house and the yards smoke free and add furniture in the garage. I think it is unreasonable to ask you to stop smoking, so I want you to know the plans as soon as possible so you may start looking for a place well before fall when school starts. If you want to stay by quitting smoking, I still want the kitchen area to be kept clean after each use and to free up space in the garage. Could you start looking and plan to move out by June, or if you sign a lease starts in the fall, by the time the lease starts? Ledia: I think you need a timeline of when they are expected to be out. LRRH: By the end of June? "Could you start looking and plan to move out by June, or if you sign a lease that starts in the fall, by the time the lease starts? Evelyn: I think you don't need the part, "I think it is unreasonable to ask you to stop smoking." LRRH: So if I send this message, we still need another notice for eviction. Evelyn: How about you first ask them if they can manage not smoking in the yards? LRRH: I think it is hard to create that casual opportunity because it is hard to ask without showing the whole picture and hard to do so without another tenant listening. Evelyn: Okay. LRRH: So next is the prepare the actual notice for eviction. It should be prepared now and sent by next week to keep the move out day of June 30. Zoey: For the record, the message is, "Hello [Name], I want to make the house and the yards smoke-free and have more space in the garage. If you want to stay by not smoking here, I still want the kitchen area to be kept clean after each use, free up space in the garage, and for your past due rent to decrease every two weeks. The four issues together seem too much to resolve, so I want to let you know now so you may start looking for a place before fall when school starts. Could you please start looking and plan to move out by June 30? (Or if you sign a lease in June that starts in the fall, by the time the lease starts.)" Zoey: And ChatGPT says, "Yes, that sounds good! "Past due rent" is a better term to use than "rent owed" as it implies that the rent is already late and needs to be caught up on." Zoey: Also, "A responsible tenant should take prompt action to address the issues mentioned in the message. If they are unable or unwilling to comply with the requests, they should start looking for a new place to live as soon as possible. It is important to communicate with the landlord to discuss any concerns or questions they may have and to work towards a mutually beneficial resolution. Additionally, they should make every effort to keep up with their rent payments and follow the terms of their lease agreement until they move out." Zoey: And, "If the tenant doesn't respond, you could try reaching out to them again to confirm whether they received your message and understand the situation. If they still do not respond or refuse to comply with your requests, you may need to consider taking legal action, such as filing for eviction or hiring a lawyer to negotiate a solution. It's important to consult with your local landlord-tenant laws and regulations to ensure that you are following the proper legal procedures." LRRH: So the next section to prepare is "filing for eviction"
🏛️ Eviction Process
⭐Zoey: There are some pointers from ChatGPT that I will add to CHK.
LRRH: Last time the pay-or-quit notice was a PDF form. Zoey: I don't think anything had changed since. I am adding a link to the form at CHK. LRRH: Okay. In that case I think we could wait until next week.
Little Red Riding Hood thanks all for the discussion.

202301011739|Criminal Law

 202305141649|⚖️ Crime Severity {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305141649","music":""}
Felony
A felony is a serious crime that subjects other to willful invasion. In reciprocative justice, the default countermeasure of felony is the death penalty. The burden is on the perpetuator to propose another resolution that the victim would accept.

Typical Definition

A serious crime punishable by either imprisonment exceeding one year or by death. Examples: Murder, manslaughter, mayhem, rape, robbery, sodomy, larceny, arson, burglary. 202302242000|[4]

Reciprocative Justice Definition

A crime involving willful intrusion of someone else's property. Reciprocative measures include imprisonment and death. Examples: the examples in typical definition are also felonies in reciprocative law. 202302242000|[4]
Misdemeanor

Typical Definition

A lighter crime punishable by a fine or imprisonment up to one year. Examples: Battery, assault. 202302242000|[4]

Reciprocative Justice Definition

A misdemeanor is the offender breaking a demeanor rule (a code of conduct) of an opt-in zone. A misdemeanor warrants revoking one's membership of the zone, and being expelled from the zone. For example, a hate crime in a zero-hate zone is a misdemeanor. 202302242000|[4]
Infraction

Typical Definition

A lighter crime punishable by a fine but not imprisonment. Examples: Littering. 202302242000|[4]

Reciprocative Justice Definition

A crime that does not warrant revoking one's membership or imprisonment. 202302242000|[4]
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202305141649","parentid":"202301011739","parentname":"Criminal Law","icon":"⚖️","title":"Crime Severity","subtitle":"Law","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2012/12/27/19/40/chain-link-72864_960_720.jpg","music":"","author":"Tanya","description":"","card-text":""}
Puzzle Plaza
[202305141753]
Three goddesses
2023 MAY 14 SUN 5:53PM
Puzzle Plaza
⭐
Hey hey hey! Let's see who gets this hard logic puzzle!
Mikela: Your adventuring party stumbles upon a tea party of three goddesses. Truth always tells the truth. Lies always lies. Dice tells the truth or lies randomly. The goddesses challenge you to identify who is who by asking only three Yes or No questions. You may direct each question to any single one of them. What should you ask?
Sasha: I am pretty sure Tanya got this before. Mikela: Then let's see who is the second person to get it! Ledia: If you ask one of them 'Are you Truth?", then only Dice would possibly say no. Then, IF the one you asked happened to say No, you know that that is Dice. Next, you ask one of the remaining two if that goddess is Dice. To that second question, only Truth would say Yes. By then you know all three. Sasha: What if the first answer is Yes? Then you don't know anything at all. I think each question should be able to make progress. Zoey: I still remember something special about Tanya's answer. It had to do with asking a goddess about another goddess. But I don't remember what the question was. Black: What if you ask Goddess A, "Can you affirm that she will say YES if I ask Goddess B whether you are Truth?" Suppose A is Truth and B is Lies. Then A would say No. Suppose A is Truth and B is Dice, A would also say No. Suppose A is Lies and B is Truth, A would say Yes. If A is Lies and B is Dice, A would also say Yes. If A is Dice, the answer could be either. Ledia: Then maybe you can ask the same question to Goddess B about C? Zoey: I remember the answer was something like that. Let's see if it works.
Zoey: Suppose A is Truth, B Lies, and C is Dice. And you ask A, "Do you know for sure if B will confirm you are Truth?" Then A would certainly reply "No". From our perspective, A can only be Truth or Dice. Zoey: Now we ask B the same question about C. B will say Yes. From our perspective, we know that B can only be Lies or Dice. Zoey: Now you repeat the question on C about A. If C says Yes, C is either Lies or Dice. Then, together, only A can be Truth. But we don't know if B or C is Lies. Black: Suppose we represent the possible identites are TLD, TDL, LTD, LDT, DTL, DLT, whomever we ask, we cannot eliminate the D, but we could eliminate the D on another column and get a pattern TLD, LTD, DTL, DLT before asking the second question. Black: If we can get that pattern where the middle goddess can only be Truth of Lies, then we can just ask whether she is Dice and figure the rest with the third question. So the remaining question is how do you know which goddess is not Dice with just the first question. Black: Okay. I figured it out.
👑 Solution
Black: Name the goddesses 1, 2, and 3 and ask Goddess 1 if their identities are in one of these orders: "Truth, Lies, and Dice" or "Lies, Dice, and Truth". (Or if the goddesses are sitting around a circular tea table, ask Goddess 1, "Is Truth sitting to the left of Lies?" Black: If Goddess 1 says Yes, then the possibilities are TLD, LTD, DTL, DLT. If Goddess 1 says No, the possibilities are TDL, LDT, DTL, DLT. So, depending whether the first answer is Yes or No, one of the seats has either Truth or Lies. Black: A second question to the goddess at that seat "Are you Dice?" will identify that goddess because she cannot be Dice, so only Lies would say Yes. Black: After finding the either Truth or Lies with the second question, ask her whether Goddess 1 is Dice and interpret her answer accordingly. Tanya: That was my answer. Mikela: Congratulation! Sasha: I think this puzzle is sufficiently hard so Tanya and Black could get a CHA WIN. Zoey: For the record, ChatGPT gets this completely wrong. XD Good job figuring this out, cheers!
{"cmd":"next"}

Quest Board
[202305152149]
Chat Post Upgrade
2023 MAY 15 MON 9:49PM
Quest Board
🔔
@Board has a quest of upgrading the chat post. What changes would you like to see?
Ivy: I think the goal is to separate the data from the presentation, so that when we want to change how a post look, we just need to change the code. Evelyn: I think it looks fine right now. Black: Every chat post ends with the discussions button. I think that button should be created by the script instead of hardcoded in the html. Ivy: Yes. StarTree: Should there be a macro at the end of a chat post that becomes the discussions button when a chat node is shown? Black: Let's start with that. Sasha: Is there a way for a chat post to expand and collapse as the same object instead of just showing and hiding a hidden object? Ivy: Yes, it would be a button function that sets the class of the button's parent, and shows the last child of the button's parent. Sasha: I think that is what I want to see. StarTree: Creates macro cmd Next. Testing. Adding loop in function. Done for the next block! StarTree: Now making a new function ShowChatEx. You can now see the effect at the Three goddess node! Ivy: Adding the frame is a little annoying because it shifts the location of the button. Sasha: StarTree please revert that change. StarTree: Done! StarTree thanks all for the ideas! @Board is now Rank B. {"cmd":"next"}

Search Visibility
[202305222205]
Poster Quest
◀ 202305222205
Magic Detectives
⭐
Let's make a proper Arcacian Quest poster.
🔍Ledia: Aren't we supposed to draw Evelyn singing? Sasha: That's more for YouTube. I want to talk about an actual poster for Arcacian Quest/Arcacian Principles. 3B: There is no place to post such a poster. Unless it is the size of a manga page. Tanya: The poster quest node has 12 destinations. Progress on any one of them would be good. Sasha: About five of them are about Arcacian principle. 3B: How about yonkoma for Chapter 11? Tanya: Anything is fine, really... 3B: Any idea for such a yonkoma? LRRH: Chapter 11 is Cooking with Arcacia. I think a manga page about the carrot cake recipe would have a better chance of being funny. Let's do it!

Self-Evaluation
[202305252300]
Self-Evaluation A5
◀ 2023 MAY 25 THU 11:00PM
Whale Nursery
📯
This is a series of monthly self-evaluation discussions. The plan is to create a rubric for each evaluation topic.
📋 [A5] Upgrade Training Manuals
📌Black: This part is about collecting notes, making and upgrading training manuals. Let's define what each grade means.
Black: It seems that this is the first one where the scale might be different. Tanya: Or it could be the same, if we focus on what it means to "Fail" in this requirement. Ledia: It would be a fail if someone asks for training material and it is missing. Sasha: How would that work? People don't normally ask us for training. Evelyn: What about training among ourselves? Sasha: Wouldn't that be the same as A3? Black: I think this task is about turning our internal documents into something sharable. Ideally 100% of our internal documents would have a sharable form. Black: If we use the same scale, then an A would be 88% of our internal documents are shared. Zoey: What are we using for the percentage? Page count? Tanya: I think it should be per topic. Black: Then the first step is to list the topics. Then we can account for how many topics are done. Grade A means 88 or more % is done. Tanya: I am fine with that plan. @StarTree please make a CAL task for creating a list of training topics. StarTree: Done! Black thanks all for the ideas.
{"cmd":"next"}

202212090038|Adventurers' Hall

 202305262224|📯 Leadership {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305262224","music":""}
Leadership
Skill
🏳️ Leadership Goes Wrong
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.boredpanda.com/instead-raises-boss-gave-bonuses-costing-business/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=organic","desc":"🏳️ Misuse of KPI"} Sasha: This is a story of malicious compliance where the employee become de-motivated by KPI and just try to hit the KPI in the expense of other qualities not being tracked.
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.inc.com/minda-zetlin/5-sentences-best-leaders-never-say-according-to-career-experts.html","desc":"🏳️ What bad leaders say"} Black:
1) "This is the way we've always done it."
2) "When I was in your position, I had it a lot worse."
3) "They didn't mean to offend."
4) "I'm not feeling well, but I'm sticking it out because the work has to get done."
5) "Please don't share this information with anyone -- it's not my news to tell."

202207161423|Philosophies

 202305302137|🏆 Sports membership {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305302137","music":""}
Sports Membership
Autonomy
The organizer of a competition has the rights to define participant requirements, while potential participants have the rights to choose whether to participate.
Q: Government funding on sports competitions
In Choice Democracy, a government cannot collect tax to fund something without proportional agreement. Given a budget or public resource to spend on sports, each person decides how their portion is spent. The government schedules the resources based on the people's choices.
Example
A school traditionally has only men's and women's sports competition. To account for people in other categories, the school allows proportional use of the budget and facility on other category choices, such as an {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.msn.com/en-us/sports/cycling/new-british-cycling-rules-bar-transgender-women-from-competing-in-elite-female-events/ar-AA1bIXjQ?OCID=ansmsnnews11","desc":"open"} category where anyone may participate.

202305071032|Healthy Community

 202305311019|🌈 Rainbow Crosswalk {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202305311019","music":""}
Rainbow Crosswalk
Case Study
This node explores how People-first principle applies on whether people may paint a crosswalk rainbow as an expression of inclusiveness. The following is in the order of consideration.
Non-infringement Check
The painting of the crosswalk cannot infringe on individual rights. In general this means the community cannot approve painting of a private crosswalk against the will of its owner. In people-first principle, a public crosswalk is co-owned by its stakeholders, therefore choice democracy can be applied to determine the sites and durations where crosswalks can be painted.
Proportionality Assessment
Suppose the advocates are not asking for a permanent but a temproary repainting of one crosswalk. One percent of a year is about 4 days. Then, under choice democracy, for every 1% consent among the stakeholders, the crosswalk can remain painted for 3.65 days.
>Assessing stakeholder agreement
STEP 1: Let people register as a stakeholder according to eligibility rules.
STEP 2: Assess and display consent among the stakeholders, showing the corresponding duration where the crosswalk may remain painted.
STEP 3: Schedule for the time slot when it would be pained.
>Burder of Assessment
Q: Who has the burden to show that there is enough consent among the stakeholders?
A: Those asking for a change.
In general, this means that the proposal needs to go through a petition or public notice process that shows the advocates have reached out to relevant stakeholders, and obtained enough consent for the change to be considered for resolving any scheduling conflicts.
Stakeholders
Q: Who are the relevant stakeholders?
A: Relevant stakeholders are those who use or take care of the crosswalk. This includes pedestrians and drivers.
💬 Discussions

202212090038|Adventurers' Hall

 202306050923|🎭 Manipulation {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306050923","music":""}
Manipulation
Behavior
Signs of Being Manipulative

From Tanya

1. They use guilt-tripping.
2. They don't let you fact check
3. They ask you to trust them

From the web

{"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.yourtango.com/self/signs-of-a-conniving-personality","desc":"[link]"} 1. They don't care what you think
2. They bring a tone of negativity
3. They are unapologetic
4. They are unapologetic
5. They lash out when they don't get their way.
6. They don't know how to finish what they start.
7. They make you afraid of losing them.
8. They turn people against you.
9. They don't even know who they are.
10. They are control freaks.
11. They get angry when confronted.
12. They throw rocks and hide their hands.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202306050923","parentid":"202212090038","parentname":"Adventurers' Hall","icon":"🎭","title":"Manipulation","subtitle":"Behavior","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/12/29/20/44/suppression-3048645_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Tanya","description":"","card-text":""}
Criminal Laws
[202306052009]
Law Game Part 10
◀ 202306052009
Paladin Hall
⭐
The Law Game continues. Natalie: Please be aware that the content may not be appropriate for children. Natalie: Please note that we play this game from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions.
[15] Change in Statute
🏛️Natalie: Penny is convicted of illegal possion of marijuana, a violation of a state statue. Sentencing is delayed and before sentence is pronounced, the statute is repealed. Can Penny still be sentenced, in most states?
Sasha: Yes. In the normal case a violation is judged according to the law when the crime took place. Natalie: Yes. Most statutes contain a "saving clause" that allows that to happen.
[16] Overlapping sentencing
🏛️Natalie: Friday is charged with illegal possession of a handgun, in violation of both state criminal law and a local ordinance. Can he be sentenced under both laws?
Tanya: I think in this case the specific has priority. Natalie: Correct! Punishing Friday in both is called double jeopardy. The local area is considered a political subdivision of the state and not a separate sovereignty.
[17] Attempted Murder
🏛️Natalie: David is charged with murder and attempted murder. If he is convicted of murder, can he also be sentenced for attempted murder, since his conviction satisfies the elements of both crimes?
Casey: No. That would be double jeopardy. Fina: In reciprocative law, murder and attempted murder are two separate crimes. Or you could say a person can be convicted of murder if they tried regardless whether they succeed. If the murder succeeds, what changes is the damage. Natalie: Casey is correct. In law it is called "factual merger". It is not permissible to punish for a lesser included offense if there is conviction of a larger offense.
Natalie thanks all for playing! {"cmd":"next"}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202306050923|🔮 Insurance {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306050923","music":""}
Insurance
Policy
Insurance is financial protection against risks and losses, where individuals and businesses pay premiums to transfer potential burdens to insurance companies, receiving compensation for covered perils and promoting stability. While an Arcacian society allows insurnace to exist, other means to obtain care makes insurance unncessary.
What happens when you need help?

Arcacian Society

Care is free to the person in needs.

Insurance Society

Care is not free to the person in needs. Some people in need cannot afford care. An insurance company may use tactics to avoid providing care.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202306050923","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"🔮","title":"Insurance","subtitle":"Policy","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/11/29/13/12/cloudy-1869753_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Sasha","description":"","card-text":""}
Writing Club
[202306062204]
The Story So Far
◀ 2023 JUN 06 TUE 10:04PM
Magic Bakery
⭐
Let's write!
Helen: Let's write our stories! Ledia: Do you mean your character backstories? Helen: Anything is fine! Let's write something each time in this thread. Evelyn: I have a feeling that we would like this thread. 😃
👒 Ledia's Backstory
⭐Ledia: I was a farm girl saved by a paladin during a zombie outbreak. After that I joined the paladins at Arx. As part of the alliance I am at Panarcadia.
Sasha: Can we comment? What do we do? Helen: What kind of feedback does Ledia want? Ledia: I am trying to keep it short. Sasha: I want to know your goal. Why are you here? What kind of adventure do you want to go? Ledia: My goal is to train and be prepared. There is no war or emergency, so it is a slice of life kind of story. Sasha: You don't need a save the world kind of goal, but just wanting to train doesn't make a good story. What conflicts do you face? Ledia: Hmm... I just want to be a paladin who is available to go questing as needed. Zoey: You still have Mira Mira to take care of. Ledia: Exactly. Sasha: Okay, so we have a Paladin who is a boutique keeper. Which is your priority? The shop or questing? Ledia: Questing. Sasha: What happens to the store while you are away? Ledia: I don't imagine being the only one there. Sasha: Unless you give a name, you are the only one. At least that is what I am imagining, that the store is perpetually "in preparation". Ledia: StarTree? StarTree: Wee~~! Zoey: Actually I think Sasha would fit right in at Mira Mira. Sasha: I don't work. Evelyn: I think I can help at Mira Mira also. Ledia: Welcome on board!
To be continued! {"cmd":"next"}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202306080951|💽 Royalty {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306080951","music":""}
Royalty
Policy
Royalty is a business practice of forbidding commercial reuse of creative work unless a portion of the profit goes to the original creator. Typically this happens because the government makes it illegal for the reuser to use the work otherwise.
Arcacian Differences
In an Arcacian society, a person may normally recreate or copy a creative work for commercial purpose given that it is done without deception. Authors of helpful creative works get credits as their work is referenced and reused in derivative works. As a result, the author is paid, but not by the person who creates the derivative work.
Arcacian Registry
Inventions or creative works can be registered to a registry by anyone including the inventor/author, a person who wants to redistribute the work, or a witness. By evaluating the truthfulness of the record and the influence and social benefit of the work, the honor of the author is calculated. The registry is forever retroactive. There is no time limit for a work to be registered.
Effect on Distribution
Since it is legal to produce the exact copy of a creative work as long as it is not done in a deceptive manner, a bakery, for example, can legally print well known cartoon characters on cakes. The bakery does not need to pay royalty to the character creator. The creator is paid through the registry.

Society using Royalty

The bakery needs to pay royalty before they may print on the cakes. This increases the price of the cakes, and makes it harder for a customer to get a cake they want as some bakeries simply don't print them.

Arcacian Society

The bakery can legally print images on the cakes for free. This makes it easier for the customer to get what they want, and easier for the society to assess the impact and compute the honor of the original creator.
In an Arcacian society, the artist author of a cartoon character automatically gets paid through the registry as their work appears on different kinds of merchandises. The artist does not need to strike commercial deals or form business partnership to get paid through mugs, T-shirts, race cars, etc. The artist can concentrate on creating art without middle-persons taking a cut in each leg of the distribution.
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://freakonomics.com/podcast/the-economics-of-everyday-things-my-sharona/","desc":"💽 My Sharona"}
💬 Discussions

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202306082038|🍼 Babies Rule {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306082038","music":""}
A king loves his two daughters so much that he decides the kingdom shall have more girls than boys and makes the following rule: All child-bearing couples must continue to bear children until they have a daughter, and stop once they have a daughter.
After many years, what should be the expected gender ratio if this subjects follow the order? {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.popularmechanics.com/science/math/a31153757/riddles-brain-teasers-logic-puzzles/","desc":"[Ref]"}
Show Answer
It is 50/50, or 1:1. There would be just as many boys as girls.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202306082038","parentid":"202208141928","parentname":"Puzzle Plaza","icon":"🍼","title":"Babies Rule","subtitle":"Puzzle","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/02/08/02/56/booties-2047596_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Mikela","description":"","card-text":""}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202306082255|🚨 Pretext Stop {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306082255","music":""}
Pretext Stop
Comparison
Pretext stop refers to the practice of stopping, often selectively, a person for a minor infraction in order to examine for more serious violations. What is your philosophy's view on pretext stop?
Arcacianism
Arcacian society has a flat hierarchy. So... you can't normally detain someone to fish for clues.

202207242047|🥁 Profiles
Motivation
[202306111318]
Why questing?
2023 JUN 11 SUN 1:18PM
Magic Bakery Home Channel
🔔
Why do you quest? What would make questing more exciting?
Tanya: This was a question I logged to Guild Log last year. I never got around asking it. So I ask it now. StarTree: It was logged on August 16, 2023! Ledia: I think we need more artefacts to celebrate accomplishments. Tanya: What do you mean by artefacts? Ledia: Such as a a collage. There was an idea of creating a monthly collage so the calendar doesn't have the same image every month. Evelyn: I remember that... quest. I don't think it ever got any progress. 😅 Tanya: Why didn't anyone do that quest? Evelyn: I think it was because hardly anyone of us wants to draw. 😅 3B: Which is better? A collage or a manga page? Casey: I like the standees. I want more tiles and actually background buildings and things. Evelyn: I like the standees too. LRRH: I want a Magic Bakery Standee. Casey: Let's do it!
🔍Tanya: For the record, the original question was about an observation that there seemed to be only two mode when people quest: 1) Either they eagerly work on guild quests, or 2) Avoid guild quest and do comfort quests. Anyone wants to comment on that observation? Sasha: That would happen if the quest is too hard. So you just need to break the quest into smaller tasks so that people would do some and then get hooked and want to finish it. Tanya: I see. Evelyn: I think it would help if we discuss when a quest is too hard. If we don't discuss, it would just sit on the log. Zoey: We should get a list of quests that can be done while watching anime. XD Casey: You can certainly draw while watching anime. Zoey: What about other tasks? Sasha: Well it rules out all quests that require thinking. Evelyn: It might be possible to do Diamond quests while watching anime. P4: You can make paper stars. Tanya: @StarTree please add those ideas to the Anime club node. StarTree: Done! LRRH: I think many quests can be done while watching anime. Sasha: That is if the anime isn't really interesting. Ledia: Ever thought of watching anime with fast forward? Zoey: Don't you already do that? XD Ledia: A Pro! Evelyn: 😅 Tanya: I think the original question is answered. Tanya thanks all for completeing the quest. @Guild is now rank B. {"cmd":"next"}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202306130954|🚦 Citizen Citations {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306130954","music":""}
Citizen Citations
Protocol
Citizen citations is a solution of empowering ordinary people to cite and prosecute wrongdoers in a society with a flat hierachy.
Common issues that Citizen Citations solve
In a society without Citizen Citations, reports of wrongdoings may be processed by a centralized authority such as a police department. Such department often operates under a scarcity paradigm where the staff cannot handle all reports, and prioritize them according to departmental agenda. Natalie: Typically in such system, even if the victim is willing to work on the case, they are forbidden from doing so. Natalie: Citizen Citation solves that bottleneck by empowering people to routinely participate in the citation workflow, allowing willing people to push cases forward.
💬 Discussions

[202306162110]
Evelyn Wallpaper
◀ 2023 JUN 16 FRI 9:10PM
Magic Detectives
⭐
We started commenting on the Evelyn wallpaper in the node but discussion should have its own node. So...
StarTree: The context is {"cmd":"url","url":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/20230616%20Evelyn%203.png?raw=true","desc":"[this]"} picture! LRRH: I think this is is good as a Cleric banner for Adventurers' Hall. But there is no music to match this. Zoey: This is almost good for Christmas. XD LRRH: 🐣 3B: Something is wrong... with her right eye. 3B: And I couldn't figure out how to do watercolor style. Fina: The crystal looks flat. 3B: Should I try to fix this or draw another one? Evelyn: I think this look very pretty already. 🙂 Sasha: I could really use it for youtube. I couldn't find a song that matches this pose or coloring. Sasha: I think the color might be too intense, too warm. Ledia: I think this Evelyn looks a little too old. 3B: The age is hard to fix because it has to do with the shape of the head. To fix that I might as well draw it again from scratch. Ledia: Really? Evelyn: In that case may I wear white instead of red? 3B: The color is easy to fix without redrawing... Evelyn: 😅 Sasha: If you don't want to redraw, maybe change the expression. I think it is easier to match a song when she is not looking at the camera. Vivi: The lines around the crystal are too dark. The yellow part of the headgear looks strange. Ledia: Should we... just go ahead and add more Christmas gear and make it a Christmas wallpaper? Zoey: Yes. XD Sasha: We don't have a Christmas song though. Ledia: Couldn't it just be an existing song? LRRH: Actually we kind of have Christmas songs. Albatross Skating Rink, and Magic Bakery Waltz if you play it with bells. Tanya: A Christmas cap would look good on this Evelyn. Casey: Why are we making Christmas card? It is summer. Tanya: I think might just finish in time for Christmas. LRRH: I think Magic Bakery is closest to Christmas. Vivi: The head of the staff is bent. 3B: There are so many things wrong with this picture, that... 3B: ... it is worth fixing so we could have a comparison. 3B: If I upgrade it for Christmas, what should the brooch be? Tanya: Could you start with having none? 3B: Okay. Ledia: Out of curiosity, could we have spotted the fixes before coloring? 3B: I think it is harder without coloring. 3B will try to fix the drawing. {"cmd":"next"}
