202207161423|Philosophies

 202306181928|📒 Definition {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306181928","music":""}
Definition
Philsophies
Q: Can a definition be bad?

Ambiguous

A definition is bad if it reduces the participants' readiness to continue the discussion. Black: For example, when the definition is ambiguous and not even the person proposing the definition can consistently tell whether something is defined by it.

Reduces Vocabulary

A definition is bad when it leaves existing concepts unreferrable. Black: For example, a definition, "A loophole is not a loophole when it is tolerable" leaves a hole in the vocabulary to refer to the thing before deciding whether it is tolerable. 44: When that happens, couldn't you just make up other words to fill the gap? Black: If someone needs to accommodate then that is evidence that the definition creates a burden to the discussion. It is a bad definition regardless whether someone repairs it. The person introducing and insisting on using bad definitions is damaging the discussion channel.

Factoring

A definition is bad when it needs more words to cover distinct concepts. Black: The vocabulary set that needs only the minimum number of words to describe all concepts can be set to be properly factored. For example, with words {Table, Length, Width, and Height}, many dimensions can be specified. In a vocabulary that is not properly refactored, there might be separate words for tables that are of certain dimensions, but missing the general definition of length, width, or height in describing a table. Black: This is not to say that the vocabulary cannot have words that refers to something specific as a convenient shorthand. The issue is when it is missing words to cover concepts. Black: A properly factored vocabulary covers all cases, which helps expose blindspots during considerations. For example, a vocabulary might have only one word to describe a rulebreaker, "assailant" which is defined or assumed to be angry, hostile and violent, for which countermeasure is creatd in the protocol. If the rulebreaker is not angry, not hostile, or not violet, the protocol could overreact. A failure analysis would reveal that the protocol has blindshots because it did not foresee a rulebreaker need not be the assumed type. Proper factoring would let the protocol maker create an appropriate countermeasure in each of the eight combinations. Black: An improperly factored vocabulary can be harder to learn because there are more definitions to memorize for people to communicate. A properly factored vocabulary let people learn and cover all concepts faster.

Shortsightedness

A definition is bad when it it requires more words in the vocabulary as the scope of consideration expands. Black: To understand this concept, consider two sets of vocabulary, Set A and Set B, that can both cover the concepts in discussion topic X. When the discussion topic expands or changes to Y, if Set A can still cover all the concepts but Set B does not, Set B can be said to be shortsighted compared to Set A.
Q: Effect of definitions on a society
True or false: Everything else being equal, a society where the people are aware and acknowledges shortcomings in the law are more likely to have better laws.

Acknowledging

A society that acknowledges its shortcomings is more likely to value those who investigate improvements in the law. This leads to more improvements and better laws.

Not Acknowledging

A society that does not acknowledge its shortcomings is more likely to downplay complaints in the law and discourage those who try to investigate improvement. This leads to slower improvements or repeated creation of bad or worse laws.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202306181928","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"📒","title":"Definition","subtitle":"Philsophies","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2019/02/09/22/21/books-3986091_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Black","description":"","card-text":""}
Loophole
[202306182110]
Loophole definition
2023 JUN 18 SUN 9:10PM
Arena
⭐
This continues an offline discussion of the definition of loophole.
Black: True or false: Everything else being equal, a society where the people are aware and acknowledge shortcomings in the law are more likely to have better laws. 44: Of course
💡44: Our original discussion was not whether we want to have better laws though, it;s about the definition of loophole, we can use this loophole definition: an ambiguity or inadequacy in the law or a set of rules. Black: The two topics are closely related because you can evaluate a definition based on how it is used and its effect on whether it helps people become aware of shortcomings of the law. Do you agree that, everything else being equal a definition of "loophole" that downplays the shortcomings of the law is worse than a definition that is consistent and objective, so that different people can use the same definition and judge whether a piece of law has or does not have a loophole? Tanya: Before discussing what a loophole "is", we need a basic understanding/agreement that not all definitions are the same quality. It is better to agree on what makes a definition GOOD before discussing the actual definition to avoid anchor bias. Black: A loophole is a type of vulnerability in the law that a person can exploit to openly circumvent the intent of the law without legal repercussion even if the cheater does not lie about their exploit. (This is different from a piece of law that is vulnerable to frauds, where the fraudster is held liable if their deceptive act is caught.) Ledia: If you use that definition, you can easily "eliminate" all loopholes by having a law that said it is illegal to knowingly act against the intention of the law even if the actions to circumvent the law are legal otherwise. Tanya: That is a foundation of Arcacian law. 44: We can name our definitions differently and even name separately my interpretation of your definition. Wouldn't that solve the issue? I don't understand why there would be "better" definition. Black: 1. "I don't understand why there would be better definition": Take the lost ID bypass for example. Which of our definition is easier to tell whether the protocol has a loophole? StarTree: The example is that ID issuing center does not allow walk-in (you have to make an appointment) unless your ID is lost or stolen. In that case you may walk-in if you pay a fine. Black: Your definition mentioned "adequacy". Adequacy of what? Earlier in the discussion you said the sitaution is not a loophole if it is tolerable. This means that even if you know the intention of the protocol, you need to know how other citizens or legislators think about the law, the cost of enforcing the law, etc, before you can tell whether that is a loophole. Black: Do you agree that your definition requires MORE to tell whether something is a loophole, and the result depends on how many people you asked? Black: And, in your definition, what is the ** purpose** of knowing whether something is a loophole? Suppose you polled 100 people on whethere it is tolerable, how would knowing that affect what you or the society would do for the situation?
⚖️Black: A good definition can be used as a guide to solve a problem it defines. Black: For example, my definition of loophole requires knkowing the intention of the law. Suppose the intention is that: Since the government requires everyone to have a valid ID, the cost of normal replacement is already in the budget (i.e. it is "free"). But the cost of replacing a lose ID is outside the budget. The designer decides that the person who needs the extra replacement is at fault, and shall pay a fine to deter unplanned stress on the system. Black: Analysis: [1] If the fine does not cover the actual extra cost, the fine should be increased. Black: [2] If the system can reasonably process the workload of those who would pay to get the ID the same day, then the "fine" should be an "express fee". Black: This means that a person doesn't need to lie about their card being lost. They could just pay for the express service. Black: [3] Suppose the system cannot process all express cases, then the fees should increase and be spent on upgrading the process to meet the demand. Black: As opposed to a policy of not increasing the fee, not upgrading the system, and just making peopl wait for a long time or restricting express processing to "people who really need it such as those who have their ID stolen". This type of thinking is called scarcity mindset. Such policy creates a reason for lying and does not adapt to the demand by increasing the supply. Black thanks all for the discussion. {"cmd":"next"}

Self-Evaluation
[202306192056]
Self-Evaluation B1
◀ 2023 JUN 19 MON 8:56PM
Whale Nursery
📯
This is a series of monthly self-evaluation discussions. The plan is to create a rubric for each evaluation topic.
📋 [B1] Reporting
📌Black: This part is about general reporting. It seems to have some overlap with A3.
Tanya: I think this is about routine reports, such as weekly report. Tanya: Coincidentally, we missed weekly report last week. I thought I have submitted but apparently it did not. I was able to submit it today, but not before we were notified that it was late. Evelyn: I hope that it was okay. Tanya: What can be done so that I don't miss it again? Black: How about having a second person confirm that the report is done? Tanya: @StarTree please add another CAL task to check for completion. StarTree: Done! Ledia: If B1 is about weekly report, then there are only 52 times a year. Missing once drops from rank SS (99% to rank S (98%). Ledia: Fail one more time it goes to Rank A (88%). Black: It seems that the evaluation of this topic is complete. Ledia: StarTree please add the number of Misses to the CAL tasks. StarTree: Done! Black thanks all for the ideas.
{"cmd":"next"}
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays 221B Baker Street Case 2. The game content is probably rated teens to adult. ⚠️
🚨 Case Start
Mikela: An inventor is found dead in his hotel room with a knife in his chest. The inventor's wife found her husband lying dead at the foot of the hotel room bureau. Among the items at the bureau were a newspaper, a large bedspring, and an open box of his favorite cigars. The windows and doors were still locked from the inside. Among the people quested are the hotel manager, hotel maid, hotel doorman, and two other inventor couples who are attending the same inventors' convention.
Sasha: The original rules of this game is pretty bad as a detective game. Last time we learned that among 14 possible clues, maybe only 3 or 4 are "good" clues. The other clues make the game too easy. If you get a puzzle clue, please try hard to make it make sense. StarTree: StarTree found something interesting! StarTree: The 2016 manual of the game has rules of cooperative play. The players discuss and decide which clue to review, and try to get the right answer with the fewest number of clues! The ranking is: Master Detective (1-5 clues), Sleuth (6-8 clues), Detective (9-11 clues), Gumshoe (12 clues), Scotland yard Inspector (13 clues), Watson (14 clues). Sasha: Wow nice find! Let's play it that way. Black: It is a classic closed room murder. Maybe we should check with the locksmith to confirm whether someone could have leave the room and make it appear that no one had left. P4: What is a bureau? Black: It is a desk where the top opens to reveal writing space. P4: 💟 Casey: I think no one went in, The clues are pretty obvious that someone could have made a trap where a knife springs out when a drawer or something opens. They were inventors. It can't be that hard. Tanya: The cigar box. We are looking for someone who gave him the rigged cigar box. 44: Should we go to the Tobacoonist to see who bought that box of cigar? Black: What do we need to know for this game? Mikela: 1) Who killed the inventor, 2) How he was killed, and 3) the Motive. Black: It looks like we have the method.
🔍 [42] Hotel
44: 44 decided to check the crime scene at the hotel. The initial report seemed to be accurate. According to the witnesses, the inventor victim, Mr. Foster, was seen whispering with another inventor's wife, Mrs. Walton, at the hotel lobby the day before the murder.
44: It looks like Mr. Walton could be the killer. He is an inventor and could make the trapped cigar box. And his motive could be jealousy. Ledia: But all we know is that they were whispering. Is it too soon to conclude? What happens if we get it wrong? Sasha: I don't think we should promote guess too early. Let's use up the first five clues before deciding. Casey: We already narrowed down to inventors, but that is at least two suspects. If each spouse of an inventor is also an inventor then there are five suspects. Tanya: I would want to check the convention to see if we can learn more about the inventors.
🔍 [62] Mesuem
Tanya: Tanya visited the convention center hoping to learn more about the inventors. In the middle of the display was an intricately designed clock. Tic. Toc. Tic Toc.
Tanya: I got a syllable clue for the motive. If you don't want to know it stop reading. Tanya: For the Motive: The second of four parts is the sound a clock makes. P4: Isn't jealousy three syllables? Ledia: Does this game give false clues like NCIS? StarTree: Based on the clues from Case 1, there are no misleading clues! Ledia: In that case I would stick with 44's story, even though I don't understand this clue.
🔍 [52] Locksmith
Black: The murderer seemed to tried to hide that the cigar box was rigged. By a cursory glance, the cigar box appeard to be an ordinary empty cigar box. But closer examination shows signs where the spring was lodged to shoot the knife.
Black: This clue doesn't tell us anything we haven't guessed. I would agree that the door was indeed locked.
🔍 [132] Tobacconist
Casey: Casey asks about who might know the victim's favorite brand of cigar. "All of his friends know that he smokes one every morning before doing anything else," said one of the victim's friends.
Casey: I guess this tells us it is not only his wife who knew the victim's routine. Sasha: Okay. Last clue before we decide. Tanya: We didn't find any clue that could contradict 44's guess. If we disregard the syllable clue.
🔍 [72] Newspaper
Evelyn: Evelyn checks the newspaper. There seems to be nothing out of ordinary.
Evelyn: I'm sorry I got "no clue". 😖 Ledia: It would be a clue if the date of the newspaper happen to be the same day of the murder. Because that would mean someone entered that morning with the newspaper. Sasha: It seems that we don't really have any contesting story, so let's drumroll.
🥁 [2] Apothecary
Ledia: The knife in the victim's chest was not thrust by human hands.
🥁 [12] Bank
StarTree: Bank records show that the victim Mr. Foster and Mr. Walton have worked together as partners on a number of inventions!
Tanya: We should have checked the bank. This tells us who his friends might be.
🥁 [22] Carriage Depot
Sasha: This is a syllable clue for the killer's name. Please skip if you don't want to see it. Sasha: Killer clue, part 1 of 2 is "Up against the ___."
🥁 [32] Dock
Sasha: This is the second syllable clue for the killer's name. Sasha: Killer clue: two of two: "2000 pounds."
🥁 [77] Park
Mikela: The absolutely true gossips have it that "The killer is a man!"
🥁 [92] Pawnbroker
Sasha: This is a syllable clue for the motive. Sasha: Motive clue: Part 1 of 4: "Caesar was a _____." Part 4 of 4: "A large body of salt water."
🥁 [102] Playhouse
Mikela: In the night before the murder, the Foster couple and another inventor couple, the Southerington went to the playhouse!
Black: Two couples going to the play together is not suspicious compared to just Mrs. Walton whispering to the victim.
🥁 [112] Pub
Mikela: The absolutely true gossip has it that Mr. Foster and Mrs. Walton were having an affair!
Sasha: I feel like we should have chosen this. This is a strong clue and it would make sense that we could get it from the pub.
🥁 [122] Scotland Yard
Tanya: No clue.
🛎️ SOLUTION
Mikela: Mr. Walton learned of the affair and sought revenge out of romantic jealousy! Mikela: Mr. Walton sneaked into Mr. Foster's room while he was at the play, and rigged a deviced to launch the knife when the cigar box opens! P4: So the knife didn't come from inside the cigar box? Sasha: For the scoring, I would say everyone gets a WIN, but 44 gets a challenge win because he got it from the first clue. Mikela: Congratulations!
Sasha: We missed that the preacher was a thief! Anyone who got that should get a bonus win. Sasha: Still, everyone wins. Congratulations!
Sasha thanks the players!

202207161423|Philosophies

 202306202157|🍒 Foraging Laws {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306202157","music":""}
Foraging Laws
Law
What is your philosophy on foraging? Is it allowed? What if the plant is under someone's care?
Zoning
There are different zones. The forager should know which zone they are in. In general the produce belongs to the caretaker, but there is a limit to how much a person can claim to oversee.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202306202157","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"🍒","title":"Foraging Laws","subtitle":"Law","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/06/05/16/40/cherry-1437707_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"James","description":"","card-text":""}
⭐
This is Magic Bakery Plays 221B Baker Street Case 3! The game content is probably rated teens to adult. ⚠️
🚨 Case Start: Silver Patch
Evelyn: The famous thoroughbred house Silver Patch and his trainer were found dead in the horse's stall. The horse had been poisoned. The trainer had been hit over the head and stabbed repeated with a sharp object. Tanya: The horse Silver patch was named for the patch of silver hair on his mane. His owner is a horse breeder who owns four other horses. Sasha: The detectives have questioned the owner and his petite wife; the house chef; the chef's husband who is the house painter, and a rival horse breeder. The detectives are lloking for a stable boy who had left unhappy a month ago. Zoey: At the crime schene were some broken pieces of glass from the bottom of an ale bottle, and a pawnbroker's ticket. Sasha: We need to find who killed the horse and the trainer, the weapon used to kill the training, and the motive.
Sasha: This board game has 200 cases. I hope that we get the hang of picking the right places. Our goal is to get the right answer within 5 clues. Ledia: The pawn ticket really stand out.
🔍 [94] Pawnbroker
Ledia: "Interesting," Ledia said as she picked up the ticket. It belonged to the stable owner.
44: I think the owner killed his own horse for insurance fraud. Black: He probably killed the trainer because the trainer happened to see him poison the horse. The murder weapon is most likely the top half of the ale bottle.
🔍 [14] Bank
Tanya: Tanya followed 44's hutch and checked the bank records. The owner indeed had a large insurance policy on Silver Patch.
Black: Do we have all parts? 44: Why didn't the owner clean up the crime scene? Black: He did, didn't he? He hid the top of the broken bottle. Zoey: 🤣 Tanya: If he is working alone he wouldn't want to be seen by others. The house might have the wife, the chef, and the painter around. Ledia: Compelling. Sasha: Hold on. Are we done already? Evelyn: 44 is very good at this game.
🔍 [4] Apothecary
Evelyn: To be thorough, Evelyn wanted to take a sample of the poison. "I think I found black paint at Silver Patch's stall," Evelyn said on the channel.
Evelyn: Is the poison paint? Zoey: Or is the murderer really the house painter? 🤔 Ledia: The painter has a wife... Tanya: But why kill the horse also? And the pawn ticket become unexplained. 44: The horse that died was not Silver Patch. The owner killed another horse but kept Silver Patch so he could keep breeding it. He probably killed the trainer because the trainer could tell the dead horse was not Silver Patch. Zoey: OMG P4: Wouldn't you need silver paint to make Silver Patch? Tanya: I think dead horse originally had black mane, the owner used the black paint to paint over the real Silver Patch's mane. Ledia: The real Silver Patch is still in the stable with a black mane.
🔍 [79] Park
P4: P4 flies to the stall that has a horse with black mane and ask him who painted it black. "Coossss~~!" said the horse.
P4: I got a Killer clue. Part 1 of 2 is "Something the produces an effect." Ledia: Nice RP! P4: And I picked the park because a stable is kind of like a park. Sasha: The owner's name is Cosgrove. And nice RP!
🔍 [24] Carriage Depot
Zoey: Zoey used elemental trace and found the top part of the broken bottle hidden in a carriage.
Zoey: My clue is a weapon clue. Part 3 of 3 rhymes with throttle. Sasha: Good job RPing! I know we can save this game! Sasha: Now the drumroll!
🥁 [34] Dock
Black: This is a killer syllable clue. Black: Part 2 of 2: An arrangement of fruit trees.
🥁 [44] Hotel
Tanya: Silver paint is found on the floor of the stall of Night Dancer, another horse of the owner.
🥁 [54] Locksmith
Mikela: No clue.
🥁 [64] Museum
Sasha: This is a motive syllable clue. Sasha: Motive, part 2 of 3: Another word for positive or certain.
🥁 [77] Park
Mikela: The absolutely true gossips have it that "The killer is a man!"
🥁 [74] Newspaper Shop
Mikela: This is a syllable clue for the motive. Mikela: Part 1 of 3: The opposite of out. Part 3 of 3: Creatures that love picnics.
Black: That's ants at the end.
🥁 [104] Playhouse
Zoey: The footprints at the stables show that the killer wore a size 12 shoe.
Zoey: So, not the petite wife.
🥁 [114] Pub
Mikela: This is a syllable clue about the weapon. Mikela: Weapon clue: Part 1 of 3: When you have no money, you're flat ____. Part 2 of 3: The alphabet letter after M.
🥁 [124] Scotland Yard
Tanya: The unhappy stable boy now works at the locksmith shop.
🥁 [134] Tobacconist
Mikela: The absolutely true rumor has it that the owner would never kill his prize horse Silver Patch.
🛎️ SOLUTION
Mikela: The owner switched the color of Silver Patch and Night Dancer with paint and killed Night Dancer to get an insurance payout! The trainer was killed when he refused to be part of the plot. Sasha: For the scoring, I think it would be the same as last time, everyone wins but 44 gets a CHA WIN. Mikela: Congratulations!
Sasha thanks the players!

202207161423|Philosophies

 202306210858|🍠 Scarcity vs Abundance {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306210858","music":""}
Scarcity Mindset refers to the a consideration confined by perceived limitations, versus an Abundance Mindset that also considers practical ways to resolve the limitations.
Example: Party budget
Fact: You have $100 and you want to throw a party, but the ideal party you want to throw would cost $150.

Scarcity Mindset

"I only have $100, so I will plan for a party within the budget."

Abundance Mindset

"The party I really want would cost $150. I don't have to throw the party right now, so I will get more money to throw the party I really want."
In the abundance mindset, the person observes that there is more time and more opportunity to get more resources. This is different from a person with a scarcity mindset is stuck with the facts presented, but fail to see leeway when they are not explicitely presented for consider: 1) It is not a fact that the party must be thrown now. 2) It is not a fact that you can't earn more money. Scarcity mindset refers to such self-inflicted constraints (time is running out, there is no means to get more money) when a person approaches a problem.
Q: Does Abundance mindset assume unlimited resources?
Does abundance mindset mean we should assume unlimited resource or to create unlimited resource?
Tanya: The definition itself is descriptive. It describes the range of considerations. A person operating under an abundance mindset does not necessarily assume that resource is unlimited. They are simply not concluding (when it is not a fact) that resource is limited, or that they lack the ability to create unlimited resources. Abundance Mindset: If you don't know, you don't assume that you can't. Scarcity Mindset: If you don't know you assume that you can't. Ledia: In terms of "should you adopt an abundance mindset?", or "is an abundance mindset always better than a scarcity mindset?", I think the answer is yes. In the party example, if you happen to have $150, both mindsets will let you throw the party you want. But if have less than $150, using a scarcity mindset is the same as giving up too soon without considering ways where you could get what you want. What if the party you really want to throw is $1 trillion? Does an abundance mindset mean you would never throw a party untill you get $1 trillion? The answer would be no, because a person with an abundance mindset can also think, "I am not limited to only throwing one party, I can throw a cheaper party while I work my way toward the $1 trillion party. Abundance mindset does not restrict the person using it.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202306210858","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"🍠","title":"Scarcity vs Abundance","subtitle":"Mindset","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2018/02/15/07/40/food-3154586_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Black","description":"","card-text":""}

@Board has a quest of upgrading the chat post. What changes would you like to see this time?
Ivy: I think it should be the header block. The part that shows the parent link, id, date, title, location, and prev and next links. StarTree: Drafting macro command ph. Ivy: I think it should be a node object. StarTree: The node object is not currently used unless a banner is being displayed. Chat posts don't have a banner. Ivy: Please first add the code so that when banner is called on a node that is a chat post, there is no effect. You may add a type field in the node data object for the code to that that it is a chat node. StarTree: Done! Ivy: Next please update post script to include that node structure. StarTree: Done! Ivy: And keep going. StarTree: Roger! StarTree: The header buried at a strange location in the chat post. StarTree will make changes from outside-in starting with replacing the discussion link at the end. StarTree: Adding function ProcessNodeData. Testing non-effect for nodes that are not chat. Adding PNDInner. Replacing macro next code. Testing. Adding AddElementFC. Adding header block content. Parsing date. Testing. Date formatting. Testing. Removing fields from script. StarTree: Wee~~! The chat script is now upgraded. @Board is now Rank A.

 202306222131|💝 Restoration {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306222131","music":""}
Restoration
Skill
Status Effects are debilitating conditions. This section is for discussing how to prevent and recover from them.
🗂️

Select Query
🧱 Autophony
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autophony","desc":"[Wiki]"} Close your nose and mouth then blow or suck to adjust the pressure through the auditory tube.
🔥 Coughing
Take a big sip of water and swallow slowly bit by bit.
🌊 Dizzyness
Tilting your head sideway could alleviate carsickness.
☁️ Hiccups
Hold breath toward your abdominal.
🔥 Spellbound

202207161423|Philosophies

 202306241608|⚡ Utility Charges {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306241608","music":""}
Utility Charges
Philosophy
What is your philosophy's view on utility bills? Should people with higher income pay more than people with lower income?

Arcacianism

Provider of free energy gets credits.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202306241608","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"⚡","title":"Utility Charges","subtitle":"Philosophy","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2018/05/10/16/07/transmission-tower-3387882_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Zoey","description":"","card-text":""}
🔔
Does your philosophy charge people who are wealthy more for utility?
Arcacia: The helper gets credit for providing energy. Ivy: Hold on. That answer is too vague. Do I get credit if I make energy for myself? Arcacia: When you help yourself you are already compensated so you don't get credits.Credits are for when you help someone else and the "loop" remains open. Ivy: I think we need a better term. Ledia: So what happens when someone can't afford energy and no one is giving them? Ivy: In Quest Society the basic model is that there is a resource bank. When its stockpile is low, there is a quest for people to refill. Those who refil will get a credit. As long as the stockpile is sufficiently filled, there is a free share for everyone. If the stockpile does not have enough, then the priority of each share is distributed by bidding. Sasha: What happens if someone tries to get more than their share? Ivy: If there aren't enough for everyone, you can't. If there are more than enough for everything, then it is settled by bidding with the credits. Ledia: I thought normally you can't store energy. On a grid the power plant just generate according to the demand. Ivy: I don't think the concept is any different. Ledia: There is a different in the order of events. For electricity, you get the power first, then the bill comes. In your model won't you need to bid everyday once you have ran out of you initial share? Or how often are you bidding? Ivy: You could book for your demand for the next month ahead of time. It would be simular to renewing a book you borrowed from a library. There might be a grace period for you to bid before your power is cut. I think there are enough existing ways to deal with this type of problem that this is not a question of if there would be a method similar to how things are done right now but is there an even better method if power can be paid by credits. Ledia: Convincing. Zoey started the node on utilities.

202207220710|Playlist

 202306252213|🎤 Start: Dash!! {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306252213","music":""}
Music Video
I say...
Hey, hey, hey, START:DASH!!
Hey, hey, hey, START:DASH!!
 うぶ毛の小鳥たちも
いつか空に羽ばたく
大きな強い翼で飛ぶ
ubuge no kotoritachi mo
itsuka sora ni habataku
ookina tsuyoi tsubasa de tobu
Even newborn birds
Will someday flutter into the sky
On their large, strong wings.
 諦めちゃダメなんだ
その日が絶対来る
君も感じてるよね
始まりの鼓動
akiramecha dame na nda
sono hi ga zettai kuru
kimi mo kanjiteru yo ne
hajimari no kodou
So, of course we can't give up,
Because that day will surely come for us.
You can feel it too, can't you?
The beating of a new beginning.
 明日よ変われ!
希望に変われ!
眩しい光に照らされて変われ
START!!
ashita yo kaware!
kibou ni kaware!
mabushii hikari ni terasarete kaware
START!!
Tomorrow, change,
Change into what we hope for!
Change into that bright, unwavering light!
START!
 悲しみに閉ざされて
泣くだけの君じゃない
熱い胸 きっと未来を切り開く筈さ
kanashimi ni tozasarete
naku dake no kimi ja nai
atsui mune kitto mirai o kirihiraku hazu sa
That person, closed up in her sadness,
Always crying, that person isn't you.
With a burning heart, I'm sure you'll cut through it!
 悲しみに閉ざされて
泣くだけじゃつまらない
kanashimi ni tozasarete
naku dake ja tsumaranai
That person, closed up in her sadness,
Always crying, that person is boring.
 きっと (きっと) 君の (夢の)
チカラ (いまを) 動かすチカラ
信じてるよ…だから START!!
kitto (kitto) kimi no (yume no)
chikara (ima o) ugokasu chikara
shinjiteru yo... dakara START!!
I'm sure, (I'm sure) that with your power (with your dreams)
(right now), moving forward with that power,
I can believe in you... so START!
 雨上がりの気分で
高まる期待のなか
躓いたことさえも
思い出にしよう
ameagari no kibun de
takamaru kitai no naka
tsumazuita koto sae mo
omoide ni shiyou
In the feeling you have after a storm,
Within that rising hope,
Be sure to remember even
The mistakes that we've made.
 明日が咲くよ!
希望が咲くよ!
楽しいメロディー口ずさみ咲いた
DASH!!
ashita ga saku yo!
kibou ga saku yo!
tanoshii merodii kuchizusami saita
DASH!!
Tomorrow will bloom!
Our hopes will bloom!
Our humming bloomed into that fun melody!
DASH!
 喜びを受けとめて
君と僕つながろう
迷い道 やっと外へ抜けだした筈さ
yorokobi o uketomete
kimi to boku tsunagarou
mayoimichi yatto soto e nukedashita hazu sa
Grasping our happiness, moving forward,
With you and I, connected,
Of course we found our way back, after being lost.
 喜びを受けとめて
君と僕 進むだろう
yorokobi o uketomete
kimi to boku susumu darou
Grasping our happiness,
With you and I, moving forward,
 それは (それは) 遠い (夢の)
カケラ (だけど) 愛しいカケラ
彼方へと…僕は DASH!!
sore wa (sore wa) tooi (yume no)
kakera (dakedo) itoshii kakera
kanata e to... boku wa DASH!!
That is (That is) a distant piece of our dream,
But it's an important piece!
Look forward into the distance, I DASH!
 またひとつ 夢が生まれ…
mata hitotsu yume ga umare...
And once again, another dream is born...
 悲しみに閉ざされて
泣くだけの君じゃない
熱い胸 きっと未来を切り開く筈さ
kanashimi ni tozasarete
naku dake no kimi ja nai
atsui mune kitto mirai o kirihiraku hazu sa
That person, closed up in her sadness,
Always crying, that person isn't you.
With a burning heart, I'm sure you'll cut through it!
 喜びを受けとめて
君と僕つながろう
迷い道 やっと外へ抜けだした筈さ
yorokobi o uketomete
kimi to boku tsunagarou
mayoimichi yatto soto e nukedashita hazu sa
Grasping our happiness, moving forward,
With you and I, connected,
Of course we found our way back, after being lost.
 喜びを受けとめて
君と僕 進むだろう
yorokobi o uketomete
kimi to boku susumu darou
Grasping our happiness,
With you and I, moving forward,
 それは (それは) 遠い (夢の)
カケラ (だけど) 愛しいカケラ
彼方へと…僕は DASH!!
sore wa (sore wa) tooi (yume no)
kakera (dakedo) itoshii kakera
kanata e to... boku wa DASH!!

But it's an important piece!

 202306252345|💦 Lie Detection {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306252345","music":""}
Lie Detection
Skill
This node is for lie detecting skills. Do they even work? Can you really tell if a person is lying or just nervous?
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.learning-mind.com/how-to-read-body-language/amp/","desc":"🔍"} 9 Secrets Sasha: 1-2) Watch for normal behavior and see what is different; 3) Blink rate; 4) Mismatched synchronicity; 5) Self-soothing gestures; 6) Qualifying language; 7) Linear narrative; 8) Nondescript descriptors; 9: Distancing tactics.

Let's continue working on migrating to GitHub.
StarTree: Status report: there has been no change since last time! Sasha: I think we shouldn't migrate because we won't have Google Search Console if we migrate. Ivy: I don't think that's how it works. Google Search Console just tells you how Google see your site. You site doesn't have to be one of Google's services. Sasha: Hmm... StarTree please add the github page to Google Search Console. StarTree: It is now added and is being processed! Sasha: Okay. Then I don't really have any objection. Ivy: StarTree please add a CSS file to GitHub page. StarTree: Done! Ivy: StarTree please check if Blogger can use the same style sheet. StarTree: StarTree couldn't make it work 😭 StarTree: Unlike Blogger, when an updated CSS fil e is uploaded to GitHub, it takes a few minutes before the changes are applied. Wee~~!

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202306272106|🐾 Legs {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306272106","music":""}
You walk into a room and see a bed. On the bed, there are two dogs, five cats, a giraffe, six cows, and a goose. There are also three doves flying above the bed. How many legs are on the floor?
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.rd.com/article/long-riddles/","desc":"[Ref]"}
Show Answer
Six: the bed's four legs, plus your two legs!
💬 Discussions

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202306272117|👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Children {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202306272117","music":""}
Mrs. Jones has four daughters. Each of her daughters has one brother. How many children does Mrs. Jones have?
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.rd.com/article/long-riddles/","desc":"[Ref]"}
Show Answer
Five! All her daughters have the same brother!

🔔
Welcome to July! StarTree: The channel is open for any topic! StarTree: Wee~~!
🎨 Evelyn Wallpaper
🎨3B: I made some changes. White doesn't look good.
StarTree: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/20230616%20Evelyn%203.png","desc":"[Original]"}{"cmd":"url","url":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/20230701%20-%20Evelyn%20WH.png","desc":"[White]"}{"cmd":"url","url":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/20230701%20-%20Evelyn.png","desc":"[Red]"}! 3B: The white one didn't look defined, so I changed it back to red... Zoey: Why does Evelyn look normal in white usually but not on this picture? 🤔 3B: Good question. LRRH: I want to see the red part of the background replaced by scenery. 3B: Good idea. Tanya: @StarTree, could you make a mock up of what it looks like if the red part becomes scenery? StarTree: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/20230701%20-%20Evelyn%20BG1.png?raw=true","desc":"Done!"} Ledia: Are we still going for a Christmas background? 3B: Well? LRRH: I lean more toward a generic Magic Bakery wallpaper. So I want panarcadia scenery in the background. 3B: I think for the poster/wallpaper design, we should really start the conversation at the draft when everything is just pencil drawings. Zoey: I think normally the character is just drawn. Then reused for all kinds of posters. Ledia: Then are we going back to visual novel style half body? 3B: I thought we are doing this for Youtube background. LRRH: Yes. 🔔
This is a series of monthly self-evaluation discussions. The plan is to create a rubric for each evaluation topic.
📋 [B2] Teamwork
Black: This part is about general teamwork. Does our ranking scale for other qualities work in this case? If so, what is a fail in teamwork? Should we track only projects that require teamwork or all projects?
Ledia: I think we should track all projects because I don't think there isn't one that doesn't require teamwork. Since we are not the quest maker, we have to at least work with the quest maker "team". That requires teamwork. Tanya: I agree. Sasha: But wouldn't that be covered in Reporting? That was B1. Tanya: Not if you define B1 to be for routine/non-project related reports. Sasha: Should all section B qualities be non-project related? Black: Section B qualities are meant to be generally applicable, so it would make sense if they are not specific to any project. Ledia: But what do you do if you are not doing a project? Evelyn: There is troubleshooting. Ledia: True. Sasha: It would be quite difficult to track troubleshooting teamwork. Since there are so many. Evelyn: How do you "fail" at teamwork when troubleshooting? Ledia: Good question. Black: In the old days, if you don't intentionally make it quantitative, for the teamwork evaluation you could just cite incidents where good teamwork or bad teamwork made a difference. Evelyn: I think in general we have good teamwork because we cover each other to complete quests. Evelyn: Bad teamwork happens when you try to do everything by yourself and don't let others help. Tanya: I am not entirely ready to give up on a quantitative measure. Ledia: You could start with a qualitative description until you figure out a quantitative description. Black: Was it good teamwork on Monday when we called Hospitalian Knights for help? We got the new core but no one was questing, so we asked HK for help and they completed the quest. Evelyn: I think that was good teamwork Tanya: I think it was good teamwork when we filled a gap in the quest and did extended exploring the week before. That was beyond expectation. We did some other team a favor. StarTree: The context is the Pisces Temple Quest! Black: So if we were to make a qualitative note, we could cite these two instances in the Pisces Temple quest. Black: And if we were to devise a metric for it we would have to consider what metric we should track from these examples. Tanya: These are instances where good teamwork would help and we took it. I am thinking if we also track the instances where bad teamwork led to issues, we could have a metric that is a ratio or a balance. Ledia: In the ranking scale, 50:50 would be a C. The rest can also follow. But... Ledia: If you don't go through each quest and consider whether there was good teamwork or bad teamwork, how are you sure that you don't have a bias in picking the incidents? Tanya: I am not against going through each project. But according to our examples, each quest could have more than one stance of good/bad teamwork. Some quests would have no teamwork relevance. Black: How about we add a CAL task to check for teamwork content in each quest and give a rating tag per instance? We could tag "TWG" for good teamwork and "TWB" for bad teamwork. Evelyn: Are we only counting "extraordinary" cases? I think that if we count ordinary teamwork, we do that everyday so the rating would be Rank S already. But if we do that, the extraordinary cases become lost in the statistics. Tanya: I would agree with not counting the routine cases. Ledia: And I would be okay with counting "routine" cases. I think if you just let each person mark when they believe they had exercised good (or bad) teamwork judgment, we could all learn from each other. So let's just declare the tag but let each person decide what they mark. Then we can get a personal rating. Ledia: Which I can use for profile stats. Sasha: I like that idea. Unlike reporting (B1) which was mostly done by Tanya, everyone should get some stats for teamwork. Ledia: I think if you do enough reports you should get a skill stats. That can happen when Cardinal Quest Log gets an XP type column and we fill it up. Black: So, do we agree on adding TWG and TWB tags? You may tag instances in retrospect. Tanya: Yes. @StarTree please tag the two instances for Pisces Temple quest. StarTree: StarTree tagged 12 instances for Pisces quest for exploring and handing off the map to Hospitalian Knights! Players who got the tag are: Tanya, StarTree, P4, Evelyn, Black, Arcacia, Ivy, Kisaragi, Sylvia, Evelyn, Arcacia, Vladanya! Ledia: Since there is not yet a TWB marking, that means everyone who gets a tag is Rank S... Evelyn: It makes more sense to me if I think of that tag as an XP type. For XP type, we have a way to translate XP to stars using squareroots. Ledia: We don't really have a way to translate between Rank and stars. What should an A be? three stars? Tanya: Three-stars takes 81 XP. Sasha: I think evaluation should be different from XP. For each period, a person's evaluation rating could drop. But XP would accumulate from one year to another. Ledia: True. Tanya: We still have the ratio method. But as Ledia said, as of now everyone with even just one TWG tag would be Rank S in teamwork. That rating seems too high. Tanya: I suggest we keep an eye on instances where TWB happens. I think once we start marking TWB, the determining reason can be standardized. Black: I think the remaining topics in section B have similar consideration, so let's continue and refine the method next time. Black thanks all for the ideas.
{"type":"chat","id":"202307052039","parentid":"202302050852","parentname":"Self Evaluation","icon":"📋","title":"Self-Evaluation B2","prev":"202306192056","author":"Black","location":"Whale Nursery"}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202307052338|🐈 Stray Cats Policy {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202307052338","music":""}
Stray Cats Policy
Comparison
How does your philosophy deal with urban stray cats? Some places have a TNR policy where a finder of a stray cat may trap, neuter, and return the cat. What does your philosophy say about that practice?
Who pays for the surgery?
In some policies, the finder pays for the surgery. All else being equal, in a Quest Society the person who does TNR would be awarded credits if they are not otherwise reimbursed. Whether TNR violates any rights remains a topic to discuss.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202307052338","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"🐈","title":"Stray Cats Policy","subtitle":"Comparison","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/02/15/12/12/cat-2068462_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Zoey","description":"","card-text":""}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202307061015|💬 Freedom Apptitude {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202307061015","music":""}
Freedom Apptitude
Metric
Freedom Appitude refers to a community's understanding and practice in protecting freedom. It is not limited to what the law protects, but also includes what individuals decide to protect.
Government Subscription
When a government subscribes to a set of rights, such as freedom of speech and freedom of the press, the government is declaring non-retaliation against those who express dissenting opinions. The opinions could be directed to the government itself (e.g. a complaint about the government), or to another individual (complaint about the behavior of another citizen). In either cases, the government is making a promise that it will not retaliate. It will not make the individual unable to speak, or prevent itself from hearing the complaints if they are directed at the government.
Individual Subscription
When an individual subscribes to a set of rights, the individual is declaring non-retaliation in the same fashion that a government would. This is not the same as an individual agreeing to enjoy protection by a government, but that the individual agrees to the ideal and extend the protection to others as a government would. Freedom Apptitude of a citizenry measures individual subscription to freedom.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202307061015","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"💬","title":"Freedom Apptitude","subtitle":"Metric","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2019/01/11/01/54/public-speaking-3926344_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Black","description":"","card-text":""}
🔔

Tanya: Who added that to the quest list? Sasha: I did. But I forgot why I added it. Tanya: I think we don't need to define every single term. You could just delist that quest. Sasha: Okay.
Sasha: Well, in that case, let me clear one more from a year ago. I put that we need a way to distingish non-RP guild goals and RP story goals for the dungeon. Tanya: Is this about the Log Fall Dungeon node? Sasha: Yes. Tanya: I think that no longer applies because right now there is only the non-RP goal.. So it can be delisted. Sasha: No objection. Sasha: Well I am done with the ones I added. StarTree: @Dnugeon needs one more guild log quest cleared to reduce the backlog! Tanya: Let's start with the oldest. StarTree: Ledia added a link that said shy people are more observant! Tanya: Why is this in @Dungeon? Sasha: Shouldn't this be in @Mira? Ledia: Well, is that true? Do Shy people tend to have great observational skills, making them easier to recognize the core of a problem? Tanya: I don't think we should post that unless we can fact check. Ledia: Delist? 202207161423|Philosophies

 202307062323|🍞 Property Crimes {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202307062323","music":""}
Property Crimes
Law
In this node I want to discuss whether your philosophy would increase or decrease property crimes. First are some examples or property crimes
💨 Catalytic Converter Theft
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2022-09-25/newsom-signs-catalytic-converter-bills","desc":"[link]"}
Situation: Catalytic converters are being stolen because they contain precious metals which can be sold to recycling companies.
Existing Countermeasure: Penalize recycling centers that fail to show transactions from licensed auto dismantlers or dealers.

Crime Reduction Factors

⚔️ Non-anonymous Credits
Quest Society uses non-anonymous credits where the transactions are recorded. Suspcious transactions would be flagged for investigation. A theft trying to sell the many catalytic converters cannot explain the sources. Tanya: What about theives who don't just sell the stolen objects, but uses them to make something else before selling them? Ivy: What about theives who don't just sell the stolen objects, but uses them to make something else before selling them? Ivy: They would face the same problem when they try to declare the source of ingredients.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202307062323","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"🍞","title":"Property Crimes","subtitle":"Law","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/09/07/08/53/money-2724235_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Natalie","description":"","card-text":""}
🔔
How would your philosophy react to property damage done by those without property? Natalie: I think this is an Arena question. I plan to discuss before making a node.
Tanya: I think a node needs to be made about the same time so that the discussion can link to the node. Tanya: @StarTree please make node and link. StarTree: Done! Fina: In reciprocative justice, a person who dealt property damage is the same as having forced others to produce the property or forced others to perform the repair. Fina: Banning forced labor altogether is a preferential law. Tanya: If the offender offers to repair the damage, can they free themself from force labor? Fina: In reciprocative justice, you can't subject the offender to a worse situation that they subjected other unless there is no sign that they would stop. Fina: Even if you have resources to repair the damage, you don't get a right to deal damages. It is still a violation to someone's autonomy even if you can repair the damage. Others still have a claim on your autonomy. Tanya: So you mean even if they had repaid the damage, the victim still has a right to forced labor for the offense, but not for the damage that is already repaid. Fina: The amount of autonomy you could claim is small. For example, if someone stole your food then replenished it before you knew it, they had done no damage to your autonomy. But if they stole your car such that you lost 1 day dealing with it, then they owe you at least 1 day of autonomy. Tanya: Neither would lead to a prison sentence, such as a year. Sasha: You totally could get a year sentence. If you stole something and don't turn yourself in, then people are taking time to investigate to catch you, then put you on trial. It only takes 36 people spending 10 hours each to result in a one-year sentence. And you have to count the time people spend keeping you in prison. Tanya: is that true? Fina: That's correct. Status Quo law doesn't properly account for that difference between someone who turns themself in and someone who does not. This difference is not up to a judge to decide. It is accounted from an expense record. Natalie thanks all for playing.

🔔
Let's keep writing our stories! Ledia: Should I keep going or should someone else go? Helen: It would be nice to do both.
👒 Ledia's Story: Mira Mira needs a plan
Ledia: At downtown Panarcadia, there is an old boutique called Mira Mira Magic Makeover. It used to be the place for new adventurers to outfit themselves, but ever since the original owner retired, the store had been mostly closed.
Ledia: The reason being the new owner Ledia is spending a lot more time questing than getting the store ready.
Ledia: StarTree, what quests are there for Mira Mira today?
StarTree: Mira Mira has 61 quests!
Ledia: StarTree, what do you think I need to do to make Mira Mira up and running?
🔍StarTree: This question is too complicated for StarTree! But previous plan included making the store front pretty, showing interesting designs, and making promotion materials about the store!
Ledia: I do need to sort the space to show designs for inspirations.
Evelyn: Evelyn has come to Mira Mira and hopes to help make it a lovely place.
💡Evelyn: If I imagine myself as a new adventurer, I would need someone to guide me on the possibilities, so being able to see different complete designs at once would be important.
Ledia: That would be the showcase area.
💡Evelyn: And after that I would want to see samples or inspirations of individual items. Maybe a section for each type of gear and a section for designs. Ledia: Non-RP: So, in terms of the node, the Showcase section should be near the top and not hidden. After that there can be a collapsed section on each inspiration type. Evelyn: Yes. I think the advertisement poster should come after we have enough on the node.
Ledia: Ledia moves the plans and notes about what to do for Mira Mira toward the end of the store. Evelyn: I don't understand the preparation room section. What is that for? Ledia: I was showing the differences in outlines. I think we need to pick a style so that the drawings can be consistent. Evelyn: I think they are too big and hard to see... Okay I think the first one looks the best: Black outline with overlay.
Evelyn: Evelyn sees the four pictures of herself in the back and thinks that the first one looks the best. Sasha: In terms of what looks the best I still think that Evelyn's profile and avatar look the best. Ledia: That one has black outline with no overlay. It uses flat coloring. Sasha: I was mainly talking about what she looks like, not the coloring. I meant the shape of her eyes, her hair, her expression. This is closer to who she is.
Evelyn: Could we put my picture in a drawer? I feel embarrassed to have them line up like this in the back. 😅 Ledia: @StarTree please help.
⭐StarTree: Roger! Sasha: I think you need a slice of life cover picture for the store and the chapter. A picture worthy as the title page. Then you can use that to replace the stock photo on the card. Ledia: That's a good idea. @3B? 3B: Are you still talking about a manga sized title page? For a slice of life image there needs to be a background. It would be more cozy if it is in the interior. Is the interior of Mira Mira decided? Ledia: I imagine it to be more like a workshop with tools and mirror, and a changing area. The backroom will have more materials. The front will have costumes that are being made and designed. There would be some already made sets that you could just get, but the store is supposed to be old, so it is small, not like a department store. Designs and samples would be in the form of catalogs. 3B: By catalog do you mean a book or a touch screen mirror where you could just browse on the mirror and try it on magically instantly? Ledia: That would make sense if you can draw it. 3B: Are there windows in the front other than the store front? Ledia: Let's say it has a small store front and is in the middle of a block. So no side windows. Sasha: Isn't that too small. I imagine it would be bigger. Ledia: If it is small then I can explain why I could just have it closed and go questing. Casey: If Mira Mira is not its own building, I can't draw it until we know what else are in the block. Ledia: I would imagine that the block is about three stories tall and has a mix of residents and different small stores. Maybe a cafe, an item store, book store, etc. 3B: Does Mira Mira itself has a second floor, or stairs to a second floor. Ledia: Yes, I think that would make total sense if that is my room and has my personal projects. 3B: For the slice of life scene, who should be in the picture? Ledia: How about myself, Evelyn, and StarTree. 3B: I don't know if it would fit but I should I try to include Sasha as a client or model? Ledia: Yes if that makes sense. Sasha: I think other than the detectives office Mira Mira would be the place I would go. As opposed to adventurer's hall or magic bakery. Ledia: Do you want to be part of Mira Mira? You look like someone who would be good at bringing in clients. Sasha: I don't want the responsibility. But if I find someone who needs style up I would bring them to you. Ledia: Honorary member. Evelyn: I wonder what my role is as a member. 😅 Ledia: You come to get things rolling so we can go questing. Zoey: Do you mean like in RPG where you need to go get material so you can craft the gear? Ledia: There is that. Sasha: I think if I want something made I would bring my own material. Sasha is strong and can solo a thing or two. Ledia: I think Evelyn is good at keeping things tidy and welcoming. She is probably good at letting people figure out what role they really want to be. Sasha: I agree with the first part, but the second part doesn't sound very convincing when she just asked what she was supposed to do. Evelyn: Sorry, I know what I am doing now. 😖 Casey: I thought it was obvious what Evelyn was doing. If you plan to quest and your party member is still working at a store, wouldn't you just go help them at the store instead of waiting by yourself? So she is just doing whatever it needs to turn the next page. Evelyn: That is part of it, but I think I do like the store and its purpose. I don't think I am here just so that I can be elsewhere earlier. 😅 Evelyn: It helped clear things up that I am not the one doing the crafting. Evelyn: Not that I mind doing what I can as needed. Ledia: Mira Mira is demand driven, so when there is no client we just go and do other quests. It is not like we need to get clients in order to keep the store. Sasha: I disagree. Your location is in downtown, isn't that supposed to be quite contested? Don't you need to get enough honor or quest points just to stay there? Ledia: That's if there is competition. If no one wants to takeover that spot then you just keep it. Sasha: That seems like a good conflict to explore. That someone else more successful or ambitious wanting to takeover that space. Ledia: My point being someone who is more ambitious would not be eyeing this old and cozy store that is historically and still is Mira Mira. They won't be spending honor just to take it over. If anything they would want to continue it as Mira Mira, which is already what we are doing, so they would just join us. Sasha: Hmm... Casey: I think Ledia has it about right. 3B: It will take me some time to draft the scene... so.... for that part please wait. Ledia thanks all for continuing this storyline.

🔔
This is Magic Bakery Plays 221B Baker Street Case 4! The game content is probably rated teens to adult. ⚠️
🚨 Case 4: The Chameleon's Vengeance
Sasha: This case is about a master of disguise Chameleon trying to kill Holmes after escaping from prison. We played this in the weekends and it was good. But I don't feel like typing it up because we have already played it. Zoey: If we are not playing it here, what is this post for? XD Sasha: Well, what do people think, should we "play" it again? Evelyn: I haven't played it. Sasha: Would you like to read the prompt? Evelyn: Word for word? Sasha: Not necessarily, but that could be the quickest.
⭐Evelyn: The Chameleon is a master of disguise who has escaped prison. He has a plot of revenge on Sherlock Holmes for capturing him a year ago. As Holmes recounts what happened today he must figure out a) what surprise the Chameleon had planned, b) Where the surprise was hidden, and c) unmask the Chameleon.
Evelyn: The day began with a visiting childhood friend from Switzerland. The friend brought Holmes a fine Swiss pocket watch as a present.
Evelyn: The friend, Watson, and Holmes leave for the Playhouse, where the Playhouse Director had asked Holmes to perform a violin duet with a Virtuoso, who was the featured performer of the night.
Evelyn : When the friend, Watson, and Holmes were waiting for their carriage, Inspector Lestrade rushed up and broke the news that the Chameleon has escaped. Watson told Holmes that it is too dangerous to go to the concept, but Holmes insisted.
Evelyn: They arrived at the playhouse where a wealthy Artist presented a potted geranium to Holmes. Then the Carriage driver told the party that he will return to pick them up after the performance.
Evelyn: At the playhouse, Watson returned from the restroom with acute laryngitis. He blamed it on his nervousness concerning the Chameleon.
Evelyn: Then the Playhouse Director came to greet Holmes' party to show them their balcony seats. Homles notices that the Directory is extraordinarily pale.
Evelyn: That was all the starting clues. The game is afoot! Black: Anyone wants to challenge getting the answer with zero additional clue? Evelyn: I like how no one dies in this case. Zoey: Do we get points off if we guess wrong now? Sasha: I would say yes, since I don't want to end up training people to just make blind guesses. You are supposed to think like a detective. Tanya: It is not clear when the Chameleon escape. I think in this case Scotland Yard might have a relevant clue--Some characteristic about the Chameleon that Holmes and Lestrade already know but we as players do not. ERROR Zoey: I think maybe the person who presented the flowers is Chameleon. Maybe Dr. Watson got sick from it. Evelyn: The prompt said the surprise is deadly. The Chameleon was trying to kill Holmes, not just make him sick. Zoey: The potted flower could be poison, but somehow Dr. Watson got it instead of Holmes. In the restroom Watson treated himself enough that he is not dying. Tanya: In the way I read the prompt I think the surprise has not happened yet. According to the plot so far, things not yet done include arriving at the balcony seat, performing on stage, and getting onto the carriage after the performance. Tanya: The Chameleon could have rigged the balcony; rigged Holme's violin; or rigged the return carriage. Tanya: Two of them are related to the Playhouse, it would make sense of the Playhouse clue is relevant. Sasha: I think in general we shouldn't try too hard getting the answer with no clue. If we just hold for people to guess with no clue the game would take too long.
🔍 [127] Scotland Yard
Tanya: Tanya reviewed the Chameleon's profile and tells the team, The Chameleon expects to see Holmes high-strung. He doesn't want to just kill Holmes. He wants to see him nervous.
Ledia: I think that clue would rule out the cab driver who presummably won't get to see Holmes for most of the night. Zoey: I think that would also rule out Watson because it doesn't help when Watson is more nervous than Holmes. Tanya: Then we are left with the Friend, the Violinist, the Director, the Inspector, and the Artist. Black: I think it is not the Violinist because I think a master of disguise might be able to micmic appearance and manner but not their violin skills. And there would be too many people notice the violinist at the playhouse. Tanya: But disguising as the violinist would probably let him go anywhere in the playhouse. Black: To do that it would be easier to just be the Director.
🔍 [107] Playhouse
Black: Black checked around the playhouse and found... Black: A syllable clue for the hiding place. Black: Four parts. Part 1: "To compete with." Part 4: After J's come ___."
Black: The last part is case (K's). Violin Case would first if the first party is "Rival". Ledia: Quite conclusive. Tanya: I think the prompt meant that the Chameleon only disguised as one person. If the hiding place is the violin case then I think we can rule out the Artist because the Artist can't easily enter backstage to rig the violins. The Friend could have rigged the case but I think it would be hard to disguise as Holme's childhood friend. Evelyn: Then we only have the Director and Inspector left. Ledia: A disguise as the Inspector could be how the Chameleon got out in the first place. Zoey: It would be the most convenient to be the Inspector. Everyone knows Holme's address. The Chameleon went to 221B first, then learned that Holmes will perform at the Playhouse because Dr. Watson told Holmes not to go. Zoey: AA XD Zoey: Now we need to know what the deadly surprise is in the violin case. It blows up, doesn't it? XD
🔍 [57] Locksmith
44: 44 was about to check Holmes's violin case when Zoey mentioned that it might blow up. 44: I got the middle parts of the syllable clue of the hiding place. Part 2: "The alphabet letter before P." Part 3: Nickname for Linda.
Sasha: Two more clues for Master Detective.
🔍 [7] Apothecary
Evelyn: Evelyn casts Protect. Evelyn: I thought bombs might be related to the drug store because they both have chemicals but I got a No Clue. 😅
🔍 [137] Tobacconist
Casey: The situation calls for the defusing specialist Casey. If the Inspector is the Chameleon, where is the Inspector? I heard that the Chameleon escaped the Inspector while being transferred to a new prison. Casey: There was a mix up of the clues. The actual clue for [137] is what Tanya reviewed. So now I am revealing Tanya's clue [127]. Tanya: I see.
Zoey: We didn't confirm that it is a bomb! XD Sasha: Well, it is time for drumroll unless anyone has another idea! Black: Who thinks that it is not a bomb? Evelyn: It could be poison gas. But I think bomb is still more probable. Sasha: Drumroll!
🥁 [17] Bank
Sasha: Syllable clue for the surprise: Sasha: Part 3 of 3: More than one sip.
🥁 [27] Carriage Depot
Black: The carriage driver is not the Chameleon.
🥁 [37] Dock
Tanya: Syllable clue for the Chameleon: Tanya: Part 2 of 2: Past tense of the verb tread.
Zoey: It seems that the places with no apparent relation is more useful. XD Tanya: Syllable clues are bad for RP though. Black: No it is not bad for RP. It is just harder. For example, this clue at the dock tells us that the Chameleon disguised as Lestrade. Then where is the real Lestrade? We found some clue at the dock. Zoey: But this is just half of Lestrade at the dock. 🤔 Evelyn: Maybe we found his pants at the dock. Ledia: I think the Chameleon is wearing Lestrade's uniform. Evelyn: Then we found some of Chameleon's prisoner clothing at the dock. Tanya: I see. Good RP.
🥁 [47] Hotel
Casey: Syllable clue for the Surprise Casey: Part 2 of 3: What the wind does.
🥁 [67] Museum
Sasha: No clue.
🥁 [82] Newspaper Shop
Sasha: No clue.
🥁 [87] Park
LRRH: Little Red Riding Hood's dog sniffed and found an underdressed man tied up behind the bushes at the park. LRRH: Syllable clue for the Chameleon part 2 of 3: The opposite of more.
🥁 [97] Pawnbroker
Sasha: No clue.
🥁 [117] Pub
Sylvia: Sylvia reports that some peculiar ingredents have been stolen at the pub. Sylvia: Syllable clue for the Surprise: Part 1 of 3: The alphabet letter after W.
🛎️ SOLUTION
Sasha: The Chameleon disguised as Inspector Lestrade and planted explosives in the violin case!
Sasha: Thank you for joining for the drumroll section, but only those who joined before drumroll get a win. Sasha: The game went better than expected!
Sasha thanks the players!

🔔
This is a routine monthly status update for Cardinal Quest for July.
StarTree: There are 5 open quests, 289 quest hours, 52 side quests, 0 prep quests, and 0 unresolved failures remaining! P4: P4 had already done the importing. 💟 Tanya: StarTree please update the counts. StarTree: Done!
Tanya: Let's move on to failure analysis for this month. #REF!: StarTree please move the Failure Area Codes to the searchable section. Tanya: Done! (Area, Causes, Severity) StarTree: Added a frame.
Tanya: It is still early. let's do Guild Log Quest also. StarTree: Two quests need to cleared to reduce the backlog! Tanya: StarTree please add a section for TPK list, and just list the TPKs in text. Tanya: "These are situations where we got a TPK. They are listed here as reminders." StarTree: It is listed, but the meaning of the TPKs are not obvious! Tanya: Let's save the expansion for next time. Please add that to Priorities and split that as its own section. StarTree: Roger! Tanya: Next, Sasha requested a new XP type 🎩 for converting real life situations to game terms. Please add it. StarTree: 🎩 is already added as KXP! Tanya: Please add the description of KXP at the Scoreboard section. StarTree: StarTree added a temporary description at the XP Legends node. That node needs to be upgraded! Tanya: It needs its own searchable section. Sasha: I want to start another 221B case. Tanya: StarTree please add a Board quest to upgrade the XP Legends node with search and descriptions. StarTree: Done! @Cardinal is now Rank B. Tanya thanks all for questing.
{"type":"chat","id":"202307122102","parentid":"202208250038","parentname":"Cardinal Quest","icon":"🎪","title":"2307 Routine Check","prev":"202306011934","author":"Tanya","location":"Quest Channel"}
🔔
This is Magic Bakery Plays 221B Baker Street Case 5! The game content is probably rated teens to adult. ⚠️ Sasha: We will enter drumroll after revealing 5 clues. If you want to get a WIN credit you must join before the drumroll section.
🚨 Case 5: The Coded Message
Sasha: Magic Detectives are called to a pawnbroker shop where the owner had died of a heart attack. There is no sign of a murder, but the envelope on the owner's desk contained a coded message. The message is addressed to the owner's old friend, who will be released from prison in two weeks.
Sasha: We are tasked to crack this code: "YQXFJUJMZJZFDXFSFH". The following has more details about the scene and situation.
Sasha: The following "clues" are part of the initial description. So I will use the ⭐ instead of the 🔍.
⭐ Persons
Sasha: The Landlady heard the hungry canary in the pawnshop for a week. When she entered the room she found the body of the pawn shop owner.
Sasha: The Pawnshop Owner was revealed to be a wanted petty thief in a number of burglaries. He laid low a few years ago after double-crossing a band of fellow thieves involved in a London Museum jewel heist. Along with his disappearance were the two most valuable items of the heist: the famous matching Eyes of Lucifer pearls.
Sasha: The Owner's Friend is currenting in a prison in Switzerland.
⭐ Scene
Sasha: The body of the owner lies over his Edwardian style desk. In the same room are pawned items including a riding saddle, a cobbler's bench, a complete set of Old English armour, a handmade wooden battleship, an old hand-carved Hotel sign, a collection of Dutch pottery, and also musical instruments, clocks and watches.
Black: About this case: 44 and I played it and discovered that the coded message can be decoded without revealing any further clue. So we challenged Amelia to do so and she got it. Black: Each clue would practically tell you the whole message. Sasha: Hold on. Let me think. Sasha: Since you have played the case, could you make the message harder to decode so that we need the clues? Black: Yes, but I can't gaurantee that the choices of clues would make sense, and whether it is still possible to solve with just 5 clues. Sasha: Let's do that anyway and see what happens. Black: New coded message: "YQXFJUJMZJZFDXFSFH" Sasha: I updated the message in the first section to this. 44: Did you change the actual message? Black: Yes, but now I would have to be the clue giver. 44: If you didn't change the purpose of the message, I would still guess from the context that the message is about where the Eyes of Lucifer are hidden, and presummably in the pawnshop. Sasha: The game is afoot! Zoey: Is the coded message still crackable without any clue? Black: Yes. Although I could make it even harder. Sasha: I would say let's just play and see what clues we get, otherwise there would be no story to RP. Tanya: If the message is a random substitution, normally the most frequent alphabet is the E. Zoey: F occured 4 times, if that is E, then ---E-------E--E-E-. Zoey: It doesn't seem to match anything directly so I will just get a clue. XD
🔍 [196] Pawnbroker
Zoey: The pearls are definitely in the pawnshop. Zoey casts elemental trace. Black: Zoey casts elemental trace but gets a very colorful response at the pawnshop. Her guts tell her that message most likely tells where the lost pearls are. But now she is not so sure if they are actually in the room, or if they are, what element she should be tracing.
Black: The actual clue from the book just confirms that the message is about where the Eyes of Lucifer are hidden. Zoey: I was debating whether I should start at the Museum because the Pawnshop is too obvious. XD Zoey: And I got a clue that is too obvious. XD Zoey: Could someone get the Museum clue? XD
🔍 [171] Museum
Tanya: Tanya checks the museum record of the Eyes of Lucifer. Black: From the records, Tanya sees that the Eyes of Lucifer glows red and its elemental signature is Fire. They are such a rare and distinct treasure that they would not be mistaken as anything else if left in plain sight. Tanya understands that it would be difficult for the pawnshop owner to find a buyer even if he wanted to sell them illegally to a collector.
Black: The clue from the book is that the Eyes of Lucifers were too hot for the owner to unload. He still had them when he died. Ledia: This is good RP. Black: 👍 Sasha: But I thought you said every clue would tell us where the pearls are hidden. Black: Maybe my memory is faulty. You happened to pick the clue that I wasn't thinking about.
🔍 [156] Dock
Casey: If it were me I would hide them in the battleship. Casey opens the handmade battleship and check its canons and ammo racks. Black: Casey checked the model ship closely and with so much awe and excitement, missing Zoey's message that there is no fire elemental signature from that battleship. Black: With magnifer in hand, Casey checked the paper of the coded message, and found three faint marks between the 6th and 7th, 9th and 10th, and 12th and 13th letters.
Black: The clue from the book was that the message had three words. But this message is not necessarily the same. Casey: So you mean this message has four words? Tanya: YQXFJU,JMZ,JZF,DXFSFH Sasha: Two clues left. Tanya: Saddle, Armour, and Clocks have six letters, each with a repeated letter. but they don't match those patterns. Maybe the letters in each section is scrambled. Tanya: Pearls also has six letters with no repeat. Maybe the first six letter word is pearls and the last six letter word is the location. Tanya: Of those three words, only Armour has repeated letters that is also in Pearls. If F is r, then the only remaining shared letter between the first word and the last word is X being a. YQarJU,JMZ,JZr,DarSrH. J is p,e,l or s. The middle two words can only have vowels i or e.
🔍 [186] Scotland Yard
Ledia: Ledia asks Zoey to check the element signature of the armour. Black: Zoey says that the armor has no fire signature.
Black: The clue from the book is no clue. Tanya: The last word is not armour. It is canary. The message is not scrambled it is backward. Tanya: YQXFJU,JMZ,JZF,DXFSFH = slraep,eMZ,eZa,yranac. Most likely "canary ate the pearls." Black : With that realization, Tanya looks around for the canary, but there is no canary in the room. Tanya: The canary is dead. It had been a week since it last ate. Who took the canary? Sasha: Last clue!
🔍 [201] Pub
Evelyn: Evelyn goes to the pub to look for the canary. Black: The canary is not at the pub.
Black: May I ask why you look in the pub? Evelyn: I just thought I could see Sylvia. I'm sorry. 😖 Zoey: What reason is that? XD Evelyn: It said the canary was hungry, so I thought someone would bring it to a place where it would be fed. The pub has food. Evelyn: And I hope that Sylvia could get some detective XP. before drumroll. 😅 LRRH: @Sylvia? LRRH: Is the game done though? Is the message cracked? Tanya: We don't know if that is the answer. It could still be wrong. Sasha: Black, how are you going to determine where the canary is? Black: I was thinking if you get one of the clues that would reveal the message. It just happens that you haven't gotten them. Black: The clue for this location in the book is that the message is written backward.
Sylvia: Evelyn remembered clearly that she brought the canary, alive, to Sylvia to be cared for, but neither the canary nor Sylvia is at the pub. The bartender said that they left in a hurry suddenly.
Zoey: OMG! XD Evelyn: I don't think Sylvia would steal the pearls. 😅 Zoey: Sylvia the Phantom Thief rebooted XD Sasha: It is drumroll time!
🥁 [206] Tobacconist
Zoey: Zoey starts elemental trace to track Sylvia and Eyes of Lucifer. Both of them have fire signature. Black: Zoey follows the trace, there is no sign that Sylvia was hidding her tracks.
Black: This clue reveals the letter for r: YQXFJU,JMZ,JZF,DXFSFH = --r---,---,---,-r----.
🥁 [151] Carriage Depot
LRRH: Little Red Riding Hood follows the chase. Black: At the carriage depot, the trace splits up into two.
Black: This clue reveals two letters. YQXFJU,JMZ,JZF,DXFSFH = ---a--,---,---,y-a-a-.
🥁 [161] Hotel
Evelyn: Evelyn calls Sylvia. Sylvia: Sylvia replies that the canary had gotten away and she lost it at the station.
Black: This clue reveals one letter. YQXFJU,JMZ,JZF,DXFSFH = -l----,---,---,------.
🥁 [181] Park
Ledia: Ledia decides to check the park, thinking that the canary probably flew to somewhere less crowded. Black: The canary sees Ledia and flies away.
Black: This clue reveals one letter. YQXFJU,JMZ,JZF,DXFSFH = s-----,---,---,------.
🥁 [141] Apothecary
Evelyn: Evelyn joins Sylvia for the search. Black: At the apothecary they both see the canary. The canary is flying high. Its belly seems to have an amber glow.
Black: This clue reveals two letters. YQXFJU,JMZ,JZF,DXFSFH = ------,--t,-t-,-----c.
🥁 [176] Newpaper Shop
Tanya: Tanya calls for P4. Black: P4 flies considerably slower than the canary. It doesn't seem that she can catch the canary in midair.
Black: This clue reveals one letter. YQXFJU,JMZ,JZF,DXFSFH = ------,-h-,---,------.
🥁 [166] Locksmith
P4: P4 uses ninja tools. Black: And what would that be? P4: 🍮 Black: The canary is so small that P4's tools would more than KO it.
Black: This clue reveals one letter. YQXFJU,JMZ,JZF,DXFSFH = ------,---,---,---n--.
🥁 [192] Playhouse
Evelyn: Evelyn tries to attract the canary by singing. Black: Evelyn casts sleep. The canary falls asleep in midair and falls toward the ground.
Black: This clue reveals one letter. YQXFJU,JMZ,JZF,DXFSFH = ----e-,e--,e--,------.
🥁 [146] Bank
LRRH: Little Red Riding Hood summons a pudding to catch the fall. Black: The canary falls into the pudding safety, since no damage is dealt, the canary is still asleep.
Black: This clue reveals one letter. YQXFJU,JMZ,JZF,DXFSFH = -----p,---,---,------.
🛎️ SOLUTION
Black: As the drumroll section had revealed, the message is "canary ate the pearls" written backward. Black: In the original game, the coded message was just shifted by one letter and written backward. That made it easier to guess without any clue. Zoey: What's the odds that we just happened to get all the non-letter clues before drumroll? XD Black: I know right. And... Black: How do you want to do this? Evelyn: I think we are supposed to return the pearls to the museum. Sylvia: May I use the steal skill to just take the pearls through the canary's body without waking it up? Sasha: @Cardinal Cardinal: Please roll three dice for skill level placement. Zoey: OMG we haven't rolled dice for so long! XD Sylvia: ➕➕➖ Sylvia is recognized for the steal magic, Rank B. Cardinal: Sylvia succeed at stealing the pearls from the canary. But she couldn't help but noticed that her skill had gotten a little rusty. Sasha: Eyes of Lucifer. Sounds like pretty powerful artifact. Are we sure we should just give it back to the museum? Ledia: It might be powerful but it sounds a little evil. Maybe it should be kept out of reach. Zoey: Like the one ring. Evelyn: May I check if it is a cursed item? Cardinal: Please roll two dice for skill level placement. Evelyn: ➕➕ Cardinal: Please roll a third die for skill level placement. Evelyn: ➕ Cardinal: Please roll a fourth die for skill level placement. Evelyn: 😅 Evelyn: ➖ Evelyn is recognized for the skills Detect Curses Rank A Cardinal: ➖➖➖➖➖➖➕ Cardinal: Evelyn recognizes that the Eyes of Lucifer is a Rank SSS cursed item. Those who try to use it will literally turn into a demon and destroy the world. The death of the pawnshop owner might not be of natural cause. Zoey: The Canary turned into a singing death note. Ledia: Then the Arx will seal them. The Eyes of Lucifer are now sealed at Arx. LRRH: Does anyone want the canary as a familiar? Evelyn: Does it like any of us? Cardinal: As the canary woke up, it seems to notice that the curse had been removed. It looks at Sylvia as if asking if she would forgive it for flying away. Tanya: It knew that it killed the previous owner and didn't want to kill Sylvia. So it flew away. Sylvia: Sylvia welcomes to canary back. Cardinal: The Canary flies to Sylvia and sings happily. Sylvia now has the canary as a familiar. Evelyn: Happy ending. 😊 Sasha: Congratulations for solving this case and for the great RP! Please return for the next case!
Sasha thanks the players!
