🔔
This is Magic Bakery plays Mice & Mystics, chapter 1 tile 5: The Courtyard Sasha: This session follows Magic Bakery game rules instead of the official rules.
📯 Casting
Sasha: Who is playing this time? Should we make the fights shorter?
Zoey: I think the fight was okay, but how do we get a hit on a monster? It seems that we only get a hit when we roll ➕➕, that would only be 1/4 of the time. Cardinal: You could describe the advantage you have. Then you may roll a third die. Zoey: Okay. Evelyn: I think I played too much last time, maybe P4 can take my place this time. P4: 💟 Ledia: The other kind of Ninja Healer. Zoey: XD Casey: I still want to play Nez. But why do I suck so bad? Tanya: You are carrying me. Maginos. Casey: No, I would just toss you on the ground next time. Sasha: I think we are missing a player for Filch. Sylvia: I'll just watch this time. Ledia: If I join, should I play Filch or Collin? I think Zoey might be closer to Filch. Zoey: I'm closer to Lily. Let's just get this over with. XD Ledia: Okay, I play Filch. At least that is DPS. Sasha: Okay, Cardinal please list the cast and HP status.
⭐Cardinal: Hero mice status
Prince Collin: ❤️❤️❤️ (Zoey)
Healer Tilda: ❤️❤️❤️ (P4)
Scamp Filch: ❤️❤️🖤 (Ledia)
Tinkerer Nez: ❤️❤️🖤🖤 (Casey)
Mystic Maginos: 🖤🖤🖤 (Tanya)
Zoey: Tanya is KO'ed XD Tanya: Since the start. I went OOM when I transformed everyone to mice in order to escape from the castle dungeon. Ledia: Good recap. Zoey: Wait. Since Lily wasn't in the dungeon, why did she become a mouse too? 🤔 Evelyn: The story is interesting isn't it? Zoey: Okay let's play! XD
⚔️ The Courtyard
Cardinal: The hero mice squeeze through a crack on the castle wall to a courtyard, where Prince Collin recognized the old oak tree that he used to climb as a kid, but the now unkempt courtyard seems a lot larger than he remembered.
Cardinal: Heroes, please describe your next action. Zoey: Prince Collin thinks that the team should move to the tree using grass and other features as cover to avoid detection, and lead them on a safer path. Casey: Nez carries Maginos following Collin. He is ready to drop Maginos if he has to fight. P4: Tilda thinks casting protect or heal now would be too risky, so instead she listens closely to tell what enemies are nearby Ledia: Filch is out of sight. The team has no idea where he went, maybe except Tilda who is sensing nearby creatures. Cardinal: Everyone rolls two dice please. Zoey: Collin: ➕➖ Casey: Nez: ➕➕ P4: Tilda: ➖➕ Ledia: Filch: ➖➖ Cardinal: ➖➖➕➕
⚔️Cardinal: As the hero mice carefully move through the unkempt vegetation, Tilda sensed at least two other mice near them, and the one in front behind the grasses is not Filch. Cardinal: Nez put down Maginos and franked the mouse in front with Collin. Nez took the chance and KO'ed the rat warrior silently in one hit with his hammer. Cardinal: At about the same time, a dark shadow swooshes above the mice and pecked at someone behind them. Filch is hit by a crow. He is now down to 1 HP. Tanya: We better hurry and take cover at the tree, says Maginos. Cardinal: Heroes please describe your next move. Casey: I pick up Maginos and keep going. We are out of the castle, this might be where we part with Filch. Zoey: Collin thinks that if Filch needs help he will come to us. It is better to keep going while their cover is not brown yet. P4: Tilda is torn between the three going forward and Filch who seems to be behind and wounded. Tilda thinks since the crow had already seen Filch, maybe she can go closer to him and cast a spell there before returning to the group. Ledia: Filch, not knowing what Tilda might be doing, intends to take out a rat warrior nearby and get his third knife. That's something he had wanted to try ever since being transformed into a mouse. It is now or never, thinks Filch, where else could you get such tiny mouse-sized knife? Zoey: OMG It is that DPS! XD Cardinal: Everyone rolls two dice please. Zoey: Collin: ➕➕ Casey: Nez: ➖➕ P4: Tilda: ➖➖ Ledia: Filch: ➖➖ Cardinal: ➖➖➕➕
⚔️Cardinal: Tilda finds Filch. That is the good news. The bad news is that so are the crow and a rat warrior. The crow swooshes down and attacks all three. Cardinal: Rat Warrior: ➕➖ Cardinal: In the chaos, it was the rat warrior who fended off the crow, but not before Tilda and Filch both took a hit. Ledia: I use perfect dodge and KO the Rat Warrior as it fends off the crow. Cardinal: Roll three dice for skill placement please. Ledia: ➕➕➖ Cardinal: The figure that the crow attacked turned out to be an afterimage. As she helps herself up, she sees that Filch had KO'ed the Rat Warrior, which seems to have collapsed on top of him. Filch is loses his next turn as he searches for the third knife. Filch is at 1 HP. Tilda is at 2 HP. Tilda did not cast a spell in the chaos. P4: May I cast group heal now and hide under the Rat Warrior also? Cardinal: It is very cramped under the Rat Warrior. Filch is now at 2 HP. Tilda at 3 HP. Ledia is recognized for Perfect Dodge Rank B.
⚔️ Tree Hole Centipede
⚔️Cardinal: On the other end of the courtyard, Prince Collin noticed an suspecting centipede slowly circling in front of a tree hole. That tree hole would be a perfect place for a rest, if not for the centipede.
Cardinal: Collin and Nez may roll three dice for attack. Tilda may cast a spell or search. Zoey: Collin will show for the centipede to attack him, which he will block the attack with his shield for Nez to attack. Then finish the centipede with his own sword. Zoey: ➕➖➕ Casey: Nez is going to strike twice if possible, he is not caring about making noise since the tree hole is right there. Casey: ➖➕➕ P4: I will search also. Cardinal: ➕➖ Cardinal: As planned, Nez hit the centipede while it was drawn to Collin. Then Collin counter attacked, and Nez finished it with a second swing. Cardinal: On the other end, Filch and Tilda searched the Rat Warrior, and... Cardinal: Filch takes off the Rat Warrior's fishscale armor, which Tilda could wear. Tilda finds herself an acorn helmet. Cardinal: (The deck only has 1 dagger left) Ledia: Out of how many cards? Cardinal: 47. Zoey: XD Ledia: Filch hands Tilda the armor, but by now she has so much armor that she is probably invincible to the crow. Cardinal: Heroes please choose your next move. Tanya: Maginos uses telepathy to tell Filch and Tilda that they found a safe tree hole at the tree. P4: Tilda learns that Filch is trying to get a dagger. She tell him to join them at the tree hole, since Nez can probably make him one. Ledia: Filch agrees and will go with her. Zoey: Collin decides to meet Tilda halfway. He thinks Nez can guard the hole if needed. Casey: Nez takes a look around for anything useful. Cardinal: Everyone rolls two dice please. P4: Tilda: ➕➕ Ledia: Filch: ➕➕ Zoey: Collin: ➖➕ Casey: Nez: ➖➕ Cardinal: ➕➕➖➖
⚔️Cardinal: As Tilda and Filch hurry to the tree hole, another Rat Warrior emerged from the grass. Filch grabbed Tilda's hand and the two just ran as the crow swooshes down and takes the Rat Warrior.
🌳 The Tree Hole
Cardinal: As the mice party reunite at the tree hole, a few other mice poke their heads out, "Who are you guys? You are not from around here are you?" One of the mice said, holding some crude spear made from twigs. Zoey: There are other mice? XD Cardinal: The mice from the tree hole seem offended by Collin's surprise. "Of course there are! Now tell us where you are from and why you want to come to Barksburg!" They said as they pointed their spears at the party. Tanya: Maginos say, "We are sorry, we are from the castle. We are just surprised that there is refuge around here and would like to take a rest. We don't mean to intrude." Cardinal: One of the mice says to another, "Castle mice aren't very smart are they? Everyone knows not to cross the yard during the day when the crow could just eat you..." Evelyn: 😅 Casey: What are we doing now? I'm lost. Cardinal: "Hey you," Stop peeling the bark from the tree!" said a mouse, "You need to get registered at the guild to harvest around here!" Casey: Okay... just wanna make some armor. Nez stops. Do they mean there is a mouse city around here? Cardinal: "Of course there is! You are standing in it already, mister!" said one mouse. Another mouse says, "It seems that they are new, we should bring them to see Mother. I think she would like to talk to someone from the castle." Cardinal: Leading the hero mice party down a winding tunnel, the party comes to a cavernous chamber talling than they could see. The chamber was full of other mice and mice buildings with market full of things seemingly pilfered from the castle. Zoey: It's a full city. XD Cardinal: Prince Collin stands in awe like a little kid. Zoey: XD Cardinal: Several guards join the party leading them up a mighty staircase running up the width of the cavern. Many mice stop to see what is going on. The staircase leads to a building that grew out of the tree wall, where an elderly she-mouse in an apron greets them. Cardinal: Drying her paws on her apron, the elderly mouse scans the party as if looking for someone. "Are you from the castle?" she asked. Zoey: "Yes, Mother?" Cardinal: "No titles here please, my caslte mouse. Many call me 'Mother' out of affection, but my name is Linera. I am the mayor of Barksburg." Ledia: A city of thieves, Filch thinks to himself as he says, "Impressive" outloud. Cardinal: Linera smiled proudly and hustled the party to a dining hall, treating them with cheese crumbs and tea in acorn cups. Evelyn: Cute! 😍 Cardinal: But beyond the hospitality, there is an anxious air about her. Tanya: "We are grateful for your hospitality, but is there someone troubling you, Linera?" says Maginos. Cardinal: "Our city lives off of what we forage from the caslte," says the mayor, "we certainly know the risk, but lately many of our best rangers have gone missing." A tear trickled down her furry cheek. "Please," she begged, "do you know what has happened to my daughter, Lily?" Chapter 1 completed
Zoey: We just got out of the castle and we are going back. XD Cardinal: Prince Collin surprised everyone as he stood up and proclaims, "We're going back!" Zoey: RP is not off?! XD XD Casey: Not right now, right? We just got out. I am pretty beat. Cardinal: Nez has doubt whether the party is ready to return. Zoey: I need to get myself. XD Cardinal: Prince Collin said something that would be equivalent to a marriage proposal if the room was not so excited at the prospect of a rescuing party for Lily. Zoey: XD
💬 Discussion
Tanya: @Cardinal, how many players are in the next chapter?
Cardinal: 3 for the rescue team, Lily is called a player but she can't move until she is rescued, at which point the chapter ends. Zoey: NOO ~~!! Evelyn: is there any story content until Lily is rescued? Cardinal: There is no story content in between. The heroes will fight through three tiles where Lily is in the last one. Evelyn: Is it bad if we skip to the last tile? Casey: But then what are we actually playing? I don't get what we are doing in the RP part, since the story is linear. In the fighting we aren't doing all that much either, since our tactic would probably be similar. Ledia: If It were me I would also go with less combat. But Sasha's original call was that this is for people who want to play. Evelyn: I am not entirely against fighting if people want to play. I just think there is too much fighting. Sasha: How should we do this? Should we just play the parts with story? Should we just roleplay the story? Or should we just summarize the story? Casey: I don't get how we can roleplay the story. There are set backstories to each character. It means we can't go off character. We can't really play ourselves, unlike how we play 221B. Ledia: That's correct. You can't just pass the story and have each of us read it like a script. Tanya: I think that only leaves the third option, that Cardinal simply summarize the story. If you want to turn that into a game, maybe we can guess what happens next. Ledia: I would rather make guesses on actual puzzles. Sasha: Anyone against summarizing the rescue now? Zoey: I am for the summary. Evelyn: I am okay with just a summary. Sasha: Okay. Two to nothing. Cardinal please do the honor.
🧀 The Rescue
Cardinal: Not without a dispute, the party returned to the castle to look for Lily after dark. Maginos uses his scrying magic and located Lily at the tunnels beyond the dinning hall. Cardinal: The heroes party sneaked and fought their way to a tunnel with strange blue crystals, where Lily's tail was caught in a mousetrap. Cardinal: As they approached, they see a vision of a beautiful young woman who seems sick, but was being treated by Tilda and other members of her healing order. Cardinal: "What was that," said Filch as soon as the vision faded. "Never mind that for now," said Maginos, "Let's free her first."
Cardinal: Heroes, how would you like to free Lily from the mousetrap? Zoey: Please don't cut my tail off. XD Cardinal: Lily begs the party to spare her tail, as she sees the party looks at her tail with weapons drawn. Zoey: XD Evelyn: I like this little puzzle at the end. 😊 Casey: Well, I think even if we cut her tail off Tilda can put it back. Nez takes the hammer to hit the pin of the mousetrap off the spring. Cardinal: Casey, roll two dice for Nez please. Casey: Does that mean you just give me 1/4 chance to succeed? ➖➕ Cardinal: Nez strikes the pin holding the spring with his hammer. As the pin is dislodged, the spring flies out violently, but luckily no one was hit. Cardinal: "I swear it was easiler the way I remembered it," Nez said. Cardinal: (The intended method in the story was to use a fork from the dinning room to pry open the mousetrap.) Casey: 🤷‍♀️ Evelyn: I heal Lily. Cardinal: With that, the party returns to the Barksburg as heroes. Yet, the party knows that their real mission to rescue King Andon has not yet started. They needed a plan, and they need it soon. Chapter 2 completed. Evelyn: I think this pacing is enjoyable. Just doing the story portions with RP for puzzle. Sasha: Then, keep going? Evelyn: I think that is too much gaming in one go. Sasha: We already finished the quests for this month. Evelyn: Could we continue our quest stories? Sasha: The one at Mira Mira? Evelyn: Yes. Sasha: Okay.
Sasha thanks the players!
{"type":"chat","id":"202307231305","parentid":"202207142259","parentname":"Mice & Mystics","icon":"🧀","title":"MM: CH1 Courtyard","prev":"202307162103","author":"Sasha","location":"Courtyard"}
🔔
This is a continuation of the story sessions for our quests.
🎪 Evelyn's Story
Evelyn: It is one week away from the end of the month. Evelyn checks the quest board and sees that Harbor is the only one that hasn't reached rank A for the month.
Evelyn: StarTree, could you recommend a rank A quest for Harbor? StarTree: Almost two years ago you logged a quest to learn the 12 habits to fix problems! Evelyn: Let's clear that quest. The content seems to be about productivity, but they seem to be more about the mental preparation. If I were to give a title it would be productive habits. Evelyn: Evelyn creates a new node for that skill. 202307231931|[Node]
⭐ 1. Create a morning ritual
📯Evelyn: What morning ritual do you have?
Zoey: Exercise. Black: Doing duolingo Ledia: News.
⭐ 2. Social Media Detox
Evelyn: I think we don't have this problem. But how do you detox if you were doing too much social media?
LRRH: On Twitter, once I signed up as a fact checker I stopped going because it feels like work. Black: Limit the time to check social media to say once per day and not in the weekend. Zoey: What if it is not social media but watching drama or anime? Evelyn: What do you do in such case? Zoey: Multitask. XD Sasha: I think we have a thread on binge watching. StarTree: It is 202301052202|this thread!
⭐ 3. Listen to Podcasts During Commute
Evelyn: For this we have some podcast channels in the books section.
Ivy: I think this advice is not entirely safe if you are driving. It is safer if you are riding on a bus or a train. Not so much if you are walking and crossing streets. Evelyn: That's true. Evelyn: Should we rate these advices? Ivy: Let's just keep going.
⚔️ 4. If Something Takes 5 Minutes Or Less, Do It.
Evelyn: I think this advice is good when doing so now would save you time later, and when it does not conflict with other priorities.
Black: There are other advices where you should do complex tasks when your mind is ready to do them. If you spend the time doing simple tasks when your mind is the most alert, you could end up being unable to do the complex tasks later in the day. Ivy: I think this advice should have a caution mark. It validity is at least contested, or known to be bad in some cases. Evelyn: I'll mark it as contested. But I think there is a point of doing simple tasks to remove clutter, or warming up with simple tasks.
💡Ivy: Maybe we should write our own tip: If your mind is not ready to tackle a big task, you could start by doing small tasks or tasks that remove clutters. If your mind is ready, then tackle the big task and leave the easier task for later when you don't need your full alertness.
LRRH: Such as grouping small tasks with watching anime or something. Tanya: We also do that at Cardinal Quest. We leave lower priority tasks for downtime.
⭐ 5. Make It A Habit To Have A Positive Attitude.
Evelyn: I think we are generally good in this aspect.
Ledia: I think the guild maintains a possitive environment.
📯Black: How do you maintain a positive attitude if you are trying to tell an older oppressor that what they do is wrong, but they won't admit?
Ledia: Good question. Zoey: ChatGPT. XD Zoey: ChatGPT has 10 points. Are you ready? XD
🔍 1. Empathy and Understanding
💡ChatGPT: Try to put yourself in their shoes and understand their perspective. Often, people may be set in their ways due to their upbringing or life experiences. Showing empathy can help bridge the gap between you and the oppressor, making them more receptive to your message.
🔍 2. Respectful Communication
💡ChatGPT: Approach the conversation with respect and avoid using accusatory or confrontational language. Focus on the behavior or actions, rather than attacking their character. Speak calmly and rationally to increase the likelihood of being heard.
🔍 3. Appeal to Shared Values
💡ChatGPT: Find common ground or shared values that can serve as a basis for your argument. Highlighting areas of agreement can create a connection and make them more open to considering your viewpoint.
🔍 4. Provide Evidence
💡ChatGPT: Back up your claims with factual information and evidence, whether it's personal experiences or objective data. Having a well-researched and informed perspective can make your argument more compelling.
🔍 5. Use Non-Violent Communication
💡ChatGPT: Employ techniques from non-violent communication, such as active listening and "I" statements, to express your feelings and concerns without putting the oppressor on the defensive.
🔍 6. Be Patient and Persistent
💡ChatGPT: Changing deeply ingrained beliefs takes time and effort. Be patient, and don't expect immediate results. Continue to express your viewpoint respectfully, even if progress seems slow.
🔍 7. Seek Allies
💡ChatGPT: Enlist the support of others who share your perspective. A collective voice can be more influential and can demonstrate that your concerns are shared by many.
🔍 8. Lead by Example
💡ChatGPT: Demonstrate the positive change you wish to see in the world through your actions and behavior. Being a role model can inspire others, including the older oppressor, to reconsider their own actions.
🔍 9. Know When to Step Back
💡ChatGPT: If the conversation becomes unproductive or hostile, recognize when it's time to step back and reassess the situation. You may need to give the oppressor some space and time to reflect on the discussion.
🔍 10. Focus on Self-Care
💡ChatGPT: Engaging in difficult conversations can be emotionally draining. Make sure to take care of yourself, both physically and mentally, to maintain your resilience and positive attitude.
ChatGPT: Changing someone's perspective is not always immediate, and in some cases, it may not be possible at all. However, approaching the situation with a positive attitude and a constructive mindset increases the likelihood of fostering understanding and promoting change. Black: I think I am already doing most of these. Tanya: I think you would just have to keep at it and add value to your presentation. Ledia: There is always a chance that the other party is intentionally hostile. Tanya: So, focus on doing what is right without expecting that it will work or work quickly.
⭐ 6. Never Hesitate To Say No.
Evelyn: I'm not sure what to say about this.
Black: In design and engineering, it is not always meaningful to say No. Sometimes what should be said is "I don't know" or "I need to study it." Evelyn: At Twitter, this advice is more about saying no to things that would have a negative impact on yourself. Such as when someone asks you to sacrifice for their benefit. Ledia: Hard to tell in a quest society. If the task is good, the asker doesn't need to pay anything. But then you should decide what is worth doing and say no if it is not worth doing.
⭐ 7. Do What Makes You Happy.
Evelyn: I think this advice requires the part that says "without hurting other people."
Tanya: Yes.
⭐ 8. Get Enough Rest.
Evelyn: I hope everyone gets enough rest.
Sasha: Lately I stopped watching NCIS because I have a headache throughout the day, and I wake up in the middle of the night. I don't seem to be recovering. Evelyn: Are you eating enough? Sasha: I think I stopped snacking while watching NCIS. Zoey: XD Ledia: It might also just be the weather if it is hot. Sasha: Yes it is hot. But it is only July. Evelyn: Let's try reverting to the former habit and drink more water. Zoey: Snacks to the rescue. XD
⭐ 9. Speak Up For Yourself.
Evelyn: I think we are fine on this.
Ivy: For the record, what are these advices from? Evelyn: It is: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://twitter.com/UpSkillYourLife/status/1437787851337486339","desc":"[Twitter]"} Ivy: Going through each tip like this makes a rather good thread. Maybe we should do this more often. Evelyn: I think I logged many links like this at @Skill. 😅 Black: If you discuss like this, are you going to summarize or copy back to the node you made? Evelyn: I plan to just display this directly like how 221B displays a case. Black: Good idea.
⭐ 10. Follow The 80/20 Rule.
Evelyn: This advice is about investing most of your energy and time on tasks that would create the big impact.
Ledia: I think most of the time when we do guild quests, we don't necesary select the one with the biggest impact. Evelyn: I thought we are doing it, in each chapter. Tanya: Roughly speaking. Ledia: But for this session, you didn't ask StarTree to give you the most impactful task. Evelyn: I think it is fine because I logged this task so I should do it. 😅 Tanya: I think it is fine because @Whale is not entirely critical, and we are sort of taking a break. Tanya: So anything is fine, really. Ledia: Think we can challenge outselves to reduce Guild Log quests below 1000? Tanya: I am content if it is going down compared to the previous month. StarTree: The count is currently at 1189! Zoey: No. Let's not try to complete 190 quests in a week. XD
⭐ 11. Appreciate More.
Evelyn: This is about practicing the attitude of gratitude. I think we are doing fine as we fill up the happy calendar.
Black: I think the happy calendar is an idea worth spreading. Evelyn: I'll add a note to the Quest Board.
⭐ 12. Plan Your Day The Night Before.
Evelyn: I don't think I do this. 😅
Tanya: Tomorrow is mainly Cardinal Quest. @StarTree did we get a reply for the ship magazine? StarTree: There is no reply! Tanya: That could be a problem. Sasha: On this topic I like the tips where you leave work half done at the end of the day, so that when you return you can pick it up right away. Ledia: I think it depends on where you are in the task. If it is almost done, just finish it. Zoey: And if it is not almost done, what else can you do but to leave it half done? 🤔 Sasha: I mean leaving the workspace open instead of closing everything. Black: Be careful depending on what program you are using. I guess make sure you save them before leaving them open. Sasha: Yes sure.
Evelyn: I think that's all for this quest. I will add this to the node in 221B style. Evelyn thanks all for joining.

Honoromics
Philosophy
This node is for honor societies topics on what you can or cannot do with honor points, and how honor is assigned for tasks.

{"name":"Ledia","score":"2"}, {"name":"Fina","score":"1"}, {"name":"Kisaragi","score":"1"} ]}
🔔
This was a review of the advices on 10 unproductive habits.
🎪 About
Evelyn: I think the content is too different from "The Story so far", so I will just do this as a small survey like last time.
Sasha: If you can't transform it, then there is a puzzle here. Evelyn: I think that is not my strength, so I will just continue in plain language. 😅
⭐ 1. Lack of focus
⭐Evelyn: The advices this time are from {"cmd":"url","url":"https://hackspirit.com/habits-that-are-sabotaging-your-success/","desc":"this article"}. It gives an example of getting distracted by notifications, which you may turn off.
Black: I find wearing headphones help even if it is not playing any music. Tanya: Yes.
⭐ 2. Multitasking
⭐Evelyn: This article says multitasking is bad when it reduces your performance, such as making you make more mistakes.
Evelyn: But from the last discussion and previous discussion, multitasking could be good if the tasks are simple. Tanya: Yes.
⭐ 3. Procrastination
⭐Evelyn: This advice says that to beat procrastination, you could make a to-do list and prioritize tasks, and set deadlines. And reward yourself when you finish a task.
Tanya: For Cardinal Quest we list all the subtasks to get a sum of overall time. Then we can see if we are on track. Tanya: For the checklist we breakdown the tasks by stage to remind us to start checking as early as possible. Evelyn: Yes. 😊
⭐ 4. Lack of planning
Evelyn: This advice is about list your vision for your future, your long and short term goals, steps to achieve your goals and a todo list for your daily tasks.
Tanya: I think we could do better at the quest board. I think currently the quest board is too much about activity volume than progress toward goals. Sasha: We have a goal of reducing the guild log quests, and migrating to GitHub. Evelyn: I think almost every item on the quest board is one small part of the peacemaking goal. So we did break down a big goal into smaller goals. Evelyn: We just don't set deadlines, because it tends to create unnecessary stress as deadlines are arbitrary. Tanya: What if there are sub tasks that are not worth doing? Evelyn: When I try to clear the guild log, if I see duplicated task I won't do it again. I think there will be a time when we need to review the remaining tasks and delist the ones not worth doing. LRRH: I think in general self-reflection or self-improvement quest like this is worth doing, but maybe not when the topic is too similar to what we have done before. Black: The self-evaluation series will loop once a year. Casey: I have an idea of a quest map. Which shows how far away we are to completing a quest, and what obstacles we have to overcome. I just haven't gotten around to design it. Tanya: I think in general we could start with just a text list without the graphics. Black: I thought of adding a "Quest" tag for the index section. But then I think it would just list what we already have in the Quest Board. Tanya: The quest board should set the focus. Evelyn: What is more important? Clearing the items in guild log, or following through with the quests on the quest board? Sasha: Clearing the guild log quests IS a quest on the quest board. Evelyn: I mean... 😅 LRRH: I think anything that you can do is fine. So don't stress over it. If a task is hard, then do the easier one first. Sasha: I did many easy ones yesterday. Tanya: I do have a concern that we are not spending our time correctly. And a small enlightenment might lead us on the right track. Sasha: In that case I would encourage anyone to try something with their chapter or when they quest. We might just discover a better way. Tanya: Yes.
⭐ 5. Lack of sleep
⭐Evelyn: The suggestion here is to avoid all stimulants close to bedtime.
Tanya: Yes.
⭐ 6. Lack of self-care
⭐Evelyn: This is about keeping habits like exercising, keeping a healthy diet, sleep, and good hygiene.
Tanya: Yes.
⭐ 7. Negative self-talk
⭐Evelyn: This says you may stop negative self-talk by cultivating self-awareness, and replacing them with positive affirmation instead.
Tanya: Yes.
⭐ 8. Fear of Failure
⭐Evelyn: This says try to see failure as an opportunity for growth instead of a disappointment.
Tanya: I think the monthly failure analysis which is now really a daily routine is good practice. Evelyn: Yes. 😊
⭐ 9. Perfectionism
⭐Evelyn: This is about being comfortable with imperfection and focus on the meaning and the process, that your self-worth isn't tied to the expected result.
Tanya: What is the difference between being comfortable with imperfection and having a low standard? Evelyn: I think having a low standard means you don't even try to do better.The bad part of perfectionism is when you try something hard but become upset when you don't succeed. Without the bad part of perfectionism, you could still aim for a higher standard, but don't feel upset when you fail. Tanya: I see. Black: I think this also has to do with scarcity mindset when you imagine that you only have one try, when in reality you have multiple tries until you succeed. Tanya: Yes.
⭐ 10. Comparisonitis
⭐Evelyn: The advice here is to be grateful to the blessings that you do have, and not to compare with anyone else's.
Tanya: Yes.
@Happy is now Rank A5. Evelyn thanks all for joining.

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202307262011|🛥️ Boat Full of People {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202307262011","music":""}
You're out on the water and see a boat filled with people. You look away for a second and look back again, but this time you don't see a single person on the boat. Why? Hint: The boat did not sink. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.rd.com/article/long-riddles/","desc":"[Source]"}
Show Answer
All the people on the boat are in relationships!
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202307262011","parentid":"202208141928","parentname":"Puzzle Plaza","icon":"🛥️","title":"Boat Full of People","subtitle":"Puzzle","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2015/02/13/09/56/motor-yacht-634925_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Mikela","description":"","card-text":""}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202307262024|👑 Principal Agent Problem {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202307262024","music":""}
Principal Agent Problem
Game Theory
When the principal and agent do not share the same goals and acts with a conflict in interests.

{"cmd":"url","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principal%E2%80%93agent_problem","desc":"[Wikipedia]"}
The Principal-Agent problem happens when the principal and the agent (that the principal hires) do not share the same goal, such that the agent does not act in the best interest of the principal. This problem is relevant to peacemaking when a government agent does not act to the best interest of its people principals.
{"cmd":"QueryAllPSNi","node":"202307170949","desc":"🛎️ Agent Governamce"} {"cmd":"QueryAllPSNi","node":"202305071032","desc":"👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 People First Principles"}
💬 Discussions

The prioritized section at art requests doesn't seem current. What should I draw next?
Tanya: @StarTree, could you make the Art Request section open in the same section instead of at the bottom, and make each subsection collapsible? StarTree: Those sections are in a flex frame. Do you want the flex frame removed? Tanya: I see. They look fine on wider screen but not on column view. Please ignore what I said for now. Sasha: I think column view matters more. 3B: I think it is okay without flex. Or use the flex only for charter and chapters. StarTree: Done!
🔮Tanya: For content, I think the highest priority would be those that help us spread or explain philosophical concepts.
Tanya: For example, could you draw a manga page or manga style explanation of Choice Democracy? Fina: I think the advantage of a manga page is contrast. Manga is good at showing how the same situation is resolved differently in different philosophies. Tanya: I see. 3B: The main advantage of choice democracy is that the minority does not lose their decision power. 3B: Then the first panel asks the question, the middle second and third panels contrast between majority rule and choice democracy, and the fourth panel is supposed to be funny. What can be the context? Tanya: The most influential topic would be land use. 3B: It is hard to make it funny or cute. Evelyn: I think using animals to represent voters would be cute. Squirrels want acorns and bunnies want carrots. 3B: So, say there are more squirrels than bunnies, majority rule results in no carrot fields, whereas the choice democracy map has fields of both kinds in the same proportion. 3B: But what is the punchline in panel 4? Gaia: What about Coyotes want both squirrels and rabbits? Evelyn: I hope that it won't be too dark. 😅 Gaia: The fourth panel can be the exception: everyone may use their token to choose, but not if that use hurts others. Fina: But it is legal if the Coyote has a territory where it can eat trespassers. Evelyn: I would rather feed the coyotes squirrels and bunny biscuits. 😅 Tanya: If you use animals, would people argue that the ratio you show would not be the natural ratio of squirrels vs rabbits? Sasha: You can always add a disclaimer. 3B: I will think about it and make a draft. I will show you when the draft is done or when I am stuck. 3B thanks all for the ideas.

What would be a good casual game for two?
Sasha: Codename? 221B? Tanya: I second 221B. Although the theme might be questionable. Sasha: Crack the case is more casual. Tanya: I don't think that game is good for 2 player, because someone needs to know to solution to give hints. Black: Between those three I think 221B is the best. But that game doesn't really feel like a board game. The way we play it doesn't require a board. Amelia: Ghost fighting treasure hunter was a blast, and it plays well when fewer than four players. Black: I think that is too kiddish. Black: I am also considering Last Night On Earth, if the rules aren't too complicated. Such as the tutorial scenario where you just need to kill some zombies. Ledia: You could always just introduce your version of the rule. Black: But then the cards and text from the game may not make sense. Ledia: True. Black: 221B and Last Night On Earth are probably doable. I'll think about it. Sasha: Actually I would want to try playing LNOE. Black: It is just a roll to move and fight game. It is bad over the internet because you have to see the board and draw cards per player, much like Mice & Mystics. Sasha: But we can let Cardinal handle the details and play it like a paper RPG. And if there is no strong story we can play as ourselves. Black: There is no strong story. It is basically scenarios. The players could be anyone. Black: But without the board and such, there isn't much to the game. You are just going around gathering what you need and avoid getting killed by zombies. Sasha: I would think that it would be more interesting when Cardinal GM it. Ledia: To me I would rather play 221B, because there is a mystery that we could guess wrong. Tanya: I would also prefer 221B. Black: Anyway, I think I am good for now. Everything else seems too complicated. Ledia: A little strange that there aren't more good game for two players. Black: If you don't want the game to take too long or be competitive. Black thanks all for the ideas.

🔔
There is a thread on why there are more laws and regulations on dog ownership but not cats, when cats are known to roam and kill other wild lives. Zoey: With or without comparing to dog laws, what should be the laws regarding cats?
Fina: In reciprocative justice, it is legal to hunt predatory animals. So if you find a cat that preys on other animals, you could kill it. Tanya: Doesn't half of the ecosystem consists of predators? Fina: Stewardism says you are not supposed to kill predators if that would break the ecosystem. But if the ecosystem won't break, then you can kill them. Evelyn: Or just keep them out. Black: What about a predator that hunts other predators? Do they get a pass? Fina: You could exclude predators that only hunt predators, but a typical predator hunts anything they can prey on. Zoey: The original thread said cats kill birds. But birds hunt worms. Fina: Cats also hunt birds that do not eat worms.
Wee~~!
{"type":"chat","id":"202308010852","parentid":"202308012104","parentname":"Animal Custody","icon":"🐾","title":"Cat Laws","prev":"189912300000","author":"Zoey","location":"World Tree"}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202308012104|🐾 Animal Custody {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202308012104","music":""}
Animal Custody
Law
This node is for animal custody laws regarding pets and familiars.
Zones
An opt-in zone can define its rules. In the common zone where no one needs to opt-in, the law is based on the rights of autonomy, where actions that violate autonomy are illegal.

An opt-in zone could specify who has authority to hunt, and what interactions are sanctioned. An opt-in zone could sanction hunting only if the creatures being hunt give consent. A creature gives consent if it is preys on peaceful creatures.
Rule 1
An owner is liable for their dependent's invasion of someone else's personal space. (This includes aggressive charging, non-aggressive licking, loud volume, or strong smell.)
Rule 2
All animals destroying the habitat can be hunted. If the animal has an owner, the owner is liable for damages. "Hunting" is a resolution on a spectrum depending on how invasive the species is to the local habitat.
Differences between dogs and cats
Rule 1 applies to both, but you would expect almost no cat owner to violate this rule. Dogs don't need to be on leashes. But to avoid liability, the owners use leashes. An owner is still at fault if their animal invades someone's space while on a leash.

Rule 2 could apply to cats if a case can be made showing that they have become pests in the local habitat to warrant a hunt.
💬 Discussions

🔔
The law game continues. Natalie: Please be aware that the content may not be appropriate for children, and that we play this game from a philosophical standpoint. The answers are not meant to be representative of all jurisdictions.
[21] Tort principles in criminal law
Natalie: Are the general tort principles of causation, cause-in-fact, and legal (proximate) cause applicable to criminal law as well?
Casey: Yes. The part that determines if something happened is the same. Natalie: Yes, when applied to the defendant, the defendant's act must be the actual (cause-in-fact) and legal (proximate) cause of the victim's injury.
[22] Superseding Cause
Natalie: What does "superseding cause" mean in determining a break in the chain of proximate causation?
Sasha: Does it mean there is an alternate cause to cover the break? Natalie: A superseding cause means a third party (other than the defendant) intervened and caused the accident. It is a type of defense for the defendant.
[23] Cause of death
Natalie: Two people fire at the same person at the same time. It is impossible to determine which bullet was the killing shot. Will both shooters be criminally responsible for causing the victim's death?
Tanya: This should be yes. And in reciprocative justice, the victim does not need to die for both to be convicted of murder. Natalie: Both are responsible because each bullet was a substantial factor in the death.
[24] Hiding the Body
Natalie: Ann wants to kill Bob and traps him in the stable to let the horse stomp on him. Thinking that he is dead, she puts him in quicksand, which turns out to be the actual cause of death. Since Ann thought that Bob had already died when she put him in quicksand, is Ann still guilty of first-degree murder?
Fina: Yes. Since she trapped Bob in the stable to be stomped. The horse is her means of the murder. And in reciprocative justice, she would be guilty of murder regardless whether Bob in fact dies. Natalie: The card's answer is yes also. The explanation is that the chain of proximate causation is not broken because she already intended the result. Sasha: I think the reciprocative justice explanation is cleaner.
[25] But For
Natalie: Ann shoots Bob in the leg. While Bob is hospitalized and vulnerable, Cid kills Bob in the hospital. Is Ann guily of homicide, if Cid would not have the opportunity to kill Bob but for what Ann did?
Tanya: Yes if Ann reasonably knows that this would happen. No otherwise. To show that Ann is guilty, the prosecutor would need to show that that is the design. Natalie: The card's answer is no, since with the facts given, it is assumed that there is no plan and Cid's action is independent. So only Cid is guilty of murder.
Natalie thanks all for playing.
{"type":"chat","id":"202308022006","parentid":"202301011739","parentname":"Law Game","icon":"⚖️","title":"Law Game Part 12","prev":"202307211946","author":"Natalie","location":"Paladin Hall"}

This is a routine monthly status update for Cardinal Quest for August.
📯StarTree: There are 7 open quests, 283 quest hours, 20 side quests, 11 prep quests, and 0 unresolved failures remaining! P4: P4 finished importing. 💟 Tanya: StarTree please update the counts. StarTree: Done!

: I already added two codes. Tanya: This time we will import the TPK records StarTree: The content needs to be transformed! Tanya: I think we will go through them one by one.
2210: Dawn Island
🔍StarTree: Back in February, someone was told which scroll to use as a reference. But that information was not passed to us. Zoey tried to find the scroll without knowing that someone knew that already. As a result, the crystal was missing a part and needed to be added after it was already activated.
Evelyn: I marked that as TPK because we could have known it eight months before, but somehow our communication failed. Zoey: I found another references and thought that was all we needed. But if we had the original one, then we would know something was missing. Tanya: So in this case, you could not find the one you were told to use, so you used substitute. But the substitute was not identical, and you couldn't tell that they were not the same because you had not seen the intended one. StarTree: Zoey heard about the reference only in October when we found that the crystal was missing something! Around that time, we see an old message thread for the first time, which showed that a reference was mentioned in February. Evelyn: I think in general we need better information about what is needed. This week we have a similar TPK where we were missing golem wall enchantment. It happened because someone misinterpreted the situation, and we have no means to double check. Tanya: I agree that we should get the record that would let us double check. Zoey: But the reference was mentioned in a thread that was not addressed to us. How would we know that information existed? Evelyn: Maybe we could ask to confirm if the reference we found was correct? For cases we have not done before. Tanya: In this case, the reference we did find was foreign, so we should ask to confirm. Evelyn: I can add that to the CHK. "If the reference is foreign, confirm with natives if that is correct." Tanya: We also need a CHK entry of gathering the record for double check. Evelyn: Added. Tanya: I think that is good enough for this round. StarTree please update the node. StarTree: Done!
Tanya thanks all for questing. @Cardinal is now Rank B.

202210080934|Vacation Island

 202308042055|🤣 How to be funny {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202308042055","music":""}
How to be funny
Skill
1. Observe humor
Pay attention to comedians, funny TV shows, movies, and humorous content online. Observe what makes you laugh and try to understand why certain jokes or situations are funny.
2. Know your audience
Different people have different senses of humor. Tailor your humor to your audience. What might be funny with friends might not be appropriate in a professional setting.
3. Timing is key
Good comedic timing can make an ordinary joke hilarious. Pause before delivering a punchline or use well-timed reactions to enhance the humor.
4. Wordplay and puns
Play around with words, double meanings, and puns. Wordplay can add wit and cleverness to your humor.
5. Self-deprecating humor
Lightly poking fun at yourself can be endearing and relatable. Just be careful not to overdo it or come across as too negative.
6. Observational humor
Notice and comment on everyday situations or human behaviors in a humorous way. Often, the funniest things are right in front of us.
7. Exaggeration
Overstate or exaggerate situations to create comedic effect. Just be mindful not to go overboard or offend anyone.
8. Use funny anecdotes
Share funny stories or experiences from your life. People love relatable and amusing personal tales.
9. Be confident
Confidence can amplify the impact of your jokes. Embrace your sense of humor, and don't be afraid to take risks.
10. Practice makes perfect
Humor is like any skill; the more you practice, the better you become. Experiment with different types of humor and see what works best for you.
11. Listen and react
Being funny isn't just about making jokes; it's also about reacting to what others say. Active listening can help you find opportunities to insert humor into conversations.
12. Avoid offensive humor
Be mindful of your audience and avoid jokes that may be offensive, inappropriate, or hurtful.
13. Stay up-to-date
Humor often relies on current events and pop culture references. Stay informed and integrate relevant jokes into your conversations.
14. Keep it light
Humor should be enjoyable and not cause discomfort or distress. Aim to create a positive and pleasant atmosphere.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202308042055","parentid":"202210080934","parentname":"Vacation Island","icon":"🤣","title":"How to be funny","subtitle":"Skill","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2016/09/10/15/45/marbles-1659398_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Zoey","description":"","card-text":""}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202308042121|👑 Monopoly and Monopsony {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202308042121","music":""}
Monopoly and Monopsony
Philosophy
Monopoly is the power to dictate what is sold, Monopsony is the power to dictate what is bought.
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://freakonomics.com/podcast/do-you-know-who-owns-your-vet/","desc":"[link]"} 💬 Discussions

⭐
This is about prioritizing tasks.
About
Sasha: This is a method called the 5/25 rule that I just found on the internet. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.yourtango.com/self/warren-buffett-five-twenty-five-rule-sky-rocket-your-productivity","desc":"[link]"}
Sasha: I think we can try going through it as an exercise as a guild. LRRH: Okay. Tanya: Don't we already know the priorities? Spread peaceful concepts to advance world peace. Sasha: Let's see if we get the same result.
⭐ 1. List 10 top goals
📯Sasha: Let's do it!
Tanya: Spread peaceful concepts to advance world peace. LRRH: Make a cute website. Evelyn: Keep a record of happy moments. Sasha: Have fun as a guild. Arcacia: Spread fun as a guild. Casey: It is hard coming up with 10 goals. Sasha: You are supposed to think. You could improve on an existing goal. P4: Healthy lives. Zoey: Looks like we will need many fillers. Black: Are these supposed to be long term goals? Sasha: Any goal. Zoey: Catch up on animes. XD Sasha: Three more to go. Black: Get the car fixed. Ivy: Implement quest society. 3B: Aren't you going to reduce th number back down to 5? Is there a point listing the goals to be eliminated? Zoey: There is no way you can list 25 goals. XD Tanya: It is easy to list 25 goals if you just re-state the goal of each chapter. But I think we are way past the usefulness of this exercise. Kisaragi: Keeping the guild tidy.
⭐ 2. Add 7 more
📯Sasha: I don't think this exericse is totally useless, let's continue and add more. Be creative, be funny.
Zoey: Can I go again? XD Let's finish the Mice & Mystics game. XD Sasha: I suppose you may go again in each round. LRRH: A guild beach towel. P4: Complete filling the paper star jar. Casey: Deal with the piles of board games. Sasha: Deal with the piles of LEGO. Tanya: Complete Cardinal Quests. Evelyn: Explore more ways to spread peace.
⭐ 3. Add 5 more
📯Sasha: Round 3. Go go go!
P4: Bring all original music to light. LRRH: Clear the guild quest log. 3B: More manga pages. Casey: Complete the item search quests. Ledia: Combine and complete all goals. Zoey: Isn't that cheating? XD
⭐ 4. Add 3 more
📯Sasha: Let's see if you can propose a goal that will stay in the final round!
Tanya: Create the peacemaking version of troubleshooting notes. LRRH: Promote the wish fulfilling quest. Ivy: Github migration.
🔍 5. Remove 10
📯Sasha: This step here is to remove 10 that are the least important.
Evelyn: Who decides what is important? Do you only remove the ones you proposed? Black: In Choice Democracy you would only remove the ones you proposed. There is no reason to control what someone sets as their own goal. Sasha: But then it means each of us needs to list 25 goals. So let's just imagine that each of us have listed these same 25 goals. Imagine that you are just thinking out load as you remove the ones according to whatever way you think is the least important. Zoey: I suppose I could remove the goal to "catch up with animes" because I am doing that regardless. XD Tanya: We need a list of all 25 goals. Sasha: StarTree? StarTree: Roger! It is its own section! Evelyn: I think "Spread fun as a guild" can replace "Have fun as a guild." So I would remove the later. Ledia: Should we add the goals that we removed to the Quest Board, so that they are not ignored? Tanya: I think the purpose of the exericise is the opposite. If it is eliminated on the list, then you should also remove it from the Quest Board. The point is to focus on goals that are important. Ledia: Then I don't quite agree with the purpose of the exercise. Black: It is somewhat of a scarcity mindset. That you have to eliminate goals to get something done. Ledia: I am okay with crossing out a goal on the list if it means it is added to the quest board. Zoey: To be honest I wouldn't add "catch up with animes" to the quest board. XD Sasha: Let's first see if there are goals we can remove outright. 3B: Then I will remove manga pages because it is already on the quest board. Evelyn: I think we haven't fully used the potential of manga pages in spreading peaceful concepts. LRRH: We won't remove that from quest board. Sasha: I don't think Github migration is very important because our website is functioning. Ledia: I would remove "complete guild log quests" because that is covered by "Combine and complete all quests." Zoey: But you can use that reason to remove any item. Ledia: The ultimate goal. LRRH: Then for the same reason I would remove the wish goal. Tanya: I don't think that this reason or argument is helpful to the exercise. Zoey: I thought you would just want to finish the exercise so we could continue what we have been doing. XD Tanya: I see. Tanya: I would remove the maintenance goals because they would be done regardless. So remove Cleaning, Fixing, and dealing with board games and LEGO. Casey: That is so not true. The board games are not going anywhere. Sasha: And the LEGOs are not going anywhere. Tanya: They are not going anywhere because they are not important to deal with. So it is still okay to remove them as goals. Sasha: That I agree.
🔍 6. Remove 7 more
📯Sasha: In this round we remove 7 more.
Evelyn: I think explore more ways to spread peace is covered by spreading peace. LRRH: StarTree please add the Beach Towel to guild log then remove it from the lsit. StarTree: Done! Casey: I guess remove the item search quest. Ledia: I would make goal #23 "make a cute website that is a peacemaking version of troubleshooting notes." then remove goal #2 Evelyn: Then I would combine goal #3 with goal #23 also: "make a cute website that records happy moments and is a peacemaking version of troubleshooting notes." Ivy: You can combine with #9 similarly. "make a cute website that records happy moments, implements quest society, and is a peacemaking version of troubleshooting notes." Tanya: I doubt that this is helpful. LRRH: I think it is helpful. Maybe we should have combined all of them into one long sentence. Zoey: But I would remove #11 because it would sound so obsessed if we put "finish Mice & Mystics" as a guild goal. XD
🔍 7. Remove 3 more
📯Sasha: Let's do it!
Ledia: I think that #22 covers #23, so maybe #23 can be removed. LRRH: I would rather update #23 to include complete all goals. If you keep #22 instead of #23, you lose the specifics on what we are trying to do. Casey: I agree with Red. Black: I still think that this exericse is not better than we are already doing. Sasha: I think it could help us focus. Evelyn: I think #23 covers #1, so #1 can be removed. P4: I think filling the paper star jar is too small to be kept in the end. Evelyn: But that is the cutest goal on the list. 😖 Ledia: Slight change to #23 wording to include #22: Make a cute website that creates and records happy moments, implements quest society to complete all goals, and is a peacemaking version of troubleshooting notes.
🔍 8. Remove 2 more
📯Sasha: Final round!
LRRH: I think #23 covers #5 with a slight change of wording from create to spread: Make a cute website that spreads happy moments, implements quest society to complete all goals, and is a peacemaking version of troubleshooting notes. Tanya: I think you could argue that #23 already includes #18 in spreading happy moments. Evelyn: I would rather suggest that including Healthy in #23: Make a cute website that spreads happy moments, implements quest society to complete all healthy goals, and is a peacemaking version of troubleshooting notes. Evelyn: I think the music quest is sufficiently different and not all songs are "happy." Tanya: I see. Sasha: Okay. Now we are left with three goals: Cardinal Quests, Original Music, and Peacemaking Website. Ledia: I think Cardinal Quest is not really "part of the guild", it is just somehow attached. Tanya: I think it is part of the guild because it is part of the alchemist path to make things happen. Ledia: But it is hard to combine it to the statement of #23. Tanya: I would consider that part of quest society quests. Ledia: Okay. I can see that. Sasha: We are done eliminating. LRRH: I think we can update the about section of the website. Tanya: StarTree please take a snapshot of the current about section. StarTree: Done! StarTree: The current description is: Welcome to Magic Bakery! This is the discussion blog for our peacemaker guild. We evaluate peaceful concepts we find and hope to present them to promote world peace. Tanya: What will it be updated to? LRRH: How about: "Welcome to Magic Bakery! This is the discussion blog for our peacemaker guild. Here we promote peacemaking by implementing quest society, spreading happiness, and keeping notes on peacemaking." Evelyn: I think that is a change to the better. Tanya: I agree. StarTree: It is updated! Sasha: Okay. I think we are done here. No changes prescribed in terms of how the guild function. This is just meant to be an exercise. Sasha: To clear a quest I have for @Detective. @Detective is now Rank B.

{"type":"chat","id":"202308051058","parentid":"202307231931","parentname":"Productivity","icon":"⏱️","title":"5/25 Rule","prev":"202307252044","author":"Sasha","location":"Quest Board"}
🔔
This is Magic Bakery plays Mice & Mystics, Chapter 3: The Grapes of Rats Zoey: We are playing it in RP for the story. We don't follow the official game rules. XD
📯 Story Content Scanning
Zoey: @Cardinal please check what stories content is there and GM. XD
Cardinal: In this chapter the heroes return to the castle to find clues about the villain Vanestra. There are three pieces of information to get. The heroes win if they get at least 2 out of three. Cardinal: The game says the chapter is for four players where Maginos must be included. But I don't think it matters in our case. Zoey: I play Lily. XD Casey: I play Nez. Tanya: Maginos. Evelyn: Tilda. P4: Filch. Sasha: Collin. Ledia: if the number of heroes doesn't matter, does it mean I can join as my own mouse character? Cardinal: Yes. Zoey: XD Ledia: Then I will be Ledia, an Adventurer mouse from Barksburg. Sylvia: I play as Sylvia, a bard at the Barksburg tavern. LRRH: I play Red the Baker mouse. I am trying to get flour from the castle. Zoey: It went full D&D XD Tanya: We have nine players. Should we split up into three groups? Zoey: Let's start with the story briefing first. XD
📯 The Grapes of Rats
Cardinal: After rescuing Lily, and a well rest, the heroes mice discussed their next step to return to the castle for information about Vanestra. Sasha: Collin spoke out loud what everyone must have thought about but afraid to ask, "If Vanestra merely planned to take over the kingdom, why didn't she kill my dad after she got married? Cardinal: At that, Tilda and Nez cried in shock. Tanya: "That is the fortunate truth," says Maginos, "It seems that her plan requires the King to be alive. That means we still have a chance to stop her, if we know her designs." Cardinal: With that, Collin proposed to return to the castle to find clues. Lily is the first to join, as she feels indebt to the heroes for saving her. Cardinal: Filch reluctantly joined, saying that Barksburg had nothing worth stealing.
Cardinal: Heroes, you may make your entrance at anytime. The stages in this chapter includes the kitchen tunnel, the dining hall, and the crystal tunnel. LRRH: Red the baker heard that the heroes are returning to the caslte and wished to tag along, "We are running low on flour, may I tag along?" Casey: Nez see the tiny mouse and said, "Don't worry, we will sure get some for you. The caslte is not safe for kids." LRRH: Red gives Nez a long list of ingredients, including several types of different flour that Nez had no idea how to tell the difference. Casey: Nez throws a glance at Tilda. "We can't bring a kid to the castle. I'm not wrong, right?" Evelyn: 😅 Ledia: "I'm sure that it will be fine," says Ledia the adventurer, "I'll tag along as her bodyguard." Ledia shows her greatsword with confidence. Sylvia: "I would like to get some wine as well," says Sylvia. She shows her knives, "I'm going regardless. It is better if we know of each other's presence in advance." Tanya: An area I would like to revisit is the crystal tunnels where we found Lily. Before that would pass the tunnels under the kitchen and the dining hall. Our paths should be the same until we reach the dining hall.

She intends to lure Maggie out of the kitchen with Ledia. Tanya: Maginos decides to add some magical firepower to tip the scale. {"type":"chat","id":"202308060931","parentid":"202207112218","parentname":"Search Visibility","icon":"🌺","title":"59, 89","prev":"202307041800","author":"Sasha","location":"Home Channel"}

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202308061221|🎪 Carnival Bet {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202308061221","music":""}
A man was at a carnival and went to a booth where a carny said to him, “If I write your exact weight on this piece of paper, then you have to give me $100, but if I cannot, I will pay you $100.” The man saw no scale near the booth so he agrees, thinking he'll lie to the carny either way about his weight. However, the man ends up paying the carny $100. How did the carny win the bet? {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.rd.com/article/long-riddles/","desc":"[Source]"}
Show Answer
The carny wrote "Your exact weight"!
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202308061221","parentid":"202208141928","parentname":"Puzzle Plaza","icon":"🎪","title":"Carnival Bet","subtitle":"Puzzle","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/08/16/15/03/carnival-rides-2648047_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Mikela","description":"","card-text":""}

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202308061227|🎩 Black or White {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202308061227","music":""}
There is a basket with five hats. Three are white and two are black. Tom, Tim, and Jim, each take a hat out of the basket and put it on their heads without seeing the hat they selected or the hats the other men selected. The men arrange themselves so Tom can see Tim and Jim's hats, Tim can see Jim's hat, and Jim can't see anyone's hat. Tom is asked what color his hat is and he says he doesn't know. Tim is asked the same question, and he also doesn't know. Finally, Jim is asked the question, and he does know. What color is his hat? {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.rd.com/article/long-riddles/","desc":"[Source]"}
Show Answer
The hat is white. If Tom doesn't know his hat color then the other two men's hats cannot be both black otherwise he would know his hat is white. When Tim doesn't know his hat color either, that means Jim's hat could not be black otherwise Tim would have to know his hat was white based on Tom's answer.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202308061227","parentid":"202208141928","parentname":"Puzzle Plaza","icon":"🎩","title":"Black or White","subtitle":"Puzzle","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2014/04/05/11/21/hat-315347_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Mikela","description":"","card-text":""}

202208141928|Puzzle Plaza

 202308061235|🍖 Cheating Butcher {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202308061235","music":""}
A butcher routinely cheats customers by pressing down on the scale when weighing a turkey. But one time a customer's order forced the butcher to admit his cheating. How?
Show Answer
The customer asked for a turkey. The butcher weighed it, but the customer wanted a heavier one. It just so happens that that was the last turkey, so the cheating butcher put that turkey under the counter, and brought back up the same turkey and pressed the scale *even more*. Satisfied that this turkey is heavier, the customer said, "I'll take both!"
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202308061235","parentid":"202208141928","parentname":"Puzzle Plaza","icon":"🍖","title":"Cheating Butcher","subtitle":"Puzzle","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2020/04/26/17/41/knife-5096410_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Mikela","description":"","card-text":""}

202207241111|Fallacies

 202308061251|🍚 Base Rate Fallacy {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202308061251","music":""}
Base Rate Fallacy
Logical Fallacy
Base Rate Fallacy is a logical fallacy where the wrong conclusion is drawn from wrong comparison.
🚑 Example: Hospitalization
FACT: Among the 100 hospitalized patients, 70 were vaccinated, and 30 were unvaccinated.
Conclusion using Base Rate Fallacy: The vaccine is not working because more hospitalized patients were vaccinated.
Without using Base Rate Fallacy: The total number vaccinated and unvaccinated persons need to be obtained. For example, if 1000 people are vaccinated, and 100 people are unvaccinated, then the result is 0.7% of vaccinated people versus 30% of unvaccinated people are hospitalized.
🧩 Self-Check Puzzle
A town has only two colors of cars: 80% are blue, 20% are green. A traffic camera is known to capture the correctly 80% of the time. One day a car runs a red light and the camera identifies the car to be green. What is the chance that the car is actually green?
🛎️ Show Answer
When the camera says that the car is green, that could be due to the camera saw a green and judged correctly, or that the camera saw a blue car but misjudged. Therefore, given 100 cars, the camera would judge 16 green cars correctly, and misjudge 16 blue cars incorrectly as a green car. The result is that of the 32 cars that the camera judges to be green, only 16 of them are actually green. The camera is only correct 50% of the time when it says the car is green.
For blue cars: the camera judges 64 blue cars correctly, and misjudges 4 green cars incorrectly as blue. As a result, the camera is correct 94% of the time if it judges that the car is blue.
{"cmd":"url","url":"https://twitter.com/sailorrooscout/status/1519324900980318210","desc":"[Twitter]"} 💬 Discussions
{"id":"202308061251","parentid":"202207241111","parentname":"Fallacies","icon":"🍚","title":"Base Rate Fallacy","subtitle":"Logical Fallacy","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2015/09/01/09/33/school-916678_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Ivy","description":"","card-text":""}
⭐
There is quest to relocate roll call. Where should it go?
📯 Roll Call Relocation
StarTree: There is quest to relocate roll call. Where should it go?
Ivy: I think roll call doesn't need its own side panel tab. It could be a link within the Bakers tab. Tanya: I think that roll call looks too similar to Bakers to be displayed in the same tab. Sasha: I like the trumpet icon better than the happy face. Evelyn: I think it can be a section in Scoreboard. Black: I think Roll Call can be its own section below Scoreboard, but make roll call all caps. Bakers can be section inside About. StarTree: StarTree moved it up below Scoreboard. Zoey: I swear that was where Roll Call was originally XD Zoey: It was not in All Caps because we moved it above Bakers. Tanya: I think we don't really need to change anything. It doesn't bother me that the side panel is long. I think we can close that quest. StarTree: @Vivi requested that Roll Call be part of Bakers back in February. Vivi: Could you make the profile section of Bakers collapsible? StarTree: Done! Black: I suggest changing the tab name from Bakers to ROLL CALL then replace the ROLL CALL section. StarTree: Done! Vivi: In that case make profiles section closed by default, and change the roll call icon to a clipboard. StarTree: Done! Vivi: Eventually Profiles can be part of Index or Scoreboard. Entries on Scoreboard should have a link to the profile. Ledia: That can come after each member has a profile node. Roll call section relocation quest is complete.
Wee~~!

202208172056|Magic Bakery

 202308061507|🧮 Accounting {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202308061507","music":""}
Accounting
Guild Quest
Guild Quests related to accounting and bookkeeping.
🔍 Statement Review
Quest: Review monthly statement records.

Checking Account

2023: ✅ 05-07
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202308061507","parentid":"202208172056","parentname":"Magic Bakery","icon":"🧮","title":"Accounting","subtitle":"Guild Quest","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/09/05/10/08/office-2717014_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Vivi","description":"","card-text":""}
🔔
This is a series of monthly self-evaluation discussion. The plan is to create a rubric for each evaluation topic.
📋 [B3] Communication and Relations
Black: For the review we said that this metric is for things like being ontime for meetings. Anyone notice other ways to fail in this?
Ledia: For meeting, we would need to count each meeting in addition to counting late meetings. Tanya: I think that can easily counted even if we don't tag every meeting. But let's add a tag. MTG for being on time. MTB for being late. Black: I think it is better with a tag. StarTree: Done! StarTree: The overall current count is 10 MTB out of 95 meetings! Tanya: What about this year alone? StarTree: 2/28! Ledia: They are both Rank A on our scale. Black: Should our ranks be base 10, where Rank A means 90% or above? Tanya: If we do that a B would be too easy: 10%. Black: Rank B would be above 90% of Rank A, so that is 81% or more for Rank B. Tanya: I see. Ledia: Then what Rank would 50% be? Black: That would be about Rank F. Ledia: I prefer Rank C to mean 50%. Black: 👍 Self-Evaluation is complete for this month.
Ledia: On the five point scale, why does Rank S has a success rate of 98%? Shouldn't it be 93.75? Tanya: Yes. And SS should be 96.875% StarTree: It is now corrected!
Black thanks all for the ideas.
{"type":"chat","id":"202308061629","parentid":"202302050852","parentname":"Self Evaluation","icon":"📋","title":"Self-Evaluation B3","prev":"202307052039","author":"Black","location":"Whale Nursery"}

202212090038|Adventurers' Hall

 202308061820|💎 Crystalization {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202308061820","music":""}
Crystalization
Skill
Crystalization is a writing / content creation method what starts with focusing on quantity, then refine and organize the content into a presentation.
Stage 1: Quantity
In this stage the author focus on collecting information and ideas. As they are collected, the author observes patterns and sort the information in groups. The grouping prompts the author to collect more data for lacking groups.
Stage 2: Structure
In this stage the author refines the structure so that new piece of information can be logically categorized. The structure is stable when the author seldomly needs to make new group or ponder which group a piece of information belongs.
Stage 3: Presentation
A stable struture allows the author to present each group in a logical order. In each group, the author can pick the most impactful argument or data.
Stage 4: Quality
In the final stage, the author focuses on details such as the quality of the writing and the aesthetics.
💬 Discussions
{"id":"202308061820","parentid":"202212090038","parentname":"Adventurers' Hall","icon":"💎","title":"Crystalization","subtitle":"Skill","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2022/10/28/08/25/amethyst-7552587_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"Ivy","description":"","card-text":""}

202207161423|Philosophies

 202308061940|🏙️ Charter City {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202308061940","music":""}
Charter City
Concept
A Charter City is a city with its own rules defined at its conception. Charter cities are compatible with freedom of association and societal structures such as Quest Society and Hospitalianism described in this website.
🏰 The Purpose of Charter Cities
Charter Cities support highest ranking of peace paradigm by letting regroup and live in a dream city of their choice. By defining the style and way of life in the charter, a charter city can specify and preserve the overall theme and atmosphere for ages. As a close analogy, a charter city can be compared to a themed hotel as big as a city.
⭐ Starting a city
Based on Gaia world concepts, each person has a share of the world resources. To start a city, a person would draft the charter and get enough endorsers to cover the area needed for the city. With that, the founders develops the area into their city.
⭐ Joining and Leaving
The city is allowed to continually occupy its space as long as it maintains enough endorsers. A healthy charter city would have a waitlist for people wanting to join, or unused endorsement for its expansion. If a charter city uses more space than endorsement it has, it would be on a course to be downsized. At that point, the city could downsize to keep the same specifications of its charter, or change the charter to attrack more endorsers to keep its size.
202208181056|🎪 Quest Society 202208170830|☕ Hospitalianism 202209242119|📯 Peace Paradigms 💬 Discussions
{"id":"202308061940","parentid":"202207161423","parentname":"Philosophies","icon":"🏙️","title":"Charter City","subtitle":"Concept","img":"https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/01/18/16/46/hong-kong-1990268_1280.jpg","music":"","author":"James","description":"","card-text":""}

🗃️3B: The original draft: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/KT_19%20(20210704)%20LRRH%20&%20Arcacia%20Sketch.png?raw=true","desc":"[link]"}
🗃️3B: The new redraft: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/KT_19%20(20230809)%20LRRH%20&%20Arcacia.png?raw=true","desc":"[link]"} 3B: To make this draft, I first made copies of the original draft and separate Arcacia and LRRH. 3B: The original draft was drawn in Mischief. I didn't feel like tracking down the mischief file and reexport them individually... 3B: Then I traced different parts of the original draft in different layers and different color. I made Arcacia's head shorter, and defined her dress a little better. 3B: To have a similar quality as Mira Mira title page, I needed a background. So I made a forest background.
🗃️3B: The redraft with draft color: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/KT_19%20(20230809)%20LRRH%20&%20Arcacia%2002.png?raw=true","desc":"[link]"} 3B: Since there are many lines, I needed paint to block the draft lines for the lower layers. Since I need to paint anyway I thought I might as well paint with the correct color. 3B: What you see here has an additional white mask to see the draft lines better.

Vivi: Arcacia's left elbow should be more to the left, and her right elbow should be behind her apron. 3B: I think the pose is more correct as is. Try holding your hands together like you are praying, then shift your hands to your right. Both of your elbows are still in front of you, but your right elbow would be lower than your left elbow. ⭐
There are two lingering quests and I want to do at least one of them. Actually make it three. Let's do one of them today. Sasha: The choices are: 1) Reset escape room games; 2) Murder Mystery; 3) Try another game. Sasha: If there is no strong reason to do one over the other, let's roll the dice.
Evelyn: Let's reset the escape room games so they can be replayed. Sasha: There are two to reset. I'll be happy if we reset one.
🕰️ Reset: Werewolf Experiment
Sasha: This is a quest to reset the escape room board game: the Werewolf Experiment. There is a chance that the set is not complete.
StarTree: This set includes a printout of the reset instruction! Sasha: I did that. The first step says I need to print and cut replacement papers so I gave up. StarTree: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://shop.mattel.com/products/escape-room-in-a-box-the-werewolf-experiment-fjr43","desc":"[Instruction]"} Evelyn: Do we need to print everything? It seems that some of the PDF content is already in the box. Sasha: Which one is missing? Evelyn: Pages: 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, ... Casey: The "used" ones are just written on with pencil. Couldn't you just erase them? Evelyn: Yes 😖 Evelyn: Erasing leaves the page with some white marks. I think that is okay. Casey: You could erase more and make the whole area lighter. Evelyn: It is working! 😊 Evelyn: The crossword puzzle page doesn't erase completely. But I think it is okay because the clues weren't very difficult. Casey: You could write on it with more letters then erase. Evelyn: I am learning something very interesting. Evelyn: Nothing needs to be reprinted. Evelyn: The set is missing a key to open a padlock and the notepad where the key is hidden. So I made something equivalent. 😊 The escape room game is reset.
Sasha: Nice! Should we reset the other escape room also? Evelyn: Okay. 😊
🕰️ Reset: Flashblack
Sasha: This is for reseting the escape room board game Flashback. We don't know if the content is complete.
StarTree: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://shop.mattel.com/pages/escape-room-in-a-box-repacking-instructions","desc":"[Reset instructions]"} Evelyn: For this set, someone wrote some answers using ballpoint pen. 😖 Evelyn: The reset instruction does not include the combination lock numbers to check the contents. 😖 StarTree: The combinations are in the answers book! Answers Spoilers next: StarTree: Purple lock: LTC. Red lock: 752. Blue lock 1: Octagon, diamond, cross. Blue lock 2: 451. Evelyn: There are about 10 pages to reprint. Otherwise the set is complete. Evelyn: Slightly cleaned the printer head because it is missing some lines when printing in black. Evelyn: Printed and cut the pages. The escape room game is reset.
Casey and Evelyn are recognized for the skill Hide Tracks. Evelyn is recognized for the skill Restoration.
One quest down!

This is the Red and Arcacian drawing... I did the flat coloring, then went ahead and did the overlay coloring...

Zoey: Nice! XD Evelyn: I prefer the one that is not brightened. Vivi: What is the dark spot between next to their hands? 3B: It is an error. I'll fix it. Vivi: It is strange when one of the tree branches happen to align with the pretzel. 3B: I will fix that too. 3B: By the way my pen is kind of broken. I will try another pen. Sasha: The faces are good for avatars. Not that they need new avatars. 3B: The dark spot is not an error. It is the tree in the background. Should I make that part a yellow sky? Vivi: I think it will look better if that part is the sky. 3B: Okay. 3B: Updated and cleaned up some lines for the tree trunks. LRRH: Isn't this poster worthy? Tanya: I would say yes. Evelyn: This picture was originally for better self of the carrot cake recipe. LRRH: StarTree please add to chapter 11. StarTree: Done! It is added to the last step because there is only one picture! Vivi: The line is slightly too long on Arcacia's left eye. 3B: Updated. Sasha: This picture is not as detailed as the one for Mira Mira. 3B: I changed the template so that I could edit each layer better, but now the drawing uses more RAM. This picture takes about 2GB of ram to edit. 3B: The Mira Mira drawing doesn't have a separable background. Sasha: Could you make a manga cut where the picture fits in the manga frame?
🎨3B: Manga Trim: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/KT_19%20(20230813)%20LRRH%20&%20Arcacia%20Manga.png?raw=true","desc":"[link]"}
Sasha: Okay. The full trim looks better. Tanya: I think the manga trim would look better if zoomed out.
🎨3B: Manga Trim 4: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://github.com/MagicBakery/Images/blob/main/KT_19%20(20230813)%20LRRH%20&%20Arcacia%20Manga%204.png?raw=true","desc":"[link]"}
Evelyn: I think this is the best one. Gaia: Nice drawing. 3B: The composition is not as good as Mira Mira. Evelyn: I think it is good for its context. 3B: I can still make changes. But I think we can start thinking what to draw next. 3B thanks all for the inputs.
