⭐
This is for the Mystery in a Box game Quarantine. Sasha: In this game you get a box with reports and newspaper articles, and the goal is to find the murderer
📯 About
Sasha: This is a play once only murder mystery game. It comes with a pile of documents about the case. Unlike 221B Baker Street, there is no clue "to get". All information is already in the pile. Sasha: Is this game playable on the channel? We have a stack of these games.
Black: I think this type of game has too much reading. Sasha: I think the person who chooses the document type can summarize what they find, like how we played NCIS. Tanya: How many documents are there? Sasha: There are: 1) Starting briefing, 2) Assignment, 3) Forensic report on the syringe, 4) 911 call record, 5) Patient record, 6) Autopsy report, 7) Patient photo, 8) Detective report (4 pages), 9) floorplan, 10) Suspect photos and profiles x8, 11) Airplane ticket, 12) newspaper (8 pages). Tanya: Is this going to be an exercise of identifying what information is relevant? Sasha: Yes, because much of the information would be irrelevant. But if we ask a player to choose a page and summarize, they won't know what is relevant. Tanya: I think then you would make all documents available, and each player takes turn making a discovery or posing a theory. Then we vote on the theories and reveal. Sasha: Then do we summarize what is on each document? Tanya: We can make a section for each document type, but only make notes of information that seems relevant. Sasha: Okay. This seems doable. Then I will start with the Summary of the Assignment. I am going to skip the "start" introduction because that is more about the game itself, which you could read.
🚨 Assignment Letter
Sasha: In the quarantine facility of the city, a patient was murdered. Magic Detectives are called to:
a: Trace the transmission of the virus to figure out who was infected by whom;
b: Identify the killer;
c: Uncover the motive for the murder.
Sasha: The public and media have not been informed about the murder
Sasha: Now the game starts. You are free to browse the content and we will summarize the findings in the following sections. Ledia: In NCIS, the person who reads a clue may define the theme and make changes to the clue. Does that apply here? Sasha: Yes, except now others can see the original clue, so there could be more than one entry, or re-entry on the same clue. Casey: Are we going to limit ourselves to only a number clues like in 221B? Sasha: I think these games are sufficiently harder so that we don't need to do that. We could guess wrong even if we read everything.
🗓️ 8/3: John Arrested
Natalie: John becomes a resident of the city jail after being arrested for illegal distribution of controlled substance during a sting operation.
⚔️ 8/4: Barfight 911 Record
Black: At 11:07pm, a bar fight was reported between Alex and Ben. Ben was found lying on the floor and was pronounced dead by the time officials arrived. According to the bartender, both were drunk and started fighting. Alex hit Ben. Ben fell and hit his head on the floor and never woke up. The victim's girlfriend Leslie was at the bar. She was transported to the police station and was released 3 hours later without charges.
P4: Alex was then released on bail with ankle monitor to an apartment owned by his father.
🗓️ 8/17: Room 17 (John in Coma)
LRRH: The patient in Room 17 fell into a coma and eventually dies on Aug 26 at 11:41am
LRRH: It is not clear who was in Room 17. The floorplan doesn't show patient names. Tanya: I think that is part of what we need to figure out. Zoey: Got the room assignment list from the investigation file. XD. They are: 15: Samara | 16: Jamie | 17: John | 18: Alex | 19: Donovan | 20: Lisa | 21: Marc
🛬 8/18: Airport
LRRH: Samara was at the airport having returned from Chicago. She will then return to her home at the Millennium Tower, where Jamie has been taking care of her cat Socks. She plans to take Jamie for lunch by the new sushi place by the courthouse.
🔍Mikela: According to Jenn's Facebook post {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.facebook.com/jennmoodyinFC/","desc":"[link]"}, she saw Lisa slapping a guy in a suit at the airport after yelling at him.
44: From the newspaper: Samara dropped her water bottle at the airport. Then Don picked it up for her.
Natalie: According to witness Robert at the airport, the murder victim, Donovan, collapsed there while travelling with another man. The other man looked scared and quickly walked away. The witness Robert described that the other man is in mid-30's, white, with brown hair, short reddish-brown beard. He was wearing a suit and black glasses. The witness also said the other man had want seems to be razor burn on his neck, and dark circles under his eyes.
Amelia: From the patient photos, it seems the other man is Marc, who also wears suit, glasses, has red brownish hair and beard stubs, and dark below his eyes.
Tanya: This plane ticket was found in the victim's suit pocket when he collapsed at the airport. It is an unused first class plane ticket of the victim to leave the city on 8/18 at 2:12pm. Among his belongings were also his wallet with driver's license, two credit cards, and $220 in cash.
💣 8/19: Court Hearing
LRRH: Samara attended a court hearing when she was already feeling unwell.
Black: 11am: Alex's hearing at the court house.
Zoey: 11am: Leslie charged at the defendant and scratched the defendant and his attorney's neck and elbowed the attorney. The attorney was nose bleeding.
Zoey: Samara was already sick. So I think Alex and Leslie got the virus from Samara.
Natalie: John attended a courtroom hearing at 1:30pm and complained that there was blood on is chair. The judge told him to ignore it and sit down.
🗣️ 8/19: Lisa Sick
Kisaragi: Lisa works as a policy aide for the Major. She called in sick today. She stayed home where she lived alone.
🗣️ 8/20: Leslie Sick
Black: Leslie is Ben's 27-yo girlfriend. They lived together in an apartment until Ben died during the barfight.
🗣️ 8/20: John Sick
Natalie: After attending the court hearing the day before, John started complaining to jail guards that he felt sick, and he was moved to an isolation cell in jail.
🚑 8/20: Samara Quarantined
LRRH: Samara's mother called for help and she was transferred to quarantine.
🔍 8/21: Facility 3
James: A private facility "Facility 3" is designated as a quarantine facility. {"cmd":"url","url":"http://www.quarantine-alert.com/","desc":"[link]"}
James: Connecting the dots from Newspaper: Facility 3 most likely belongs to Archon Genomics (CEO Robert). The facility is called the Arcane Foundry, and is headed by Dr. Grace.
🚑 8/21?: Lisa Quarantined
Kisaragi: The mayor insisted that Lisa calls for help. She was transferred to quarantine.
🚑 8/22: John Quarantined
Natalie: John was examined by a doctor in jail and was transferred immediately to quarantine.
🚑 8/23: Jamie Quarantined
P4: Jamie is a 60 yo working at a real estate company. She was transferred from her apartment in the Millennium tower to quarantine after she called 911 herself that she had high fever and couldn't breathe.
🚑 8/23: Leslie Quarantined
Black: Leslie started coughing up blood. Her caretaker and neighbor called for help and Leslie is transfered to quarantine.
Zoey: Leslie was kept in observation in the contaminated workroom, that is room 27.
⚔️ 8/23: Lisa Attacks
Kisaragi: Lisa was forcibly admitted to quarantine. That night at 1:02am, Lisa got up from her bed and pulled out her IV's. She ran down the wallway toward the clinic and attacked the patient in the room next to hers. She was restrained by the staff. The patient she attacked suffered only minor injuries.
Kisaragi: I think the floorplan means that Lisa's room number is one bigger than the patient she attacked. The room numbers are 15 to 21. Lisa is not in room 15 or 17. Someone else was already in Room 17. Zoey: According to the room assignment on the investigation file, Lisa was in Room 20, so she attacked the murder victim Donovan in Room 19.
🚑 8/24: Alex Quarantined
P4: Alex called 911 because he felt very sick. He was evaluated and quarantined.
🚑 8/24: Marc Quarantined
James: Marc called 911 by himself and was transferred to quarantine from the Andover Building where he lived alone.
Amelia: On the newspaper, Marc seems to be posing for an article on Archon Genomics.
🔍 8/25: Syringe
Ivy: A syringe that is unaccounted at the facility's inventory was found discarded on the hallway floor. The needle of the syringe was missing. There is no chemical or blood found inside the syringe.
StarTree: StarTree lifted a partial fingerprint on the syringe!
🔒 8/25: Cypher Note
Tanya: A crumpled cypher note was found in the waste bin near the contaminated staging area.
Message: Ef fcfaroqri, xr grvwrzr qseq aeqwruq prnd meb gr iwzcvjwuj wutdnmeqwdu egdcq qsr andkroq. Ecqsdnwpeqwdu wf jneuqri tdn bdc qd qeyr evv urorffenb mrefcnrf qd anrzruq iwfovdfcnr.
Tanya: The pattern eqwdu repeated. Assuming the last four letters are "tion": Tanya: ef fcfaroTri, xr grvwrzr TseT aeTIruT prnO meb gr iIzcvjINj INtOnmeTION egOcT Tsr anOkroT. ecTsOnwpeTION If jneNTri tOn bOc TO Teyr evv Nrorffenb mrefcnrf TO anrzrNT iIfovOfcnr. Tanya: Assume s is H and e is A: Tanya: Af fcfaroTri, xr grvIrzr THAT aATIruT prnO mAb gr iIzcvjINj INtOnmATION AgOcT THr anOkroT. AcTHOnIpATION If jnANTri tOn bOc TO TAyr Avv NrorffAnb mrAfcnrf TO anrzrNT iIfovOfcnr. Tanya: Assume r is E: Tanya: Af fcfaEoTEi, xE gEvIEzE THAT aATIEuT pEnO mAb gE iIzcvjINj INtOnmATION AgOcT THE anOkEoT. AcTHOnIpATION If jnANTEi tOn bOc TO TAyE Avv NEoEffAnb mEAfcnEf TO anEzENT iIfovOfcnE. Tanya: Assume g is B, v is L, z is V: Tanya: Af fcfaEoTEi, xE BELIEVE THAT aATIEuT pEnO mAb BE iIVcLjINj INtOnmATION ABOcT THE anOkEoT. AcTHOnIpATION If jnANTEi tOn bOc TO TAyE ALL NEoEffAnb mEAfcnEf TO anEzENT iIfoLOfcnE. Tanya: Assume c is U, t is F, n is R, m is M, p is Z, b is Y, x is W, a is P, u is N: Tanya: Af fUfPEoTEi, WE BELIEVE THAT PATIENT ZERO MAY BE iIVULjINj INFORMATION ABOUT THE PROkEoT. AUTHORIZATION If jRANTEi FOR YOU TO TAyE ALL NEoEffARY MEAfUREf TO PREzENT iIfoLOfURE. Tanya: Assume that o is C and f is S, i is D, j is g, k is J, z is V: Tanya: AS SUSPECTED, WE BELIEVE THAT PATIENT ZERO MAY BE DIVULGING INFORMATION ABOUT THE PROJECT. AUTHORIZATION IS GRANTED FOR YOU TO TAKE ALL NECESSARY MEASURES TO PREVENT DISCLOSURE. Zoey: XD Zoey: Supposedly Marc is the other person, so he also entered quarantine to kill Donovan. Tanya: I think it is still possible that the murderer is someone other than the patients. The surveillance report mentioned three cameras: Loading bay, entrance vestibute, and the airlock. But the floorplan shows that the clean workroom #10 has its own entrance. Staff could enter any room without going through the airlock room #13. Sasha: Looks like we have contesting theories, but let's keep discussions at the end after going through all the clues.
🔍 8/25: Autopsy Report
Evelyn: The male victim died of respiratory failure. Air bubbles were found in his brain. Puncture holes on his thigh suggest that the murdered injected air to the artery there. The vitals monitor alerted the staff at 11:07pm on August 25. The staff tried to save them but the victim was pronounced dead by 11:19pm.
☠️ 8/26: Leslie Dies
LRRH: Leslie dies at 10:37am.
LRRH: The patient at Room 17 dies at 11:41 am.
🔍 8/26: Surveillance Footage
Zoey: There was no camera for the hallway or interior of the facility, but the cameras at the entraces show no one other than facility staff entering or exiting. All staff members wear full protective suit entering and exiting. The gloves, boots and hoods are built-in to the suit.
Zoey: I think this is the game's way of telling us that the murderer is one of the other patients.
☠️ 8/??: Amanda Dies
LRRH: Leslie's caretaker Amanda dies of same symptoms at her apartment.
🔍 8/??: Rumors
Mikela: There is a link to a conspiracy article that says Archon Genomics might be researching biological weapons for the government.
🛎️ Detective Theories
Sasha: The sections above are all the clues. Here we list our guesses on how the virus spread, who the murderer was, and the motive.
Tanya: Based on the cypher message, Patient Zero should be Don, the murder victim. He would have passed it to Marc. At the airport, Lisa got the infection from snapping one of them, and Samara also got infected for being at the airport. The next day at the courthouse, Leslie and Alex got infected from Samara in the morning, then John got it from the chair. Last was Jamie who got infected from Alex. I think Jamie is Alex's mother. Zoey: Also from the message, it seems that the director of Arcane Foundry gave Marc the go to kill Don to prevent him from telling others about the project. Ledia: So the man in suit that Lisa attacked at the airport and also in quarantine is Don, isn't it? Tanya: I think it doesn't matter to the case. Black: I think Jamie did not get the virus from Alex, she got it from Samara when they met for lunch near the courhouse. Tanya: Good catch. Sasha: So far we have this sequence: Don, Marc, Lisa (Airport), Samara (Airport), Leslie (Courthouse), Alex (Courthouse), John (Courthouse), Jamie (Lunch) Ledia: Why did Marc go to the airport? It doesn't seem that he knew he was sick. Tanya: I think Don didn't know that he was sick. I think he was taking a flight to meet with someone who might be interest in the project. Marc might not be flying with him, but to see him off. Ledia: That is a strange arrangement. Black: I think they would be in the same flight, but once Marc saw that Don fell sick, Marc realized he himself probably got he virus and fled. Sasha: It seems that no one has a strong opposing theory, so for the three questions, you either choose Yes or No. If you get at least two right, you win. Anyone who gets all three correct gets the crown. Ledia: I think there is something we got wrong, but not one of these questions. Black: No one else has a clear tie to the project or to Don. Lisa, who attacked Don was restrained at the scene. She wouldn't have time to hide the needle. The cipher note was found near room #21 where Marc was. Zoey: I think we could be wrong on the infection sequence. Evelyn: Does Don work for Arcane Foundry? We only know that Marc works there. Maybe Don was a visitor at Archon Genomics, he was on a flight back home. So Marc was just sending him off at the airport. Ledia: If that is the case it would be strange for Don and Marc not going to airport together. One know that Lisa drove one of them to the airport. Evelyn: Is it strange to not meet at the airport? 😅 Black: We know that Lisa attacked Don, so Lisa probably drove Don to the airport. Marc could have met Don separately. Ledia: I think in that case the order of infection could be Don, Lisa, Marc, Samara, Leslie, Alex, John, Jamie. We don't know whether Samara got it from Don, Lisa, or Marc. Evelyn: I think Lisa, Marc, and Samara all got it from Don, because I don't think Lisa and Marc could become infectious themselves right after contracting the virus. Ledia: Then for the first question I would vote No. I think Lisa got the virus before Marc, since Lisa was in the same car with Don. Evelyn: I think so too. Zoey: Why did Lisa slap Don? She drove him to the airport. Ledia: That is a mystery. Zoey: I am switching to Ledia's sequence. Sasha: I also think Ledia's sequence is more probable. LRRH: If Don does not work for Archon Genomics, Don doesn't have a chance to get the virus unless through someone who works there. That would mean Don got it from Marc, but Marc is not patient zero. Therefore Don works for Archon Genomics. Tanya: That was a loose proof by contradiction. Kisaragi: I think Tanya's order is correct because the witness said Marc had rashes around his neck. Marc was already infected before going to the airport. But Don's symptoms were more severe, so Don was patient zero. Evelyn: Kisa is right. I'm switching to Tanya's sequence 😖 Ledia: There are more than one way for the order to be wrong but only one way to be right. Zoey: I don't want to think so much XD Sasha: Since we are voting, unless vote you don't get a win or a loss. LRRH: I think Tanya is right. Casey: I think the last two questions are a given, so it is at least a win. Ivy: Same. P4: Same. James: Same. Natalie: Same. StarTree: Wee~! Mikela: Will the crowd be right this time?
Infection order: Don, Marc, Lisa (Airport), Samara (Airport), Leslie (Courthouse), Alex (Courthouse), John (Courthouse), Jamie (Lunch)
Yes: Tanya, Black, Kisaragi, Evelyn, LRRH, Casey, Ivy, P4, James, Natalie, StarTree, Mikela
No: Ledia, Zoey, Sasha
Murderer: Marc
Yes: Tanya, Ledia, Black, Zoey, Evelyn, Sasha, Kisaragi, LRRH, Casey, Ivy, P4, James, Natalie, StarTree, Mikela
No:
Motive: To hide the project.
Yes: Tanya, Ledia, Black, Zoey, Evelyn, Sasha, Kisaragi, LRRH, Casey, Ivy, P4, James, Natalie, StarTree, Mikela
No:
Sasha: There is no drumroll section. So next is the solution!
🛎️ SOLUTION
Sasha: The majority is not correct! The solution has this order:
Infection Order: Don, Lisa (Airport), Marco (Airport), Samara (Airport), Jamie (Cat pick up), Leslie (Courthouse), Alex (Courthouse), John (Courthouse) Sasha: The solution is as Ledia said, that Marc got the virus at the airport. The other difference is that Jamie got infected when Samara picked up her cat back.
Sasha: The murderer was Marc and the motive is as we guessed. However, we missing a few things from the pile of documents.
Sasha: There was a note on the newspaper to contact Mr. X. That website no longer works. But the content of the website contains a photo ID of Donovan as a scientist at Archon Genomics, and 8 fingerprint samples from the patients. If we had that information, we could have matched the partial fingerprint to that of Marc. Sasha: Another thing we missed was that there was a coded message on an Archon Genomics advertisement on the Newspaper:
TGG GTG CTC
TGG GTA TCC
CTT CGG TGC
GTA CGT TCA
B CTT CTT TTA
TGA CTC GCT
TAC TAA TTG
CGA TGG CTT
CTA
The solution says that it translates to: Sasha: "The threat is terminated."
Sasha: Congratulations to all for winning and to Ledia, Zoey, and myself for getting all three true/false choices right!
Natalie: The solution page has a copyright notice that says it cannot be reproduced in any form. Sasha: But we are playing it, not selling it. We are not posting the content for others to see. Natalie: I think it is questionable. Sasha: This is from a different publisher that says hosting the game for profit is a violation. It doesn't say it is a violation if you are just playing with friends. {"cmd":"url","url":"http://www.quarantine-alert.com/","desc":"[link]"} "Hosting our games for profit without our consent is a violation of international Copyright law. If you plan to make a profit on our games &/or host them publicly, you must have a commercial/multi-use license." Natalie: I think it depends on the publisher. Sasha: But the game is not meant to be only a solo game. If we were physically together we would all be reading the content. Sasha: This is another publisher that only says you need to get a business license if you want to run the game with the public or for profit, or use it as a company event, or as a fundrasier. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://nightofmystery.com/faq/","desc":"[link]"} Natalie: I think it depends on the publisher. In that link it says that you need a business license even if you run it for team building for your company or non-profit. Sasha: Magic Bakery is neither a company nor a non-profit. Natalie: I think it depends on the publisher. Evelyn: I think this should be a question to the publisher. LRRH: Does the problem exist only if we post the playthrough online? Tanya: I think posting is irrelevant. It is about sharing the game to let "others" play. LRRH: But the game can definitely be played as a group, so the only difference is "what is a group that is ok"? Zoey: The question is, "Can the game be played on zoom with friends?" Natalie: The copyright notice on the solution is, "© Copyright, 2019, TMEC, LLC, All Rights Reserved. No part or portion of the contents of our mystery experiences including but not limited to physical components, online content, or multimedia content may be resold, reproduced, duplicated, or transmitted in any form without our pior written permission." Tanya: I would agree that this game could not have been run according to that copyright wording. Sasha: But it could have been run if we were all sitting together, agreed? Tanya: Yes. But even if we played in person, it wouldn't cover showing a playthrough in writing online. That means we cannot post this game run. Sasha: What if we make this section private? Tanya: The point was you couldn't have taken a picture of the content for it to be played online even in private. Sasha: But you don't see the copyright notice until you see the solution. Tanya: The Start Here page has an "All Rights Reserve." note, but not the detailed one on the solution. LRRH: I don't like it when we have a session we can't show. Ledia: You could just show it and wait to see if the company sues you. LRRH: Personally I would be okay with that compromise if we don't post more of these. Sasha: What a waste. Evelyn: We can still play it in person. Sasha: But if we can't talk about it, what is the point? Casey: What if you play in-person then transform the content when you post it? Sasha: I think that is too much work, because it would be like playing the game twice. Once you have played it, the transforming part will be boring and somewhat pointless. Evelyn: What if you give the game content to Cardinal, and we play the game like an RPG? We will tell Cardinal what we try to do, and Cardinal tells us the respond. Then we are playing it without reading the source material. Natalie: This is from a different publisher that disallows live-streaming or recording of a play session. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.mymysteryparty.com/commercial-license-virtual-use/","desc":"[link]"} Even if TMEC does not list such a violation in their license, if you don't know what their license is, you should assume that permission is not granted. Tanya: I side with Natalie on that stance. Even if you play it in person in private, it is questionable whether you should write down the playthrough. Evelyn: I think if we play it through Cardinal, the content would be substantially transformed. Tanya: That depends on how much Cardinal transforms it. LRRH: In that situation, should we or should we not mention that the game is based on the original? If we mention it, It could make people not want to buy the game. If we don't mention it, it would not help people who want to buy the actual game. Casey: Actually, wouldn't the same rule apply to 221B Baker Street and Mice & Mystics? Could we have recorded the gameplay? Sasha: People post playthrough videos online. Casey: Doesn't mean that it is legal. By Natalie's assumption we can't post those games. Tanya: I would say this form of activity is not really compatible with the guild, unless the game material is already free online. Evelyn: What happens if we play them through Cardinal with sufficient changes? Tanya: Cardinal would have to change the cyphers. For that effort I think we would better be posting about us solving real problems than to solve transformed puzzles to avoid copyright infringement. Sasha: Suppose we are playing Quarantine in person. What could we have posted about our experience of playing it? Tanya: I think the intent of the publisher is for us not to give away the puzzle or the solution. That means you can't discuss the details of the puzzle or the solution. Ledia: Then there is hardly anything left to post. Tanya: You just have to find free games or games that let you post. Sasha: This is somewhat disastrous. We can't post memories of playing board games we already have. Black: You can still play it, then post about your fond memories about playing it. Sasha: Retelling is not the same as viewing the actual record. LRRH: I am learning toward suspending all direct gameplay of commercial board games unless it is sufficiently transformed and played through Cardinal. Evelyn: Would our record fall under educational fair use, if we focus on how we approach the puzzle from an education standpoint? {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.copyright.gov/fair-use/","desc":"[link]"} Evelyn: I think the part where Tanya solved the cipher was educational because she was showing us how to start with some pattern, then make guesses to see if the remaining message would make sense. I would not want to have that part erased from record. 😖 Tanya: I don't think this is an educational fair use because we are still playing it as a game; we care if we are correct; and to do so we are using all of the original material, instead of, say, just showing how to decypher a message by itself without the context of the game. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://copyright.universityofcalifornia.edu/use/fair-use.html","desc":"[link]"} Sasha: But for logical/critical/lateral thinking education, why would you take and focus on just a part? The entire context matters. Tanya: You would still run into the problem of the source material being a copyrighted work of fiction. No one would have a problem if the source material is not copyrighted. Evelyn: I think we can find public domain source material. Zoey: Or can ChatGPT make public domain source material. XD StarTree: ChatGPT says what it makes is not automatically considered to be in public domain, but belongs to OpenAI! Zoey: Cardinal that is. XD LRRH: Once Cardinal transforms the content, it would become original work, and there would be no issue. Tanya: But the changes should be more significant than just changing the characters' names. LRRH: Yes.
Sasha: Okay. Could we end with a review about the game? What do you like? What do you dislike?
Evelyn: The game told us to create a timeline. I think that is important and we did well when we summarized in a timeline format. The timestamps from the clue documents were everywhere so we need to take a clue apart and list individual events on the timeline. Zoey: I think the cipher told us too much information, that constituted two-thirds of the answer. Tanya: The game did not explain why Lisa slapped Don and was still mad at him in quarantine. The game also did not explain why Marc didn't do better hidding the murder. Where was the removed needle? Why leave the syringe in the hallway? Why leave the cypher note? Tanya: And why would the director tell Marc, who is also sick to do the murder when there is a path where another healthy person could have inflitrated and do the job without leaving any evidence behind? Ledia: Maybe the director doesn't want more people to know, and threatened Marc that if he doesn't follow the order he won't get the secret treatment for the virus. Black: When I was playing it I gave up on the cipher. I tried shifting the letters but quickly found that wouldn't work. Tanya: When that didn't work I imagined that it was random substitution. I started looking for patterns, especially for the pattern "evv". But there were still too many other character to guess. Then I noticed the longer repeated pattern. I first imagine that the longer pattern ended with "ing", but that did not work. So I tried "tion" and it worked. Sasha: There is one more cipher about the DNA sequence. Tanya: I don't feel like working on that given that we know the answer and the questionable copyright issue. Sasha: If the original does not disclose the how it is deciphered, then our explanation is original work. Ledia: Compelling. Zoey: So I found a codon chart such as this: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.researchgate.net/figure/The-genetic-code-table_fig1_267946831","desc":"[link]"} If we follow that we get: Zoey: wvlwvslrcvrsblll[end]lay[end]lrwll Zoey: I don't see how that translates to the message in the solution "the threat is terminlated" Tanya: If you don't count the "b", the two have the same number of characters. Zoey: But nothing that would give you three of the same character in a roll. Tanya: Let's first substitute from the solution and see what happens: w is T, v is H, l is E: Tanya: THETHsErcvrsbEEE#Eay#ErTEE Tanya: Assume s is R, r is A: Tanya: THETHREAcvARbEEE#Eay#EATEE Tanya: It doesn't work. Either we are using the chart wrong, the cypher was wrong, or it is more complex to decode. Sasha: Based on the solution, shouldn't the last code be GAT or GAC to result in a D? Tanya: But it says complex. There might be another rule. Ivy: Those are DNA codons, what if you first get the pairing? A pairs with T. C pairs with G Tanya: I see. Zoey: It works! Leave it to the scientist! XD Tanya: For the record, the paired sequence is this: Tanya: ACC(T) CAC(H) GAG(E) ACC(T) CAT(H) AGG(R) GAA(E) GCC(A) ACG(T) CAT(H) GCA(A) AGT(S) (B) GAA(E) GAA(E) AAT(N) ACT(T) GAG(E) CGA(R) ATG(M) ATT(I) AAC(N) GCT(A) ACC(T) GAA(E) GAT(D) Tanya: "The threat has been terminated". Not "the threat is terminated". The official FAQ did tell us to expect typos. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.mysteryexperiencescompany.com/about","desc":"[link]"} Ledia: The B was a clue since the codon chart does not include a B. Sasha: I think Tanya and Ivy should be recognized for deciper skill. Tanya and Ivy are recognized for the skill Code Breaker. Natalie is recognized for the skill Call for Justice. Sasha: I think this is a good place to stop, after leaving nothing unanswered.
Sasha thanks all for playing! Let's make this even more educational next time!

Zoey: It has been a year since we last talked about this. OMG XD Sasha: And it is still managable. There is nothing wrong with my stash. Zoey: I think the number increased, and there wasn't really any progress in getting people to borrow board games.
🏡 NextDoor Posting

This is Magic Bakery plays Mice & Mystics, Chapter 4: The Forging of the Beast Sasha: We are playing it in RP for the story. We don't follow the official game rules.
Evelyn: Since the publisher only made the first chapter public, is there a problem if we talk about what happens in Chapter Four? 😖 Sasha: There is already a playthrough on youtube... I know just because someone does it doesn't mean it is okay. But our blog isn't even searchable on Google. Cardinal, do your thing. Cardinal: Cardinal will summarize the situation, the players will come up with their dialogues. Casey: This is going to be hard. Sasha: Just be yourself.
📯 Roll Call
📯Cardinal: This session continues from the last one where the nine players were in the Alchemist Chamber. Where Maginos sees that his tome with answers is missing. The mice then go to the king's chamber to check the king, while Nez worries that the Vanestra is building something at the forge.
Evelyn: Are there story moments in this chapter? Cardinal: The mice heroes will discover the status of the King, and see what Vanestra is building at the forge. Evelyn: Okay.
⚔️ King's Chamber
Cardinal: The hero and adventurer mice sneaked into the king's chamber, which has been infested by countless spiders. The king looks sick and lies motionless in bed with spiders crawling all over him.
Cardinal: Players please decide your action. Evelyn: Tilda checks if the King is poisoned and casts anti-poison on the King to make him immune. Tanya: Maginos give mana to Evelyn to cast that spell. Sylvia: I ask Collin for a song that could wake up the king, if we are supposed to wake up the king. Sasha: Collin tells Sylvia about the song that the former queen used to sing and kill spiders crawing on him. Zoey: Lily goes full barrage on the spiders around. XD P4: Filch kills spider around and check for anything special. Ledia: Should Vanestra know whether we are here? Ledia uses chain lightning on the spiders. Casey: We let the captain go, so Vanestra probably know that we are here. Nez has no idea how best to help the King, and hope that the King wakes up, somehow breaks free from Vanestra's spell and command other humans in the castle to drive out Vanestra. In the meantime Nez fights the spiders. LRRH: Red collects some poison from the spider and leaves vinegar, mint, catnip, pepper, etc to drive away spiders. Cardinal: Everyone roll two deice please. Evelyn: ➕➖ Tanya: ➕➖ Sylvia: ➖➕ Sasha: ➕➖ Zoey: ➖➖ P4: ➖➕ Ledia: ➖➕ Casey: ➕➖ LRRH: ➕➕ Cardinal: ➖➕➖
🎩Cardinal: The hero mice defended the King as Tilda cast anti-poison and Sylvia plays the late queen's favorite song, which had more effect in bring the rescures in tears than waking up the King. Despite their combined power, Tilda's spell could only increase the King's resistance to poison for one day. Knowing no obvious way to wake up the King, the group decides to first investigate the forge and see what Vanestra is up to.
Cardinal: If anyone wants to say something to the King before leaving the chamber, now is the time. Sasha: Collin has been speaking to the King hoping to wake him up. Before leaving, Collin says, "Wake up, Father, everyone is waiting." P4: Filch goes to the other side of the King and asks, "Remember to give Filch treasures when you wake up." Zoey: XD Cardinal: As the heroes move on to the forge, they learn two pieces of information: Cardinal: ➖➕➖➖ Cardinal: First, the scent of peppermint was effective at driving out the spiders, but Red didn't have enough. Cardinal: Second, Lily ran out of arrows. Zoey: It's okay, I still have a knife. XD Little Red Riding Hood obtained a vial of Spider Poison.
🌊 Drain Pipe
Cardinal: To get to the Forge, the hero mice sneaked underground through the pipes. The water at one section is very fast below, anyone who falls is likely to be flushed out the castle.
Cardinal: Heroes, please describe how you approach the situation as you travel across the pipes above the rapid. Sasha: I think we should tie outselves to each other. I think we have the fishing wire as party gear. Casey: I will be in the middle then. P4: Filch doesn't want to be tied up. He has his own ropes and just jumps to the pipes above swing around freely. Tanya: I walk in front of Nez. It is probably easier for him to catch me from falling. Evelyn: Tilda follows Nez. Sylvia: Sylvia follows Tilda. Ledia: Ledia follows Sylvia Sasha: I suppose Collin is in front. LRRH: Red goes second and put some spider web on her feet. Cardinal: Everyone roll one dice please in marching order. P4: Filch: ➕ Sasha: Collin: ➖ LRRH: Red: ➖ Tanya: Maginos: ➕ Casey: Nez: ➖ Evelyn: Tilda: ➕ Sylvia: #REF! Ledia: Sylvia: ➖ Zoey: Lily: ➖ Evelyn: 😖 Cardinal: ➕➕➖➖➖➖➖➖➕
🎩Cardinal: As Filch swings arcobatically across, he watches the horror unfold as Nez slipped and started falling into the rapid.
Cardinal: Filch, Collin, Maginos, Tilda, and Lily, please describe your immediate reaction. P4: Filch throws a roped knife to cut the ropes holding Nez. Nez can grab that rope. Sasha: Collin hears the commotion and immediately crouches down to hug the pipe. Tanya: Maginos casts levitate on Nez. Evelyn: Tilda casts water breathing on the whole group. Zoey: Lily fies a hook rope to the pipe above as an anchor to hold her end of the party. Cardinal: Roll one two dice please. P4: ➖➖ Sasha: ➕➕ Tanya: ➖➕ Evelyn: ➕➖ Zoey: ➕➖ Cardinal: Tanya please keep rolling until you get fail. Tanya: ➕➖
🎩Cardinal: Filch cut the rope holding Nez, but Nez couldn't grab his rope. The party sees Nez fall into the rapid water, only to rise up a few human yards behind when Maginos' levitate spell connected. Collin and Lily pull up the rest of the dangling party, and resumed the same formation, this time with Nez holding the two ends of the rope the rest of the way instead of tying them to himself.
Tanya is recognized for the magic Levitate Rank B. Evelyn is recognized for the magic Water Breathing Rank C. Casey: That was embarrassing. Ledia: Was it correct to cut the rope? P4: If it is not cut Collin and Lilly would need to lift six people. Ledia: After cutting, Collin is lifting Red and Maginos. Lily with her hook is holding Tilda, Sylvia, and myself. Tanya: I think either way would be fine after casting levitate Casey: Are we using the logic from Jumba You 202207101102|puzzle? We are mice, we can lift our own weight even when we can't as humans. Tanya: Maginos is not sure if Collin and Lily could have lifted the everyone without levitate. Cardinal: As the party catches their breath, they can feel the warmth from the forge on the otherside of the venting grill.
⚔️ The Forge
Cardinal:
Cardinal: Heroes, please describe your action. Ledia: I think we should try to get the beast into an oven to be destroyed. Casey: if the mech requires an operator, maybe we can seize the control. Tanya: Should we know more about the beast before deciding what to do? Cardinal: The dice would decide whether your plan would work. Zoey: Then Lily finds something she can shoot and breaks the mech with trueshot. XD Tanya: I see. Maginos hacks into the mech. Evelyn: I think the workers are overworked and especially suspectible to sleep. So Tilda casts sleep on the floor. P4: Filch hides to support whichever plan to make it work. Sylvia: Sylvia plays song of haste for the party. LRRH: Red brings food as a distraction. Sasha: Collin will support the plan that works. Cardinal: Everyone please roll two dice, and keep rolling until you get a minues. Zoey: Is this a competition? XD Ledia: Melt the Mech: ➖➕➕➕➖ Casey: Take the mech: ➕➕➕➕➕➕➕➕➕➕➕➕➕➕➖ YES!!!! Zoey: OMG. XD. True Shot: ➕➖➖ Tanya: Hacking: ➕➖➖ Evelyn: Sleep: ➕➕➕➖ P4: Support: ➕➖➕➖ Sylvia: Haste: ➕➕➖ LRRH: Distract: ➕➕➖ Sasha: Support: ➕➕➕➕➖
🎩Cardinal: A tasty fragrant filled the room of hungry workers as they hammered away. Captain Vurst orders the workers to contiue as he exits the forge to check the source of the smell with dripping drool. Cardinal: Meanwhile, the workers fall asleep under Tilda's sleep spell. Nez climbs the hook shot by Lily to the collar, where the operator of the Mech would sit. Cardinal: But instead of an operator, it was occupied by a strange glowing orb. Other than that, the operator seat was as familiar to Nez as he had prototyped.
Cardinal: Nez, how would you like to do this? Casey: I toss the orb down to Maginos for him to decide what to do. While I confirm that the Mech can move and say, "Let's ride out of the castle!" Cardinal: ➖➖➖➕ Cardinal: Maginos, as much as you are curious about the orb, you feel that it is unsafe to keep it because Vanestra can probably see you through it if that was a device meant to control the Mech. Tanya: I toss the orb into the forge fire. Cardinal: ➕➕➖ Cardinal: As the orb hits the molten metal, it evaporates with a painful scream in Vanestra's voice. The screen wakes up the whole floor of dumbfound workers. Sylvia micmics Vanestra's scream with her fiddle. As the terrified workers dash out of the forge, Red sneaks back to the forge from a side door. On the walls of and tables of the vacated forge were the design drawing of the Mech. Some were Nez's drawing, while some were new. Ledia: Should we just burn all of them? Tanya: I think we should take anything that could be related to any weakness of the new designs. Cardinal: As the mice heroes discuss what to do with the drawings, Collin sees Brodie the cat dashing toward the forge in the hallway.
Chapter 4 is complete. Casey obtains the Mech. Casey is regconized for the skill Mech Design Rank S Casey is regconized for the skill Summon Mech Rank S Casey is regconized for the skill Universal Mech Operator Rank SSS. Sasha is recognized for the skill Sense Enemy Rank S. Sylvia is recognized for the skill Bardic Mimicry Rank B. LRRH is recognized for the skill Aromatics Rank B.
Zoey: Cat vs Mech. XD Evelyn: That was a good game. 😊 Ledia: I like the dice competition to decide which plan works, even though apparently my plan was in conflict with the winning plan and I didn't end up doing anything. Casey: 14 Pluses in a row! Cardinal: Ledia, you may pick a fire skill to rank up to Rank A. Ledia: Dragon Fire Rank A that can melt metal. Ledia is recognized for the skill Dragon Fire Rank A. Casey: The odds of 14 pluses in a row is 0.006% isn't it? Tanya: That is the odds of at least 14 pluses. Exactly 14 pluses is 1/(2^15) = 1/32768 = 0.003% Casey: Awesome!
Sasha: Any comments on whether they way we play this is okay? Evelyn: I wouldn't know since I don't know what the original story is. 😅 Zoey: I don't think it includes Nez taking the Mech. XD Tanya: I don't think peppermint is in the actual game. Sasha: I think it is fine if we don't know what is in the actual game. Ledia: But does Evelyn want to know what the actual story is? Evelyn: I think right now is fine because we still go back to the actually at the start of each chapter. In general I am more interested in the story we make than knowing the original story. P4: Nez almost didn't make it to the forge. Casey: I know!!!! Zoey: Dramatic triumph! XD Evelyn: I am happy that we ended up being able to all play together. 😊
Good game, everyone!

⭐
StarTree tries to do something for GitHub Migration!
⭐ Enabling Jquery
📯StarTree: To enable Jquery, the GitHub website needs Jquery data. Should StarTree just copy the entire Archive1 and Archive2 for the test?
Black: I think that is fine for testing. StarTree: What should the GitHub site be able to do first when Jquery is enabled? Black: How about you make a second button next to the compass, so that when you click on it, it will query from GitHub archive instead of blogspot archive? Ivy: I think the first step should be letting index.html read the URL with the node id and query the node content. Then when your second button is clicked, the iframe can just load that address. StarTree: The top level iframe can load index.html itself but not the second level iframe! Black: I thought ultimately we don't want the GitHub site to use iframe. It should just load the content to its container. Ivy: Okay. Please do it the way Black said. StarTree: Roger! StarTree: Added Archive1 and 2. Adding a second button: 🚧. Adding function: JQAdd., GetInputBoxValue, ArchiveSelect, BoardAdd, BoardFill. LRRH: Could you use the 🐣 icon for the new button? StarTree: Done! StarTree: Adding try catch to GuessContainerWidth at Blogspot. Encountered this issue: {"cmd":"url","url":"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10752055/cross-origin-requests-are-only-supported-for-http-error-when-loading-a-local","desc":"[link]"}. Installing Live Server to VSCode. {"cmd":"url","url":"https://www.lego.com/en-us/product/eldorado-fortress-10320","desc":"[link]"}. Testing. StarTree: JQuery is implemented but many Javascript function need to be copied over for the content loaded by JQuery to function! Black: Good progress. StarTree: Wee~~! @Board is now Rank A.
To be continued!

⭐
StarTree ports functions from Blogspot to GitHub!
⭐ Porting Functions
⭐StarTree: There are too many function to check one by one so StarTree will copy all of them but put them in alphabetical order!
StarTree: StarTree gives up reordering the functions because there are about 300 of them! Black: I think it would be good to keep the new and old code in the same order so we could see the difference by using text compare. Black: If you reorder them you could reorder both of them using the compare software. StarTree: The comparison software doesn't allow editting due to an encoding error! StarTree: Should archive html be organized inside a "p" folder to keep the same directory struction as blogspot? Black: I am not sure. Is it easy to change? StarTree: It is easy to change! Black: Could you try without? StarTree: Roger! Two quests for GitHub Migration are complete. StarTree: What should be next? Index search or enable viewer URL? Black: I think enabling URL should be next because it is more important. It would allow the links to work, then I can post links to GitHub. StarTree: Roger!
To be continued!

202212090038|Adventurers' Hall

 202308230949|⌛ Backward Compatibility {"cmd":"PIN2","node":"202308230949","music":""}
Backward Compatibility
Design
Design something new that also works with old components.
Example: Guild Website
2023: The guild has a blog at Blogspot and is migrating the content to a website hosted at GitHub. To be backward compatible, the new code is to be written in a way so that it will still work if it is copied from GitHub back to Blogspot.
💬 Discussions
